1 review
'So Happy!!'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 10, 2012 NEW

I am a travel agent and book hotels all the time. This property has completely changed my view on Days Inns. I have always thought them to be a 2 star property.. Until we stayed here in Hyannis. My husband and I are Elks and we went to the Cape for our annual State Convention. It was held in another hotel. We opted to spend a little less money and book three rooms at the Days Inn. It was very reasonably priced. At check in, the two gentlemen couldnt have been more accommodating. They talked about their free breakfast, fruit, yogurt, coffee, danish and the like. They showed us where the pools are, indoor and outdoor. They described places to go in the area. And they even made sure that our three rooms were across the hall from each other. The hallways were clean, the bed was comfortable, we had a lovely balcony.. I am sold! It was one of the best weekends away. We are from the North Shore in Massachusetts. But we will most assuredly be back. Thank you Days Inn Hyannis.. we had a grand ole time! Diane and Adam.

SFC1976
Boston, Massachusetts
Senior Reviewer
7 reviews 7 reviews
Reviews in 7 cities Reviews in 7 cities
13 helpful votes 13 helpful votes
'Value for money at the right price'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed June 4, 2012

If, like me, you typically stay at Hilton or Marriott brand properties then it would be easy to be disappointed with this Days Inn....but, for the price paid (just over $110 in this case) this hotel offers good value on the Cape. Check-in was a breeze and the front desk staff extremely helpful. The room was basic, but clean and had a flat screen TV, fridge and coffee maker although the supplied coffee was only enough for one cup of regular or decaf which seemed a bit mean if you had two coffee drinkers in the room. Fortunately, free coffee was always available in the lobby. The mattresses on our double beds were firm and comfortable, but the sheets felt cheap and starchy. One annoyance as we were settling down to sleep - our neighbors took a shower or ran a bath and the noise was extremely loud in our room - fortunately only lasted about 10 minutes. The free wi-fi worked very well. We thought the breakfast was low budget and not particularly appetizing (pancakes, tasteless scambled eggs, cheap pastries and muffins, bagels etc.) but just about satisfactory for the price (free!). Both indoor and outdoor pools looked OK but we didn't use them. The location of the hotel is great for getting out and about, and the proximity to shops and restaurants is excellent. Bottom line - most hotels/motels on the cape are overpriced and for $110 this Days Inn offers good value. If price is less important to you, I would definitely pay $30/$40 more to stay at the Hampton Inn about a mile away.
Less

This hotel was chaotic. The whole point of a hotel is to get sleep. In fact, the only 2 things I care about when staying at a hotel are: cleanliness and quiet while I sleep. I paid $170 WITH my AAA discount to stay here and it was barely worth $100. There were kids running around everywhere at all hours without parents. They kept slamming the doors (even at 7 AM) and running up and down the hallways screaming, even kicking a soccer ball in the hallway. I went out to the hallway and politely asked the handful of boys to please keep it down. After it continued, I called down to the front desk at 8 PM (we were exhausted after driving all day and wanted to just get some sleep). Since we had the next night also booked we asked if we could get a refund and just take our chances finding another hotel on Memorial Day weekend (because that's how bad it was). The guy was rude and said there's no way I could get a refund, but he would come up and check it out. It continued so at 9:30 PM, my boyfriend and I went to the desk and he said we were the first who called on a list of people and showed us a LONG list of rooms who had called to complain. He also was much nicer when my boyfriend was with me. He said he went up there to check and there were about 15 adolescent boys running and it WAS ridiculous in his opinion, there were no parents anywhere to be found, and some people just recreate and shouldn't. Since that did not help my case, I asked to be reimbursed again for the next night and to just cancel it. He told me he could not do anything about it and that at 10 PM the curfew is enforced. The chaos continued through all hours of the day and night, I cannot tell you how frustrating it was. Upon leaving I spoke to the manager who just said "soccer teams came in theres nothing we can do. Did you try calling us again? Someone even called this morning (it was only 8 AM) and we went and stopped the boys." Oh really? If you have a laundry list of people who keep calling and its the same complaint, why dont you do something? NOt only the noise and the hassle, but also the kids were spilling hte free coffee and putting their fingers in the condiments, just acting out of control. I will NEVER EVER stay here or at any Days Inn again - ESPECiALLY for $170. I was tired the whole trip and it basically ruined my experience.

Holiday Inn Hyannis

MarciaM
Senior Contributor
29 reviews 29 reviews
Reviews in 19 cities Reviews in 19 cities
74 helpful votes 74 helpful votes
'Nice Holiday Inn - I would stay here again.'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed June 11, 2012 NEW

We had a king-bed room for 4 nights. The bed was VERY comfortable; the mattress not too hard or soft & the comforter was very nice. The room was very clean, except for the carpet which looked rather dirty. Nice large flat-screen tv with many good channels. The bathroom looks to have been recently updated and was very clean with a really deep bathtub, marble walls & floors, and new vanity & sink - a good functional bathroom. We were on the second floor and it was nice to be able to open the window to get some fresh air. We only ate breakfast at the hotel, which was your typical hotel buffet breakfast. Only comment we have is "no toast?" Friendly's is right across the street and Olive Garden is right beside the hotel. There is a grocery store across the street (we walked over) where you get essentials or do as we did and buy some 6-packs of waters or drinks & keep them in the in-room frige; otherwise, pay $2 each in the machines at the hotel. In room safe - love those. The pool looked nice, but we didn't use it. The Madhatter lounge is a nice lively night-time spot with televisions, music and a cool glass wall that has bubbles floating up - the bartender there is great - he makes you feel welcome no matter who or what age you are. They have a business center where you can print boarding passes free, but everything else will cost you. Every staffmember of this hotel that I encountered was very genuinely friendly. I would stay here again.
Less

This was our first trip to Cape Cod and Hyannis was an excellent location for visiting the Cape and Islands. Hotel was easily found and in a good location with a good selection of local eating places which the hotel gave us information on at the point of welcome. Staff were very friendly and pool facility good (although slightly restricted in times for use - not sure if this was due to being early in the season). I would have enjoyed a swim in the morning but none available.

All in all a good value hotel in a good location with very helpful friendly staff.

bluejuce
United States
2 reviews
Reviews in 2 cities Reviews in 2 cities
1 helpful vote 1 helpful vote
'A bit dated but clean and friendly.'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed April 27, 2012 via mobile
1
person found this review helpful

We stayed in the king suite and found it to be clean and tidy if a bit dated. It looks like it was last redone about ten years ago. The tile in the bathrooms was missing some grout, and the celing could use some love (popcorn panels ...ugh)The windows (both downstairs and the loft) all opened, which is a nice change from "canned air only" hotels. The balcony had a nice view of the hotel's courtyard. Price was a bit on the high end to be a great value, but was far far better than the 80.00 a night places in Hyannis. Furniture and TVs (yes one downstairs and one in the loft) were all recent, and the staff was friendly and helpful. All in all a good clean place to spend the night.
Less

'Fairly priced, decent hotel'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed March 15, 2012
4
people found this review helpful

Similar to just about any other chain hotel out there. The room was clean and spacious, just about everything I needed in a one-night stay.

The bar is really cool, with a backdrop of swirling bubbles and neon lights. The bartender there made a mean rum and coke.

Breakfast was so-so. It had the usual spread you would expect, and was pretty crowded. The food was good, but it seemed as though they were slightly understaffed for the crowd they were handling.

Overall, I would recommend this hotel. It was a great stay for the price.

Courtyard Cape Cod Hyannis

explore with more
New York City, New York
Top Contributor
50 reviews 50 reviews
Reviews in 35 cities Reviews in 35 cities
21 helpful votes 21 helpful votes
'Good accomodation on Cape Cod'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed June 14, 2012 NEW

Stayed for one night and was pleasantly surprised by the excellent quality of the accomodation. The hotel is located next to the Cape Cod mall, so it is not the best hotel is you want to be near a beach, or is you are looking for a boutique hotel or charming B&B accomodation. But it is a very clean and comfortable hotel. The room was excellent - large and clean. And a nice feature is that you can open the window! The morning staff, in particular, were very friendly, and there is a good but simple restaurant in the lobby.
A good choice for a Cape Cod visit.
Less

Bostongirl88
Sudbury, Massachusetts
Contributor
11 reviews 11 reviews
Reviews in 8 cities Reviews in 8 cities
7 helpful votes 7 helpful votes
'Okay, but needs more oversight of regular housekeeping'
3 of 5 stars Reviewed May 20, 2012

Just came back from a family event down at the Cape and this is the first more negative than postive review that I have written. First, this is a good place, but the management needs to highlight oversight of housekeeping and routine observation of minor areas, such as cleaning around rink area - had not been thorough and I asked an attendant in the area to go over it. I showed what needed the attention - door area, sink area, and then later saw the edge of the shower area needed more attention; and the attendant did what was asked, but to be more pro-active, this need not be the job of the guest. The indoor pool needed to be tested for ph level, looked a bit cloudy. When we came in the room, it had faint cigarette smells, opened the window and got wonderful sea air which helped, could be the previous guests were heavy smokers and that can carry into a non-smoking area sometimes. When I went to the lobby, the retraction desk had a wire basket on the ground nearby, but it was full. This was during check-in time so it could be that they were busy, but it was not that busy. Small areas like this get noticed by guests and need to be emptied before it is too full. I have been to the cape many times and thought we would try Courtyard out for its convenience and level of comfort. he bed mattress was great, the linens were very comfortable, the reviews were mostly favorable. However, for the price I thought it would be a bit better for overall quality. I would give the staff a passing C, but with hope that they spruce it up a bit before the season really gets busy. It was only half full hotel with a full staff - three attendants on the first floor for cleaning rooms and two registration staff at the front desk, but it looked like they were just going through the motions, not ready for the prime time starting with Memorial Day full throttle. Executive management can make this review turn to a full appreciation if they pay attention to the details mentioned here. Otherwise, it is a good place.

Also for the quietest room, please request rooms far away from the mall side or the road side, because the Sears automotive garages are next door and may be removing lug nuts, the parking is also on Side B as they call it for easier access than walking through the hallways, and in the early weekend morning, the early bird departures for the ferry goers may be noisier than your preferences,,or also the seagulls, yes, a flock of seagulls, who love the asphalt next to the mall for noisy bird parties of throwing quohags, we will let the bird lovers explain what seagulls are doing out there at dawn. Enough said on finding the best rooms as we found out at dawn after a late night ourselves. Not a deal breaker, because we happily fell back to slumbering with fresh, crisp, cool salt air restoring our beauty sleep.





Less
Was this review helpful? Yes

'Never Verbally Spar With A Guest'

4
people found this review helpful

First, the hotel gave no indication they are under major lobby renovations. There was a workman using spakle inches behind the young man checking me in at what looked to be a mini bar.

The noise during the transaction was relentless. He took 3 other guest check ins over mine because he could not verify the reservation. When I asked for the manager--he told me there is no manager on at this time. What? 3:45 PM? A major check in time? I later found out this was NOT the case

I specifically asked for a quiet corner of the hotel to get some sleep. They put me near the hall's second enterance, near the ice machine, next to a guest who came for a romantic weekend. And this is February--off season on the Cape. The hotel was NOT sold out. I call the desk about noise at 6 AM. The night dek man was nice. He told me to call back later when a manager would come on. The manager who I was spoke with later in the morning admitted she never read the log book noting my complaint. She was terse with me on the phone. It was point---counter point with Alyson, the manager at the time. She said the halls were walked and they heard no noise. WELL.............The windows rattled with the sound of the wind. The walls were paper thin, hearing the couple next door having religious moments......."Oh, God! Yes!!!!" Yes!!!!

I had to call Marriott myself, hand the phone over to the man at check in, for him to get my Marriott Elite membership information. He called the closed Elite POINTS desk in Utah.

Never again.

Avoid this Marriot like the Medeival Black Death Plague. And this is from who stays at Marriott over 70 days a year.

Problem with this review?
RogerThat911
Seattle, Washington
1 review
'Underrated hotel , deserves more!'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed May 31, 2012 NEW

After reading pretty bad reviews for other cheap motels in LA, we zeroed in on this hotel and stayed there for 3 days on memorial weekend, and following are my observations.

+ve:
1)The location is good, right next to hollywood metro,ralph's super market and plethora of thai restaurants
2)For about 80 bucks a night, rooms are clean, with TV,AC,mini fridge,hot water,free wifi and shared internet access near the entrance
3)Ideal for singles
4)Close to universal studios and sunset boulevard
5)If you are not traveling by car this is the place to be !!!

-ve:
1)No in-house catering present, so no breakfast/lunch/dinner
2)Doesn't look ideal for families somewhat but shouldn't matter as you spend rest of day outside.

I would have given 5 rating if catering was present.It is worth the buck spent.
Less

We stayed here for one night in April 2012. It was great value for money and conveniently located. Don't be put off by by your first look from the outside. We had a comfortable room, telephone, TV and free wifi (which worked not like in some I've stayed in). There is a pool and a jacuzzi which is a great suntrap for when you want to chill. There are laundry facilities and if you want to use a desktop computer there is one to use for free. There was free carparking. So in terms of facilities there wasn't a lot missing so is great for a short stay in Hollywood

The staff were incredibly helpful and really wanted to make our stay good.

Its only a few minutes drive from Universal Studios and on foot its not that far from the Hollywood Walk of Fame, Sunset etc

Eva G
Marathon
1 review
1 helpful vote 1 helpful vote
'Very good motel in a convenient neighborhood.'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed April 22, 2012
1
person found this review helpful

I am spending a week here in April, 2012 and found it to be perfect for what I need. It's cheap ($72.00/ night) and very quiet. There's telephone, TV and free Wi-Fi in each room Counter staff helped me to use the internet and they were always friendly.
The neighborhood is convenient, located at the base of Griffiths Park and underneath the famous Hollywood sign. There is a small strip mall next to the motel with bank, grocery store, a Ross, Jamba Juice, Starbucks, Thai and Chinese restaurants. More restaurants on the Hollywood Blvd. only a few blocks away. I would gladly return.

'For a motel in LA, good value'

The good: pricing - can't be beat, hospitality - front desk and housekeeping very friendly, renovation - nicely painted rooms, new carpet and redone (small) baths, linens/towels - clean and changed daily, free parking but also convenient to subway.
Not so good: the outside of the motel is drab as is the front office (kind of feels like you're visiting a prisoner or going to a mental hospital with its desk behind sliding window), walls are thin, pressboard furniture worn around the edges, windows are old so noise travels easily, heat/air con unit lowd so not really usable when sleeping
Overall: the management/owners seem to be making consistent improvements and if the furniture is updated, windows are changed, aircon/heat updated and front office redone this will be an incredible deal. They could even raise the price somewhat if they do that!
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?

Problem with this review?
Debbi M
Belmont, California, United States
1 review
'super convenient'
3 of 5 stars Reviewed April 10, 2012

The hotel has free parking and is a block from the subway, which we took to Universal City (tip: the subway tickets have an expiration time, so only buy them one-way). There is a grocery store, a jamba juice and a starbucks practically next store and a drugstore on the corner. There are many inexpensive and tasty Thai restaurants in a couple of blocks.

The courtyard echos sounds, so it is a bit noisy if you are a light sleeper. We were able to walk around the neighborhood in the early evening without feeling threatened, but we did see beggers and drunks and there were sirens during the night. The hotel has bars on the first floor windows.

Our room had a clean shower, but no tub. There is a hot tub and pool in the courtyard, open 9am-9pm.
Less

Comfort Inn Cape Cod

Eric A
Greenfield, Massachusetts
1 review
'Has the potential to be better'
3 of 5 stars Reviewed June 13, 2012 NEW

The staff was extremely friendly throughout the hotel, especially the front desk, who was very helpful with providing suggestions for restaurants and beaches near by. The lobby was nice and big, and the breakfast provided was OK, but it was free so I'm not complaining to much. The rooms were a good size. Ours had a mini fridge/micro which was a nice amenity. I liked how the vanity was outside of the bathroom. It made it easier to get ready in the morning. New flat screen TVs that swiveled were very nice.

The internet throughout the hotel was extremely poor. We had to go to the lobby for the internet to be tolerable. No option for Ethernet connections that I saw which made the situation worse. Hotels now a days should have adequate speeds for their internet. At least 1MB per second. We were lucky to get half of that in the lobby.

The pull out couch in the room was torn on the arm and extremely worn. Also not very comfortable. I feel sorry for who ever has to sleep on it. Some of the outlets in the room had no face plate, which is not safe at all. The caulking around the toilet was almost entirely gone. And the wall paper in the bathroom was stained and starting to peel. No HBO while we were there. According to the front desk, they were still in the process of upgrading the cable service after installing the TVs.

If only one of the above issues could be addressed I would suggest the internet. Having crappy internet speeds now a days is like having a TV without cable. Please fix!
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
Ask Eric A about Comfort Inn Cape Cod
This review is the subjective opinion of a TripAdvisor member and not of TripAdvisor LLC.

Problem with this review?
Ask MARKLI about Comfort Inn Cape Cod
This review is the subjective opinion of a TripAdvisor member and not of TripAdvisor LLC.
Jeff Lang, General Manager at Comfort Inn Cape Cod, responded to this review
May 26, 2012
Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel on Tripadvisor. On behalf of our staff, we apologize for not providing you with a better experience while staying with us. I can understand your frustration with not being able to utilize our indoor heated pool and whirlpool as we were required to do some repairs and maintenance on some of our pool equipment. Unfortunately since the need for these repairs were unanticipated, we were not able to inform you of the pool closing in advance. However, thanks to these repairs, the pool and whirlpool are now in terrific condition as we enter the summer months. The construction trailer was used to store our old televisions as we recently purchased 37 inch Panasonic flat-screen televisions for all of our guestrooms. The trailer has since been removed. I'm glad to hear that found our hotel staff hard-working and friendly. We take a lot of pride in providing our guests with exceptional service and we are pleased to hear that you found this to be the case. I hope you will give us another opportunity to stay here again in the near future.

Hyannis Travel Inn

psummerbee

Reviews in 24 cities Reviews in 24 cities
23 helpful votes 23 helpful votes
'Stay let down by poor and noisy room'
2 of 5 stars Reviewed June 4, 2012
2
people found this review helpful

We booked this hotel following reviews on this site and our guide book. The hotel was in a great location and the staff were all very helpful and polite. There was a free continental breakfast served by the pool and also plenty of free parking

The problem came with the room we were given, 318. It felt like we had been given the worst room in the hotel. The carpet was dirty and didn't appear to have been cleaned (in fact the whole room felt dirty), there were screws on the bed from the door handle, which was razor sharp. The room was above the pool filter which vibrated through the room from about 7.30 am, in the evening we had to ask (a few times) for it to be turned off due to the noise. The room was also at the top of a staircase by a door banged everytime someone walked through

For some reason we were unable to switch rooms on the first night and on the 2nd we were out long enough and returned at 10.30 and just asked for the filter to be turned off, and it was

The inn cost $200 for 2 nights and although may be classed as budget, the room was well below par

Lovelyliki
Douglas MA
Senior Contributor
24 reviews 24 reviews
Reviews in 21 cities Reviews in 21 cities
28 helpful votes 28 helpful votes
'An awesome deal for the money'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed May 8, 2012
1
person found this review helpful

My husband & I haven't spent time down the cape in years. Like 35 years. We decided to go down for a few days & I spent hours checking out different motels down the cape & you have hundreds to choose from. We decided on the Hyannis Travel Inn because they were having a great package - buy 2 nights get 2 nights free. You can't beat that deal. I was so surprised when we pulled in to find out it was the same place we stayed at 35 years ago - at that time they were running a special where they gave you a gift card for a local restaurant. The place has only a few small negatives & many positives. The negatives were they use a key instead of a key card - we felt safe IN the room with the double locks but I'm always leary about leaving the room wondering how many people could have duplicated the room key. The toilet paper roll was on the opposite wall of the toilet & couldn't be reached from sitting ON the toilet. I know it's little but aggravating. We were also told we'd get a king size bed & we got 2 double beds, not a biggie but not what we were expecting. The positives are many. The room was clean as was the bathroom. They had a bath mat you could use in the tub which was a huge positive for me as I have a bad knee & it made me feel safer. The first day we came back to our room & found the maid had been there. We didn't get maid service the 2nd day though I don't know why. The room comes with with a refrigerator & WiFi. Also a blow dryer & something they called an I-ron. Think it might be something to do with an I-pad or I-phone. Also came with an I-Ron board that you must use the I-ron on. Couldn't figure it out. (just kidding). The continental breakfast was awesome. Didn't matter what time we arrived, there was plenty of food. Okay so they don't cook eggs for you - wait a minute - they actually do! There are had boiled eggs, as well as pancakes & waffles (though I didn't see any syrup), different kinds of muffins & pastries, bagels, toast, cereal, coffee, tea & orange juice. Because we couldn't use the 4th night, they told us we could come back & use it in October- so we already booked it. They have an indoor pool & hot tub which we never got to use but it looked very nice. Oh, the place was QUIET. Very important for us. Even though they were totally booked the weekend we stayed, it was quiet. The motel is within walking distance of downtown Hyannis & I'd suggest walking if you can. We tried to find parking on a rainy Friday night & maybe because it was raining it was so busy but we had a hard time finding a place to park on Main Street. We didn't see any town parking lots or anything like that.
Less

EuropeinFebruary
Chartley, Massachusetts
Contributor
14 reviews 14 reviews
Reviews in 10 cities Reviews in 10 cities
10 helpful votes 10 helpful votes
'Right on the Money'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed April 23, 2012
2
people found this review helpful

If you are looking for location and value then this is your place.

We have stayed at the Hyannis Travel Inn a few times and it always delivers. We use it as a launching point for our kid's sporting events on the Cape but we have seen groups of golfers, seniors, and girls on a shopping weekend staying here as well. We keep our expectations in check so we are always pleased. It is not the Ritz. It is a well managed family operated motel in the Cape Cod tradition. While certainly not a new hotel, we find that they are always updating some element of the motel on a continuous basis.

The prices are great and the location, one block off Main Street is a winner. Shopping and dining are only steps away. There is an Italian restaurant, an Irish Pub, and a Steakhouse / Sports Bar all within a 3 minute walk. Waterfront dining is only about 10 minutes on foot and all the shopping of Main Street is basically across the road.

The indoor pool is a nice plus for our kids and the continental breakfast served poolside saves us a breakfast expense at the start of each day.

We got a great offseason special on their website and I think they may also offer AAA discounts.
Less

kalona_harrison
Tewksbury
1 review
3 helpful votes 3 helpful votes
'Would stay here again!'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed April 17, 2012
3
people found this review helpful

This was my second time here and it offers the best value on a budget with the locations in downtown Hyannis. There's an indoor pool, jacuzzi and outdoor pool for the summer. They offer continental breakfast (waffles and pancakes that can be either microwaved or in the toaster), danishes (cinnamon roll, cheese danish, apple danish, etc.), hard boiled eggs, yogurt, cereal (Cheerios, Raisin Bran, Bran, etc.), English muffins, wheat/white toast, plain and poppy seed bagels with cream cheese, coffee, and orange juice.

The room accommodations were good. The water pressure in the shower was great. Most budget hotels I've been in do not have good water pressure so this was a plus for me as well as free wifi and close to plenty of restaurants - seafood, pizza, fast food like McDonald's and Burger King, Mexican, etc. Also close to local beaches and shopping.

My recent stay encouraged me to write this review because of the responsiveness of Liam. After checking out, I realized my ring was missing which I must have dropped along the way from the room and car. The staff was very, very helpful and helping me find it. The lady that tended the continental breakfast area, walked with me from the room to the parking lot to the stairwells and the lobby looking for my ring. The maid also helped me look for in the room while she cleaned it. After no luck, I notified Liam and he said he would call me as soon as it was found or turned in. Well, 20 min. later while on my way to Race Point, he calls and tells me that his son found the ring in the lobby! He then said he would put it in an envelope and leave it at the front desk. I went back after my afternoon at the beach intending to leave a monetary gift for his son but the staff refused. They would not take it.

Based on my experience I would recommend this hotel. The staff is very helpful and in my case, extremely helpful. It may not be a resort but for a family on a budget, this hits the spot.

I spend part of my Spring break vacation here with my daughter every year and never disappointed.
Less

Both the room and the bath had recently been updated nicely with a flat screen tv, refrigerator, microwave, brand new matresses and bedding. The location of the Inn is fantastic being one block away from Main St. Having the included breakfast poolside was a bonus. its_jimc
North Conway, New Hampshire
Reviewer
5 reviews 5 reviews
Reviews in 3 cities Reviews in 3 cities
1 helpful vote 1 helpful vote
'Great weekend in February, will do again!'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed February 22, 2012

My wife and I just spent a weekend here and had a wonderful experience. As noted, the buildings are due for some sprucing up, but the people were super nice and the room was great. Jennifer and Liam at the front desk really know what being customer friendly means!

We had 2 queen beds with a good sized table between them, and along the same wall was a comfortable love seat, so the room was quite large. Add an older but functional fridge, a microwave, and a TV (also an older model but it worked fine) and it was a very spacious and comfortable room.

It's perfectly located a few steps from Main St. and many many local eating and drinking spots. Right now a lot of places are yet to open, but there are a fair number of restaurants open, and just being to leave the Inn and go for a walk along Main St. was great.

We took advantage of the Valentine's special, which was nicely done. We couldn't stay a third night, so we got a "Night to go" certificate which we'll be using to have another nice relaxing weekend on the cape before crazy season!
Less

We didn't use the pool so can't comment on that but ate in the Hearth and Kettle and found it to be reasonably good value with good service.

Reviewer
3 reviews 3 reviews
'good family place'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed June 9, 2012 NEW

We spent a long (5 nights) Memorial Day Weekend at this Resort. We had a two double bed room, which was clean, and pretty big. The bathroom was updated recently. The maids were thorough with cleaning the room daily.
We enjoyed the outdoor pool and hottub, and our 4 year old daughter the inside one, the "pirate ship", which was lots of fun!
The reason I am not giving it 5 stars is because we requested a minifridge at the time of booking, and I was assured we'll have one; we double checked this at the time of our arrival, and yet, when we entered the room, there was no fridge. A couple of days later we asked about it, and we were told someone will bring it; but no one came... so we insisted, and finally got one for the last night... at least, they didn't charge us extra for it... And another reason: the beds were not too comfortable... and were very squeaky...
All in all, I would say it was a nice place to stay.

'Very nice- especially for children'

we stayed at this property for 3 nights over the Memorial Day weekend. It was a very nice, clean, well managed place. There were soccer teams staying at the same time, so our two boys loved it... seeing so many other children and playing with them in the pool and by the fire pit in the evening roasting marshmallows!!
The place it truly catered to young children and our boys loved it.

The Hearth and Kettle restaurant was not good at all- we ate dinner one evening.

'A Good Time'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed May 4, 2012
1
person found this review helpful

I stayed here with my 11 yr old daughter over April vacation. I was impressed with our room, very clean, spacious and the bathroom was brand new. There was many activities going on for the kids throughout the day but my daughter wanted to spend most of the time in the wave pool. It was very crowded and it had to close down a few times unscheduled due to feces and vomit. This is to be expected during a school vacation week. It's definatley a "kid's hotel" so don't come here expecting peace and quiet. I was woken up at 6am to kids running up and down the hall screaming and it didn't stop. We ate 2 meals at the hearth 'n' kettle (on site) and it was very good. We would love to go back but I think I will try to avoid a school vacation week next time.

'Fun vacation week spot'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed April 23, 2012
1
person found this review helpful

The Cape Codder was nicer than I expected... The room was spacious, the furnishings were updated, and all the staffpeople we encountered were very friendly and helpful (especially at the front desk). We were visiting with two children during school vacation week, and the hotel had lots of special events (dance parties, face painting, etc.) to keep the kids busy. It was also nice to have a restaurant right in the building. Of course the main attraction was the wave pool, which my kids went crazy over. It was a lot of fun, although the lack of seating proved to be a problem. It's tough to visit a pool and have nowhere to sit or stow your things... A few more chairs would have been appeciated. Overall, though, we had a great time and I would recommend it, especially for families.

'Noisy!'
3 of 5 stars Reviewed April 23, 2012
2
people found this review helpful

Stayed here twice. Once on a weekend and the second time midweek. Rooms are very noisy if you have anybody staying in an adjoining room. Neighbor turned on the TV around 2 am and was speaking in normal voice, but we heard it all. Called the front desk, and heard the neighbors complain when the front desk called them to ask them to keep the noise level low. Continental breakfast varied, full kitchen only on weekends offseason. Staff was plaesant, pool and sauna were okay. Facility definitely needs an upgrade. Location is right on Main Street, close to the ferry. Holiday Inn might be more $$$, but the facilities there definitely outshine the Heritage House.

Reviews in 20 cities Reviews in 20 cities
56 helpful votes 56 helpful votes
'Disaster'
3 of 5 stars Reviewed October 27, 2011
3
people found this review helpful

This a motel. Don't be fooled, it's a motel. The rooms were only slightly larger than a typical holiday inn, and they are in desperate need of renovation. The bed was ~ 2ft off the floor ! The bathroom was dirty and the fixtures were worn. I was disgusted by the lack of cleaning by housekeeping.
Service in this place is awful. The bell hop doubles as the bus boy and waiter at the one and only restaurant. The food was tasty, but the staff was so rude, I walked out one day. We were traveling with a tour group. Breakfast buffet was provided every morning, but there was apparently a policy that 4oz of juice was the limit for each patron, because when I asked for more juice, I was told that I had had all the juice that I was permitted to have for breakfast....that's when I walked out!
Please stay elsewhere. I certainly will the next time I visit Hyannis.
Less

mirandayork

Senior Contributor
44 reviews 44 reviews
Reviews in 30 cities Reviews in 30 cities
21 helpful votes 21 helpful votes
'Uninspiring but clean.'
2 of 5 stars Reviewed October 20, 2011

Not what we expected at all after seeing the website. Built at the end of the 60s and is still there! Reception not very friendly or helpful except at one point on the 2nd day when they printed a driving route to New York for us. Asked about breakfast - "yes, we serve breakfast". No more info - had to drag bits out of them. Asked about evening meals - no the restaurant only opens Fri and Sat eve. But each evening they were providing meals for coach parties. We probably wouldn't have eaten there as there is loads within walking distance down Main St (though avoid Schooners - see review) and lots more a short drive away. Because of the attitude etc we decided to have breakfast out and found a good place almost next door (Persy's Place) and one across the road. Rooms - spacious, dated, bed the least comfortable of any we've had during this holiday. Bathroom cramped and needs modernising. Reception smells of chlorine from the pool (pool looked quite nice). Wi-fi, as a previous person has said, only available in reception. Reception consists of a few chairs. Website says also available in dining areas but told we couldn't go in there!
Not a hotel we'd go back to or would recommend - I'd class it as a motel.
Less

SomewhatSelective
suburban Phila
Contributor
11 reviews 11 reviews
Reviews in 10 cities Reviews in 10 cities
16 helpful votes 16 helpful votes
'Beware the front desk'
3 of 5 stars Reviewed October 20, 2011

Called for reservations this summer and spoke to a young man whose command of English was iffy and reserved what seemed to be a suite for the family at what seemed to be a decent price. On the way to the hotel that evening, I realized we were running quite late and so telephoned the hotel to confirm that we wouldn't be arriving for another few hours; the young woman who answered told us not to worry.
When we arrived at 11:30 or so to check in I was told that we, or at least part of our party had already done so, which was impossible since we were all together. The rooms had been given to someone else (whose name, by the way, bore no resemblance to ours). And it turned out that the suite we had reserved did not exist either, and the price we had been quoted referred to one room, not the total. Close to an hour followed while one man behind the counter retreated to an office where we could hear him make calls to other management, while a another man (foreign, much younger) who obviously had less authority stood by uncomfortably and waited for orders.
Finally, way past midnight, we were able to get the first man to emerge from the office and were given two rooms in two separate buildings for the price we had originally been quoted, although he was quite obviously angry with us for insisting on paying that price. I never saw the rooms in the main building and so cannot comment on them, but the rooms in the motel-like buildings in the parking lot were fairly large, plain, motel-like and decently clean. The price for the rooms is clearly based on the location of the hotel and the fact that it was high season on the Cape - they were not high-end rooms.
Encounters with staff - not the same as the night before - the next day were pleasant enough. The management apparently hires young Europeans for the summer, some of whom do not have the requisite language skills or sufficient knowledge of the area to be of help (we overheard one young clerk tell a guest a driving time to Provincetown that was way off, especially for a Saturday). In the worst cases, like ours, the miscommunication makes for exhausted guests and angry staff.
Great location if you need access to the ferries, however!
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes

2
people found this review helpful

My husband and I spent a few days here and very much enjoyed our stay. The hotel is in a perfect location overlooking the harbour in Hyannis within easy walking distance of restaurants, bars and attractions. It is not a luxury property but the rooms are clean and quite big. The decor is somewhat tired but the price is reasonable. Coffee juice and pastries were included in lieu of breakfast. It would be a big improvement if something savoury were to be included e.g. bread rolls or bagels. We could not see the point of sweet food for breakfast. All in all a nice place to "chill out" at a reasonable price.

ryanma30
Boston, Massachusetts
2 reviews
5 helpful votes 5 helpful votes
'Wonderful stay... A bit unhappy with just one aspect.'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed September 4, 2011
5
people found this review helpful

A very basic hotel with throwbacks to the 70's.  Location is wonderful as it is directly across from the Hyannis Harbor.  If you are looking for super modern with loads of extra's then this is bit the place for you.  It is a simple, clean, and fair priced motel.

Pro's
-directly across from the harbor
-very clean rooms
-majority of the staff is wonderful and very helpful
-ample parking
-indoor and outdoor pools
-free coffee and small pastries
-family run for many years
-loads of coupons and brochures in the office.
-great evening staff recommended the Black Cat next door..thank you!

Con's
-was a wonderful weather day on that Friday and Saturday and the lady (who is pregnant) refused to open the pool outside.  There were kids that thought 80 and mostly sunny in the afternoon was too cool.  Same weather on that Thursday and Monday and pool was open (different lifeguard)

-one very rude and condescending front desk employee (daytime, woman, glasses)  I wish I had her name because I would have spoken to the owner)  She was observed to be very mean to a fellow worker in the parking lot.  He was a maintenance worker who was very friendly with everyone. She was screaming and berating him in the lot about a trash bag and towels.  We had just been walking through the lot and heard her very loudly.  We even hard issues with her at the front desk when we asked a few questions about the pool and about an Internet coupon.  We are not sure if we would go back again next summer vacation as it really just bothered us a great deal.  Our kids were amazed at her and would see her and they would go the other way.

Otherwise, we would stay there again if you can avoid the one bad apple.  Sad because we had a wonderful vacation when not considering her.  I hope that it will be taken care of in the future.  
Less

vbos2n
Boston, Massachusetts
1 review
1 helpful vote 1 helpful vote
'old motel'
2 of 5 stars Reviewed August 22, 2011
1
person found this review helpful

My family and I stayed here aug.18 -20. Pros: availability, close to ferry to martha's vineyard, free parking and walk to veteran memorial park and kalmus beach. Also, the front desk was very nice and allowed us to leave our cars in their lot for free the day we checked out so that we could take the ferry to the vineyard (came back same day).
cons: motel is old, not updated, and charge $5 extra for refrigerator. Normally I wouldn't care but we had our infant daughter with us and had to keep her food and milk refrigerated. Thus this motel is not best choice if you have kids. No irons and hair dryers in the room, you have to go ask for one at front desk. the grounds are not pretty. Pools are really small and the outdoor pool is just in the middle of the parking lot!
cleanliness: my room was dirty there were roasted nuts on the chair and nuts on the rug. They did not change out sheets daily, which would of been ok but I don't even think there were fresh sheets to begin with. The beds were old. Overall this is a bare bones motel. nothing special, just a place to sleep. I would not suggest it for families with children, maybe just adults. Bathrooms are small (mine smelled) and shower head was broken.
Less

roaming_around_US
Pa
Contributor
15 reviews 15 reviews
Reviews in 10 cities Reviews in 10 cities
14 helpful votes 14 helpful votes
'You pay for location!'
3 of 5 stars Reviewed August 21, 2011
2
people found this review helpful

You pay for location and this place has it! Right across the street from the Hyannis Harbor, where you will catch the boat for Martha's Vineyard and Nantucket. Also great place to catch a fishing boat for hire and there are plenty of them. Half and full day. There are a few rooms facing the harbor, we weren't in one of them, but just step outside our door and we could see the boats from our room.
If you are looking for anything modern, don't stay here. This places wreaks of the '60's. The toilet in our room was so low I almost needed a riser to get up from it. No bathroom fan, either. Basic linen and towels. Beds were average. Not the best or worst. Air conditioning units are in the wall at bed height and loud, blowing over us at night. I have trouble sleeping when it's not dark in the room. The curtains were thin and the light shone through the main windows, the back side windows only had a valance with no blinds. Same in the bathroom, though the windows were frosted. The room was very bright for sleeping. This may not bother some. Some mini blinds or full curtains would really help with the light shining in at night. We booked through HotWire for a what I thought was a discount. We could have gotten the same rate through the hotel. Also, my granddaughter was paging through a coupon book and they offered a discount coupon for "walk-ins" at about a $20 saving over our rate. This didn't make me happy. We were there during the busiest month, August, and they had rooms available for walk-ins. The outdoor pool was closed the entire time we were there (4days), but the indoor pool was open until 9PM each nite. Breakfast was minimal, but what I would call normal...coffee,tea, orange juice and pastry. Really no privacy if you wanted to sit outside of your room, you basically are sitting on the sidewalk, with your neighbor very close. We were on the ground floor. This is a VERY BUSY AREA. Right across the street on the same side as the hotel, you will find the parking for the boats. Cars coming and going all the time. But it really wasn't "noisy" when we were there, just very busy. We walked everywhere, mainly the main street, a few blocks away, to shops and restaurants. The beach area (really the bay, not the ocean) is not far, you could walk (I think it's far), but it's an easy drive with kids and the stuff you have to lug for a day at the "beach". The motel offers a discount coupon for a few restaurants, $6 off 2 adult meals. Not bad. The staff was very helpful and nice. The motel was very clean and kept-up as far as that goes, but for the price of the room, I expected much more. I would stay here again if I went during the off season when the rooms are $65, but I wouldn't spend $138/night again to stay here. But, like I said....location location location.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
Ask roaming_around_US about Hyannis Holiday Motel

'NEVER AGAIN'

people found this review helpful

Let me start by start by saying that we booked our stay at this Motel because it is located right in the center of town and the staff was very friendly upon booking reservation of August 1 -7, 2011. We arrived late (which we called in advance and was told this would not be a problem), and the female clerk charged the wrong amount on the credit card. She was extremely unfriendly and lacked in customer service skills. After a small disagreement, we adjourned to our reserved room. The room was very clean but is in DESPERATE NEED OF A REMODEL. We unpacked the car (which at check-in, we had to provide the license plate number) and began to settle into the room. My friend goes to use the facilities, at which point, she exclaims, 'I think we have heated toilet seats'. I mean seriously, is this really possible in a place like this? It was rather comical at first. Before heading to dinner, we stopped in at the front desk to inquire about the 'heated' seats. The male desk clerk, looks at us like we are absolutely crazy, and tells us that he will have someone check it out. Later that night the bathroom floor is slippery from the sweat DRIPPING from the toilet seat! To use the bathroom was extremely uncomfortable. We inquired again and were greeted with the same response. By day three we are told that they run hot water through the pipes in the summer. SERIOUSLY????? Has anyone ever heard something so ridiculous? They never offered us a new room or any type of compensation for our discomfort. By the weekend, the occupancy level increased and the parking became extremely limited where our room was located. Sure they have plenty of parking of the complete opposite side in the back of the motel. We inquired once again at the front desk if the cars that were parked in the lot were in fact paying customers. The response was that there was no way he could keep track of all the cars in the parking lot. ARE YOU KIDDING ME? We had to provide our license plate number at the time of check in. Bottom line this motel is not worth the money and the staff is unfriendly and rude. The accommodations are extremely limited, such as, no coffee pot, internet, microwave, need we go on! NEVER AGAIN!

'One night stay for Cape Cod Melody Tent show'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed August 17, 2011
1
person found this review helpful

Highly recommend this motel for a one night stay. Most of the area require min 2 or 3 night stay during summer months. This is one of the few who allow 1 night stay at a very reasonable rate. We stayed in the queen bed room with jacuzzi tub for 2. The room was very spacious and clean with nice sized bathroom with a large jacuzzi tub. It was lovely and relaxing after going to a show and walking around town all day and evening. We also swam in the indoor pool. This was also clean and water was refreshing. The staff is very friendly and helpful. We did not have breakfast at the motel or go to the bar they have onsite. But the area is perfect -You don't need your car unless you plan to go to the beaches - it is right in the middle of Main Street with easy access to restaurants, bars, shops, even walked to the Harbor and had an excellent lunch of lobster salad at Spanky's. We also walked to Melody Tent and had dinner at Paddocks before the show - highly recommend. Nice date night and overnight stay!

3 helpful votes 3 helpful votes
'Horrible customer service/False allegations'
1 of 5 stars Reviewed August 15, 2011
3
people found this review helpful

This past Saturday night I had the worst experience a person could have as a guest of a hotel. I checked into the hotel sometime after 6 pm and went to my room. After cleaning up I went to the front desk and asked the woman if it was possible for 2 friends of mine who had come down the cape to run the same race as I did could stay in my room and I would pay any additional charge .She stated that it was hotel policy that only 2 adults(which we all are, in fact married men with children) and 3 children could stay in the room I was given. She said that they could hang out but could not stay over. I said that is fine I understand your policy. We came back to the room with a couple of friends and were quietly hanging out when the night watchman/security guard knocked on my door and said my guests had to leave. I said fine and we all left and walked them back to the hotel they were staying.
When I got back to my room I find a note taped to my car saying I am being evicted and the security guard accusing us of breaking the window of the hotel room below us. I told him nothing could be further from the truth and I asked him to prove it to me that it was one of us. He said it was on video and I asked him to show me the video and he wouldn't /couldn't . He was being very confrontational. At that point 2 police officers arrived and could not have been more cordial and understanding of the situation. They did say because it was private property that it would be best for us to leave. They went out of there way in trying to find us another hotel to stay in for the night. I am pretty sure that if they felt we were at fault and broke a window they would have arrested someone for destruction of property. It was pretty clear that we did nothing wrong. We then went to the room to retrieve our bags I found that my car keys were taken by the security personal. This person had no right to touch my personal belongings. The next day I made several attempts to speak with a manager about the situation and was unsucessful. He finally returned my call this morning and was very rude to my wife and said he will be charging me for the broken window. It now seems that I will have to take legal action. As you can see in other reviews, previous guests also had issues with the manager and security. There are many great places to stay on the cape and this is not one of them.
Less

We have a Zero Tolerence Policy in effect, which is for the comfort and security of all our guests that do not need to be distrubed by unruly people who have no regard for other people and thier property. This policy is fully stated on our website and we will continue to uphold it.

'could use an update and new staff'
3 of 5 stars Reviewed May 22, 2012

Stayed here for a conference for the second time. Both experiences were similar in that the front desk staff is downright rude and the hotel is pretty worn down. On the second trip, my closet door wasn't even attached, it was simply leaning against the wall. There is a horrible draft at the sliding glass door so it obviously doesn't seal well. The beds were very comfortable, however, with both foam and feather pillows. As others have mentioned, there's a weird layout with lots of steps - tough to navigate with luggage, much less with any type of disability. Banquet staff was friendly & helpful, as was the only waitstaff I came in contact with. The gym was very nice - best thing about this place. If I were going to this area on vacation I would definitely find another option.

'Not bad but needs improving'
3 of 5 stars Reviewed May 11, 2012
1
person found this review helpful

We recently stayed here for a convention. We had second floor room in the building near the lobby which was in an ideal location. The room itself was clean and very large. It does need some updating though. The beds were very comfortable, the pillows were just okay. The bathroom in our room was very small but functional. Friends of ours were in a building on the other side of the putting greens. Their room was smaller than ours but their bathroom was twice the size. Enjoyed having a fridge in the room and a spacious balcony that overlooked the putting greens. Since we were on the second floor we did not have an issue with noise above. There was a family across the hall and down one room from us that had a child that cried, loudly. We could here the child when we were in the hallway but not in our room. The hallways and other areas of the hotel also need updated. The indoor pool was a nice size as was the area around the outdoor pool. The food in the restaurant/bar was very good. The food at our event in the function hall was also good. The staff was alittle slow and at times seemed disorganized (never did get coffee or spoons with our dessert) but overall it was a wonderful event. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. This hotel was very nice for a convention/conference or for one/two nights but not for an extended trip to Hyannis.

Traer S
Providence, RI
1 review
1 helpful vote 1 helpful vote
'Elm Court is magical.'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed February 8, 2012
1
person found this review helpful

Intimate Opulence.
Elm Court was once the summer home of Emily Vanderbilt when Lenox was a gilded age playground for moguls and socialites. This stunning, yet petite estate is quite understated when you compare it with other Vanderbilt properties like Biltmore and the Newport mansions and that's exactly what makes it so accessible.

Where to begin? The rooms are all individually decorated with period antiques, (some even original to the house) and feature striking architectural details. Even the smallest room is airy and spacious. The suites are just plain decadent. The common rooms include a spectacularly adorned library with an eclectic collection of books on every topic imaginable,an all glass conservatory that overlooks the mountains and a truly awesome, enormous, walk-in fireplace in the foyer where we sat at night drinking wine and toasting marshmellows. You also have full access to the estate kitchen where we cooked dinner one night. Finally, the estate is surrounded by woods through which there are many trails and paths, several which lead down to a beautiful lake.

The managers are incomparable. Amy and Les (married couple) live on the grounds and attend to every last detail with grace and sincerity. We came with our 5 month old daughter for whom they provided a Pack n Play and a rocking chair in the room. Amy also booked a babysitter for us to have a date night. (Unfortunately our daughter got sick and we had to cancel.) I wish I could say that we were special, but I suspect that they make everyone feel like instant family.

Elm Court does not feel like a hotel. There is no check in desk, no valet, no spa. I find this to be part of what makes the experience so singular. At Elm Court, you don't visit a Vanderbilt estate, you live in one. The website is not as sophisticated as you would expect from a property of this caliber, but don't be fooled. From the decadent treats (procured from a local chocolatier) left on your pillow at turn down, to the all organic breakfast and eco-friendly toiletries, Elm Court is all about the details.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
Ask Traer S about Elm Court
This review is the subjective opinion of a TripAdvisor member and not of TripAdvisor LLC.

ALnLuc
Waterbury, Connecticut
1 review
'A wonderful experience'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed December 4, 2011

Let me begin by saying that all the complimentary things said in previous posts about Les, the general manager, are absolutely true-- a warm, gracious host who made us feel very comfortable and welcome. Thank you for that! As far as the property, if you're looking for an ultra modern "chic" resort with no "flaws," then this place isn't for you. But, if you are looking to be taken back to an era long past, and surrounded in the history & true elegance of the gilded age, then book this place immediately. To put things in perspective, we're talking about a property 100+ years old that was fairly recently rennovated after 50 years of neglect and vandalism. There's a wall displaying numerous "before" photos, and the transformation to its current state is VERY impressive. The building, which I would describe as a type of castle, is very well restored, and while it isn't "spotless," it is gorgeous in its own right, tranquil, relaxing, warm, inviting, and in a beautiful location overlooking the Berkshire mountains and a lake. The view must be breathtaking during foliage season. I was hooked the moment I entered and saw a raging fire in a monstrous fireplace located in the lobby. Les said we could've roasted marsmallows in there, but it was large enough to roast a pig!!!! I felt like I walked into the Great Gatsby or "stately Wayne manor." We stayed in the Sloane Suite-a very large, elegantly appointed room with a comfortable king sized bed, wood burning fireplace, in suite bathroom with jacuzzi tub, couch, and small dinner table with 2 chairs. There was even another small bed in the room presumably for a child. We explored pretty much the entire mansion, and I think viewed all of the rooms. I would definitely recommend any of the suites as my top choices. The Vanderbilt suite, in particular, is absolutely magnificent, and I plan to stay there next time. Even the smallest room was very nice and appeared comfortable, but not all of the non-suites had private baths. Guests are given free run of the huge kitchen for storing food/drink, and even preparing meals if one so desired. We had no interest in leaving the property, and brought food which we ate in our suite in front of a fire. There's even a small room on the third level which had ping pong and air hockey tables. There was very interesting furniture and accent pieces throughout, giving the place a very elegant, tasteful, and subtlely upscale atmosphere. I wouldn't necessarily recommend this place for children. BUT, Elm Court is a PERFECT choice for a short romantic getaway, and I can also see it as being an outstanding location for a special event such as a wedding. I'm by no means a "world traveler," but I have pretty high standards for when I do go away. Elm Court overall exceeded my expectations. I would unreservedly recommend the place, particularly the suites, for people who want to live in a fantasy world for a brief period, and can overlook a few small flaws related to the age of the building. We definitely will be there again!!!!
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
Ask ALnLuc about Elm Court
This review is the subjective opinion of a TripAdvisor member and not of TripAdvisor LLC.

Reviewer
4 reviews 4 reviews
Reviews in 4 cities Reviews in 4 cities
2 helpful votes 2 helpful votes
'Awesome Experience!'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed October 28, 2011
2
people found this review helpful

I love all things Vanderbilt and was so excited to finally find a Vanderbilt home where you can actually stay! I was not disappointed. The mansion has a long history and is beautifully restored. I made reservations online with no trouble at all. I specified that I wanted a bathroom in my room since I know lots of B&Bs have shared bathrooms. Elm Court does have some of these rooms, so specify if you want your own bathroom. I cannot express how much I loved this place!! Les was our host & he was great. We talked a lot about the history of the house and toured most of it too. There are tons of places to walk on the grounds & it's all so scenic. It's close to the villages of Lenox, Stockbridge & Lee, so that's convenient. We only stayed one night (mid-week getaway!), had a nice breakfast the next morning & dawdled as long as we possibly could. The rooms are gorgeous & clean. Did I leave anything out? Oh yeah - I want to move in!!!
Less

Please visit again, during the winter months, for snowshoeing on the grounds you loved so much! We'll have the snowshoes and cocoa waiting!

With sincere thanks and best,
Sonya

Hyannis Harbor Hotel

Dianne285
Milford, Pennsylvania
1 review
'Weekend at Hyannis Harbor Hotel Cape Cod ,Ma. Cousins reunion. 4/20/12'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed June 14, 2012 NEW

We checked into a bi-level unit . Thought it would be nice to have a larger unit to share with my sister & 2 cousins..... and yet be together to reminisence ! It was a cousins reunion. The first room we reserved had been flooded so they gave us a alternate. I can say the room was clean which is good ..but the set up had a lot to be desired ! The man problem is the usage of space. There was a bedroom on 1st. with a king bed & upstairs the 2nd bedroom had 2 queens size beds... very nice but on this unit which could hold 8 people....there was only one tiny bathroom on the first level. So any one who was upstairs had to go downstairs to use the BR facilities......not only that.... the sink area of bathroom was out side the actual bathroom....not very sanitary . The hotel is close to ferrys ....a plus , town is within walking distance if you are able to walk.... problably a mile. They do have a restaurant but it wasn't opened ,.... we found other places in a reasonable distance to eat at. On a whole being off seasoned....I think the hotel did Ok for us... they did give us a discount since our room was changed... and it was clean....but the bi-level units need to be re-modeled & diffienently of need of a second fl bath room. We had a great weekend , enjoyed walking into town & found cute places to eat. But , do your researach... there isn't too much to do in this area. Also we had a very difficult time getting off the cape due to traffic. ...2 hours delay due to bridge construction....so be prepared !
Less

Reviews in 2 cities Reviews in 2 cities
21 helpful votes 21 helpful votes
'A little pricey'
2 of 5 stars Reviewed June 11, 2012 NEW

Stayed from June 7th thru June 10th during a Men's Golf Weekend. Most of the group stayed at a less desirable hotel on Main St. Hyannis, but I chose to spend a little more and get place with a nice outdoor pool. The pool was excellent, but the room was tiny. Pretty much all I needed, but for the money, I expected a bit more. There was a small lounge in the hotel, several other lounges within walking distance, and a very nice view of the harbor. I was surprised to find out that I was being charged 14 bucks a night to park my car. The reason is that parking is limited due to the ferrys that leave the Harbor. As a result, it cost me to park my car in their own "private parking lot". What a scam. No, I will not stay here again.
Less

happy t
somewhere,ct
Reviewer
3 reviews 3 reviews
'Three stars might be pushing it.'
3 of 5 stars Reviewed May 2, 2012

Having read the horrible reveiws regarding this hotel , we went expecting the worst. Lucky for us, we must have gotten a renovated room. It was on the 1st floor in the back part of the hotel, a handicapped room. The room was as pictured on the website. It was clean, sparse and not disgusting, however there was a strange odor, kinda like lavender and mint. I checked for bugs...none that I saw except for a spider in the bathroom. Sheets were clean, looks as if the ceiling had been repopcorned recently, air conditioner and heater were updated. The bath was a good size, but lacked a vanity, they cgave you 2 small glass shelves for your toiletry...not enough. We had a deck which was peeling paint, the exterior needs work on the building and parking lot. The indoor pool was open upon request( rather odd) however extrememly old...but looked clean ( if you can get past the oldness), there is a Jacuzzi as well, but not a commercial one. I personally wouldn't use the pool. The lobby is very nice, and the outdoor pool area seemed updated and nice, but the pool and outside was closed due to the time of year. I would but it on a par of a Days Inn. It has a lot of potencial, but still needs work. If you go in the summer when the pool is open, pershaps then it will be a three star hotel (motel)...but if you look at it just as a room...don't expect too much. I was happy it was clean, and not stained or gross. After seeing some pics online, I thought I was going to be in for a horrible experience. I think we got lucky getting a renovated room. I smelled no mold in the areas we were in. The location is wonderful, walking distance to the Main St. and Ferry's. If you get a great rate it's worth a try.
Less

Reviews in 39 cities Reviews in 39 cities
46 helpful votes 46 helpful votes
'Filthy, Disgusting, Horrible Rooms.'
1 of 5 stars Reviewed April 24, 2012
3
people found this review helpful

This is what my reservation said, "Newly renovated guest room features one king size bed with one queen sleeper sofa. Harbor front rooms surround our center courtyard with outdoor pool area, Harborview Restaurant and Bar, new harbor view terrace, pergola and fire pit. These rooms are located closer to the harbor and ferry than our non-harbor front rooms."

The truth of the matter is the rooms were horrendous. Wallpaper was peeling off the walls. There was mold everywhere. The tile floor was dirty and stained. There was no cooking capabilities (no stove top, no microwave.) There was a fridge surprisingly.

The bathroom was atrocious. Dirt and mildew everywhere. When you were standing in the shower, it felt like a coffin there was no room to turn around.

As for the location of the rooms, saying they had a harbor view is like saying you can see the Great Wall of China from the Space Station. The harbor view you get is that of the ferries in dock and that is across a road across a parking lot across a pier. This does NOT count as a harbor view.

Overall, this hotel is a dive. Best advice I can give is to stay away until they actually renovate the rooms as they promised.
Less

ferran5
Cliffside Park, New Jersey
Senior Reviewer
8 reviews 8 reviews
Reviews in 3 cities Reviews in 3 cities
3 helpful votes 3 helpful votes
'A Value For Your Family'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed May 25, 2012
1
person found this review helpful

After spending, for many years, my Cape Cod vacations at a small family owned motor inn, last summer I decided to go right across the street to a "chain" motor inn known to cater to families with children and seniors. I refer to one of the "America's Best Value Inn and Suites" at 206 Main Street, Hyannis, Massachusette 02601. It has a cheerful, welcoming atmosphere; is well-maintained; keeps clean rooms; a gracious front office supposedly open and staffed throughout the night; and a small coffee room open for the seniors early in the morning. There is plenty of parking space to accommodate this two-level motel as well as a swimming pool. Its location is ideal for tourists. It's at the east end of Main Street of Hyannis, a busy shopping and dining district. Also, the price is right for seniors and families, but rates are really not that much lower than in privately owned tourist motels. I hope to return to "America's Best Value Inn and Suites" this summer.
Less

3 helpful votes 3 helpful votes
'A cheap hotel'
2 of 5 stars Reviewed October 10, 2011
3
people found this review helpful

I thought it was a bad sign that this was the only 2-star hotel available for the Saturday night of a holiday weekend. One bright spot: some of the reviewers had complained about noise in the parking lot, and the staff assured me that it was an isolated occurrence and DID give me a quiet end room. Everything else? The towels were small as postage stamps. The tissues rough. The sheets very rough. The first night of the 2-night stay, my knee bled in a few obvious spots on one of the beds. To my surprise, even though I left a good tip, the cleaner did not change the sheets, just remade the bed! The breakfast was not too bad. The feeling you get in general is that they are out to save a penny.

It's an old hotel but they are trying to renovate it. The only problem I had was the set up of the room--the door opened right to the beds and I didn't like that. Also, the walls are VERY VERY thin and I was awakened to the couple next door engaging in sexual activity. Good for them but bad for me after driving all day. LOL. But it's not a bad place at all--especially if you are on a budget.

'Nice confortable room at a reasonable price'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed August 7, 2011
1
person found this review helpful

Traveled with wife and 2 kids and needed a place to stay over in Hyannis before catching the ferry to Nantucket the following day. This is a _very_ budget motel. The room smelled stuffy at first. But it smelled much better after running air conditioning for a little while. The room was clean and all the appliances worked. The motel is a stone throw away from the Hyannis Airport, close to many restaurants on Rt. 132. Staff was very friendly and the free wireless internet connection was good (ask for password at the desk).

1 of 5 stars Reviewed May 19, 2010

My husband and I had actually stayed in this hotel back in October. As we rolled into town, we were greeted by some lunatic walking in the middle of the road. My husband was hauling a trailer and had to lock his brakes up in order to avoid hitting this nut. So after that fiasco, we pulled into the parking lot, the whacko watched every move we made. It was quiet scary from the gates. There were a couple people staying there at the time and they walked out of their rooms to watch us, it was frightening. The hotel staff was very nice though, they did all they could to make us feel comfortable but the room was sub par. It looked clean but the curtains and bedspread has stains, I was afraid to walk on the carpet and our coffee maker was broken. I was a little afraid to put my head on the pillow at night so it was a restless sleep. We were up and out of there by 6am out of fear. This was definitely a hotel on the wrong side of town. It is a shame since the employees did their best to make it a nice stay.

Courtyard Resort

Dee D
Mystic, Connecticut
1 review
'One of my favorite places to vacation!'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed June 8, 2012

Hyannis gets 5 stars for being a GREAT little town for strolling Main Street day or night. Quaint shops, wonderful restaurants, outdoor cafes, fun family atmosphere, and close to beaches. The Courtyard Resort is right off Main Street and in the center of all the activity! I've been vacationing there annually since 2001. While the room decor is dated, the resort is currently updating rooms floor by floor, but honestly, there is so much to do we spend very little time in our room when visiting the Cape anyway. All we require is a nice pool when we are there, (kudos to their large liver-shaped pool, sauna, & raised hot tub which we always seem to have to ourselves), and a clean place to rest out heads. They satisfy on both counts. They do also have a garden with BBQ grills and picnic tables right off the pool area for those who enjoy cookouts. Go and have fun!

Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
Ask Dee D about Courtyard Resort
This review is the subjective opinion of a TripAdvisor member and not of TripAdvisor LLC.

shawchessplayer
Kendal, United Kingdom
Contributor
20 reviews 20 reviews
Reviews in 20 cities Reviews in 20 cities
21 helpful votes 21 helpful votes
'Awful'
1 of 5 stars Reviewed February 9, 2012
1
person found this review helpful

We stayed here as a time share week, and we can honestly say it is the worst time share we have ever seen.
It is difficult to describe how poor this property is.
In the 1960s-1970s it was a motel and this is the best way to describe the property. Unfortunately, it is very obvious that very little has changed since it was a motel. The furnishings in the rooms must be the originals, and there are very few facilities. RCI withdrew this property from their books a few years ago, so if your time share company is still using it you may want to ask them why.
Our room ( and other rooms are similar ) 
 had a very old' tatty' sofa, full of cigarette burns
 the carpet was old, had squares missing, and again had cigarette burns
  had a pull-down bed with no duvet, bedspread, or any decent covering. There was a brown rough blanket- what we would call an ex-army blanket'
 12 thin wire coat hangers in an old wardrobe
 had two old electric rings as the cooker' which were loose
 had minimal kitchen utensils- odd knives & forks which didn't match
 had no wine glasses- only tumblers
 had no utensils for microwave cooking
 had NO iron or ironing board
 had NO hair dryer
 had NO laundry facilities  in fact there were NO laundry facilities on site !! I asked and was given instructions to go to the town laundry  well over  mile away.


The site 
 had nobody on site overnight from about 4:30  5:00 p.m. until the following morning
 had NO laundry facilities
 had NO internet
 The swimming pool only had two small lights on after dark -. it was difficult to see. A few large windows had gaps between the woodwork The windows were so filled with moisture it wasn't possible to see through them One night the hot tub smelled absolutely putrid. This was fixed for the next day after we complained. After a night of rain the ladies changing room was flooded, and full of towels and buckets for 2 days. The towels supplied were so old and small it was difficult to get dry. There were a half dozen sun-beds outside the pool which were so filthy we couldn't use them

Less

albert1947
Worcester, Massachusetts
1 review
4 helpful votes 4 helpful votes
'Old Cape Cod - Friendly - Comfortable - Clean'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed November 19, 2010
4
people found this review helpful

as an owner, I am annoyed at the reviews. They always tried to stay affordableand as far as being clean goes.they are.however, they do not do daily housekeeping  only weekly  (you can pay to have daily housekeeping)  but there is a housekeeping unit that has everything stocked that you might need, including clean linen and towels each day if you want them. There is a towel and linen closet in the unit itselfwith plenty of clean towels and sheets. I do take umbrage with people who want lobster but want to pay for a bag of chips! I have to defend the Courtyard as I have spent many wonderful times down there.and the location CANNOT BE BEAT. As far as being dirty or moldy  that is nonsense. The people who left negative reviews sound like very unsophisticated bumpkins who are not in touch with old cape cod! You can stay at the Courtyard and feel very comfortable and relaxed.
Less

rockybullwink
Alexandria, Virginia
1 review
3 helpful votes 3 helpful votes
'Don't take your socks off!'
1 of 5 stars Reviewed November 14, 2010
3
people found this review helpful

We were given a week's stay as a gift for me and my partner's 3rd anniversary. I will start with the only positive first and that is the location. Easy to get to and from key areas of interest.

Everything else is a negative and I have no tolerance for unclean floors, hence the sock reference, and soiled linens. I also found the showers to be akin to the scene from "Psycho" with such a drab and moldy atmosphere (not to mention the rust stains) the shampoo burned my eyes as they were left open.

Why were they left open, I knew you'd ask, well that is due to the simple fact that the dead bolt didn't lock. When my partner tried to find a maintenance man he was told that "we don't do that around here!!??"

Well, our week's stay turned into 2 nights after the racket from the hot water pipes kept us awake followed during the first night the 2nd night was another story for it seemed like it was being rented out by the hour???!!

The sound cans being opened, the smell of smoke, and noises as you can imagine....eeekkkk......followed by silence and then a repeat of the same was crazy! To make matters worse someone knocked on our door, and wouldn't stop, and when I finally opened it (chain attached) a sketchy looking young man with a nascar hat asks me what my problem is!!!!!

We high tailed it out of there the next morning and headed for an expensive, but clean, alternative.
Less
