notlovingthistrip
Hyannis, Massachusetts
1 review
1 helpful vote 1 helpful vote
'To be polite, it's a dump'
1 of 5 stars Reviewed November 6, 2010
1
person found this review helpful

We just walked in, and we are already checking for hotel rooms elsewhere. The door has been kicked in (the wood around the deadbolt is obviously shattered, and has been re-glued), the fabric cover on the sofa is ripped, the headboard on the murphy bed is broken, and there are stains on the linens. Out in the hall the walls are discolored and there are sections where the wall cover is peeling off. A family member owns a time share, has enjoyed her visits here in the past, and gave us this trip as a gift.

Obviously there must be "good" rooms in this facility (given the positive reviews and our family member's good experience) but I'm afraid I haven't seen a single thing I can recommend to others. While I could perhaps look past the shabby/ripped/stained furnishings... a door that has been kicked in is just too much. This "resort" is dirty, shabby, and sends out a very "sketchy" vibe. If you're a woman traveling alone or a family traveling with children give this one a pass.

(and I hate writing this since, as I said, it was a gift)
Less

1 helpful vote 1 helpful vote
'Very good for the money. Clean & Adequate.'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed July 29, 2011
1
person found this review helpful

How wonderful that the Cascade is right there in a great location for economy minded people like me! The room was clean and spacious (and there was no odor). We chose not to spend $200+ a night for an accomodation that we were going to sleep in. We were out for at least 10 hours a day, every day. We never needed a car, everything was in walking distance and Hyannis is a super place to vacation for a few days. Call first, if a pool is important to you; there wasn't any water in it. If you get bad weather (we didn't) they have movies to borrow at the office. Ignore that picture of the dirty washcloth. Their towels are old but the owner says that is because some people tend to take home new towels and he is trying to keep the costs down. He has discarded the stained ones in the picture.

jeepgirl201
Seattle, WA
1 review
2 helpful votes 2 helpful votes
'Wonder place to stay with my pet :)'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed April 15, 2009
2
people found this review helpful

When my husband and I checked into the motel we felt welcome. The desk person was very helpful and nice. You can see two friendly heads of the owners dogs peeking at you. (so cute). Lots of brochures of places to visit in the office including information for the islands.
We stayed for two nights in a two double bed efficiency room. It was very clean. So, we were happy. It came with soap, cups, extra toliet paper and had a pretty nice kitchen set up. Bar counter and stools. It had a 27" tv, alarm clock, coffee maker, microwave. It felt like home and my dog skippy was very happy.
There was a big area for my dog to run around and you get to look at some vintage bikes.
The hotel is walking distance to almost everything.
My over all experience at the Cascade was pleasant and I can't wait to come back to the Cape. Maybe next time I will try there suite!

I would've rathered slept in the car, but it was already late, so we slept one night and checked out the next morning and luckily found another place to stay. Then we saw their pool, and it was green, I mean, if the pool isn't kept up to date, then imagine the rooms. I realize it is a motel, but i've been to other motels and they were much cleaner. 40 helpful votes 40 helpful votes
'It'll do'
3 of 5 stars Reviewed August 19, 2008
2
people found this review helpful

My wife and I (and our two small dogs), stayed for one night. What you get is a clean small room with a frig and TV. Don't expect anything else like soap, ice, swimmable water in the pool, etc. The pluses are that it's cheap, allows dogs for a small fee, has a great location, and has bikes available. I highly recommend Perseys Place for breakfast (a 1 minute walk towards town) and Spanky's for lunch or dinner (a 10 minute walk towards the dock). The location seemed reasonably quiet considering it's right on Main Street and that people were coming and going deep into the night and early morning.

nekarama
Boston, Massachusetts
1 review
1 helpful vote 1 helpful vote
'Nice clean hotel'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed May 18, 2012
1
person found this review helpful

We stayed in May. Used our Groupon deal. Was pleasantly surprised seeing there were some not so good reviews. Was expecting to find a run down hotel but was overall satisfied with our experience. (I guess everyone's standards are different). We stayed in the Regal room which still had a canopy bed even though we were told at reservation that the hotel was" recently renovated" and none of their rooms had canopied beds. The decor/linen and furniture could use some updating but overall we could live with it. Rooms were clean, and cleaned daily. The only complaint is the extra pillows by the closet rack did not have clean pillow cases (there was some hair on it) but I didnt make a big deal, I just didnt use it. There were some reviews complaining about no hot water when they tried to use the jacuzzi but our water was flaming hot!! (we stayed in room 236). We also had a $20 credit to the hotel restaurant. Food was not that great but we also arrived 20 minutes beforethe kitchen closed. Not sure if that had anything to do with it. We were just happy that we could eat seeing we had checked in rather late. Our appetizer was cold but our waiter was sooooo accommodating and made up for it. The DJ did not show up that night...bummer. But he he showed up on Sat night and the music was pretty good. The staff at the hotel were nice. The weather was cold and rainy so we didnt walk Main St much but did get some shopping done by car. The highlight of our trip was dinner at the Brazillian Grill next door. Bring an appetite, thats all I have to say! We also went on the Cape Cod Railroad for Sunday brunch. Paid $90 for two people. Food was horrible but scenery was relaxing. Wouldn't go again though. Not worth the brunch part. We were very satisfied with our hotel and our weekend getaway as a whole. I hope the hotel offers another deal for $99 for 2 nights in the Regal room.
Less

After several phone calls from inept help to inept managment they decided moving us into a different room in a empty hotel wasnt an option but how about a a bottle of $4.00 comp champange. The phone conversation ended from inept managment to inept help when inept managment wished inept help good luck and hung up leaving inept help to deal with me in a much more agrivated state than when I entered. We came back at 5;00 p.m to relax after being forced to leave for the day. Still pounding on the roof .Went to dinner came back at 7:p.m still pounding on the roof. Went to front desk to request they stop for the day and was told by different inept help that they were
working till 8:00 p.m.At that point in time I had enough. I issued an ultimatum. Call your inept manager down here immediately,and stop the work in 15 minutes, because in 20 minutes i'm calling the cops theirs going to be a situation here. It was the only way left to me. The workers were off the roof in 5 minutes. I never did see the inept manager. If she is allowed to get away with this crap from her bosses whats that say about the rest of the company and higher ups. Is this the way the company is run across the board? I'll never know. Myself, my family, my relatives, my friends, strangers on the street will know how bad this place is and never stay there EVER!!!!
Just a few more points:
1) We paid $578.62 for a two night stay. You expect above average service for this kind of stay. As far as I'm concerned they stole our money, treated us like dirt, and have no clue about hospitality.
2) We paid another a $80.00 or so for two breakfast and one dinner in a restaraunt that was only open 6 hrs a day. ( 7am-10 am) and (6pm - 930pm). The menu had 1 soup, 4 appetizers, and 3 or 4 main dishes. Limited menu, inept hept, awful food, rotten service. We didnt eat there they can have the money, food poisoning, cooks spitting in the food, or bugs in our food seemed totally possable in this place.
3) They started working again the next day at 8:00am
4) It's not even all of it. I'm only giving the highlights, But you get the idea. DO'NT STAY HERE EVER!!!!!!!
Happy Vacationing , just do'nt do it here!

Staff International Inn and Suites, Director of Sales at International Inn and Suites on Cape Cod, responded to this review
May 24, 2012
Mr. Peter L,

The situation you were put in during your stay is unacceptable and I sincerely apologize for the incontinence.

We have been working diligently to get the hotel in the best condition possible for our guests and between the re-roofing, painting and room updates we do feel that our establishment will be ready without inconvenience to our customers this season.

Unfortunately this renovation process left us with a few complaints, such as yours. The roofing should have not only been brought to your attention at booking but again at check-in and accommodating you with a room change should have been allowed. Although I cannot go back and change the stay experience you had, I would once again like to stress my deepest apologies.

We have just updated numerous members of our staff to assure our guests have the best stay possible. Even as we speak, there are new management members inspecting each room so that your stay is free of issues. With new management members in place, we can offer each of our guests the wonderful customer service they deserve.

Thank you for your feedback,
Cari Edwards
Sales and Marketing Manager
International Inn and Suites
662 Main Street
Hyannis, MA 02601

The good: Bed was comfortable; room was clean and spacious (we had a Princess Suite); plenty of hot water for the jacuzzi; location is terrific...lots to see and do within walking distance; all of the hotel staff I deal with were pleasant and helpful.

Reviewer
5 reviews 5 reviews
Reviews in 3 cities Reviews in 3 cities
4 helpful votes 4 helpful votes
'Disappointment'
2 of 5 stars Reviewed April 23, 2012
2
people found this review helpful

Stayed here this past weekend (4/19 - 4/22) for a weekend getaway on the Cape. We booked a king room, but got a handicap accessible room with a queen bed. Not a big deal since the bed was comfortable. However, the room has no place to hang anything up. I ended up hanging my clothes on the handicap rails in the bathroom. Housekeeping was non-existent. We asked about housekeeping on Saturday, after not seeing housekeeping at all on Friday. The response was "do you need something?" The room we were in also had pieces of molding missing, mismatched paint on the walls and plaster by the light switch were the wall had been patched. The hotel was also supposed to have a restaurant (that was closed while we were there) and a pool (also closed). Not a huge deal to us, but it would have been nice to know those things so I wouldn't have packed my swim suit. The upside is the location. The hotel is right on Main Street in Hyannis, a short walk to the ocean, some great bars, restaurants and shops. I'll definately return to Hyannis and the Cape, but won't stay here again.
Less

'Experienced Traveler'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed August 31, 2011
2
people found this review helpful

I was on my way to another hotel when driving past The Cape Cod Inn. It looked quaint and 1960 ish from the outside, yet I decided to look into the cost of a nights lodging. The rate was very reasonable yet I asked to look at the room prior to paying. What a very pleasant surprise! The room was in fact completely renovated from the entry door, carpeting, window treatments, air conditioning....it was all new, including the furnishings!!! NEW NEW NEW!!! The new owners were very pleasant and accommodating. This was truly a nice little find. Am returning to Hyannis tomorrow for a nights stay. I am very disturbed by some of the other reviews that I have seen here. Towels were new although not the best of quality and the breakfast....well lets say it was not the Four Seasons. As far as a clean and kept place at a bargain rate, don't hesitate to stay here!

P.B. NH

'8/2011 - Dump, Dump, Dump!'
1 of 5 stars Reviewed August 13, 2011
3
people found this review helpful

Only had to stay here due to a last minute business trip in the middle of tourist season; no rooms available at other national-chain hotels. This place is a dump. Rooms are very poorly renovated. No table or chairs in rooms. No desks. No hangars. No alarm clocks. No iron or ironing board. Incessant housekeeping personnel attempt entry every hour, and finally ignore locked door and enter room. No swing-bar safety/security locks on the doors. Pool is full of construction materials (from recent room renovations). Took 1/2 hour to check in; check in process is very slow. Had to change rooms twice due to room (type) reserved by other guests during my stay. You have to pay for your room up front. Stay away.

I asked for contact info for the third party and she was about to give it to me. when i mentioned that she better not be lying as i will file a lawsuit she quickly giggled and stated everyone is suing them. then she refused to give me the info and hung up on me. i have tried calling back for more than an hour and no answer. no i am stuck trying to find a clean room at a reasonable rate 3 days ahead of travel date. i booked this room 3 months ago. i would recommend not to stay at this motel.

I had booked this hotel for Labor Day weekend, when Hurricane Earl was coming. Not wanting to be caught in a HURRICANE, I called to inquire about cancelling. I was told it was $45.00 to cancel, so I decided to keep my trip and hope for the best. As the news of the hurricane was getting worse, I figured I would just call and cancel anyway. The male answering the phone told me that DUE TO THE HURRICANE, THERE WERE NO CANCELLATION CHARGES. However, they still charged me $45.00 to my credit card.

I filed a complaint with the Better Business Bureau and my credit card company, stating that they violated a verbal committment for a refund/cancellation at no charge.

This is their idiotic, moronic response:

"this person called to make a resevation. which we did so for him. he states that no one told him about our cancellation policy,which i know is not true. once the resrvation is made,befor we hang up the phone the last thing we tell them is our policy.he called a total of three times. once in the afternoon on 9/03/10 the manager answered and he said he wanted to cancel. the women told him that there will be a charge. half price ($45) of the first night. once he was informed of that he stated that he will indeed come. his reservation was for 9/04/10. the tropical storm came on 9/03/10. his reservation like i stated was on the following day which was a very nice and sunny day. he could have made the drive up here,like so many of my other customers did. the second call was on 9/03/10 at night which was my shift. and yes i did say there would be no charge.but he did not tell me that he called earlier in the day and spoke to the manager.he was already charged by his second call because we doubted he would show up. he also did not state that his reservation was for 9/04/10 the following day. had i known that i would not have said there would be no charge. i should have checked myself to see when he was to arrive. but i didnt.the third time he called he spoke with her and she said that she would speak with me and if she felt that he deserved a refund she would issue one.the manage never said she would call back. and as for the manager not being reachable thats garbage. she is her 24/7 she has a apartment attached to the motel. thats our side of the story. thank you. "

This is a business that will still charge your credit card with their cancellation rate when they think you will not show up, even though you tell them you will still go. This is a business that does not have good communication amongst its employees because one was telling me there was no cancellation charge while the manager insists there was. This is a business that does not honor its verbal committment to its guests if it means gaining a few extra dollars. This is a business that doesn't care about its own image and has a complete moron write a response to an investigation from the Better Business Bureau.

Do NOT, under ANY circumstances, EVER give these people any business.

freshyMCM
Boston, Massachusetts
Reviewer
4 reviews 4 reviews
Reviews in 3 cities Reviews in 3 cities
3 helpful votes 3 helpful votes
'Not as bad as previous reviews!'
3 of 5 stars Reviewed August 17, 2010
3
people found this review helpful

Honestly, I was looking to stay closer to Sandwich MA, but unfortunately, all the motels there were booked. A site had a link to the closest motels with available rooms, and I found The Cape Cod Inn. They had a room, with a king bed, so I booked it. After booking, I started to read the reviews of this motel and I became extremely anxious and afraid I made the wrong choice.

Once we arrived, it was a bit late, and a Saturday, so the street was filled with people. I'm used to staying places that aren't as open and next to busy streets. We checked in, they had my reservation, they gave us our room keys, gave us our parking permit and they filled us in on where our room was, where the pool was, and asked if we needed the wifi code. Very friendly and efficient if I may say so myself. They even gave us a 10% off coupon for their attached Duck Pub restaurant.

Upon entering our room, which was right at the pool, I felt relieved. The bed was made nicely, the a/c was already on and pumping out nice cool air, the fridge was very clean and bathroom was clean and stocked with 8 towels. The room was a little on the smaller side, but it had everything we needed. Everything I mentioned, along with a little closet, a desk and chair, and a TV with clear cable and a hook up for a portable DVD player or gaming device if you brought one.

Our first night there, we walked down Main St. You could eat, go shopping, and pick up any souvenirs you wanted all within a few blocks from the motel. Even go bowling, candle pin or regular within feet from the rooms. Our second day there, we went to breakfast and when we returned, our room was cleaned, bed made, fresh soaps and towels and they even took care of the beer cans we had scattered all over the floor. We even decided to take advantage of the pool. It went from 3 1/2 feet to 8 1/2 feet. Only complaint, and it's not even a complaint, just weird, is that you had to bring your own towel. That could be normal since it's the first time in a long time I took advantage of a pool at a motel. The pool itself along with the surrounding area was very clean. Nothing floating around, not to much chlorine. It was very refreshing. After dinner, we jumped back in and they even kept the pool open a little longer because we were having a good time. After swimming we sat outside our room on cozy chairs. They had tables outside some rooms too. Perfect for sipping on your favorite beverage enjoying the cool breezy Cape Cod air. Even had a few conversations with our neighbors.

One thing that bothered me, but not my hubby, was the ice machine. It was literally a box filled with ice and you had to scoop out yourself. That would fine if I was the only one sticking my hands in there, but I probably wasn't. I would have been using the ice IN my drinks, so I walked to White Hen and grabbed a bag.

Over all, the place was pretty nice. Sure nothing stuck out as amazing, but it served it's purpose. For us, as a couple, we're very easy to keep happy. Give us a clean bed and fridge and we're sold. Maybe after all these horrible reviews of the place, they got their act together. Or maybe we were just lucky. I guess we're just a couple of people that aren't bothered by mixed match light bulbs or a little too much paint on the bathroom tile.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes

Hamlet903
Fayetteville, New York
Senior Reviewer
6 reviews 6 reviews
Reviews in 5 cities Reviews in 5 cities
8 helpful votes 8 helpful votes
'If there's a downside to this place, I can't think of it'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 14, 2012 NEW

Because we have family and friends nearby, we travel fairly often to the Boston area. Up till now, we'd almost always stayed in one of the Kimpton hotels, but they were pretty high-priced when we checked them out for our most recent trip. So, based on its first-rate Trip Advisor reviews, and on its reasonable rates, we decided to try the Hotel Commonwealth. From now on, it will be the first place we check when we go to Boston. From the time we got out of our car, everything went right: the front door staff and front desk staff were both as friendly as any we've seen, and the room was one of those rare surprises that look even better in reality than they did in the on-line photos. Not only was it comfortable but quiet--very important to me as I'm fairly sensitive to noise. The quiet was all the more impressive when you consider the hotel's setting on a very pretty but very busy street: we had all the pleasure of being able to gaze out our window at the street scene, with none of the roar wafting up to us from below. The location is also great: we hadn't realized that, in booking at the Commonwealth, we were landing just about a block away from our favorite French bistro in Boston, and you can go in almost any direction and find a nice assortment of good restaurants and bars. The best direction to go in, though, is down Commonwealth Avenue heading away from Kenmore Square: walking along such an elegant stretch each day was one of the pleasures of staying here. If you don't feel like walking, however, you couldn't be any closer to a subway station: walk out the door of the hotel, turn left, and you're there in just a few steps. Also, if you go past the entrance to the subway, there's a good convenience store--something we always find convenient (fittingly enough) when we want to stock up on drinks and snacks during a hotel stay.
Less

BAZBOWRAL
BOWRAL
Reviewer
3 reviews 3 reviews
Reviews in 3 cities Reviews in 3 cities
1 helpful vote 1 helpful vote
'First time at Hotel Commonwealth and Boston'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed June 13, 2012 NEW

We spemt 6 nights at the Commonwealth Hotel in Boston and we were not dissapointed. The welcome from the staff at the front desk was warm and hospitable.
The room we were allocated was Room 216 on the 2nd floor, which turnwd out to be not a good chice as it is right above the Eastern Standard restaurant which at night pays very loud music, which was loud enough to be disturbing despite ear plugs.
This is when a good hotel comes to the fore. Having raised our concerns with the front desk we were promptly moved to a room on the 5th floor - bliss!!! - it was identical in size to the 2nd floor room but much quieter.
This made our stay in Boston much more pleasant.

The hotel staff are great, the location is good - especially the buzz when the Red Sox are playing at Fenway Park, also the T station fro the Green line is right outside the hotel, which makes travel to downtown Boston easy.
From reading other reviews of the hotel I would agree it will be our preferred place to stay, when we next visit Boston.
One caveat for intending tourists - the city of Boston charges 3 separate taxes which are added to your hotel bill and needs to be factored into hotel bills in the city.

That apart we enjoyed our visit to Boston and can say the our enjoyment was enhanced by the staff and amenities of the Hotel Commonwealth
Less

The Lenox Hotel

happyvacationer5

Senior Contributor
25 reviews 25 reviews
Reviews in 13 cities Reviews in 13 cities
7 helpful votes 7 helpful votes
'A Fabulous Hotel'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 13, 2012 NEW

We stayed at the Lenox Hotel in Boston. What a wonderful and gorgeous hotel. I would say the Lenox Hotel is easily a 5 star. Everything about the hotel is outstanding, the rooms, as you can see they are very nicely decorated and immaculate, the lobby (above) is spectacular. The rooms are even equipped with a mini refrigerator which makes for a great opportunity for you to bring those fabulous leftovers. I'm sure that the hotel would not mind heating up your takeout for you.

The service is amazing. Very prompt room service served with a flair. There were a few things on the room service menu that was competitively priced, such as the mushroom pizza we rec'd for $10. Most pizzas are $10. Any small problem, you may have and the front desk is so happy and looks to serve your every want and need.

We had breakfast at their City Table and the food was very good.

I would definitely recommend this hotel and stay again given the chance.

For more of my trips, please check out www.newenglandandbeyondtravelblog.blogspot.com

yes the location is great, and the service is very good but our bathroom in the junior suite we had was really bad. I was staying with 2 friends and we all thought the same thing so it wasn't just me being picky, the bathroom needed some serious updating.

Another little entertaining thing that happened was we wanted some sparkling water and you need to call for mini bar items, as opposed to having a stocked mini bar in the room... so i called for sparkling water one morning and it never came but no big deal we were heading out anyway. When we returned to the room later that day there was a huge spread set up... 3 huge bottles of sparkling water and three bottles of champagne on ice with 6 champagne flutes. It was like they weren't sure what i wanted so just brought me all sorts of sparkly drinks.

All in all the hotel really is in a great location, and the staff was very nice, but i think i would try something else next time I'm in Boston.

'Quaint hotel with fabulous location.'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed June 11, 2012 NEW

We stayed this June in junior suite queen-queen room. We loved this hotel and will be back. Here are the pluses and some suggestions for improvement.

Pluses:
1. Very cute historic property.
2. Fabulous location to explore Boston common, freedom trail, prudential center mall, Newbury st. We walked everywhere.
3. Very eager to please front desk staff. They were ready to meet any request. The best and friendliest front desk staff I have experienced.
4. Great extra touches, like stuffed monkey for kids, coffee and bananas in morning, cookies and tea in pm.

Suggestions:
1. Housekeeping was not to par. Need more attention to detail. At times convinced us to opt out of turndown service.
2. Wifi is free but so slow. Hotel needs better router.
3. Valet was pricey. At least make tips included in price would be a possible way to make the guest not feel as bad.

Overall I feel you can not go wrong with the Lenox. We will be back.

CuteLilSlick
Toronto, Ontario, Canada
Reviewer
3 reviews 3 reviews
Reviews in 3 cities Reviews in 3 cities
'Whenever I visit Boston, The Lenox is where I'll stay!'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 10, 2012 NEW

SERVICE: The service was outstanding! The Lenox sets the standard that ALL hotels and resorts should follow. No minute detail is missed. From the time you check in to the the time you check out, the staff is genuinely friendly, hospitable and professional. As you walk past the Front Desk on your way out in the morning, everyone greets you with a warm "Good Morning! Enjoy the day!". If you're in a rush and can't stay for breakfast, you can grab a complimentary fresh coffee, tea and/or banana to go. For all you coffee drinkers out there, your coffee comes complete with a cup cover and sleeve! When the day is over and you're ready to hit the sac, you're welcomed home to a turned down bed with gourmet chocolates on your pillow. Heavenly!

LOCATION: This boutique hotel is situated in the midst of a multitude of stores, bars and restaurants. The area is filled with magnificently architectured buildings, with each building being different from the next. Everything is walking distance and there's enough going on without it being too much.

DECOR: The hotel offers an elegantly decorated, yet welcoming lobby, bar and restaurant . The rooms are well-appointed and have ample space.

ROOM: Anything you need to be in your hotel room, is there. There is a safe, a bar fridge stocked with complimentary bottles of water, 2 bathrobes, plenty of towels, a hairdryer, shower cap, shoe mitt, salon quality shampoo, conditioner and body wash, spa quality soap and lotion, cotton balls and swabs. The beds are oh so comfortable, covered in a light duvet, comforter, and a multitude of shams and pillows.

Pantherdash25
Ely, United Kingdom
Reviewer
4 reviews 4 reviews
Reviews in 3 cities Reviews in 3 cities
4 helpful votes 4 helpful votes
'Honeymoon Heaven'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 10, 2012 NEW
1
person found this review helpful

We're a Military Family and stayed here for our Honeymoon in 2011 immediately after I got back from Afghnanistan serving with US and NATO forces.

Firstly, thanks to the brilliant staff here and a big apology for not wriitng this review sooner. I emailed the Hotel from Khandahar to explain my plans for the holiday. They immediately sprang into action with generous discounts, priviledged rooms and a level of service that we simply don't get very often in the UK.

Our greeting was marvellous, the hotel is spotless and has a warm feeling of family to it. The decor and feel is rich, lustrous whilst also being friendly and accessible.

Food here is incredible. After eating drab food in a combat zone for a long time, my stomach wasn't ready for my initial foray into lobster sliders (which were the best and most fresh of the holiday) and an enormous breakfast at the Poor House down the street in Back Bay. I fell a little poorly - this in no way reflects the hotel or the Poor House Bar, just that I'd been eating boil in the bag for a long time and was literally straight from theatre! The hotel checked on me, looked after H and re-arranged our planned itinerary. No stress. When I emerged that night craving Guiness, the Solas bar made me the coolest, creamist pint ever and produced on me telling them that I'd felt alittle ill, unprompted and unordered, the best bowl of French Onion Soup with Parmesan crouton I've ever had. Seriosuly men, this was the Angelina Jolie of soups. Every sip felt like an elixir revitalising my energy. Glorious and on the sunny Boston street with my Wife - perfect.

The best was yet to come. I had planned a series of surprises for my Wife, one of which was a trip to the annual Tanglewood Music Festival in Beautiful Lennox County. John Williams conducting the Boston Symphony Orchestra in an ancient Redwood Forest - magic. The hotel was characteristically Herculean. Thomas and the girls on the desk hired a car for us. The car was superb and cost us next to nothing. They even made us a picnic to stave off hunger!

Cookies and lemonade in a morning as you leave the elevator. Incredible food. Great service. Selfless staff. A decent, if modest gym for you Crossfitters out there. Rooms lavish, comfy and with spectacular views across the Back Bay skyline.

I can't speak highly enough of this place. It is simply magic, distilled. Can't wait to come back. This is Boston at it's best and really knows how to look affter combat veterans.
Less

Aoibh
Dublin, Ireland
Senior Contributor
31 reviews 31 reviews
Reviews in 16 cities Reviews in 16 cities
84 helpful votes 84 helpful votes
'Very friendly staff, fantastic hotel.'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 8, 2012

We stayed for a week in the Lenox in April last. The hotel itself is very well located close to a lot of the attractions. Newbury Street with all its shops and restaurants is just a block away, and the Prudential centre is 2 blocks. It is just one block from a subway Green Line station.
We had a Junior King Suite which was very spacious and well equipped. A very large bedroom with plenty of room to sit and walk about, a big walk in closet which had a fridge and small safe and a large well-furnished bathroom.
WiFi throughout the hotel was free and had good speed.
The hotel staff on the reception desk and the Concierge on duty were always very helpful and friendly. We had breakfast on three mornings in the hotels' City Table restaurant. There was a good choice of food and it was possible to request items not listed. The quality and service were both to a high standard and the prices were comparable to those of restaurants in the general area. The bananas in the morning and cookies in the evening at reception are a nice touch. The lit fire in the lobby gave a very nice warm greeting after a day out and about.
Boston is a lovely city and our stay was made all the more enjoyable by having stayed in this great hotel. It was a very nice experience and we look forward to being able to go back to Boston and staying in the Lenox.
Less

'Perfect place to stay!'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 6, 2012
1
person found this review helpful

We were there for a wedding and stayed 2 nights. The hotel is elegant & historic with tons of character. The room was spacious with complimentery waters. The staff was helpful & friendly. There is a gentleman named Jimmy that is 89years old and been there for 64 years. Sharp as a tack & had our hands full of helpful maps before we even got upstairs. The wedding was in the dome room- gorgeous domed ceiling. The set up s perfect for a wedding. The ceremony & reception dinner were in the same space but there was a happy hour across to hall to give them a chance to set everything up. Easy access to the T & great walk down to Boston Commons.

Chevy Chase, Maryland

3 reviews 3 reviews
'Expensive and worth it!'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 14, 2012 NEW

This is everything a 5 star hotel should be. Beautiful hotel, beautifully located on the Harbor. Spotlessly clean. Wonderful, courteous service: from check-in to housekeeping to the Concierges. Breakfasts at the Sea Grill - Many menu choices, food was delicious, service was very good; weather was gorgeous and we ate outside. Location is great - walking distance to North End restaurants, nearby inexpensive restaurants, Aquarium, harbor tours by boat; lovely, lively harbor walk. We took the Rowes Wharf Water Taxi over from Logan Airport - it was fun.

thegasgod_slcut
Draper, Utah
Senior Contributor
37 reviews 37 reviews
Reviews in 19 cities Reviews in 19 cities
24 helpful votes 24 helpful votes
'Enjoyed our stay'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 10, 2012 NEW

The Hotel is beautiful! Rooms are nice, clean spacious. Beds are Devine. Turn down service each night. Beautiful views of Harbor and City. Centrally located, walking distance to Quincy Market, freedom trail, North End. Airport sits opposite of Hotel across Harbor. Couple of downsides. Could not get a Taxi. They do not have an agreement with any service so there is always a wait. We missed dinner reservations the first night, second night ended up taking the train to Fenway after waiting 25 minutes for a cab to show up. Waited 20 minutes for a cab to the airport. Very frustrating. Dining is very expensive and food was not great. Do yourself a favor and venture out. Plenty of places within walking distance. No in room coffee service. I missed this. Thankfully there is a Dunkin on every corner.
Less

helendawley0208
Waterford, Connecticut
Reviewer
3 reviews 3 reviews
'Looking for 5-star treatment in Boston!'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 10, 2012 NEW

The Boston Harbor Hotel is a phenomenal experience. We opted for the 555 package. It starts out with a desert tray awaiting your arrival. The room was plenty spacious and overlooked the harbor. The staff were very attentive. There are a few restaurants on the premise. We had dinner in Meritage. What a great experience, our package included a five-course wine sampling dinner. The food is tastefully designed and just as delicious. There is a spa, pool and fitness room. The location is close to many downtown activities and the concierge will help find a perfect fit to any schedule. We opted for a whale watch tour. Two thumbs up there as well. Our stay ended with breakfast in our room. The corned beef hash is delightful. A must try. This was our anniversary gift to each other. Our experience was nothing shy of perfect. Highly recommend this establishment.
Less

mwomble848
Tulsa, Oklahoma
Contributor
13 reviews 13 reviews
Reviews in 8 cities Reviews in 8 cities
3 helpful votes 3 helpful votes
'Nice hotel in Boston on the Water'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed June 8, 2012

Hotel has GREAT views IF you get a room that faces the water, so be sure to request one. If not, you'll be facing dull office buildings. Rooms are nice, very clean and roomy. All of the employees are wonderfully efficient and very anxious to please.

However, there are several areas that need improvement: the fitness center doesn't open until 6am, which is hard to figure out since it's on a separate floor and would not disturb the guests. There were several members and some guests waiting for it to open. Once open, it is a great facility and the attendants are very helpful and friendly.

The hotel had no flexibility when requesting a late checkout - unlike a major chain if you're a frequent guest. This was very disappointing but they were very courteous in explaining why. It would be easy to keep a few housekeeping employees around to tidy up rooms to accommodate a 3pm or 4pm late checkout, even for a charge. However, they do not grasp or embrace this concept.
Less

I welcome you to contact me directly at the hotel so that we may speak in greater depth about your experience and how we can improve. I hope we will have the opportunity to welcome you back to The Boston Harbor Hotel at Rowes Wharf in the near future!

HotelAficionado1
Township of Washington, NJ
1 review
'Best Hotel in Boston'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 6, 2012

The staff is the friendliest ever encountered & provide better service than the Penninsula or St. Regis in NYC, not to mention the Ritz or The Four Seasons in Boston. No matter how busy the hotel is, the staff always makes you feel welcome & often greets guests by name. The large dramatic lobby has a gorgeous old world feel and is comfortable for lounging with friends or meeting business acquaintances. The hotel is spotless, and turn-down service is unobtrusive and quick. The Sea Grill is a beautiful restaurant offering views of the harbor, and delicious food. One can dine outside on the harbor in nice weather, & enjoy musical programs in the summer. This hotel will wow you in every way.

Birchwood Inn

Winnie113
New Jersey, USA
2 reviews
Reviews in 4 cities Reviews in 4 cities
9 helpful votes 9 helpful votes
''Perfect Weekend Getaway  relaxation, restoration and rejuvenation''
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 16, 2012

My cousin and I travel a lot and Birchwood Inn has definitely made it to the top of favorite places to stay and revisit. I don't write reviews much but this is one I can't wait to rave about.

My cousin and I have been researching for a weekend SPA getaway to celebrate her big 'Five-O'. The glowing reviews on Trip Advisor definitely helped finalized our decisions. Needless to say our mini vacation turned out into an AWESOME celebration with a 'big bang' and fond memories (even without SPA treatment)!!! Our entire stay was 'exceptional' and more than our expectations. Our heartfelt thanks to Birchwood Inn, the soft-spoken & gracious Ellen (filled with passion & love), charming David and the quiet, friendly & adorable Quinn (our four-legged friend) for making this special celebration a memory of our lifetime  Keep up the good work and we can't wait to see you rise up to # 1 of 24 Lenox B&B and Inns List.

We arrived late on Friday evening. As we parked at our 'assigned parking spot' (feeling special, absolutely loving it!), we were surprisingly greeted by the friendliest reception of David, Assistant Innkeeper and Quinn, the adorable Golden Retriever!

Our 'Dana Room' was absolutely stunning, spacious and comfortable. We are definitely pampered by the attention to the beautifully decorated details, including the bathroom - clean and spotless! The bed, awww feels like sleeping on the cloud  it's heavenly!!

We were taken on a tour throughout the Inn. Every room is different and varied for different tastes. There's a huge library with a fireplace, lot of sitting areas, books, board games, puzzles, etc. You could choose to read, play or simply sit and be inspired in front of the fireplace. David also took his time to explain and introduce great places to dine and visit.

After we settled in, we took a quick stroll to the nearby little town where there are beautiful churches, a park, galleries, restaurants, antiques, spas, and wine and cheese stores. As it was getting late, we ordered take out from one of the recommended restaurants, the food was yummy. It was a wonderful treat after a long tiring day.

The next morning, we'd planned to sleep in but were pleasantly awaken by the delicious aroma of homemade breakfast and coffee. The breakfast menu was perfect for the start of the day  perfect portion, beautifully decorated (no detail was left unattended) and absolutely 'out of this world'!!!! Our gracious host, Ellen and her crew took time to attend to each individual's needs. They are very accommodating. (Ellen was kind enough to make extra order of her special Rhubarb Muffins for us to take home so that we could share with our loved ones.)

Within 5 miles distance, there's a premium outlet with incredible bargains. We didn't plan for this but we ended up filling our trunk and back seats with bags of clothes and shoes (will worry about the bills later). Later in the afternoon, we took a quick break back to the Inn just to have Ellen's famous afternoon tea/snack: homemade cookies and homemade ice tea. It was worth it. Minutes later, we headed out again - for more shopping... (unbelievable)! Time flies when you've fun. 3 days 2 nights seemed so short but it was definitely a good break.

To sum up: We left home with exhaustion and stress. We returned home feeling happy, vibrant yet relaxed, rejuvenated and restored.

Birchwood Inn definitely lived up to our expectations and more We highly recommend it.
It fits into any lifestyles, singles, couples or families and for any occasions. You can choose to do a lot or, simply relax and do absolutely nothing. The property was beautifully maintained. Birchwood Inn is filled with details that are incredibly unique and charming. Ellen (the Innkeeper) and David (the Assistant Innkeeper) were fantastic hosts and made everyone feel very welcome. The breakfast and afternoon tea was to die for, the location couldn't be better - within walking distance of the town center and the park trails. Last but not least, great news for dog lovers, this is a dog friendly Inn.
Less

Reviews in 2 cities Reviews in 2 cities
2 helpful votes 2 helpful votes
'Great bed and breakfast experience'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed November 23, 2011
1
person found this review helpful

We loved our stay at the Birchwood! Our suite was grand yet comfortable with a charming old fashion fireplace. Food was exemplary, both at breakfast and afternoon tea. Ellen is a great chef and has created some unique breakfasts including a delicious Parmesan shell filled with herbed eggs. We were especially impressed with the common areas that are filled with beautiful antiques and furnishings. We had a very comfortable nights sleep and found the location very convenient. We especially enjoyed the fine dining that is close by and the park that is just across the street for hiking and exploring.

After having spent the first part of our vacation at a large inn in Stockbridge, we realized the true benefit of staying at a bed and breakfast over a larger hotel. In this case, the beds were so much more comfortable, the personalized attention to detail appreciated and the delicious breakfasts and tea that were included in our room rates really made a happy ending to our Berkshire getaway!

We would highly recommend the Birchwood Inn.

'A Slice of Heaven'

person found this review helpful

If you are looking for perfection personified - look no further. You will want to move in and never leave. The house is magnificent furnished with beautiful antiques. The staff is incredibly helpful, warm, friendly and efficient. Ellen (the owner) is a superb master chef who works with her staff to prepare fantastic gourmet breakfasts each morning. David (the innkeeper) is a real renaissance man, from making dinner reservations to helping you dig your car out of the snow. Rebecca is Ellen's "wing man" and makes sure you are comfortable and relaxed. Piper & Quinn are the permanent canine residents - who are the sweetest creatures you will ever encounter. The Inn is conveniently located to a host of attractions, places and activities, i.e.Tanglewood, musuems, shops, restaurants, parks and wild life preserves. Whether you want to sit back in a cozy chair in front of the fireplace or do some hiking or skiing - this is the place to do it all. It doesn't get any better than this!

'Excellent hotel in great location with really helpful staff.'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 12, 2012 NEW
1
person found this review helpful

This hotel is a dark smouldering beacon of helpfulness.All the staff were extremely helpful and courteous.
We booked a studio room, which had a large bedroom area with sitting area and gas fireplace, it was all beautifully appointed. The room seemed like a junior suite, as it has a long entrance hall, off which is a bathroom, wash basin area and a small dressing room area. The bathroom had an excellent rainforest shower over a jacuzzi bath, and there were plenty of fluffy towells and products.
The in house complimentary car is a great bonus for getting around town on dull or wet days and the drivers are all really engaging and interesting.
The gym has 4 pieces of equipment, a treadmill, spinning bike and sitting bike and cross trainer and free weights, outside on the terrace is a hot tub. There is also a small roof terrace on the 11th floor with loungers.
overall very good.
Less

'perfect location - great hotel'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 11, 2012 NEW

I recently stayed at XV Beacon for 3 nights and really enjoyed my stay. The rooms are extremely comfortable and well equipped - I stayed in a Beacon Hill studio room on the 9th floor, which was very large, with a lounge area and fireplace. The bathroom was spacious with beautiful towels and soap.
What really stands out for me at this hotel are the concierges Jonathan and Patricia. Each made a number of arrangements for me from restaurant bookings to hairdressing appointments and they were both so helpful and engaged. Emails sent in advance of my stay were answered promptly and helpfully and Jonathan made an effort to catch up with me once I arrived. It is the little personal touches like that that really make your stay. The establishments recommended were top class and they arranged for the hotel car to drive me to various appointments, which is a great service. Dinner in Moo restaurant was very good.
The location of the hotel could not be better, right near Boston Common in a beautiful historic area and walking distance to everywhere.
Highly recommended.
Less

MM-TorontoTraveler
Toronto
Contributor
19 reviews 19 reviews
Reviews in 11 cities Reviews in 11 cities
5 helpful votes 5 helpful votes
'High Class Boutique Hotel'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 4, 2012
1
person found this review helpful

XV Beacon Hotel (Fifteen Beacon) is a luxurious boutique hotel on the top of Beacon Hill in Boston. Walking distance to shops, parks and restaurants (everything is walking distance in Boston), this hotel is situated 15 minutes from Boston Logan BOS Airport (approx. $22 taxi fare).
The hotel is a 1903 landmark building with the charm of historic Boston but with the comfort of chic, classic and modern facilities. With only 63 rooms in the entire hotel, XV Beacon hotel feels like a home away from home, with friendly and helpful staff at the front desk and concierge. Each room has a cozy feeling including your own gas fireplace. We have stayed at this hotel twice in the last five years and even during our recent visit the service and quality remains superior.
During our May visit we stayed in room 404 (which happened to be the largest suite on that floor) - each floor only has seven guest rooms. Opt for one of the Beacon Hill Studio's you won't regret it - including either a Queen or King Bed, gas fireplace, large flat screen TV, large sitting area, and fabulous bathroom.
One other great feature at XV Beacon is their complimentary in-town Lexus car service. The hotel has one Sedan and one SUV that can accommodate either 2 or 4 passengers. Service is available on a first come-first serve basis; however if you know you are headed somewhere specific during your stay you can pencil in your time and location with the concierge. This is a fantastic service since taxi's are not that easy to find in Boston, and not as affordable as they are in NYC. Be sure to take advantage of this service during your stay.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes

'Friendly staff with a couple of details got overlooked'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed June 1, 2012

I booked using Luxury Link and made arrangement for a full suite at a modest additonal charge. That suite on the 2nd floor was spacious and an excellent value for the cost.
Housekeeping turndown was a disappointment. The bed was fixed but wastebaskets and bath towels were not refreshed in the living room bath.
The restaurant was enjoyable for breakfast and I almost had the place to myself.
For dinner on Saturday, MOOOO was busy. The food was good. It was a bit pricey , $44 for swordfish with no extras. The best deal is to puchase the extra sampling at $18 for two people which included some tasty sides.

JoyfulWriter

Senior Contributor
25 reviews 25 reviews
Reviews in 18 cities Reviews in 18 cities
29 helpful votes 29 helpful votes
'Kindness from a Doorman'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 29, 2012
4
people found this review helpful

This will be an unusual review since I've never actually stayed in this hotel. However, I believe I have something to say that will recommend this hotel as a great place to stay. First of all, it is beautiful, elegant and has a terrific location. But, that's not my story. My story has to do with an employee that went above and beyond the call of duty to a person who was not even a guest at the hotel. Here it is:

My husband and I were on a cruise ship stopping in Boston for a partial day port stop. It poured rain during our entire visit to Boston. We stopped on the sidewalk under the overhanging roof of the XV Hotel. We needed a moment's respite from the rain and also, I wanted to take a picture without getting my camera drenched. We spoke to the two uniformed doormen about this need and they were very friendly and said, yes, by all means, stand under the porch. With a laugh, I remarked that this was our one day in Boston and this (the rain) was our unfortunate introduction to the remarkable city. One of the doorman (whom I will call Mr. M in this account) very kindly said, 'Wait just a moment,' and went inside the hotel. He quickly came out with an umbrella which he presented to me (I'd not brought mine, hoping the rain would stop  it never did!).

I was overwhelmed with his kindness and immediately thought, this must be the best hotel in the city and what a friendly town  and certainly, this was the most generous and kind doorman I'd ever met. The umbrella, by the way, was a tremendous help to me as the rain started pouring more and more. I will never forget this kindness and I will always have good feelings for the town, the hotel and that thoughtful doorman. Thank you, Mr. M -- you know who you are.

The website for XV Beacon Hill tells how the attractive building is a 1903 landmark Beaux Arts hotel, located on the crest of Beacon Hill. I can attest to the fact that the location is excellent for sightseeing. It is a luxury boutique hotel and, I'm afraid, on the pricey side (at least for my pocketbook). While I would love to stay there, I don't foresee that happening. Regardless, I would recommend this hotel to those of you who can afford a wonderful, luxury hotel with kind doormen and a very short walk to the State Capitol and the lovely green Boston Common park.

Kudos to XV Beacon Hill Hotel and the very kind Mr. M!

Less
Was this review helpful? Yes

We were very pleased with our stay at XV Beacon and highly recommend it.

'WOW'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 17, 2012
6
people found this review helpful

From arrival to departure, this was a WOW experience and we have been all around the world and have experienced it all.
Our stay last month at XV Beacon was absolutely wonderful from start to finish. (The cab driver at the airport said: Good choice of hotels!) We have recommended this boutique hotel to several couples who live in the area and visited us. They agreed that XV Beacon is the perfect place for their other friends, too.

Location: 10++ (20 of 10) - walking distance to everything and everyplace; rooftop patio is fantastic; nice exercise/spa area; close to many excellent restaurants, including Moo, where we dined for dinner and brunch, and met friends for cocktails several times  all were impressed
Staff: 10++ (20 of 10)  friendly, professional ,excited to be at XV Beacon; helpful
Concierges: 10++ (20 of 10)  friendly, professional, knowledgeable, interested in finding the perfect places for us and things to do and everyone was SO NICE and made us so comfortable
Decoration; artwork, furniture, fireplace, etc.: 10++ - The rain shower head is relazing and incredible, and the water pressure is so nice. The bed helped us slept like babies each night; the fireplace was comforting and warm; the entire room and hotel was decorated to perfection. In-house Lexus and driver: 10++ (20 of 10)  impressive; excellent and caring drivers; comfortable cars. Very nice perk for guests.
Housekeeping: 10++ (20 of 10)  SPOTLESS; considerate; professional; friendly, etc. LOVE the ability for us to indicate whether we needed or wanted housekeeping service. Very considerate feature that we appreciated.
Room comfort: 10++ Ultra QUIET ROOM on the back corner. The shower head is PERFECT.
Water pressure is AMAZING. Nice bathrobes, towels and linens. Also liked the vases in the rooms - which we filled with tulips from the local market.
We definitely will return.
MAJOR COMPLIMENTS: we arrived at about 6 am and were immediately welcomed cheerfully and then checked in and given a most-excellent room. That is amazing (most hotels sigh and tell their guests that check in is 3 pm). The staff is THE BEST, in a beautiful location and facility, and they all are so happy to be there.
Many thanks for making our vacation incredibly wonderful.

We "love them to bits". You will too.

mauibuilt
bay area, california
1 review
'4 stars for property and location, 3 stars for stay on Memorial Day weekend'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed June 4, 2012 NEW

Lobby was very nice and plenty of seating to lounge around. Rooms were decent and beds comfortable. It was nice that they served Starbuck's coffee and pastries as well. Loved how a shuttle arrived every 15 minutes and took us to Universal Citywalk. If attending Universal Studios, it's just a short walk from the drop-off at Citywalk. Shuttle operated late probably because it was Memorial Day weekend. Location was definitely ideal.
As for a mixed 3 stars review, this was based on the following issues we experienced during our 2 day stay at the hotel. On the first night, we had requested a set of extra towels. An hour had passed, but yet no one had come by. Since we had to leave for dinner, called housekeeping back to cancel the request. The next day, made the same request. Same issue after 30 minutes had gone by. Called housekeeping again and explained the previous night's issue. I was told that the service elevator was broken and that someone should be coming up very soon. Knock on the door and this older gentlemen was breathing heavy and apologized for the delay. Second issue: the kids wanted to go swimming Sunday afternoon, however, there was a 21 and over pool party from 12-6pm. The scene was definitely like a spring break event with music, dancing, and alcohol. We were told that this pool party event started about a week ago and might go on through summer. The gentlemen at the concierge desk explained that we could use the Hilton swimming pool. To get there, had to walk across the front of the hotel past the parking structure, up the elevators to the Hilton, and then to their swimming pool. A bit inconvenient, but end result was the kids got to swim.
If we plan to visit Universal again, we will probably give the hotel another chance. As a note, got to use my SPG cash and points. Points does not cover tax and parking fee though.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes

15 helpful votes 15 helpful votes
'It pays to be a Starwood member...'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed June 3, 2012 NEW
1
person found this review helpful

We've only stayed in Sheratons a few times, so we are a Starwood member. But we never thought it would pay off like it did. We needed to stay in this location for business (unfortunately we didn't even get over to Universal Studios.) But I was concerned about being in an expensive city with no free breakfast and a teenage son who is always hungry. When we checked in, we were upgraded to a higher floor for Starwood members, and given a pass for free breakfasts and free snacks and beverages in the evening. The food was varied and delicious, and very filling. The rooms were large and very comfortable, although the bathrooms are quite small. The hotel is a bit worn at the seams, but has been redone. We ate in the hotel dining room twice and it was quite good. The pool area is small and a bit worn and shady, but it was nice to be outside. I would definitely recommend this hotel. (But no free internet service in the rooms.)
Less

'Good location but accommodations not up to par'
2 of 5 stars Reviewed June 2, 2012 NEW
1
person found this review helpful

The location is great for visiting Universal Studios/City Walk. They have a shuttle but it is an easy 5 minute walk. The major issue was the room. It was very small and the noise from the freeway made it difficult to sleep. It seems like they could have used thicker glass on the windows. Also it was annoying that for the price, free Wi fi was not included. Anyway, if you really want to be close to Universal, staying here might make sense. Just be sure to ask for room on the quieter side of the building. Otherwise, I might recommend the Beverly Garland hotel which is not as close to Universal but does still have a free shuttle. For less money, we had a much bigger and quieter room there with free Wi-fi.

Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
C C
Overland Park, Kansas
2 reviews
'Great for Universal and City Walk'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed June 1, 2012 NEW
1
person found this review helpful

We stayed here 3 nights and honestly I was a bit skeptical upon arrival. Our flight came in early in the morning so we headed to the hotel to drop our bags and head out to Universal Studios. (Quick note: it is a good 40 minute drive from LAX or about an $80 cab fare. Might be worth renting a car if you are comfortable manuevering L.A. highways) The bell desk was very helpful in storing our bags while we hopped the free shuttle up to the park. I was also happy to see an updated, comfortable lobby that looked very inviting and clean. Aside from a long, crowded day at the park, we were happy to return via shuttle to the hotel for a quick check in.
After a slight misunderstanding on what type of room I thought we would have have, we settled into a room on the second floor, which is one flight (maybe 8-9 steps) down to a clean and well lit hall to our room, which had a balcony facing the pool. (I thought that we would have a "walk-out" room, when I originally booked, but upon review of my reservation, I noticed that it was either a patio OR balcony facing the pool.) I was actually glad we'd gotten this location for several reasons - no elevator wait, close to exit for the pool, one flight back up to the main floor with the bar, concierge, front desk and gift shop. Actually I would suggest that if you are ok with a few stairs, this is the best way to go. Given that other reviews complain of the long elevator waits, we never had to experience any of that. The hotel is older so I am not used to the lack of counterspace in the bathroom, but it was not unmanageable. So for the rest of the review, I will just give a short list of the pros and cons.
The room itself - clean beds and bathroom. Carpet could use a good cleaning but no worse that any other hotel. The trim was coming off (or completely gone) on the doorway. It was odd that it had not been repaired or replaced. But again - not that big of deal. What I was disappointed in was the lack of refridgerator and tiny ice bucket for use. Also, I would have liked a table or another chair in the room, as I don't like to have anything sit on the floor in a hotel (ie packages, purse, bags) Really these points were more of an inconvenience than anything.
Staff - The night we arrived there was loud dance music coming from somewhere still going strong at 11 pm. I called once to have it resolved but 20 minutes later nothing had been done. I then got out of bed and dressed and went to the front desk personally. I stood there while security was called and it was resolved within about 5 minutes. Had my room not been in this location, I don't know that I would have gotten up and traveled the elevator and through the lobby to complain. Housekeeping was courteous and helpful in the hotel and at the pool.
Gift shop/bar/restaurant - all a bit pricy, but you are paying for convenience and anyone staying at any hotel should be aware of that and deal with it. We had room service for breakfast and it was around 40.00 for the three of us - yes, not the free continental breakfast you would find other hotels, but if you have ever had room service before in any hotel - its pricy but convenient. Of course using the amenities such as these at any hotel is an option so this shouldn't have much weight on considering the hotel itself.
Business center - convenient, plenty of computers and free. Of course I would have preferred free wi-fi... who wouldn't? Again, just an inconvenience, not a tragedy.
Location - you can't beat this for the price. We realized on day 2 that the walk was easy and only about 5 minutes (and a little bit of good exercise - esp after 2 or 3 trips back and forth)
Concierge was helpful in getting us an airport car service and reservations to Warner Bros. studios.
This is not a five-star hotel but definitely convenient, clean and worth the price for those things alone. If you are a complainer and specifically look for things that aren't perfect, stay somewhere else. If not, this hotel will work for you.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?

Problem with this review?
CYW33
San Diego, CA
2 reviews
Reviews in 2 cities Reviews in 2 cities
2 helpful votes 2 helpful votes
'Beautiful Ballroom'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed May 29, 2012

I didn't get a chance to actually stay at this hotel, but I attended a wedding here this past weekend. The ceremony took place outdoors in a beautiful garden. With the trees surrounding the site, the weather was cool and there was ample shade to make seating comfortable. The only unfortunate thing about the location was that there was a nearby bell that rang maybe every ten minutes (similar to a school bell). A little distracting, but not horrible.

After the ceremony, there were plenty of banquet staff strategically placed to guide guests to the ballroom. It was kind of a pain to wait for the slow elevators to take groups ten at a time up to the top floor, but because of the staff, it went smoothly.

The ballroom itself was BEAUTIFUL! I've been to a lot of weddings, and this was my favorite reception site so far ... even prettier than where I got married! The ceiling has twinkling lights that look like stars. The floor to ceiling windows on BOTH sides of the ballroom offered great views of either the mountain or the city. You can see the new Transformers ride at Universal Studios, too!

I can't say enough about the banquet servers. Imelda, who was serving our table, was so great. She cleared out our glasses and plates efficiently and without getting in the way. My water glass was NEVER empty. She even showed us a quick dance move to our delight.

The food was delicious, especially the salmon. I also loved the lemon bars.

If the service you get while staying overnight at this hotel is as good as it was during the wedding, then I would definitely recommend staying here.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?

'Service was lacking in every area...'
2 of 5 stars Reviewed May 29, 2012

Stayed there for business 5/18-5/21, and I always stay at Sheratons when I travel. There were 8 of us staying there and we were very disappointed in the service at this hotel. Everything took forever. When we went to the bar for drinks it was not very busy (two other people at the bar) and it still took 20 min for the bar tender to get us our drinks, once empty, we had to flag down the bartender to get a second drink. This level of service was repeated two nights later, when it took so long for the bar tender to get our drink order that the kitchen was closed by the she came back. We ended up ordering out pizza. Breakfast was no different. The one lady who was there disappeared for 20 min, so again we had to wait. We asked the bellman to watch our suitcases while we got breakfast go to the morning we were leaving and could not find him for 15 min after. We had negotiated free parking for the 8 of us, and were still billed, so we had to fix that as well.

As for the rooms, they are very small. The bathrooms are tiny! Almost no counter space and the door hit the toilet. Needless to say, we will not be staying at this Sheraton again.
Less

'Would stay again!'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 22, 2012
1
person found this review helpful

Great location if you are planning to visit Universal Studios - just a short walk to the park. Please note that the 10 minute walk to Universal is not handicapped-stroller friendly. Those of you that don't want to climb hills/steps and cross traffic will want to wait for the shuttle that comes every 20 minutes. (they say 10 minutes, but its more like 20)

For the room, it was clean. The bathroom was TINY!! The toilet is literally under the sink area counter area. The cast of The Voice was staying at the hotel when we were there - so cool!

Randy Player, General Manager at Sheraton Universal Hotel, responded to this review
May 23, 2012
Dear Jaimekaye-

Thank you for your great rating and comments and I was happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay. The walk up to Universal can be a challenge with a wheelchair or stroller as there is a flight of stairs. I agree with you that in these cases it would probably be best to take the shuttle operated by Universal Studios. I'm glad that you found the rooms to be clean and we're hoping to increase the size of our bathrooms during a future renovation. We had a lot of fun hosting The Voice contestants this season and hope to have them back again for next season!

Thank you again and we hope to welcome you back soon.

Randy Player
General Manager

12 helpful votes 12 helpful votes
'Never Let Down at Four Seasons'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 13, 2012 NEW

It is a Four Season Hotel so the expectations are high, and once again this hotel didn't disappoint.

The lobby is understated and classy, reeks of class and money, but at the same time is inviting. This is a rare combination that makes you feel immediately at home.

The front check in staff is world class. I found them to be kind and caring and genuinely interested that I have a positive stay. The only way that I can put it is that seemed personally invested in my happiness and comfort. Great first impression.

The rooms, though on the smaller side, are gorgeous. The design is elegant, not terribly modern but much like the living room of an extraordinarily rich aunt. Classic.

The beds are simply divine and encourage loungy mornings after drinking too much wine at the Bristol Lounge.

Though not the same since Aujourd Hui left, it is still in a prime location in Boston...near both the business centers of the city and (if you're a tourist) near the "sights"

Highly recommended
Less

bednbreakfastgirl
Southold, NY
Reviewer
5 reviews 5 reviews
Reviews in 5 cities Reviews in 5 cities
15 helpful votes 15 helpful votes
'Nice family stay'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 11, 2012 NEW

We stayed over Memorial Day weekend with our children and parents. While the suite was priced a bit high for the size of it, my parents were able to book a room at half price so it worked out for that reason. Check in was a breeze, kids were able to choose a toy and backpack from cart (booked kidcation package), and we were able to check in at the time I told reservationist we would arrive which was much earlier than listed check in time. Once we got to room, kids were excited to see the special soaps and diapers, etc. that were left for them. Housekeeping even wrote their names on inside tub with the bath crayons. My 13 year old was impressed by this. We left to explore once dropping off things and returned at 4 to find special snacks and drinks left for all 3 kids. A root beer, whoopie pies and m&m's for eldest, a juice box and age appropriate snack tray for 3 year old, and special crackers and bib for baby. All very nice touches!
We had dinner, (all of us), in Bristol Lounge and our waiter was very accommodating to kids. Even brought out a portable DVD player for our son. Helpful with his wine ideas and food choices. Food was very good. Disappointed to see some people wearing their shorts and t-shirts, come on, at least put on something nice! After dinner we had the "icecream man" come to our room and we all were able to have him make us sundae's. Cute idea except kids were ready to sleep then.
Don't hesitate to come if you have children or if not. The children are not running around yet the hotel truly made us feel welcome which doesn't always happen with 4-5 star places. We are looking forward to coming again as we felt so welcome and Memorial Day weekend seemed to be a great time as many had left the city. I am sure they try to keep people with kids away from rooms of single or business travelers so you won't be disturbed. Love the ability to walk everywhere in this city.

Less

radTX
Dallas, TX
2 reviews
Reviews in 2 cities Reviews in 2 cities
3 helpful votes 3 helpful votes
'Fantastic Hotel Choice'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 7, 2012
3
people found this review helpful

I'll try to cover the items I think are important when looking for a hotel.

Location: it really is one of the best locations in the city. You can walk pretty much anywhere. Or, if you need to go further, the subway is very close and can get you to Cambridge, Copley Square, Fenway, etc., in just a few minutes. Boston Common is one block away. Also within easy walking distance: Beacon Hill, Downtown, North End (Little Italy), Faneuil Hall, Theater District.

Airport Access: You can take a taxi from the airport for about $20. Or you can take the subway. Tip: if you're going to be there for more than a couple days, buy a "Charlie Ticket" at the subway station for unlimited rides.

Room: The room was a very good size (this is third hotel I've stayed at in Boston in the last couple years and they were all really great. This one stood out because of the size of the room - which I did not expect from a "boutique hotel"). There were two queen beds. We were on the 13th floor (may be the first hotel I've stayed in that doesn't "skip" the 13th floor). The style and decor is very modern, yet comfortable. The beds were great. The shower had good water pressure and never ran out of hot water. The fridge is stocked with the normal uber-expensive sodas and liquor, so we just pulled all that stuff out and used the fridge to chill beer that we bought at the Boston Wine Exchange around the corner (another great tip for beer lovers: go to the Boston Wine Exchange - the selection is very good). Another tip for beer lovers: check out the Barracuda Tavern just steps away from the hotel. It's a great little bar. Very laid back. Good food and a great beer list.

My biggest complaint: expensive wifi (this seems to be a trend with the higher end hotels (where it seems to be free at a cheap motel anywhere)).

Service: The hotel staff were all very pleasant and professional. I asked for a couple things to be brought to the room and they were delivered right away. Maps were given on request. There are large containers of water in the lobby with either lemon or orange in them. It was a good refreshment upon arriving back at the hotel after walking around all day. There is a wine reception open to all guests from 5p to 6p each day. The valet/doormen/bag handlers/etc. were all very helpful with getting taxis, storing bags, etc. The housekeeping was absent when appropriate and available when appropriate.

Overall: I would definitely stay here again. It's a very comfortable hotel with great service in a perfect location.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes

honeymooncanada
Cleveland, OH
Contributor
12 reviews 12 reviews
Reviews in 10 cities Reviews in 10 cities
23 helpful votes 23 helpful votes
'First impression of a Kimpton....a Delight!'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 4, 2012
3
people found this review helpful

I tend to be boring and stick to what I know (Hiltons and Marriotts), but Boston is trickier because the most beloved properties are boutiques. So, I tried a Kimpton for the first time. The hotel chain is excellent.

I arrived early before my room was ready. They kindly called me on the phone to let me know when it was time to check in. I made sure to join the Kimpton rewards program - got me a $10 voucher to the minibar and free WIFI.

What sets this hotel chain apart is the folks who work there. On the first night, a younger male employee gave us a rundown of the best burgers in Boston. Who doesn't love a great burger? The next night a female employee walked us through many wonderful Italian options on the North End.

The wine happy hour is a great way to kick off the evening - and they aren't stingy on the pours!

The hotel is very pet friendly. We were a little nervous because a happy pooch greated us everytime we got off the elevator (barking). However, as we moved to our room, the sound lessened - good sound proofing.

I was a little under the weather, and was shocked at the offering of "extras" for a guest's use during one's stay - including a humidifier. How thoughtful!

The rooms aren't huge, but are well-designed so you don't feel too closed in. The location was great - easy walk to Boston Commons, the North End, Freedom Trail, Beacon Hill (Don't miss Paramount for Breakfast).
Less

UnboundTraveler
Washington DC, District of Columbia
Top Contributor
56 reviews 56 reviews
Reviews in 37 cities Reviews in 37 cities
33 helpful votes 33 helpful votes
'Excellent location in the heart of Boston'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed May 31, 2012
1
person found this review helpful

Stayed here for a getaway weekend with some friends and was very pleased with the choice. The staff really are very friendly--they have a 'can do' attitude for most anything you ask for. The location is unbeatable. It is right on the Freedom Trail across from the Granary (a historic graveyard) and within walking distance to everything. You can take the T (subway) to it right from the airport. Beds are extremely comfortable and the room has a great, fully-stocked mini bar with reasonable prices for most items. The water pressure was so great it almost made me want to spend my vacation in the shower. Best hotel shower I've had.

My two suggestions would be: make sure you know what room you are booking. We booked a premium corner room that looked nothing like the picture online. They said it was the same class of room but it was one small window vs a wall of windows. In their defense, they did correct the problem and gave us the better room. Also, the coffee and tea were cold every morning we were there so I'd suggest the Dunkin Donuts or Starbucks right around the corner.

Overall, it is a very good hotel to choose if you are in Boston so see the sites and spend a fun weekend exploring.
Less

Leo V
Downey, California
2 reviews
Reviews in 2 cities Reviews in 2 cities
'Middle of it all!'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed May 31, 2012

Hobby of mine takes me to pro MLB baseball stadiums around the US. Fenway Park was next on my list and I figured I would want to visit other sites in Boston. Girly and I stayed in downtown for 3 nights with the intention of walking or using the T subway to get around. We had arrived at 6 am early from a red eye flight from the west coast so we were at a disadvantage of not knowing what to do. Our first impression of the hotel came from its attentive staff. The front desk was kind enough to advise that while our room would not be ready until after noon that they could hold our luggage until one became available. Without hesitation they provided a map of the city and recommended key locations that would keep us busy until they called us. Impressive! Hotel itself is nicely decorated geared for any mainstream visitor. The room is about 360 square feet, bathroom was in marble with glass shower. The TV was on the small side but not that it mattered. Since you are downtown you are not going to get the the best views, maybe the other end had views, not sure. We were on the 15th floor but on the north end. The lobby in the front is comfortable to watch the city walk by and is used to hold a wine happy hour daily. We unfortunately missed the happy hour but there was a good vibe when we walked by it. The location of the hotel has its advantages with access to Freedom Trail, 5-10 minute walk to North End (little Italy), Quincy Market (Faneuil Hall), Beacon Hill, Boston Common Park, and downtown. We missed out on eating at KO restaurant, atttached to hotel. Also missed out on catching a brew at Beantown Pub which is steps away. Overall we were more than impressed with the hotel staff and location. Enjoy!
