BlueTravels
Boston Area
Contributor
14 reviews 14 reviews
Reviews in 5 cities Reviews in 5 cities
1 helpful vote 1 helpful vote
'NOT a luxury hotel'
2 of 5 stars Reviewed May 20, 2012

We booked a room at the Taj to celebrate our anniversary, thinking that we were booking a luxury hotel. While we had no major problems, nothing about the rooms, the property, or the staff make this a luxury property. It's comparable to many of the local chain hotels, which are better priced. This was immediately apparent by the long line at the check-in desk and the room size and furnishings. The bathroom was downright TINY.

They advertised complimentary car service, so we called ahead to the concierge to arrange dinner reservations and the car. We were told that the car did not go to the North End, which is less than 2 miles away, but only covered the immediate area (so what good is a car service??) and in any event, it was first come, first serve.

We selected a closer restaurant recommended by the concierge, about 6 blocks away, and requested 6:00 pm reservations. When we came downstairs to go to the restaurant and asked if the car was available, we were told that they did not put it into service until 6:00 pm! (I guess guests don't go anywhere during the day.) Why did the concierge not recommend a slightly later reservation time?? When we asked how to call for pick-up when we were finished eating, we were told that the car only TOOK guests TO places, it was not available to bring them back.

This was such a crock. Is there a car service or not? Or does their complimentary jag just make for good advertising?

Other non-luxury touches included: a lack of synthetic pillows. (We were told they were 'out'), very thin walls that subjected us to listening to our neighbor's TV late into the night, a maintenance man who barged in because he said I called him (I did not, but even if I had, I'd have preferred that he wait until I answered the door), over-cooked Eggs Benedict, and an understaffed caf with slow service. (Lots of bus-boys but only one poor waiter trying to keep up.)

The included breakfast was a hassle. We paid a higher room rate that included breakfast, but the staff didn't initially know what included. Finally, they let us order breakfast entrees and said we were 'lucky' because often the breakfast only includes coffee, juice and danish (what they call the continental.) They double taxed us on it, because instead of just giving it to us, they billed it and then credited back all but the tax and gratuity. I was fine with the gratuity, of course, but objected to the tax because we had already paid tax on the higher room rate.

Two good points about staying here. Location, Location, near Newbury Street and the Public Gardens. The second is that, unlike the Eggs Benedict, the strawberries and muesli at breakfast were quite good.

Had this not been billed as a luxury hotel and had we not paid such a pretty penny, I'd have given it a higher rating.

We live in MA and occasionally treat ourselves to a night in the city. Next time we'll do it someplace else.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
See 2 more reviews by BlueTravels for Boston

TajBostonManagement, Manager at Taj Boston, responded to this review
May 24, 2012
Dear Guest,

Thank you for choosing the Taj and for leaving your feedback on this forum. We greatly appreciate all reviews, as it is one of the most important ways for us to make the necessary improvements to the Hotel and service. On behalf of Taj Boston, we sincerely apologize for the inconveniences you faced during your stay.

Our complimentary Jaguar service is intended to provide added convenience to our visitors, and apologize that it had been more of an inconvenience for you. We offer this service to all of our guests, and is based upon availability only. In order to provide transportation to as many guests as we can, we have advised our drivers to stay within close proximity of the Hotel. Unfortunately, these areas have not been made entirely clear to some of our staff, as the North End is within this close proximity. I have forwarded your comments to our Hotel Manager, and will ensure the Staff follows the proper protocol pertaining to the car service. Additionally, we will ensure that the staff communicates to guests exactly how this service works, as its functions may differ from other car services. I will also make certain that each issue you encountered is addressed, and we will do everything we can to make the necessary improvements.

We are currently in the process of making various updates to our guestrooms, to include new carpets and televisions. This continuous process is a result of the feedback we receive, as well as our constant effort to do everything we can to create a luxury experience for our guests. We greatly appreciate your assistance in improving our Hotel, and do hope the rest of your trip to Boston was enjoyable. We invite you to stay with us again on your next stay in the city so that we can offer you the true luxury experience that we strive for every day.

Kindest Regards,

Taj Boston Management

'Wonderful Stay'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 14, 2012 NEW

I stayed at the W Boston for fun as I had an expiring free weekend night stay from one of their frequent stay promotions. It was suprisingly easy redeeming this promotion, both in Boston and New York City. No hidden fees, the rooms themselves were 100% free. Check-in went smoothly and I was upgraded to a very spacious king room, complete with all the expected amenities of a W hotel (Bliss products, DVD player, robes, ultra comfortable beds, etc). I booked a massage at the Bliss Spa, which was amazing. As a Beacon Hill resident, I now use the Spa regularly, and it is always an enjoyable experience. Upon returning to my room, there was a handwritten note adressing me by name thanking me for my stay. It was a very nice touch, one I have not seen through my many stays at the W Chicago City Center and W Dallas. I ordered room service, and the food arrived quickly and was very delicious. The room itself was very clean and quiet, despite being in the heart of the Theater District and overlooking the busy Stuart Street. Overall, I found the hotel and the customer service to be exceptional.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
Ask anonymous928 about W Boston
This review is the subjective opinion of a TripAdvisor member and not of TripAdvisor LLC.

Professorgreen
Boston, Massachusetts
Senior Contributor
26 reviews 26 reviews
Reviews in 15 cities Reviews in 15 cities
28 helpful votes 28 helpful votes
'Nice touches, should be copied'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed June 10, 2012 NEW

This is a good location as others have observed. The lobby, bar and restaurant share the small ground floor area. So, not the grand open spaces of other downtown hotels. The bar service was friendly, but seemed one person short during happy hour. Get a window seat and enjoy watching the passers-by. It is downtown-priced, so four individual sliders and four drinks was $100. Be advised as folks continually note, the valet parking is $44 a night. Self-parking options are limited and would run about $30. In downtown, you're generally gonna walk, cab or T. Pleasant surprises were in the room. Nice shower, marble and large. Bed was comfortable. be advised this is a downtown hotel in a busy area, there is street noise until 2 a.m. and the hotel is on the lower floors of the tower, only to about floor 14 (condos above). Consider earplugs. Very pleasant surprise was a charging station in the room with plugs for mini-USB (cell phones), IPad, and IPhone. What a great idea after I have forgotten these all the time. Three free bottles of water; however, the Boston tap water is fine to drink. The worktable and chair were very nice and the room was spacious with two side chairs, side table, work table, office chair and more. One complaint is the lighting over the sink is only on one side, so shaving involves some head turing. But there is a lighted make-up mirror. Late night (11 p.m.) room service was prompt and the menu and the delivery person explained that the service gratuity was already added. Okay by me. I would recommend it for a comfortable business stay or look location for enjoying time in the city. My spouse says it beats the Westin Copley where we had stayed serveral times, except for the views from the Westin SPG floors on the 40+ floors.
Less

'And the winner for best hotel Shower Head goes to W Boston'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed June 9, 2012 NEW

Ya....the shower is wonderful...lots of water coming from this gentle rain fall shower head. This hotel is well located in the city and tries very hard to be 'hip' with the young crowd. We figured this out as we came back from a Red Sox game late at night and had to clear two gentlemen in suits and ear pieces acting as security. When we showed them our hotel key and got it was obvious that night life is key to the W. The rooms are unique and clean. I always wonder why the ore expensive the hotel, and this is an expensive hotel, that you have to pay for what the economy hotel chains give you for free. Ie, wifi, parking, etc. If you are young and hip then the W beckons you.

'unexpected treat'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 9, 2012 NEW

When we booked the room we had never heard of the W Hotel before so didn't really know what to expect. The drive to Boston was stressful with traffic backups for much of the way. When we arrived at the hotel we were stressed and tired. I went to check in and my husband and daughter sat down near the elevator to wait. Within minutes an employee noticed them and offered to get them something. When I came back a short time later my husband was sipping an ice cold beer and smiling. The hotel advertises "whatever whenever" service and they truly do just that. Our whole stay was as accommodating as our initial greeting. We always look for a W hotel now when we travel.

Mustihaveone
Mustihaveone
Senior Contributor
36 reviews 36 reviews
Reviews in 25 cities Reviews in 25 cities
15 helpful votes 15 helpful votes
'Good, but seen far better W's'
3 of 5 stars Reviewed June 7, 2012

Overall, this is a good hotel, but I can't help compare service and decor to others - like W Kowloon or W Istanbul - and feel there is room to improve.

Positives: Good location, close enough to downtown and South Station (I like to walk). Chinatown is around the corner which means restaurants galore, including a nice vegan one on the corner of Washington and Beach (I think). There is also some F&B choice right across the street. Good, smooth check in, was offered my choice of Gold awards, polite. Room is very comfortable, bathroom's spacious, there is no tub which is to me a plus as it leads to cleaner lines and more space in the shower area.

Negatives: These are not so much negatives as very subjective opinions and room to improve. The first thing that hits you when you enter the room in the evening is the harsh fluorescent lights - perhaps this is to do with energy conversation, but lighting, carpeting and even the bathroom flooring just did not give the "W image" that I have in mind. Almost reminded me of Westins instead. Housekeeping forgot to replace a consumed complimentary bottle of water on day 2 of my stay, forcing me to open a $7 bottle of Fiji in the middle of the night to parch my throat - forgetful or devious, I don't know. The next day they did give a new bottle. The room itself, was basic - I am not sure I was upgraded for being a lifetime gold: the check-in person did not mention anything about an upgrade (I like to know, it is ok if I don't get one, but I wish they would explicitly say whether they can or not deliver on a promise to upgrade whenever possible that they make to all Gold and Platinum members - you must be upfront on these things, not hide and sweep it under the carpet). Instead he announced that I'd have a room with a king - sorry, but that is what I already signed up for so it hardly deserves trumpeting. And had they indeed upgraded me, and if this is my upgraded room then the standard rooms must be rather standard indeed.
Less

'THE place to enjoy the city'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 29, 2012
1
person found this review helpful

Having in mind the Golden Gate Bridge 75th anniversary, we decided to stay a couple of days in the city; we choose it mainly because its location, our previous experience with other Fairmont's hotels and tripadvisor reviews.
First of all, this is not your average hotel, what you get is an apartment fully equipped in the city with all the amenities of a luxury hotel.
Secondly the staff goes above and beyond, every one of them; their attention has not rival in San Francisco.
All the above united to the little details this hotel offers you such as house car, ambiance music every time you enter your room, fitness facility open 24 hrs, coffee and tea all day at the lounge, cheese and wine afternoon hour, daily breakfast, immediate attention to all your requests; make you feel at home.
Thank you Fairmont Heritage Place Ghirardelli Staff for make our San Francisco stay a splendid holiday.

    *

See 4 more reviews by carbonlazy for San Francisco
carbonlazy
London, United Kingdom
Senior Contributor
26 reviews 26 reviews
Reviews in 11 cities Reviews in 11 cities
24 helpful votes 24 helpful votes
'AMAZING place to stay!'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 24, 2012
4
people found this review helpful

We booked a 2 bed suite. Upon arrival valet took care of our car. We had a warm welcome. The staff are great. It's not a typical grand hotel entrance - more practical but the best is yet to come.
Checked into our suite - music was playing on the more than ample sound system. Huge living room, dining room and kitchen. 2 good sized bedrooms. Perfect for a long stay though we were only there for 3 nights.
Luxurious, clean and appointed to the highest of standards. You even get an iPad in the room!
Kitchen had everything you need. There is a washing machine and dryer - with all powders supplied.
The location in Ghiradelli Square was fantastic. Shops and restaurants all around yet very quiet. The most comfortable beds and the best sleep after a day out in San Fran.
They have BMW bicycles you can borrow free of charge. We had a great time cycling around safely round Fisherman's Wharf with the kids. They even supply helmets, rucksack and a bike lock and bottles of water - very thoughtful.
Breakfast is continental but it is easily enough to kick start the morning.
The kids were tired one afternoon so stayed in, ordered free DVD movies via the huge selection and when room service brought the DVD, they bring along a complimentary bag of microwave popcorn. Nice touch.
We would love to go back and stay longer. There is so much to do - Crooked Street is not far away. You can get the tram from nearby which is an experience. Really enjoyed our stay and though it was pricey it was completely worth it.
Very impressed with the way Fairmont dealt with our enquiry from beginning to end.
Highly recommended.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes

Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
pcsullivan
Texas
Contributor
19 reviews 19 reviews
Reviews in 10 cities Reviews in 10 cities
18 helpful votes 18 helpful votes
'Great Stay'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 15, 2012
4
people found this review helpful

We booked this location because we used to live in the neighborhood, and were we ever impressed with the changes! First off, we were met at the airport by the house driver, who was nice as could be while we wrestled with the paperwork of lost luggage! We arrived at a very discreet entrance and were whisked into a world of pampering. We were greeted by Jeremy, who informed us that he had upgraded us to a 2-bedroom suite (did our driver inform him of our frustrating little luggage experience?). Whatever, we were happy to be treated so nicely!
Our view wasn't much (the high-rise next door), but we took full advantage of the lovely terraces (shielded from the wind and heated, one with a fantastic view, the other just off the member lounge). The included breakfast (fresh-squeezed orange juice, Illy Coffees, fresh fruit, assorted breads and pastries, cereals and oatmeal, and a hot entree) certainly did the trick for us, and we kept meaning to join the complimentary wine reception, but ended up with so much wine from our excursion to the wine shop in Ghirardelli Square, that we just took it up to the terrace and enjoyed the view and the fire pit.
Our apartment was very nice, with a nicely equipped kitchen with a very clever dining arrangement, living room with fireplace, and two bedrooms and bathrooms. There was also a washer and dryer in the unit, as well as a laptop safe in the master bedroom closet. Bicycles were available for guests to use, as was the wonderful house car. We used the house car several times to ferry us to one restaurant or another.
The staff was impeccable. The housekeeping staff was everywhere, from polishing the rails outside to the twice-daily service. I'd single someone out, but it wouldn't be fair to do so because everyone was spot on.
This is a great place for couples, families, and groups of friends. The location is surprisingly quiet, and there is so much to do right outside your door.
My only suggestion would be for management to make the coffee/tea service available all the time. We noticed quite a few international guests and they can be on totally different timetables. The Fairmont Tea, by the way, was delicious!
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
Ask pcsullivan about Fairmont Heritage Place, Ghirardelli Square

'Not Enough Luxury for the Price'
3 of 5 stars Reviewed May 28, 2012
2
people found this review helpful

For years, I stayed at the old Ritz Carlton when I came to Boston. But after it was taken over by the Taj and its service fell off a cliff, we decided to try somewhere new. We decided to spend our 15 year anniversary in Boston at the Four Seasons. We reserved a park view room. I was surprised when we were shown to our room; it is basically a Holiday Inn layout with nicer furniture and carpeting and view. The allocation of the space is the same, the layout is the same, etc.

The service was excellent, the food was very good, but the room itself, especially for a room that is at the top of the room hierarchy, was completely unimpressive.
Less

cls2711
Reading, UK
Reviewer
4 reviews 4 reviews
Reviews in 4 cities Reviews in 4 cities
27 helpful votes 27 helpful votes
'Wonderful!'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 11, 2012

Stayed here for 3 nights and cannot fault it - they think of everything. The staff are excellent and nothing is too much trouble. We had a deluxe room and it was very spacious and absolutely immaculate. The attention to detail is what makes this hotel, on top of all the usual things you get in a 5 star hotel. Things like a night light in the bathroom, book mark placed inside the book that you've left on the side, cuddly toy for kids to choose at reception to accompany them for their stay and loads more little things are what makes this hotel stand out from other 5 star hotels.

The location is ideal for seeing Boston. Most things are walking distance or the "T" is just a short walk away.

I cannot praise this hotel enough and would definitely return.
Less

irishcurse
Boston, Massachusetts
Senior Reviewer
8 reviews 8 reviews
Reviews in 8 cities Reviews in 8 cities
15 helpful votes 15 helpful votes
'Birthday Surprise'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 1, 2012
1
person found this review helpful

This was a birthday surprise for my girlfriend, since we couldn't get away, I decided on a staycation. We arrived at The Four Seasons and to say the least she was "shocked" when the doorman opened the door and asked if she was checking in. Her reply was "I don't know", but we were and for the next two days, all was perfect! Check in was a breeze and we were upgraded because of my AMEX card, which includes a number of amemities. Our Executive Suite was wonderful, two rooms with a view (4th floor) of the Public Gardens, amazing, amazing view. I had called the hotel the day before to have a dozen roses in the room and they were beautiful (Winston's). Two minutes after arriving in the room the door bell rang (yes, a door bell) and a server brought in a birthday plate, a small dessert with a birthday greeting. Everywhere we went in the hotel you are greeted by name and the answer to every request is yes. Drinks in the Bristol lounge were great and the bartender was better (sorry forgot his name) great conversation about the changes in the bar business.

That evening we decided on room service and we had to try the Bristol Burger, we have had them a long time ago at the bar, but room serivce can be tricky. Not here they arrived on time and as ordered. Mine med-rare and hers medium. they were fantastic, the fries awesome. as we ate we marveled at how they arrived at perfect temp from room service when some restaurants can't do it from kitchen to dining room.

Room service breakfast was wonderful, the food , the view, the champagne, Yes! Later that day, my girlfriends actual birthday another birthday treat arrived a dessert with a birthday wish. We decided to have her birthday dinner at the Bristol Lounge and it was superb. Though it didn't start that way. The restaurant was busy and we were seated at a banquette with a "gentleman" with a voice that suggested he was sitting next to you, as I looked around our wonderful server suggested a different table, Thank you. From there dinner was wonderful, the short ribs fantastic and my young ladies filet excellent. Another birthday dessert arrived at the table with her name on it. A great meal, a great server, a great restaurant.

Wednesday was check out and back to the real world, for me it was early packing everything and the bellman packing the roses (great job, thanks). My Love was able to stay for a few extra hours with late checkout and the hotel car to get her to work. She used the gym every day and loved the staff and space.

Four Season's prides itself in customer service and they rarely fail! A great stay in a great property with a staff that cares about it's guests. For a special occasion make it The Four Season's
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
Ask irishcurse about Four Seasons Hotel Boston
This review is the subjective opinion of a TripAdvisor member and not of TripAdvisor LLC.
Kristan Fletcher, Public Relations Manager at Four Seasons Hotel Boston, responded to this review
May 7, 2012
Thank you so much for your wonderful note. We're delighted that your girlfriend had such a special birthday - what better surprise than a memorable staycation? We know how much effort goes into planning a surprise, so we applaud YOU - and are also ecstatic to hear what a fantastic stay you both had, start to finish. We're thrilled that you enjoyed your guest room and amenity, and also pleased that you loved The Bristol Lounge and Room Service too (we agree: the truffle fries are amazing!). We're also so happy that your girlfriend was able to relish each second, from a workout in the gym to all the extra staff touches. We pride ourselves on providing exceptional service and love nothing more than when our guests experience just that. We can't thank you enough for choosing Four Seasons Boston to celebrate this happy time, and we hope that every stay with us, whether for a special occasion or simply a night away, is equally incredible!

 Boston Marriott Copley Place

declue
CT
Top Contributor
113 reviews 113 reviews
Reviews in 43 cities Reviews in 43 cities
188 helpful votes 188 helpful votes
'Great location and service'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed June 13, 2012 NEW
1
person found this review helpful

If you want to be near prime shopping, Newbury street, touristy sites and a short walk to the theater district, the Copley Marriott is it!

Check-in:
Was a fast, easy process.
Note: I can see though during busy times how they could be potentially overwhelmed, so if you see the crowd just head over to the right and check your luggage with the concierge and take a walk!

Room:
Didn't have to wait a while for the elevator, which is nice in a larger hotel. The room was very clean, on the smaller side, by typical for a Boston hotel. Very nice bed and pillows. Flat screen TV, everything you'd expected from a Marriott.

Fitness Room:
Very nice fitness area. Solid amount of treadmills, ellipticals and other machines. Small selection of dumbbells and a nautilus circuit. Big pool for laps, along with a hot tub.

Location:
A couple blocks from Newbury, a couple blocks from the church and library, a maybe 1 to 1.5 miles from Boston Common. Grocery store across the street and of course a fantastically high-end "mall" on the 2nd floor that spans over to the prudential building. The hotel sits between the Prudential building and the John Hancock building.

Price: Varies WILDLY. My corporate was fantastic, not a single complaint.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
See 11 more reviews by declue for Boston
Ask declue about Boston Marriott Copley Place
This review is the subjective opinion of a TripAdvisor member and not of TripAdvisor LLC.

4 of 5 stars Reviewed June 13, 2012 NEW

When returning to Boston for MIT reunions we often stay on campus in the Marriott there - but this time we opted to stay in the Boston Marriott Copley Place. What a great selection as it allowed for easy walking to upscale shops in adjoining Copley Center, The Prudential Center, as well as Newbury Street - making it a a teriffic close choice when one tires of shopping/walking. The hotel itself had wonderful valet and cab service, the rooms were quiet and clean, and there are numerous public areas allowing for friends to meet.

LondonSunseeker22
London
Senior Contributor
21 reviews 21 reviews
Reviews in 16 cities Reviews in 16 cities
9 helpful votes 9 helpful votes
'Central Hotel'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed June 5, 2012
2
people found this review helpful

This hotel is really central with easy access to the Prudential Center, Newbury Street and the shops in the Copley Center. The nearest T station is in the Prudential Center and is a 5 minute walk from the hotel. It is a large and busy hotel so you may wait some time for a lift or service at the front desk. The "lounge" area is essentially part of the thoroughfare for the shopping center so van be exceptionally busy. The queues at Starbucks are long at peak times. This is a hotel to use for either business purposes or shopping - you would not stay here for a quiet break!
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes

TRV_1957
Birmingham, Alabama
Top Contributor
55 reviews 55 reviews
Reviews in 48 cities Reviews in 48 cities
42 helpful votes 42 helpful votes
'Convenient location if a bit bland'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed June 4, 2012
1
person found this review helpful

Stayed at this property for five nights to attend a conference and visit my daughter. While I have been to Boston several times, this was my first stay at the Marriott. Centrally located. Front desk staff were exemplary, making check-in feel like a Ritz Carlton or Four Seasons - obviously well trained and managed. Small lobby that is often quite crowded and loud. Rooms have been recently renovated, so both the furniture and soft goods are fresh. Great corner room on high floor with view of Back Bay and the Charles, but bathroom is tiny and ho-hum. The only restaurant is a combo sports bar. Cold breakfast buffet was way overpriced, though the staff were very friendly and polite. Instead go to the Au Bon Pain in either of the two adjacent retail centers - better selection and half the price. Also be sure to shop at Shaw's grocery store immediately across the street for bottled water and snacks. Lastly, for a great salad bar, check out the Blue Glass Cafe on the ground floor of the John Hancock, a couple blocks away. Instead of the Green Line at Copley, consider using the Orange Line at Back Bay Station. Just as close and faster.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
Ask TRV_1957 about Boston Marriott Copley Place
This review is the subjective opinion of a TripAdvisor member and not of TripAdvisor LLC.
SBV7
Costa Rica

'Chaos at power failure'
2 of 5 stars Reviewed June 3, 2012

I was in Boston at the Marriott Copley for the weekend of May the 3th 2012. We returned for just 1 night on May 7th in order to fly out of Boston the next day. At 11 am. when ready to leave the room the power went off for more than 90 minutes. I was amazed that the hotel didn't have or where not working the emergency power plants to be able to handle at least the elevators. I had to stay in my room for more than 2 hours until the hotel staff allowed me to go down using the elevators.

This can't happen in a more than 40 floor hotel building in a 5 star hotel. It was extremely frightening. NO EVACUATION PLANS  NO STAFF TRAINED TO HANDLE THIS KIND OF EMERGENCIES.
Less

'Great hotel centrally located!'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 2, 2012
1
person found this review helpful

My husband and I stayed here for one night while traveling around Massachusetts. It is connected to shopping and restaurants. We were able to walk to Newberry Street for shopping and dining from the hotel. Also, it is not a far walk to get to public transportation. We checked out of the hotel at 11 am but wanted to walk the freedom trail. The front desk said they would store our luggage with no problem. The staff were very friendly and the view from our room was outstanding. We had a room on the 21st floor and it looked out to the water and downtown buildings. The room was very clean and the bed was comfortable. I would definitely stay here on a return trip to Boston. Very nice hotel.

MJJBunny
Jensen Beach, Florida
Senior Reviewer
9 reviews 9 reviews
Reviews in 6 cities Reviews in 6 cities
1 helpful vote 1 helpful vote
'Convenience in Boston'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed May 30, 2012

We spent the day as tourists in Boston. Somewhere between check in and catching the trolley for a tour of Boston which arrives directly outside the hotel door, the Mr. lost his credit card. The hotel staff was extremely helpful and immediately notified security. After a fruitless search of the places we had been, we stopped at the concierge desk and they called security. The card was there and the concierge person immediately went to collect the card. Above and beyond I thought.

The room was very comfortable and clean. Bathroom was small, but we are talking about a place where space is at a premium. We had breakfast at Champions on site and it was very good. I also loved that there was free internet in the lobby and on the second floor.

Hotel location is connected by walkway to Prudential Center. Extremely convenient if you want upscale shopping. Would definitely stay at this hotel again when in the area.
Less

Trevelling_Macs
San Diego, California
Senior Contributor
43 reviews 43 reviews
Reviews in 36 cities Reviews in 36 cities
17 helpful votes 17 helpful votes
'Super nice stay and centrally located'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 15, 2012 NEW

This was my third visit to Boston and since the Sheraton was the headquarter hotel for the conference I was attending I decided to give it a try. I really enjoyed my stay here and was a perfect stay. I was put up in the north tower with a distant but nice view of the Charles river. The stay was very comfortable and I had no issues with anything. I would recommend it to anyone.

Pros:
Wonderful location in Back Bay. You don't have to even exit since the hotel is directly connected to the Hynes convention center, the prudential mall and several shops and eateries. Well contained. Perfect for convention center visitors and great for rainy days.

Nice spacious and comfortable rooms. Good and prompt room service and amenities.

Room service was also excellent and not very pricey.

Free bottled water and Starbucks blonde brew.

Minor Cons:
Same old story of paid Wi-fi even for SPG members unless you are platinum level (so much for membership), but the saving grace was good connectivity and speed.

The two towers face each other so you get nice views of not only the Charles river but also of the rooms in the south tower if the shades are open. Not a great thing for privacy.

Less
Was this review helpful? Yes

'Excellent location but expensive and dated'
2 of 5 stars Reviewed June 15, 2012 NEW

We stayed at the Sheraton as we were attending a school reunion in Boston. The location is very convenient as the hotel directly connects to Boston's prudential building and shops and fancy shopping center Copley place (including a legal seafoods restaurant, cheesecake factory, pf changs, a religious chapel and many shops). A lot of other amenities within the hotel include a starbucks, a post office/business center etc.

Reception checkin was average and did not take too long. The rooms are ok but the bathroom was small. although we got a Starwood preferred guest rate the hotel rooms were very expensive. I think we expected a lot more than we got. The club level breakfast was also very average, nothing vavavoom for the room price we paid.

Flanders59
Antwerp, Belgium
Senior Contributor
32 reviews 32 reviews
Reviews in 17 cities Reviews in 17 cities
21 helpful votes 21 helpful votes
'Perfect location in a wonderful city'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed June 14, 2012 NEW

We stayed at the Sheraton for 6 nights and enjoyed it very much. Location is perfect: close to lovely Copley Square, the shops and cosy breakfast places on Newbury Street, Prudential Center (Skywalk & shopping), the T station around the corner (easy access into the city to almost everywhere you'd want to go). The restaurant scene is amazing in Boston! We thoroughly enjoyed this beautiful city as well as our trips to Provincetown (Cape Cod) and Cambridge (Harvard Univ). Service at the Sheraton was rather impersonal but certainly not lacking. Our room was in the south tower on the 14th floor, close to the elevator and ice machine but we did not experience any discomfort or noise. View on the city (huge window), very big room (2 queen beds), bathroom OK, aircon working excellent, complimentary bottle of mineral water daily, coffee and tea facilities. PS: We found the staff at the Starbucks in the hotel rather unfriendly. But definitely: Visit Boston! You'll love it!
Less

SamirShivani
Delhi
Contributor
12 reviews 12 reviews
Reviews in 8 cities Reviews in 8 cities
9 helpful votes 9 helpful votes
'One of the best in the area'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 14, 2012 NEW

I stayed here for 10 days on a business trip.

Location: It's a 5-7 min walk from 2 metro lines (Orange line and Green line). 15 min walk from the waterfront. 15-20 min walk from frog pond ice-skating rink. It's on the edge of a huge shopping complex. A grocery store 5 min away. Bustling upmarket shopping street (Newburry St) in vicinity. Lots of eating options around. You can't ask for more.

Inside: Rooms aren't exactly huge sized but look fresh. Beds are comfortable, and interiors soothing & up-market. Breakfast was continental, basic but very nice.
Housekeeping is efficient, reception staff very helpful.
They have a nice Gym and a small but clean indoor pool. There are some ballrooms and convention halls as well but I had no opportunity to use any of that.

I'd not hesitate to stay with them again!
Less

'Overpriced, but clean; central location'
3 of 5 stars Reviewed June 13, 2012 NEW via mobile

I have no complaints about the hotel itself: the rooms are clean and have all of the basic amenities, there is a nice pool and fitness center, and the location is near many shops, restaurants and walking distance to the Public Garden, Boston Common and The Charles waterfront. However, the hotel is overpriced given the amenities, the restaurant is overpriced with slow service and sub-par food. More importantly, the staff is unfriendly, bordering on rude. Upon check-in they had no record of the specifics of my room request (king room, etc) and had made no note on my colleague's account when he had called ahead with a specific request. They made no apologies and requested to see my confirmation email (sent by them) before she would begrudgingly honor the room reservation I hade made months prior.
Less

'Good location mediocre for the price'
3 of 5 stars Reviewed June 12, 2012 NEW via mobile

I was in Boston for a meeting and stayed at the Sheraton. The check in process was fine but the description of the rooms is missleading. I was assigned a room with double beds but was offered an alternative of a room with a queen bed and a access bathroom. I chose the queen, it was a mistake, the room was tiny and smelled of mildew. I changed rooms to the double which was larger but still to small to leave the ironing board out. Bathrooms are so small the door must be shut to use the shower.
No microwave or refrigerator and thirteen dollars a day for Internet.
For meetings this OK but for any other stays I would look elsewhere.

Problem with this review?
NeuroscienceYogi
State College, Pennsylvania
Senior Contributor
22 reviews 22 reviews
Reviews in 10 cities Reviews in 10 cities
3 helpful votes 3 helpful votes
'Charm, Warmth, Mostly Exceptional Staff, Some only OK rooms'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed May 31, 2012 NEW

My business host in Pacific Hts recommended it. It was an exceptional, cozy, and elegant hotel. Very traditional, high-end B&B w/some nice European touches. The 7/24 coffee and tea in the sitting room was more like 7/23, IME. It took three requests at the desk to get it restocked, which took an hour. Business center is marginal and small - amazingly they had no PowerPoint viewer program installed. Astonished that a hotel in the middle these VCs and hedge fund mgrs, had a biz center w/no ability to look at a PP preso. Could download it in minutes, but had no "administrator" privileges, nor did anyone in the hotel. One of the staff did persist, and they were getting one "soon" when I left 3 days later.

Be careful what room you get; booked 6 wks in advance on hotels.com. The room (109), was next to the elevator, next to the 7/24 front desk, on first floor landing surrounded by all the up and down stairs. With towels under the door, ear plugs and exhausted from a long flight, I made it work. Unable to switch rooms first night, but they did switch the next two nights to a lovely room, 301. 109 shouldn't really be a guest room, and I don't believe it typically is as they delayed 2 hours getting it "ready" b/f they gave it to me.

Breakfast is excellent "extended self-serve continental".

BTW, the wireless routers are under the bed in each room, so if you lose svcs, turn it off and on again. The WiFi in the sitting room is only OK as router is in another room; in rooms is excellent.

I'll go back, but it was not "excellent" this trip.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
Ask NeuroscienceYogi about Hotel Drisco
This review is the subjective opinion of a TripAdvisor member and not of TripAdvisor LLC.

Pam J
Seattle
1 review
'San Francisco Treasure'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 31, 2012 NEW

My second stay at the Drisco prompts me to write a glowing review for the hotel. On my first visit we splurged and booked a suite, which we loved. I hoped to be in the same room location for my second stay but it didn't look like the stars were going to align. I spoke to the wonderful, accommodating, professional front desk staff prior to my arrival and voila, when we checked in we were very pleased to be given the key to a terrific room. This hotel is so intimate, you feel like the small staff are all looking out for you as you come and go past the lovely front desk. The breakfast is outstanding and relaxed because again, the staff ensure you have everything you could possibly want. The Drisco is perfect if you are looking to get out of the congestion of Union Square and away from large, corporate hotels, but it comes with service and decor that in fact exceed that of many upscale hotels.

burnhamdesign
2 reviews
Reviews in 2 cities Reviews in 2 cities
1 helpful vote 1 helpful vote
'traditional charm and warmth in pacific heights'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 23, 2012

the drisco was recommended to me by a colleague when i asked for a place to stay in pacific heights. he told me it was small and elegant and would have everything i needed for a short trip, and he was right. it's an old-school, charming place, upscale, with excellent service. more like a high-end b&b. the rooms are immaculate, comfortable and well equipped. the staff is friendly and extremely accommodating. there's no real room service but there is a wonderful breakfast served every morning, and the front desk offered an array of take-out menus when i expressed an interest in dinner after coming home late from a work event.
pacific heights is pretty, the hotel is walking distance from fillmore shopping and well located in general. i should say that lovely as it is, the drisco is very quiet and conservative, not to be compared to more lively, hipper boutique hotels.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
Ask burnhamdesign about Hotel Drisco
This review is the subjective opinion of a TripAdvisor member and not of TripAdvisor LLC.
John Spear, General Manager at Hotel Drisco, responded to this review
June 1, 2012
Dear Guest,

Thank you for your kind comments! I'm so glad you enjoyed your stay with us!

I particularly liked your comment about the Drisco not being the hippest hotel around, because I'll admit it -- we're not hip. 'Swish' and 'cool' are also not words that leap to mind to describe the vibe here at the Drisco. "Trendy' is a tougher word, though, because although we eschew the transient and fleeting fads in our popular culture (if it's a professional dog-walker on staff or in-room web cams you're looking for, we can recommend some alternative hotels to you), we're definitely ahead of the curve when it comes to providing incredibly thoughtful touches to make our guests comfortable. Among our recent additions:

* Ambient noise-cancelling devices in every guestroom. We realize that being away form home in an unfamiliar environment leads to less-than-restful sleep for some, so we provide these devices to help guests fall asleep faster and sleep more soundly.

* State-of-the-art WiFi -- blazing fast and free. We jumped on the WiFi bandwagon years ago, and adopted one of the earliest generations of this technology. When our guests started using iPhones and iPads more often, this older WiFi technology didn't measure up, so we are right now in the process of installing a cutting edge WiFi system.

* A complimentary "extended" continental breakfast that is second-to-none. In fact, virtually every amenity we offer here at the Drisco is free (including, now, local phone calls) but many of our guests appreciate the wonderful breakfast we offer over everything else. Start your day in the French way with an espresso, a fresh-baked croissant, Plugra butter and organic jam. Or try our hand-made granola with wildflower honey sprinkled atop local sheep's milk yogurt. And if you're not looking for a carb load, sample our meats and cheeses and (on a weekend morning), smoked salmon. There's so much more on offer as well.

I could go on, but by now you have probably read many of the other comments here on TripAdvisor from our guests describing our other amenities in detail. You can also check out the amenities page on our web site, or you can always call and ask for me personally if you have any questions -- I am at your service!

John Spear
General Manager
Report response as inappropriate
This response is the subjective opinion of the management representative and not of TripAdvisor LLC.

Ask Perryba209 about Hotel Drisco

John Spear, General Manager at Hotel Drisco, responded to this review
May 31, 2012
Dear Guest,

I loved your comment about people loving their jobs here at the Drisco, and I'm so glad that our team here contributed to the enjoyment of your stay.

It is as important to me that my employees feel passionate about their jobs as it is that our guests feel enchanted by their stay with us. After all, you simply can't have one without the other.

The management and ownership of the Drisco realize that we owe everything to the employees that deliver our unique brand of service, and to our lovely guests who support us. I would like to take this opportunity to thank both our employees and our guests for helping to make the Drisco simply the best place to stay in San Francisco.

Thank you,

John Spear
General Manager

'Best Hotel in San Francisco, hands down!'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 23, 2012
2
people found this review helpful

Being a magazine editor at one of the largest magazines in the country, I get to stay at some pretty amazing hotels whenever I go traveling. My husband lovingly teases me that unless it's a five star hotel, I won't even enter the property. He's kind of right...but I do love the luxury of a amazing hotel room. As a former San Francisco native, traveling to San Francisco is always something extra special and there is nowhere more special than staying at the Hotel Drisco (and I've tried all of the top 5 star hotels in this city). Location-wise, you can't get any better than this. You're living in the most gorgeous residential area in the city, with walking distance to Fillmore Street and Union Street. And the hotel? Absolutely lovely. The building is a historic Victorian with all its charm and beauty. Every part of the property, from the inside out, has been lovingly restored. The entire building was recently renovated and the new interiors are beautiful, soothing and pristine. And the staff! They're simply incredible. They make you feel as if you're a long-lost relative. The amazing breakfast buffet and the lovely wine and cheese hour every night (both included in your hotel room price) enhances the feeling of you staying with family. I love this hotel so much and it's the #1 hotel I recommend to anyone who is visiting my favorite city in the world: San Francisco. Stay here! You will never stay anywhere else.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
Ask Hanna2240 about Hotel Drisco
This review is the subjective opinion of a TripAdvisor member and not of TripAdvisor LLC.
John Spear, General Manager at Hotel Drisco, responded to this review
May 31, 2012
Dear Guest,

Thanks very much for your wonderfully kind comments. I am so glad that you love the Drisco!

I have always loved the Drisco, well before I ever became the General Manager here. This property reflects my personality and meets my needs better than any other hotel in San Francisco. However, it is so important to us that our guests enjoy their stay here, that I feel compelled to point out that the Drisco is not the perfect hotel for everyone.

For example, if you are looking to be in the center of the action, if you thrive on the vibrant pulse of jam-packed crowds, if you want to be within 60 seconds' walk to shopping and dining, then there are simply other hotels better suited to you in San Francisco. If, however, you feel at home tucked away in a high-end residential neighborhood at the top of a hill, but still close to world-class shopping and dining, then you can't beat the Drisco.

If you require an environment completely free of ambient noise, there are other hotels in San Francisco that have been built much more recently, with state-of-the-art soundproofing. The Drisco was built in 1903 with traditional wood-framed construction. The floors can creak a little, and the windows open wide to let in both the fresh air as well as the sounds of the neighborhood.

If you always look for the hippest, hottest and newest hotel, there are more modern hotels than the Drisco, to be sure. However, if you appreciate classic elegance and warm, friendly service, you simply cannot do better in San Francisco than a stay at the Hotel Drisco.

Kind Regards,

John Spear
General Manager

Ask Shash F about Hotel Drisco

John Spear, General Manager at Hotel Drisco, responded to this review
May 31, 2012
Dear Guest,

Thank you for your very kind comments about your stay with us. I'm very pleased that you felt the staff were like family! I especially appreciated your "room tip" about the more expensive rooms with views and the less expensive rooms without views, since this topic generates a lot of comments form our guests, and I would like to take this opportunity to describe our rooms in some detail:

We have 48 guestrooms here at the Drisco, of which 19 are suites. Every suite faces the exterior of the building, with the City View Suites and Two Bedroom Two Bath Suites providing wonderful city views and the One Bedroom Suites looking out on our lovely neighborhood. The other type of guestroom that faces the exterior and offers city views in our City View Deluxe King guestroom. If a room that faces the exterior of the building is important to you, you will want to book one of the room types mentioned above. Because of their larger size and the more expansive views offered, these are also our more expensive room types.

If you would like to experience all of the wonderful complimentary services and amenities we offer here at the Drisco, but at a slightly lower price, then choosing one of our Deluxe King or Deluxe Queen rooms is the way to go. The majority of these rooms face our interior courtyard. We keep our courtyard very neat and tidy, but there are no city or neighborhood views from the majority of these guestrooms.

Lastly, if you are a real bargain hunter, I will let you in on a secret here on TripAdvisor that you will not find on our web site -- what we call our Detached Bath Guestrooms. These are our least expensive rooms (while still offering all our wonderful complimentary services and amenities). The important things to understand about these rooms are: 1.) The rooms have completely private bathrooms but your private bathroom is located across a public hallway, 2.) the rooms are very small and do not have desks and 3.) There are no views from these rooms.
Our Detached Bath Guestrooms are not available online -- please call the hotel directly and specifically ask if one of these rooms is available for your dates of stay.

Thanks again!

John Spear
General Manager

This response is the subjective opinion of the management representative and not of TripAdvisor LLC.

'Fabulous boutique hotel in a great spot!'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 16, 2012

I just spent 3 nights at the Hotel Drisco as a special birthday treat from my son and daughter. The three of us stayed in room 408, a large comfortable suite with an amazing view. From the minute we arrived at the hotel the customer service was outstanding. The room was exceptionally clean and was outfitted with everything you could possibly need. A call to the front desk for extra pillows had them at our door in 5 minutes. The continental breakfast was delicious and beautifully presented (the lattes were wonderful!). I even took advantage of the gym which, although small, had everything I needed.
We walked to Union Street when we first arrived and had lunch at Rosa's Cafe...another great find! The hotel is in a gorgeous, safe neighborhood within walking distance of the shops and restaurants on Union St. if you love to walk.
I fell in love with San Francisco on an extended visit in 2010 and now I have fallen in love with the Hotel Drisco. I can't wait to go back!
Less

Problem with this review?
Ask LeighD about Hotel Drisco
This review is the subjective opinion of a TripAdvisor member and not of TripAdvisor LLC.
John Spear, General Manager at Hotel Drisco, responded to this review
May 31, 2012
Dear Guest,

Thanks for your kind words! So glad to hear you have fallen in love with the Drisco!

In your review you mentioned walking to Rose's Cafe (one of my favorites), and I wanted to take the opportunity here to describe a few of the other restaurants within walking distance of the hotel.

The Drisco is located in a quiet residential neighborhood, so there are no commercial establishments in the immediate vicinity of the hotel -- just tree-lined streets and lovely homes. One of the closest restaurants, Garibaldi's, lies seven blocks southwest. It's a San Francisco institution and is known for delicious and inventive California-Mediterranean cuisine. Just a few paces further in the same direction is Osteria, a family-owned traditional Italian restaurant. In the other direction, eight blocks away, lies Rose's (mentioned above), a restaurant specializing in local California products but drawing creative inspiration from Italy. Just beyond Rose's on Union Street are dozens of additional wonderful restaurants. There are even more restaurants located on Sacramento Street 10-12 blocks to the West ((including Spruce, consistently rated one of the best restaurants in all of San Francisco) and on Fillmore Street six to ten blocks to the East.

One advantage to our location atop a hill in Pacific Heights is that every one of these restaurants are a downhill walk from the hotel. However, when it comes time to return, it's a very steep walk back up the hill. For this reason many of our guests choose to walk to their restaurant of choice and then take a taxi back. But if your'e fit and want to burn off that creme brulee you just had for dessert, it's a lovely walk both ways!

Many thanks again,

John Spear
General Manager
Report response as inappropriate
This response is the subjective opinion of the management representative and not of TripAdvisor LLC.

'Best customer service ever!'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 1, 2012 NEW
2
people found this review helpful

As a former San Franciscan, I return often both on business and to visit friends and find it easier to stay at a hotel when I do. There are many fine hotels in The City, so for me, the way I'm treated by the hotel staff is the defining reason for me to return. The customer service I received by every staff member at the Omni was exceptional. At a time when poor customer service seems to be the norm just about everywhere, and many people have become resigned to it, the Omni is definitely doing something right.

In addition, the room was clean and comfortable, the bed was exquisite, room service (while pricey) was delicious, and I was able to open the window a bit to get fresh air (important to me). As a Select Guest member, I received free internet (few hotels offer this benefit) as well as morning beverage service.

Omni will be my hotel of choice from now on.

Portlandia69
Portland, Oregon
Contributor
18 reviews 18 reviews
Reviews in 7 cities Reviews in 7 cities
6 helpful votes 6 helpful votes
'Excellent quality and service for the price!'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 1, 2012 NEW
1
person found this review helpful

We just stayed here for 3 nights over Memorial Day Weekend. They only charge half price for overnight valet parking on Friday and Saturday which was nice. Parking in this town can be expensive. The service at this hotel is top notch and as good as I have experienced anywhere including Four Seasons. We arrived late on Friday night and Kendra at the front desk greeted us with a smile. She was super friendly, curtious, and even helped us find a great place to grab a bite at 11PM just a block away. The staff here goes out of their way to make sure you feel comfortable. Lex at the conceirge is a wealth of knowledge and gave us some great tips on things to do in the area as well as some super restaurant options. There is a free walking tour on Saturday mornings that leaves from the Omni at 10am (check to see if that is all the time). We had a great tour of China Town and it lasted about 2 hours. It was super convenient meeting in the lobby for the walking tour.

I was concerned about the location in the financial district when I was first considering options for lodging. However, the excellent reviews on Trip Advisor for the Omni kept bringing me back. The location is actually excellent as many reviewers have commented. The bus and cable car lines are right out the front door. Cabs are everywhere and easy walking distance to North Beach and Nob Hill.

The rooms are recently updated and very quiet. The beds are comfortable and there is a good size desk with wired and wireless internet. My only complaint would be the wireless service was spotty and slow. I chose to plug in my lap top with the provided wire connection and then I was good to go. The bathroom was updated and spacious.

We had a free morning beverage and newspaper included each day. The beverage was delivered everyday exactly at the time we requested. The juice was fresh as was the coffee and cream.

I would highly recommend this hotel whether for business or leisure. The combination of updated rooms, quiet location, public transportation, and excellent service put this on the top of my list!
I plan to stay here again when we come back to San Francisco.
Less

'Quiet, clean hotel'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 31, 2012 NEW

We really enjoyed our four night stay here over Memorial Day weekend. We were in room 1505 which was quiet, spacious, and clean. The king bed was huge and we loved the bedding. Turn down service and handwritten notes from housekeeping were nice touches as well.

The hotel bar was expensive, but the pour was easily a double or triple so we weren't too upset. The area is dead on weekends since it is the financial district, but the proximity to the Market, Union Square and North Shore makes for a nice and central location. There are two top notch restaurants literally around the corner ( wexlers and wayfarer tavern).

My only complaint was the shower. The tub appeared to be relined with vinyl or plastic and I slipped several times each showeron the slick surface no matter how careful I was. A non slip mat would have been nice. I did not mention it to the hotel, so I'm not sure if they would have done anything for us.

We definitely will stay here again. Make sure you join the frequent guest program, wifi is free even if you are a basic member.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?

'Attention to detail!'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 24, 2012 via mobile

What a great find this hotel is! Perfect location one block off union square. Easy access to great public transportation (don't rent a car), great food and shopping. Staff is well informed, unfailingly polite and very attentive, special thanks to Ann and Omar. We were upgraded free of charge to a great room with small sitting room at the end of the hall (207). Very private and quiet. Rooms are clean and comfy. Beds are great! We were concerned about no a/c but didn't need it in May. We appreciated the wine and cheese and enjoyed chatting with other guests and the innkeeper, Wayne. Thanks to all for a great stay in San Francisco!

Problem with this review?
wehcfkane
Adams, Massachusetts
1 review
1 helpful vote 1 helpful vote
'Not 100% perfect, but close'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 22, 2012
1
person found this review helpful

I sit at the desk in my room at the Inn on the last morning of my visit. It has been a great place. It has an old world charm that can't be beat and the friendly a knowledgeable staff are top notch. The hotel is obviously old, but it is well kept up. The place is in no way dingy.The place has a very European feel to it. For location you can't beat it, right near Union Square.So much is just a short walk and if you are going farther afield, you can catch the Cable Car on Powell not even a half block away or walk, (or take the Cable car) to the Powell Street turnaround and catch the Muni or Bart lines. Yes, some rooms are on the small side, like mine, and yes, my window view was a brick wall, but I was never kept awake by traffic or the sounds of the city and spent most of my time out and about so no real issue for me. No AC in the room, just heat, but there is a ceiling fan and on high, with the typical Bay Area Weather this was sufficient. Two minor things that were lacking. No coffee maker in the room, but coffee and tea are in the sitting area at the end of the hall towards the front of the building. The other minor issue is the ice machine, well, it is really just a small freezer on the 4th floor with an ice maker in it with a big container to catch the ice. Worked fine, but often the ice available was low due to the amount of time it took for the ice to build up in the catcher. I did not partake of the wine and cheese offerings in the evening, but I saw the spread and it is quite nice. All in all a great experience with only a couple of minor issues, but well woth the stay. Highly recommend the Inn At Union Square.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
Ask wehcfkane about The Inn at Union Square

We would definitely stay here again and recommend it to anyone looking for a boutique hotel.

Problem with this review?
SanDiegoDoc
San Diego
Contributor
12 reviews 12 reviews
Reviews in 8 cities Reviews in 8 cities
10 helpful votes 10 helpful votes
'Great little place - depending upon your room'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed May 18, 2012
7
people found this review helpful

What good is a review unless it gets down to specifics? With this in mind I hope readers find the following information useful.
1) This is a very small, homey hotel (~30 rooms) a half-block from Union square on Post St. A terrific location, and across the street from the Westin St. Francis - the other end of the hotel spectrum (ie very large, very pricey). Location is 5 Stars. Easy walk up the hill from the Bart with immediate access to public transportation.
2) Great staff - very responsive - very personal. 5 star attention
3) Rooms - here's where it gets dicey. It's a 6 story hotel with guest rooms on floors 2-6. XX1 rooms (ie 201, 301, etc) are adjacent to the stairs and next to each floor's small common area. Breakfast and the wine/cheese/fruit evening bonus are served in the common areas on the 3rd and 5th floors, with ice available on the 2nd and 4th floors. That said, I stayed in room 502. Had we not been early risers, the noise from the breakfast area probably would have been problematic. I can't imagine what it would be like in room 301 or 501. In addition, (assuming all XX2 rooms have the same layout as ours), room 502 is tiny. I mean really really small. The bathroom is closet sized and the shower enclosure would be literally too small for anyone larger than ~180 lbs to bathe in comfortably. My daughter stayed in 503 which was almost twice the size of 502, had a full sized bathroom w bathtub, yet cost 10$ less than ours. I would strongly recommend avoiding 301, 302, 501, and 502 when booking at the Inn. Honestly, they shouldn't charge the same amount for the XX2 rooms as they do for the full sized rooms down the hall. My daughter's room was 4 stars, and ours was 3.
4) Views - none. Nonexistent. Didn't bother us however if you want a view, stay elsewhere. 0 stars.
5) Breakfast - typical juice/sweet roll/fruit/cereal/bagel/hard boiled eggs continental fare. Nice to have. You're around the corner from Sears fine foods if you want a big pricey excellent breakfast. For us, what the Inn offered was more than sufficient - and since it's included in the room rate, a nice perk. 5 stars.
6) Wine/cheese in the evening. Again, very nice - social - and included in the room rate. We enjoyed it each nighht. 5 stars.
7) Finally - the rooms don't have air conditioning. This is generally not needed in San Fran - but on the other hand I don't know how comfortable the rooms would be during a heat wave. There are ceiling fans with multiple speed adjustments available.

Would we stay here again. Yes. Would I make sure to avoid the XX1 and XX2 rooms on the 3rd and 5th floors - absolutely!
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
Ask SanDiegoDoc about The Inn at Union Square
This review is the subjective opinion of a TripAdvisor member and not of TripAdvisor LLC.

'Excellent Service, Lovely Interior and Prime Location'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 15, 2012
2
people found this review helpful

Just got back from a whirlwind trip of California and must say that this hotel was one of the best we stayed at. Typically San Francisco interior, the staff were incredibly friendly, approachable and helpful. Special mention to Anne and Omar who would go above and beyond to ensure you have a great stay. They were also very informative about the San Fran area and recommended places to go and eat. The room was very spacious and comfortable. The location is also prime, being in the heart of San Fran just on the corner of Union Square. Do not have a bad word to say about the Inn, seriously consider staying here if you're visiting San Fran. Oh and don't forget the wine and cheese everyday at 5pm. Thanks for a great stay!

4 reviews 4 reviews

'Good hotel in a great location with excellent value'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed May 13, 2012

A good hotel in a great location with excellent value.

Location: Excellent, near the corner of Powell and Post

Staff: Genuinely friendly and helpful

Room: Was a little small and lacked good bathroom ventilation but otherwise was clean and nicely furnished.

Value: Outstanding. Ask for the AAA discount if you have a membership. Free breakfast with lots of fresh pastries, hard boiled eggs, fruit, yogurt, tea and coffee. Free wine tasting in the evening with lots of cheeses and grapes etc.

The wine tasting was a great way to socialize and meet other guests.

I would return to this hotel.
Less

Hotel was very clean and the maids came in DAILY and took our sheets off and replaced with new bedding everyday. Even folded the clothes we had laying on the bed very neatly. Very unexpected. Can be a little noisy at night but overall, if your wanting to splurge, come here! It's a wonderful experience... good staff.

Bryan D
Somis, California
1 review
1 helpful vote 1 helpful vote
'Worst Experience'
1 of 5 stars Reviewed May 26, 2012
1
person found this review helpful

My son and I have stayed at the four seasons in Dublin, Bev. Hills, Westlake, and others and I must say, our experience in San Francisco (May 25, 2012 - May 28, 2012) has been the worst! As usual, I arrived and ordered a drink. The bartender looked at me with a blank expression and was rude (never experienced this before at any four seasons). Second, they placed my son's bed under the air vent, and I awoke to my son being congested. Third, when I asked to upgrade because the room they selected for us was too small, they hiked the price of the junior suites by 20% (more than the advertised price on the net). Again, I stay at the four seasons a lot and was shocked at the rude and essentially poor standards of this hotel. I will never stay here again and in fact will be checking out and staying at the Ritz while we end our short vacation in San Francisco. I am truly dissapointed with this hotel.
Less

5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 18, 2012

person found this review helpful

First time staying at a Four seasons and e were not disappointed. We booked an Executive Suite which was massive wrapped around a corner of the building. The service at this hotel is excellent from pulling up in the taxi where they whisked our luggage straight up to our suite without asking our names (we had name tags on our bags). The luggage arrived before we did!
We ate breakfast each day in the restaurant and the choice and quality was very good.
The best thing was the quietness of the hotel, you could hear a pin drop in the corridors and in the room I have never slept so well in a city hotel.

Also, the Christmas holiday at the Four Seasons was wonderful; Christmas dinner was perfect!

mobert
los angeles
Contributor
19 reviews 19 reviews
Reviews in 15 cities Reviews in 15 cities
45 helpful votes 45 helpful votes
'A gem in the Four Seasons chain'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 15, 2012

We spent three wonderful nights at this hotel last February over President's Day weekend. This is an absolute gem in the Four Seasons chain and I believe it is without a doubt the finest hotel in the city of San Francisco. A beautiful property well located on Market Street less than a five minute walk to Union Square. The lobby and bar/restaurant areas are beautifully done in a rich wood finish, marble floors, and decorated with a gorgeous art collection. The rooms are spacious, serene, and relaxing with a wonderful window seat for lounging. And as an added bonus, guests are eligible to use the SportClub LA facilities free of charge. The service is truly special - when we checked in, the hotel upgraded us three room categories so we were on the top floor in a large room with a great view.
I highly recommend this hotel and look forward to returning. Thank you Four Seasons San Francisco for making our visit so special and memorable!
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
Ask mobert about Four Seasons Hotel San Francisco
This review is the subjective opinion of a TripAdvisor member and not of TripAdvisor LLC.

May 20, 2012

Doug Housley
General Manager Four Seasons Hotel San Francisco

Melanie_G10184
Durban, South Africa
Senior Contributor
23 reviews 23 reviews
Reviews in 11 cities Reviews in 11 cities
17 helpful votes 17 helpful votes
'Enjoyable stay'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed May 14, 2012

We had booked a deluxe room and upon entering were deeply disappointed at how small and gloomy the room looked (there was also a slight unpleasant odour in the room). I realised i would not be able to handle spending 4 nights there and called the front desk to find out if we could upgrade to a larger nicer room. They offered us an executive suite for $150 more per day which we accepted and they had the suite ready for us in about 45 minutes. It was definately worth it as the living room was large and the bedroom more spacious with better decor and a larger bathroom. The bathroom was not the nicest looking and had just the basics but the bedroom and living room was beautiful. I was very pleased and our stay there was quiet enjoyable. We had dinner at Seasons restaurant, it is a beautiful restaurant with excellent service. Although the prices are relatively high (around $50 for a steak without any side dishes), my husband and i both ordered the rib eye and it was undoubtedly the most delicious steak we had ever eaten! We decided we would have dinner there again 2 days later as the food was so good however when we called that evening for a reservation were told it was closed on a monday :( Valet parking was available which cost $58 per night plus tax which i thought was a rip off. The spa menu was very limited and we did not both with any treatments as the choices available did not sound very tempting. The levels of service we received were excellent and the rooms were very clean.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?

Doug Housley
General Manager Four Seasons Hotel San Francisco

'cradle of comfort'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 11, 2012
1
person found this review helpful

I can't compliment this management team enough; it is a wonderful business hotel. Everyone, from the front desk to the maids on the floor to the person who answers in room service is WELL trained, helpful and KNOWLEDGEABLE. These people don't make mistakes. The room was also beautifully designed and maintained and offered wonderful views. A little note, I happened to become sick soon after checking in. The concierge sent people to drug stores, grocery stores and somehow even found jello! If you want people who are going to care for you this is the place to stay.

If you are looking for very nice rooms and great service, Four Seasons, San Fransisco is the place to stay. Reviews in 4 cities Reviews in 4 cities

'Luxury!'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 26, 2012

We recently stayed 3 nights in an executive suite that we were upgraded to. It was great. Room service is very expensive but we tried breakfast one morning..(88.00) crazy, but it was GREAT. Hotel was very clean and the maids came in DAILY and took our sheets off and replaced with new bedding everyday. Even folded the clothes we had laying on the bed very neatly. Very unexpected. Can be a little noisy at night but overall, if your wanting to splurge, come here! It's a wonderful experience... good staff.
Less

Bryan D
Somis, California
1 review
1 helpful vote 1 helpful vote
'Worst Experience'
1 of 5 stars Reviewed May 26, 2012
1
person found this review helpful

My son and I have stayed at the four seasons in Dublin, Bev. Hills, Westlake, and others and I must say, our experience in San Francisco (May 25, 2012 - May 28, 2012) has been the worst! As usual, I arrived and ordered a drink. The bartender looked at me with a blank expression and was rude (never experienced this before at any four seasons). Second, they placed my son's bed under the air vent, and I awoke to my son being congested. Third, when I asked to upgrade because the room they selected for us was too small, they hiked the price of the junior suites by 20% (more than the advertised price on the net). Again, I stay at the four seasons a lot and was shocked at the rude and essentially poor standards of this hotel. I will never stay here again and in fact will be checking out and staying at the Ritz while we end our short vacation in San Francisco. I am truly dissapointed with this hotel.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes

Reviews in 3 cities Reviews in 3 cities
5 helpful votes 5 helpful votes
'Excellent Hotel'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 18, 2012
1
person found this review helpful

First time staying at a Four seasons and e were not disappointed. We booked an Executive Suite which was massive wrapped around a corner of the building. The service at this hotel is excellent from pulling up in the taxi where they whisked our luggage straight up to our suite without asking our names (we had name tags on our bags). The luggage arrived before we did!
We ate breakfast each day in the restaurant and the choice and quality was very good.
The best thing was the quietness of the hotel, you could hear a pin drop in the corridors and in the room I have never slept so well in a city hotel.
Less

mobert
los angeles
Contributor
19 reviews 19 reviews
Reviews in 15 cities Reviews in 15 cities
45 helpful votes 45 helpful votes
'A gem in the Four Seasons chain'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 15, 2012

We spent three wonderful nights at this hotel last February over President's Day weekend. This is an absolute gem in the Four Seasons chain and I believe it is without a doubt the finest hotel in the city of San Francisco. A beautiful property well located on Market Street less than a five minute walk to Union Square. The lobby and bar/restaurant areas are beautifully done in a rich wood finish, marble floors, and decorated with a gorgeous art collection. The rooms are spacious, serene, and relaxing with a wonderful window seat for lounging. And as an added bonus, guests are eligible to use the SportClub LA facilities free of charge. The service is truly special - when we checked in, the hotel upgraded us three room categories so we were on the top floor in a large room with a great view.
I highly recommend this hotel and look forward to returning. Thank you Four Seasons San Francisco for making our visit so special and memorable!
Less

Melanie_G10184
Durban, South Africa
Senior Contributor
23 reviews 23 reviews
Reviews in 11 cities Reviews in 11 cities
17 helpful votes 17 helpful votes
'Enjoyable stay'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed May 14, 2012

We had booked a deluxe room and upon entering were deeply disappointed at how small and gloomy the room looked (there was also a slight unpleasant odour in the room). I realised i would not be able to handle spending 4 nights there and called the front desk to find out if we could upgrade to a larger nicer room. They offered us an executive suite for $150 more per day which we accepted and they had the suite ready for us in about 45 minutes. It was definately worth it as the living room was large and the bedroom more spacious with better decor and a larger bathroom. The bathroom was not the nicest looking and had just the basics but the bedroom and living room was beautiful. I was very pleased and our stay there was quiet enjoyable. We had dinner at Seasons restaurant, it is a beautiful restaurant with excellent service. Although the prices are relatively high (around $50 for a steak without any side dishes), my husband and i both ordered the rib eye and it was undoubtedly the most delicious steak we had ever eaten! We decided we would have dinner there again 2 days later as the food was so good however when we called that evening for a reservation were told it was closed on a monday :( Valet parking was available which cost $58 per night plus tax which i thought was a rip off. The spa menu was very limited and we did not both with any treatments as the choices available did not sound very tempting. The levels of service we received were excellent and the rooms were very clean.
Less

Permanenthoneymoon

Reviews in 8 cities Reviews in 8 cities
'Ideally situated and an excellent stay'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 5, 2012 NEW

My husband and I arrived at this hotel on the 18th May 2012 and immediately were made to feel most welcome. A warm atmosphere with very informative desk staff. The bell boy gave us an amazing amount of information including the lowdown on the Bay to Breaker run which was taking place during our stay and turned out to be great fun.The free wine tasting hour from 5pm was another added touch enabling you to meet other guests and obtain some wine knowledge at the same time in the warm atmosphere of the lounge with a welcoming open fire.
We had a beautiful room overlooking Alcatraz and the location of the hotel is perfectly situated for the city tour bus just round the corner. The hotel has an excellent restaurant on site which serves a mean chowder which was the best we ever had.All needs were catered for in the rooms e.g.coffe machine,dressing gowns,iron and board etc.We couldn't fault this hotel for anything.We notified the hotel that this was our silver wedding anniversary trip although the actual anniversary date wasn't in San Francisco but Yosemite where we travelled on to and Iris the concierge still had a bottle of bubbly and Giradelli chocolate left in our room with a card.
Less

mombatDallas
