46 reviews 46 reviews
Reviews in 21 cities Reviews in 21 cities
13 helpful votes 13 helpful votes
'Absolute perfection on Fisherman's Wharf'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 4, 2012 NEW
2
people found this review helpful

We have been to San Francisco several times. The stay at the Argonaut was heavenly, by far the best experience I have had on Fisherman's Wharf. Friendly bellmen who while being extremely efficient and helpful, are also mischievous and funny! Check in was great, friendly smiling faces. Gorgeous lobby, wine reception at 5:00 every evening. Adjoining on one side is a fantastic maritime history museum, for free, and on the other side, a wine tasting bar! For big kids and little kids. The decor is adorable, nautical theme. Heavenly beds, so comfortable, and the room is almost eerily quiet, or you can crank out the window and hear the sounds of the wharf. From our room facing the Cannery, we could hear a guy playing jazz music on the corner. Wonderful time, hated to leave!
Less

JDBaiocco
Idaho Falls, Idaho
Contributor
15 reviews 15 reviews
Reviews in 8 cities Reviews in 8 cities
8 helpful votes 8 helpful votes
'Good Location, Fair Accomodations'
3 of 5 stars Reviewed June 4, 2012 NEW via mobile
1
person found this review helpful

The best thing going for this hotel is the location. We flew into SF for a weekend getaway, so with only 2 full days to see the city we wanted to be in the best possible spot. I say this is a good spot because you can catch the trolley nearby as well as one of open top bus tours around the corner so that makes it convenient. The hotel can charge twice what you'd pay elsewhere due to its location. The room itself was clean but quite narrow and small. And if you're unwilling to pay a king's ransom for a bay view, you get to look out your window at the other hotel windows facing you. The staff was courteous, but not overly so. The concierge we dealt with Kathy was very nice and efficient but what I'd expect from a hotel of this stature. I will be going back to SF in the near future for another long weekend but I'll probably skip the Argonaut now that I'm familiar with the layout of downtown SF. Not really worth the price if you don't care about staying so close to Fisherman's Wharf. I prefer getting off the beaten path anyway.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
See 3 more reviews by JDBaiocco for San Francisco
Ask JDBaiocco about Argonaut Hotel - a Kimpton Hotel
This review is the subjective opinion of a TripAdvisor member and not of TripAdvisor LLC.
David von Winckler, General Manager at Argonaut Hotel - a Kimpton Hotel, responded to this review
June 5, 2012
JDBaiocco,
Thanks much for your honest feedback! Our location is certainly one we are proud of  being nestled within the historic Cannery Building facing the San Francisco Bay and Golden Gate Bridge. You are right, our view rooms are quite popular, but please note, we always have special promotions running that get you that view at a great deal! Please do not hesitate to reach out next time you are coming into town, I would be more than happy to let you know of the best deals available, and make sure you get that view you want.

Cheers!
Report response as inappropriate
This response is the subjective opinion of the management representative and not of TripAdvisor LLC.

I would thoroughly recommend a stay here and try & catch up with Ernie who has immense knowledge of San Francisco in general.

RubiesTorbayDevon
Paignton, United Kingdom
Senior Contributor
30 reviews 30 reviews
Reviews in 21 cities Reviews in 21 cities
15 helpful votes 15 helpful votes
'Wonderful Hotel'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 3, 2012 NEW
1
person found this review helpful

This was our first visit to USA and this hotel was our first stop on the start of our journey around CA, AZ, and Nevada. The location is superb just around the corner from the cable cars and just a few blocks from the trams and hop on hop off buses. Across the road from The Ghirardelli Park, and opposite the Pier. The staff at this hotel are really helpful, friendly and efficient. The hotel is very clean comfortable with great decor. Our room was spacious with lovely touches of amenities, If you needed anything i.e. one day I required a mending kit to sew on a button I lost and within minutes one was brought to the room. The breakfast was good, we only ate once in the evening but this was also good. In the evening around 5pm there was a wine tasting reception, a lovely touch where one could chat to the other guest. If I had to fault this hotel it would only be that the bar closed early about 9.30pm, however there were plenty of bars near by to go to. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

    *
    *

Less

Problem with this review?
electronicpaper
Edmonton, Canada
Contributor
16 reviews 16 reviews
Reviews in 15 cities Reviews in 15 cities
17 helpful votes 17 helpful votes
'Excellent Sangria, Pricey Socks'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed June 2, 2012 NEW
1
person found this review helpful

Pleasant stay, comfortable and clean boutique hotel with a maritime theme. We thought the "brick-like" faade gave it a historic and distinguished look. The tour guide told us that it was built from bricks recovered after the 1906 earthquake and fire. Truth or legend, it is a nice story. The wine tasting hour was a nice touch and the sangria excellent.

There were fluffy socks and cute animal print robes in the closet. Having enjoyed complimentary socks and slippers at prime hotels before, we grabbed them and used them without thinking twice and missed the note that they were not free. For a luxury hotel, that was quite a surprise that we learned the hard way with a hefty charge on the credit card after departure. Pricey socks, but probably fit for a hotel that charges $46 nightly for parking. Another interesting detail was that the Kimpton loyalty profile was not linked to the reservation, so nobody knew about our guest preferences.

Room was big and nicely decorated, we liked the star-shaped pillows. Since the hotel was close to the waterfront, we were able to watch the 75th Golden Gate anniversary fireworks from right outside the hotel.

    *

Less
Was this review helpful? Yes

See 2 more reviews by bagpiper55 for San Francisco
bagpiper55
katy, tx
Reviewer
5 reviews 5 reviews
Reviews in 2 cities Reviews in 2 cities
2 helpful votes 2 helpful votes
'Great stay'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 2, 2012 NEW
1
person found this review helpful

We recently stayed at the Argonaut and loved the hotel. Everyone was extremely friendly and helpful and, while we weren't able to take our four-legged family member, we certainly enjoyed getting to meet all of the other well-behaved four-legged guests. The little chalk board near the entrance with their names on it was a cute touch, too. But, back to human matters. Since no one, or no place, is perfect, there are 2 minor criticisms. First, I'm not sure if we were in a handicapped room (there were grab rails all along the walls near the toilet), but there was no counter space in the bathroom. We had a pedestal type sink with a very small table next to it that held the soap, glasses, etc. leaving no room for personal stuff. The second complaint was that the air conditioner really didn't work very well. We were able to open our window to the cold SF air, but it was very noisy outside making it difficult to sleep, and there wasn't much of a breeze coming in because of the direction we faced. Minor issues that did not ruin our stay at the hotel.

While I would definitely recommend the hotel to others (we did and, in fact, one of our friends stayed there the week after we did based on my TripAdvisor research), we won't be staying in the area again - a bit too crowded and touristy. We saw several other Kimpton hotels in SF though that we would love to stay at next time.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes

Very close to Fisherman's Wharf, Golden Gate park, Muir Woods and Alcatraz and approx. 3 hrs from Yosemite National Park. There is also a great view from the roof. There are many great... More
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
Lynn F
Williamstown, New Jersey
2 reviews
Reviews in 2 cities Reviews in 2 cities
6 helpful votes 6 helpful votes
'Great place just a little noisy'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 5, 2012 NEW

We enjoyed our stay at The Suites at Fisherman's Wharf. Units were very clean with modern furnishings. Clean towels everyday was a great plus for a timeshare. Very close to Fisherman's Wharf, Golden Gate park, Muir Woods and Alcatraz and approx. 3 hrs from Yosemite National Park. There is also a great view from the roof. There are many great restaurants within walking distance or buy a Muni pass which you can use on the cable, trolley and buses to get around town. The staff was great. We had a clogged sink one night but it was quickly taken care of. My only complaint was it was a little noisy. Our bedroom wall backed up to the atrium/lobby where you could hear every word that was said outside. You could also hear noise from the other units and I understand that's because it's an older building. It also takes you a few nights to get used to the cable car noise because The Suites are located right on the Powell Hyde Cable Car route. Also if you are going to buy any groceries and carry them back to your unit remember the steep inclines of the streets. Over all we enjoyed our stay and would definitely recommend The Suites!
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
Ask Lynn F about Suites at Fisherman's Wharf

Valafly
Mkt Harborough. England
Senior Reviewer
7 reviews 7 reviews
Reviews in 7 cities Reviews in 7 cities
7 helpful votes 7 helpful votes
'Comfortable, spacious accommodation!'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 3, 2012 NEW
1
person found this review helpful

We stayed at The Suites for 3 nights and could not fault the experience. Very easy to find and in an excellent location for Fisherman's Wharf attractions and restaurants. Also within close proximity for trams, trolleys and bus stops. The staff are very helpful and check in with Jason was quick and efficient. Before arrival, I requested a room on the third floor and were given Room 306. It was quiet and we didn't find the traffic noise a problem at all, and I am a very light sleeper. This is a time share property and so the rooms were a very good size and very clean. The furniture and fittings were of good quality with two flat screen TV's. The king-size bed was very comfortable with nice white bed linen. There is a good little grocery store just two blocks away. You can park your car in the garage underneath the hotel which is very convenient and we didn't have a problem getting in and out of the car park. Overall we were very impressed with The Suites at Fisherman's Wharf and would definately stay there again. Great value for money!
Less

'Great place to stay in San Fran'

Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
Carmania
Melbourne
Contributor
13 reviews 13 reviews
Reviews in 5 cities Reviews in 5 cities
11 helpful votes 11 helpful votes
'Great place to stay in San Fran'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 2, 2012 NEW

Had seen the photos of the view looking down onto Hyde St and out to the bay on Trip Advisor and we were lucky enough to score this room on the corner of the building with the fantastic view.
Was worried about the possible noise from the underground cable car mechanical stuff and sure, it is a constant noise you will hear till 1am (it's pretty much right on the dot when they turn it off) but for the view we had, it was totally worth it and hardly bothered us.

Balcony but no ash tray so a plastic coke bottle fixed that. However be very careful when out there - we got locked out one night with no phone! We were lucky that the concierge out front the super-swish restaurant across the road heard us calling out and notified the hotel staff, who came up to save us. Keep an eye out for all the luxury cars like Aston Martins, Maseratis etc. parked out front of that restaurant - for car lovers like us it was a total drool fest at night.

The staff were super-friendly, bended over backwards to help us and they even have this tic-tac-toe game going on between them and the visitors (you get a souvenir or little prize if you finish the board but we gave up after a few days - we had better things to do in this beautiful city!)
The bed was awesome, facilities superb and we even ate in a couple of nights. Not sure why a few reviews said this place was dated...
The best thing is it is so close to Fisherman's Wharf. Short walk (downhill thank goodness) to the cable car and Fisherman's Wharf, a bit of a longer walk to the shops, and the cable car/buses gets you to wherever else you want to go. The walk to get the ferry to Alcatraz is a nice long stroll down the wharf's main drag.
We will definitely stay at this hotel again when we return to San Fran.

    *
    *
    *
    *

Adrienna M
ventura
1 review
6 helpful votes 6 helpful votes
'March 2012'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 29, 2012
6
people found this review helpful

We went up for the weekend for a family wedding. The wedding party had reserved hotel rooms at another location at a discounted price. We decided to try Suites because it was in our timeshare group. We were not disapointed. It was very close to were the wedding was taking place, but also in a centralized location. Close to the pier, cable cars and Ghiradelli Square, just to name a few. Makeing the reservations were a breeze. Check in was quick. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The suites were a nice size and very clean and comfortable. Modern furnishings. The elevators were small, but had a beautiful wide staircase which I chose to take. We have a large truck, and the parking spaces were a little small, but we got in and out ok. I would definatly stay here again. I don't really remember if it was noisy or not, so I guess it couldn't have been that bad. I would reccomend this place without a doubt.
Less

'Great time'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed May 17, 2012 via mobile
5
people found this review helpful

After reading the reviews, even the ones about the street noise, we decided to book. Well, we were not disappointed. Suite was very spacious and clean. We were on the first floor on the corner of two streets and yes we had street noise. However, it does quite down and as we are early risers, we were awake as the street cars started. To us the noise wasn't an issue as we wanted to experience S.F. and we did. This hotel is in a wonderful location and soon we were hopping on and off of streetcars and trams. Would we stay here again? YES. This was our first time here and to California and we loved it.

'Location, location, location'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 13, 2012
4
people found this review helpful

Was an awesome place to stay! Walking distance to cable cars, great restaurants, bike rentals, grocery shopping, buses and lots of attractions to see. Safe area to walk at night. We stayed in room 305. Plenty of room and clean!! Miquel and Jason at the front desk were wonderful (I can't remember everyone's name, but they were all friendly). Great customer service! They suggested places to see and told us how to get there. The parking was no problem at all. Very reasonable for SF.

Rooftop view was amazing. A little chilly at night, so wear a sweater or jacket.

Cable cars start at 8:00 am. It was fun to hear the bells.

Will definately go back and stay here again.

Loved San Francisco!!

See 2 more reviews by westcoastim for San Francisco
westcoastim
SoCal
Senior Contributor
21 reviews 21 reviews
Reviews in 14 cities Reviews in 14 cities
51 helpful votes 51 helpful votes
'Great location- Big room!'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed May 12, 2012
2
people found this review helpful

Great find in Fisherman's Wharf area!

Pros:
Great location. Close to cable car stop, bike rental, restaurants, cupcake shop!
The room was awesome. Large suite which was HUGE, especially for SF standards!
The room was clean with a full kitchen and separate living room and bedroom with two large flat screen TVs and DVD player.
They have a parking garage under the hotel for $22.80 a day.
Friendly staff (most of them).
Good price for the size room and location. We paid $139 per night!
Nice rooftop deck with great views.

Cons:
I requested the third floor but ended up getting the first floor.
It sounded like the people were jumping around in the room above us. That was annoying. The courtyard can be loud and echo-y in your room if you have the windows open.
No A/C. I think it would get pretty warm in the summertime. Not a lot of airflow on the bottom floor because the inside widows open to the courtyard.
The windows have no screens on them. Kinda weird.
The parking garage is tiny and a parking spot is not guaranteed until you get there and check in. You have to leave your keys with the front desk anytime you are parked in there. Not a big deal because they are open 24 hours but it is a hassle when you are leaving and they are helping a customer check in. You have to stand there for a long time just to get your keys. Finally I had to start being rude and interrupting and asking for my keys. The process was annoying but I guess the garage is so small that they need your keys in case they need to move your car to get into a storage closet or something in the garage.

All in all we really liked this place and would definitely go back. Next time I would just hope to get the 3rd floor. I think that would make a big difference!!

    *
    *
    *
    *

Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?

White Swan Inn, a Joie de Vivre Hotel

'A quiet oasis in San Francisco'

I would easily give this a five star if only they would upgrade some furniture. The location is terrific, our room was so charming I was ready to move in! We had room 26 which was in the back of the hotel and very, very quiet. It was a large room with a beautiful gas fireplace (with a convenient switch... More
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
jandn
Missoula, Montana
Senior Contributor
27 reviews 27 reviews
Reviews in 21 cities Reviews in 21 cities
28 helpful votes 28 helpful votes
'A quiet oasis in San Francisco'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed June 5, 2012 NEW

I would easily give this a five star if only they would upgrade some furniture. The location is terrific, our room was so charming I was ready to move in! We had room 26 which was in the back of the hotel and very, very quiet. It was a large room with a beautiful gas fireplace (with a convenient switch at bedside!) The breakfasts are wonderful. We stayed here 3 nights, giving you a substantial discount) and every morning the hot buffet-style breakfasts were varied with an egg dish every morning and a different serving of meat (suasage, bacon). They also provide a complete array of pastries, croissants, oatmeal, etc. They do not skimp. They also have homemade cookies AND wonderful appetizers and good wine in the evening. Hot coffee and tea all day long. The public area for breakfast and evening appetizers/wine are wonderful with fireplaces, den-like atmosphere. BUT, again, the furniture is old and seats broken down. The small sofa our bedroom was a sleeper couch and very uncomfortable to sit on. The bathrooms are small but adequate. Very friendly staff.
A very minor point: one morning it was raining so we decided to use their fitness equipment consisting of a bicycle and treadmill. I think the treadmill was the first one made and you could not hear yourself over its noise which was okay since the TV wasn't working either. But in San Fran, you really don't need a fitness room!
One block away on Powell St. is a very good, very busy Italian restaurant called Uncle Vito's Good pizza and pasta with a very brisk take-out service. It's obvious that the locals love it. Don't expect atmosphere, just great food at a very reasonable price.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes

'Charming hotel'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 4, 2012 NEW

Room: Very nicely decorated. Definitely has a soul. Also large and comfortable with decent sun light.
Internet: I have had pretty good luck except during prime time (9pm to 11pm) when the speed slow down.
Valet parking: I am glad they offer it. But the parking lot must be far since we were 6-7 cars waiting for them in the morning. It took me over 45 minutes to get to my car.
Breakfast: It was included in the room price and was pretty good.
Free cakes, scones and cookies in the evening: Delicious. I was on a diet but couldn't stop eating them.

redheadca
Menlo Park, CA
Top Contributor
72 reviews 72 reviews
Reviews in 45 cities Reviews in 45 cities
194 helpful votes 194 helpful votes
'Great location and little extras'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed May 27, 2012 via mobile

Located a short walk from Union Square we stayed one night of Memorial weekend. We booked direct and they upgraded our room from a queen to a king. We were on the fourth floor right over the street. Yes, there was traffic noise, but it was pretty quiet by midnight. The have a wine hour that we missed, but we did have the complementary breakfast. Not just dry rolls and cereal, they served scrambled eggs, sausage, potatoes and excellent quality coffee. the king room was very large and comfy, but the room did get pretty warm in the middle of the night. We live in the bay area, but when we have a late night and don't want to drive home, we will definitely consider the White Swan or another of the Joie de Vivre hotels.
Less

JackandDebbie27
Burnaby, Canada
Contributor
15 reviews 15 reviews
Reviews in 8 cities Reviews in 8 cities
17 helpful votes 17 helpful votes
'Three Cheers for the White Swan Inn'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 21, 2012

Close to welcome Cable cars, essential public transport and charming eateries, the White Swan Inn proved a safe, secure, first-class choice for our week-long stay in San Francisco. Our room was large, comfortable, tastefully-decorated and featured a corner fireplace that proved cosy on more than one cool night. Staff were friendly, informative, prompt and attentive. Breakfasts were home-made, hearty and taken in a bright, cheerful dining area that was conducive to meeting and talking with other guests. Likewise, the inn provided a charming late afternoon opportunity to enjoy sweet and savory nibblies, a glass or two of good local red and white wines and a comfortable place to relax and reflect. We enjoyed a wonderful time at the White Swan Inn; it was our San Francisco home away from home.
Less

Problem with this review?
See 12 more reviews by cathaleen for San Francisco
cathaleen
Prince George, Canada
Senior Contributor
45 reviews 45 reviews
Reviews in 21 cities Reviews in 21 cities
10 helpful votes 10 helpful votes
'Lovely stay, would return'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 12, 2012
1
person found this review helpful

We recently stayed at the White Swan, and had a lovely stay. The hotel is close to Union square and Powell street, but just removed far enough from the noise and the bustle of the area. Also convenient walk to trolleys, buses, BART, and cable cars and the travel info center at Market and Powell. Our room was quiet at night, we heard no street noise at all which was great. It is an older hotel, but it is in excellent condition, our room was lovely in size and an excellent price for all that is offered. ( The one thing about an older hotel, I have never had a shower with as much water pressure, it was amazing - no low flow showers/water conservation here)

It was lovely having the bonus fridge in the room and the complimentary beverages of bottled water and pops. The breakfasts were much more then I expected, I was expecting more a continental cold breakfast, but every morning there was an egg dish, some type of sausages, fresh fruit and also some pastries and very good coffee. It was excellent. WE only attended on of the dinner time wine tastings, and we arrived a little late so there was only red wine, left, and weren't hungry, but there was very reasonable appearing food options even for this event. Some guests in the building came down after us and were very whiny about the no white wine left, but they arrived late, it was nearly over, and if you need wine so much go and buy some across the street at the market there. Also very good daily cookie treats in the lobby.

We arrived later then expected when we got to San Francisco, so it was around 10 pm before we got to the hotel and to go eat. The front desk offered us a list of recommended eateries in the area, which we did use during our stay, and enjoyed all that we tried.

I would not hesitate to recommend staying here and hope you have as lovely a time as we did.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
See 12 more reviews by cathaleen for San Francisco
Ask cathaleen about White Swan Inn, a Joie de Vivre Hotel
This review is the subjective opinion of a TripAdvisor member and not of TripAdvisor LLC.

62 helpful votes 62 helpful votes
'Mixed feelings'
3 of 5 stars Reviewed June 5, 2012 NEW

Pros: Large comfortable room, good bed, mini kitchenette, great location, evening turndown service, free wifi, coffee and tea in The Club on the top floor, nice staff.

Cons: First night (Sat. night/Sun. morning) had a lot of noise even though we were given a "quiet room." Revelers from Ruby Skye Club at 2:00 a.m. and union protesters at 7:00 a.m. for an hour on a bullhorn. (To be fair, there was no noise for the next 2 nights of our stay.) Toilet was continuously backed up. We asked maintenance to come on 3 different occasions (which they did) and then we just gave up because it was never fixed satisfactorily.

To sum up, would probably try a different hotel on a future visit.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
Ask mckinfam about The Donatello Hotel
This review is the subjective opinion of a TripAdvisor member and not of TripAdvisor LLC.

'Great hotel in good location'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 5, 2012 NEW

We thoroughly enjoyed our 4 night stay at the Donatello hotel.
We had read the reviews and were hopeful that it would be good but it exceeded our expectations.
It is in Post Street very close to Union Square which makes everything very accessible.
We were on the 14th floor in a nice modern room.
There is quality nightly entertainment in the bar/casual dining area.
The staff were all very good and attentive
Yes,it would be nice to have a breakfast facility but given the location yiou are spoilt for options elsewhere.
We would deffinately stay here again if we are lucky enough to return to SF

Problem with this review?
krisca2
2 reviews
1 helpful vote 1 helpful vote
'VERY accommodating, great location!'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 3, 2012 NEW via mobile
1
person found this review helpful

First visit to San Francisco with three friends, when at the last minute another friend decided to join. So we had five girls (ages 24-26) with six nights of luggage and one hotel room. Before booking a second room, we decided to check out the room we had already booked. To our surprise, space was not going to be an issue. The rooms were very spacious, as was the bathroom. The inroom nook with a mini fridge, counter, sink and microwave was also a bonus. The hotel is a short walk to all the shopping at Union Square. Also, transportation is very accessible from this hotel location. Picking up the F line on the train, or the Powell-Mason or Powell-Hyde cable car will quickly get you down to Fisherman's Wharf and the rest of the pier where you can take the cruise to Alcatraz, rent a bike to cross the Golden Gate or just take in the beautiful scenery. We had an awesome trip, and it all started with the Donatello!!! Thanks again!
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
Ask krisca2 about The Donatello Hotel
This review is the subjective opinion of a TripAdvisor member and not of TripAdvisor LLC.

Problem with this review?
CarmenWBendigo
Bendigo, Australia
Senior Reviewer
8 reviews 8 reviews
Reviews in 7 cities Reviews in 7 cities
9 helpful votes 9 helpful votes
'Great stay'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 29, 2012

We were very happy with our choice of the Donatello Hotel. The location was perfect for everything we wanted to see and access to public transport was quick and easy. Access to Union Square, cable cars, etc was perfect.

Valet parking (although on the expensive side) was quick and friendly as were all the hotel staff we encountered.

The rooms were very spacious and clean with a refrigerator and microwave available. Bathroom was also large and well set out for our needs.

The only complaint I would have is that street noise does travel up to the room and sirens are very common during the night!! This is not really the hotels fault and you have to expect some level of street noise when you are in a big city.

All in all, we had a fantastic 3 night stay. We would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone and hope to come back at some stage.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
Ask CarmenWBendigo about The Donatello Hotel
This review is the subjective opinion of a TripAdvisor member and not of TripAdvisor LLC.

Problem with this review?
JustMB
Leeds, United Kingdom
Contributor
11 reviews 11 reviews
Reviews in 9 cities Reviews in 9 cities
5 helpful votes 5 helpful votes
'Stay here when on lay-over. Great hotel'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed June 5, 2012 NEW

We really liked this place. There are a few really nice touches such as Managers reception in the evening with complimentary drinks and complimentary breakfast (omelettes made to order also included).
Our room was on the 8th floor facing the airport and you could hear some of the noise of the airport, although nothing to keep you awake. There was also a constant noise from what I think might have been the air condition unit in the roof, again it wasn't loud enough to keep us from sleeping. The beds were comfortable and the whole place was clean.
Staff were very friendly and helpful. Internet is $10 per day and reasonably fast. Parking is $22 for the night although you can leave the car just outside on the street which is ok to do from 10pm to 10am (2 hour parking limit is in place from midnight until 8 am).
I could imagine that this is a good place to stay with family and kids as the rooms are a really good size and have two TVs.
Stay here - you can't go wrong.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?

baliliving
Sydney, Australia
Senior Contributor
28 reviews 28 reviews
Reviews in 21 cities Reviews in 21 cities
52 helpful votes 52 helpful votes
'Good stay'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed June 2, 2012 NEW

Stayed here May 30 following a flight from Australia and in transit until the next day.

The free shuttle service from LAX was on time and later (on our return to LAX) found to be very frequent. We checked-in early morning, well before published available time. We were greeted by a friendly receptionist who advised us that our room was ready.
In fact, all the staff should be recommended for their friendliness.

The room was comfortable and large with the only downside being that as a light sleeper I could hear the planes landing throughout the night. My wife however had no such problem. My issue was easily overcome as I moved into the lounge area of our room where waiting was a very comfortable fold out sofa bed. A quick close of the adjoining door and I was asleep pretty quickly.

The Embassy Suites offered a two hour manager's cocktail time from 5.30 to 7.30pm, and free cooked breakfast the next morning. A real bonus on both counts.

We had dinner in their restaurant and found the food quality and service to be very good.

We'd happily stay here again and will do so at the end of June.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes

aloe4
Texas
Senior Reviewer
6 reviews 6 reviews
Reviews in 6 cities Reviews in 6 cities
1 helpful vote 1 helpful vote
'Great Accomodations'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 31, 2012 NEW

Our stay at the Embassy North LAX location was a great one. We arrived a little early (before check-in time) and were advised that our assigned room was not ready and that we could leave our bags. When we returned at check-in time, I confirmed that we were assigned a quiet room due to traveling with our toddler. The nice desk clerk confirmed that we were on the 4th floor on the quieter side. However, she was reminded of a wedding reception that was taking place on that night and wanted to make things better for us. She upgraded us to a PURE room on the 7th floor that would not only ensure peace, but also a reduced allergen stay in our room. This would much appreciated as I'd been wanting a PURE experience so that I could decide if it would be something I'd pay for.....and I must say that those chances are probably greater now. The room was clean and spacious, which is so helpful when traveling with kid(s) so that they can move around and not be cramped. Breakfast at Embassy is always greatly appreciated as well. We had some extremely nice wait staff members who made sure we were well taken care of each morning. We were glad to give them a nice tip at the end of our stay.

Overall, great stay and highly advised!
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes

PegTraveller
Winnipeg, Manitoba
Senior Contributor
22 reviews 22 reviews
Reviews in 15 cities Reviews in 15 cities
45 helpful votes 45 helpful votes
'Wonderful Hotel with great perks!'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed May 30, 2012 NEW

Stayed 2 nights on the way home from New Zealand and glad we made the choice we did. Good location next to the airport but fairly limited in the dining choices within walking distance. Rooms were clean, well laid out and well appointed. Manager's party from 5:30 to 7:30 was great as was the complimentary made to order breakfast buffet the next morning. All this certainly adds to the excellent value the hotel provides. The complimentary airport shuttle really doesn't leave every 15-20 minutes but more like every 30 minutes so beware of the time you give yourself. That being said, the shuttle drivers were courteous and friendly.

The reason they are getting a four out of five is a result of the street noise and single pane sliding patio doors that did little to keep the noise of planes, idling buses, roaring motorcycles and partying in nearby rooms (with their patio doors ajar) from entering ours. It often sounded as if there was nothing between us and the street and save for our trusty earplugs, we may have never got a wink of sleep. Perhaps other rooms that face different parts of the block are quieter so if possible, ask for ones that do not face the street.

Would recommend and would return. Front desk staff are excellent and ready to please. Overall, very happy with the choice.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
Ask PegTraveller about Embassy Suites LAX North

You can definitely request a different side of the hotel during your next stay and we will do our best to accommodate you. We look forward to seeing you again soon!

Sterster
Bucks County, PA
Senior Reviewer
7 reviews 7 reviews
Reviews in 6 cities Reviews in 6 cities
91 helpful votes 91 helpful votes
'Top notch accomodations'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 20, 2012
2
people found this review helpful

My wife and I stayed for a total of two nights  one right before a flight to Hawaii and one right after a flight to Hawaii. The front desk staff was friendly and answered any questions we had. The complementary breakfast was great. Plenty of hot and cold food and fruit to choose from, including Starbucks coffee. One of the nice kitchen waiters there even made us fresh pancakes to order and they were delicious! The rooms are clean and very nice with a separate living room and bedroom  each with its own TV. The bed was great  nice clean, fluffy comforter and four pillows to choose from. There is also a small office off of the lobby with free internet access and a printer if you need it. It is located only five or ten minutes away from the airport and the shuttle (which they share with the Hilton) comes every 15-20 minutes. I would definitely stay there again.
Less

It would seem someone would be in charge!! Even if you have a non-working shower/tub, you will be left in that room--"waiting" on a call from management, that will never come. There is a great Marriott a few blocks down-- spend a few more dollars and experience luxury!! After being a Hilton Honors member for 15 years- this experience has forever changed my loyalty!
Less

joyride64
Goleta, California
Senior Reviewer
8 reviews 8 reviews
Reviews in 5 cities Reviews in 5 cities
9 helpful votes 9 helpful votes
'The Good, and the Not So Good'
3 of 5 stars Reviewed May 15, 2012
1
person found this review helpful

I have stayed at this hotel several times in the last few years and have always been very satisfied, to the point of recommending it to others. My last visit changed that. Though I might still stay here (even knowing what I know), my recent experience has now made me cautious. First, the good from previous visits: decent rate; underground parking; airport shuttle; very good sized rooms and bathroom; indoor pool; breakfast included; and a happy hour. Now the bad from my last stay: we were not given the room that I requested (2Q), but given a king room with a sofa bed. Not our preference for our two kids, but we made do by asking for a rollaway to be brought up to the room. Problem was, neither the sofa bed nor the rollaway were made. I called the front desk to have them made up while we were out to dinner. Upon our return, nothing had been done, so I called again. A very nice person from housekeeping came up right away, but seemed confused that I would want the beds made with sheets and a blanket. I got the feeling that he thought I was supposed to make them up myself - uh, no, I don't think so. After that was absolutely the most terrible night's sleep because - and this is the most important thing you need to know about this hotel - our room had a sliding glass door that was not double-paned so no soundproofing NEXT TO LAX. Trust me, you need soundproofing here. I heard every airplane, truck and car that was anywhere near the airport. Just awful. No sleep was to be had that night at all. So, if you stay at this hotel, be sure to get a room on the side street with windows, not a sliding glass door. Previous stays we didn't hear the noise because we were on the quieter street side. Makes a HUGE difference. I was very disappointed that I was not given a better room since I had made it clear that I was a returning guest. I am very surprised that when the hotel renovated last year that their first priority wasn't to make all their rooms quiet. I live in an airport flight path and double-paned windows and doors are a must. Other minor complaints, the pool was way over chlorinated to the point that my teenage children said their eyes were burning; and the front desk was a bit disorganized, or perhaps just understaffed. I will probably give this hotel another chance if I happen to stay in the area again, but only if I am guaranteed that I will receive a room on the quiet side.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
Ask joyride64 about Embassy Suites LAX North
This review is the subjective opinion of a TripAdvisor member and not of TripAdvisor LLC.

May 16, 2012
Thank you for your time in posting your comments, and we appreciate your continued loyalty. I apologize for the issues you faced during your stay with us, and we've passed your comments along to our staff to insure this doesn't happen again. When you make your next reservation, give us a call and we'll do what we can to place you on your requested side of the hotel. We hope to see you here again soon!

funnyjoni
Las Vegas, Nevada
Senior Reviewer
6 reviews 6 reviews
Reviews in 3 cities Reviews in 3 cities
'Just Okay & Overpriced'
3 of 5 stars Reviewed May 30, 2012 NEW

This was a nice visit but started shaky.

We payed full retail at $199 per night so you would think they would take care of us.

FORGET EARLY CHECK-IN: We took Amtrak from Seattle so after a 21 hour train ride we arrived at the hotel at 10:00 am with our luggage. They told us they would try to accommodate with an early check-in, all we needed to do is leave our bags with the bell captain and they will call us as soon as they have a clean room. We were told that there were a lot of people leaving that morning since we checked in on Memorial Day and most were checking out after spending the long weekend there. They finally called us with our room AT 4:00 PM, it's hard to believe they didn't have one clean room until 4:00 (the normal check-in time). I think it's because my husband didn't tip the woman at the desk that said she would call.
LOST LUGGAGE: When we did get in our room they couldn't find our luggage, apparently it was put into another room earlier in the day.
STEAKHOUSE: Was closed for Memorial Day, a little disappointing but understandable so we ate at Morton's Steakhouse and it was delicious.
BREAKFAST: The breakfast the next morning was nice but not worth he extra money to stay here since there are nicer less expensive hotel options.
Less

'Steak is Great'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 26, 2012

The Leatherneck Steakhouse is a wonderful yet intimate place. The steaks were as good as Ruth Chris,the servers were attentive and friendly, and the view of Downtown with a faraway view of the Bay was fabulous. The prices are also reasonable for this type of place. We ate here twice and the steaks melt in your mouth. Had a side for two of large sized asparagus with Hollandaise that were incredible!! A great experience and would not try another steak place here.
The hotel is also great.Free full buffet breakfast which was great and varied each day.Room had nice appointments,fruit and cheese tray each day. They treat you right and I will only stay here on any visit to SF.

LesMary
Batemans Bay, Australia
Senior Contributor
47 reviews 47 reviews
Reviews in 31 cities Reviews in 31 cities
40 helpful votes 40 helpful votes
'A gem in SF'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed May 25, 2012

We stayed 8 nights recently at Marines Memorial Club Hotel. Used it as a base to do day tours by bus.
Reception very good. Location very good, close to Union Square and downtown SF, plus good access to transport, street cars, cable cars. Rooms were old world but comfortable, big bed, good shower and fridge, what more do you want? Bit noisy though, we were on 7th floor and constant AC noise from other buildings rooftops, plus traffic noise. Breakfast good, hot and cold selection. Afternoon happy hour also very good. All the staff in hotel were excellent. No real complaints, although price of $179 during week and $199 at weekend PLUS taxes, was a little high I thought.

Highly recommended.
Less

See 4 more reviews by Rhodesian for San Francisco
Rhodesian
SWEDEN
Senior Contributor
48 reviews 48 reviews
Reviews in 37 cities Reviews in 37 cities
136 helpful votes 136 helpful votes
'Old Glory'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed May 24, 2012
1
person found this review helpful

I am a reserve officer in the RSAF since decades. I have access to the MMC as a reciprocal member. I have just returned after a week with my wife here in a fireplace suite.
First of all, the building itself is a living museum. Many guests as well. When trying to make a reservation through the e-mail I am sad to state that it took quite a few including overseas calls until I received a response. The rate I paid for the room included a 85 sq m two room suite w bath and working gas fireplace. A generous full breakfast and a very generous free happy hour every evening between four and 6 was included, as well as access to the best health club in San Francisco, located on the premises.
So why not top marks? First of all, the suite has absolutely NO noise insulation. Probably not a problem for old Marines, but even I , who have mortar damaged hearing on one side, was forced to have earplugs, and to stuff the space between windows and windowboards with decoration pillows in order to get any sleep. Secondly, I must say I found reception cool. Also interaction w other guests. We did meet a couple of nice couples and chatted away two evenings with them but I have to say that most people just stared at me and my wife. She is admittedly beautiful, but the stares were not followed by smiles. I do expect the average Marine family to be on the conservative side, but found it sad to be judged like this, especially since I always have been a true conservative, as has my wife.
The leatherneck restaurant serves up decently priced food that Granny makes. If she is in a good mood You get good food. Breakfast is filling and adequate. Steff is efficient, although sadly not filled with smiles. The business room gives You access to computers for free which is good. The health club has a pool. but the ambience of the club is VERY much athletic. You swim Your laps. You do not hang around or lounge in a chair with a drink. Basically since You can't get anything else than water, there is one chair and no view except a brick wall.
The club IS historical, but for USD 400 including tax for a room I had expected more than sofas upholstered in plastic and unsmiling staff. And to those who wonder-yes we tipped every morning and every happy hour. Generously.
I would have LOVED to love this club, just as a do with my own, the Royal Air Force Club. Or the Muthaiga Club. Or any other great historic hotel like Raffles, The Eastern and Oriental, the Savoy or the Strand. I just didn't feel either welcome or valued. Except from the charming Leatherneck restaurant maitre'd, Mark Sokolov, and the kind barmaid Patty. For these two people, and for the Glory of the Marines, I give the place four stars.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?

6 helpful votes 6 helpful votes
'ONLY place to stay in San Fran!'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 21, 2012
1
person found this review helpful

LOVED this hotel!! Was here last summer with my husband and three children (all under 10). We stayed in one room with two queen beds - and the room was still VERY spacious for us. The hotel employees were very nice, the FULL SERVICE BREAKFAST which is included at no charge is daily and AMAZING!! Breakfast is served on the top floor with great views of the city. Plus there were plenty of other perks, the location is perfect and there are laundry machines on two floors that you may use at NO CHARGE. Plus if you forget laundry detergent they have some for free at the front desk. I knew about the laundry machines in advance so I packed a couple of one time use detergent packs that I had picked up at CVS in advance. Aside from being dedicated to the marines this hotel is amazing and I would recommend anyone looking for a really great place to stay in San Francisco stay here. It's a beautiful building with great service and EXCELLENT amenities!
Less

4602usmc

Reviews in 7 cities Reviews in 7 cities
5 helpful votes 5 helpful votes
'One of the finest Marine Corps Historical Hotels'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 21, 2012
1
person found this review helpful

I have had the distinct pleasure of staying at the Marine Corps Memorial Club Hotel on two occassions, both times the stay was an absolute pleasure! The distinctive interior, artifacts, and general Marine Corps historical atmosphere is overwhelming! Every floor has its own era or dedication memorials, Medal of Honor wall, Commandant's Hall etc. The complete buffet breakfest in the morning is fresh, hot, tasty and has a great variety. If you want only fruit, there is plenty to choose from, if you want good old "SOS" it is there for you. My glass of orange juice never got half empty, and the waiters and waitress's were "on it" . Clean, professional, and very much Marine Corps and/or military minded. The hotel concierge was VERY courteous, and helpful. He knew the area, the best places to eat, depending on what I was looking for, and when I needed to ship an item, he took it and when I got home, it was there, packaged perfectly. I cannot say enough about this hotel except that we currently have plans to hold our conference here every year! Support your military, and stop in if your are ever near the hotel, and if you are traveling, you MUST stay here, it will become your favorite!.
Less

Lee3LosAngeles
Arlington, Virginia
Senior Reviewer
6 reviews 6 reviews
Reviews in 6 cities Reviews in 6 cities
11 helpful votes 11 helpful votes
'Oasis in Union Square'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed May 16, 2012
2
people found this review helpful

We pilgrimaged back to Marines Memorial on the occasion of our son's graduation from College. We always look forward to visiting San Francisco and the old hotel. We were certainly not disappointed this time. The lobby hadn't changed at all, the wood was well polished, and the Marine momentos were all exactly where they should have been. The parking charge at the Olympic Club was a little higher, but the Breakfast Buffet was better than ever. The only detractor from an otherwise perfect stay was the noise coming from a private party on our floor. I probably could have complained and I'm sure the staff would have responded quickly, but I didn't want to bother, and my room was so comfortable that I really wasn't too disappointed that I wasn't sleeping. If you are an active duty or retired military member, or can otherwise join Marines Memorial, I encourage you to stay there just one night. You'll probably become a pilgrim like us.
Less

'Lovely Stay in San Francisco'

The Marine Memorial Club Hotel is an absolutely beautiful accommodation; clean, quiet, dignified...in the heart of the city.literally. If I could have fallen deeper in love with SF because of this hotel...I did! I love that the windows open; because the smell of the city is of flowers and clean spring air--delightful.

'Great location and attentive service'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 4, 2012 NEW

We really enjoyed this hotel. We upgraded to a suite and were glad we did as this was a very comfortable size, but not overly large. The regular rooms must be quite small. The bathroom was small, but clean. The rooms were well decorated, with an interesting style and were also quite clean. The staff was very responsive to concerns. Finally, they have a wine tasting each night. Over three nights we had tastings from two wineries.

They do have a car service that works with them for the airport. It was only $5-7 more than a cab and much more comfortable.

'great hotel and great location'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 2, 2012 NEW
1
person found this review helpful

Stayed at the Galleria Park for a week while in San Francisco. The rooms were very clean and the beds super comfortable. The hotel is in a good location. The hotel staff were very helpful in suggesting places to eat, directions, etc. Would definitely stay there again.

Chappedheel
Chapel Hill NC
Contributor
15 reviews 15 reviews
Reviews in 9 cities Reviews in 9 cities
5 helpful votes 5 helpful votes
'Would return in a heartbeat'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed May 25, 2012

Can't imagine a better-situated place for San Francisco. If the rooms were only a couple of feet wider (so that one person could pass between the bed and another person sitting at the desk), this place could price itself out of reach for many of us. Within walking distance of Union Sq., Moscone Convention Ctr., Museum of Modern Art, Yerba Buena Gardens, Chinatown, and the Ferry Pier -- and easy access to BART and almost any bus or trolley line you might want, including the F trolley over to Fisherman's Whart/Ghirardelli Sq. Since it's in the financial district, it's comparatively quiet at night (although Sutter-Street-front lower floors could be noisy on weekends), but as safe as you need for most purposes. Be sure to scope out the French bistros in the area and up the hill on Bush.

Although one would wish that breakfast were available truly in-house (there's a sign in the elevator that says "dining - mezzanine, referring solely to coffee and tea service), breakfast at the attached "Hecho" Japanese (-?"Mexican"?) restaurant probably counts from the management's point of view. However, it seemed a little funky and slow for my purposes, and most didn't seem to eat breakfast there (different story for lunch/dinner -- miso soup and sushi was fine). For myself, I was more than happy to have thick toast, fruit cup, frittata, and amazing drinking chocolate at Bread and Chocolate next door, reading the paper and people-watching at the corner of Sutter and Kearny.

Very pretty little garden terrace on the 3rd floor, with "jogging path" (short!) and lovely plantings.
Only other wish: some nibbles and for non-drinkers,non-alcoholic beverage for wine hour (a little chintzy to suggest that we take snacks from our honor bar for nibbles - even just plain popcorn wouldn't cost the owners that much).
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
See 5 more reviews by Chappedheel for San Francisco
Ask Chappedheel about Galleria Park, a Joie de Vivre hotel
This review is the subjective opinion of a TripAdvisor member and not of TripAdvisor LLC.
Kevin Scott, Director of Operations at Galleria Park, a Joie de Vivre hotel, responded to this review
June 1, 2012
Chappedheel,

Hello there and thank you so much for staying with us at Galleria Park last week and your feedback on your most recent stay.
Please know that your feedback is being addressed. We are looking to offer our guests some unique and tasty nibbles during our complimentary wine hour. Upon your next visit to San Francisco we hope that you decide to stay with us again and see the changes we have made because of you.

Thank you again for your feedback and hope to see you soon!
Report response as inappropriate
This response is the subjective opinion of the management representative and not of TripAdvisor LLC.

'Resolved'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 22, 2012

Last year, I posted a review regarding an awful booking experience. We were planning our annual trip to SF during the Christmas holidays and we ended up in an another hotel.
Earlier this month, I received a TA message from The Galleria's manager inviting me to give his hotel another chance. Coincidentally, we had just finalized our flight plans ( we plan early!) for our trip this Christmas and was checking out hotel rates.
After exchanging a few emails, he resolved my complaint and I promised to withdraw my previous post. While I look forward to our stay and will post a review thereafter, I am encouraged that the hotel has taken steps to see to customers' issues and in my case,it's never too late.

Problem with this review?
thisisbeaker
London, United Kingdom
Contributor
17 reviews 17 reviews
Reviews in 9 cities Reviews in 9 cities
3 helpful votes 3 helpful votes
'So good we went back for a second stay'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed June 3, 2012 NEW

My wife and I first stayed here in 2007 for 5 nights at the end of a trip from LA to San Francisco, and again after a trip from Vegas, through Yosemite and Sonoma. The hotel's location is superb for the cost. It's a 5 minute walk to Union Square - possibly 10 minutes on the way back up the hill! The rooms are a really good size, and conveniently have a fridge to store water/snacks in. The staff are all really friendly, and the DVD collection at reception is handy for a quiet night in. We had the complimentary breakfast a couple of times, but can highly recommend Sears on Powell for breakfast and dinner. Hold fond memories of this place, as I proposed to my wife here!!
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?

LChipNC
Contributor
19 reviews 19 reviews
Reviews in 4 cities Reviews in 4 cities
'Great value for great location'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed May 30, 2012 NEW via mobile

I chose this hotel for my vacation to San Francisco based on the trip advisor reviews, and they were right on the money. With AAA, we spent less than 200 per night. It was a great value for the location-- right on north/south and east/west cable car lines and right by Union Square. Since we were out exploring the city most of the time, it was perfect for us. Clean, comfortable, quiet, no frills. What else do you need really? It was a great choice and I wouldn't choose anywhere else in hindsight. We took the cable cars to fishermans wharf and the ferry building, took cabs to fancy restaurants, and found some great spots nearby, too. It's walking distance to union square shopping and there are convenient grocery and convenience stores and pharmacies within a block. Terrific choice. I gave it 4 stars because it wasn't a "wow" factor-- just a good value.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes

castermom
syracuse
Reviewer
3 reviews 3 reviews
Reviews in 2 cities Reviews in 2 cities
2 helpful votes 2 helpful votes
'Clean & comfortable, good value for price, friendly staff'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 25, 2012
1
person found this review helpful

Couldn't have been happier with our accommodations. Very clean, well-appointed room. Spacious bathroom. Friendly staff, especially doormen Cornell and David, and desk staff, including Grace. Twice, bartender graciously obtained salt from the kitchen for my son for a throat gargle. Good location, close to muni system, Chinatown. Walgreens and Starbucks around every corner. Posh Bagel a favorite for breakfast two blocks away. I would stay there again in a heartbeat. It's nice to have confidence in your hotel. Even though you only may be there to sleep, you want to be assured that where you are staying is safe, clean and comfortable. The Orchard Hotel was all of these and more. Only two minor fixes: needs flat screen TV and more water pressure in the shower.
Less

'great hotel, great location'

1
person found this review helpful

We stayed at the Orchard Garden Hotel 5/25/2012 for 4 nights. Loved the location right next to Chinatown gates, walking distance to many great restaurants. The room was small but perfect for us, comfortable king sized bed, I liked the fact that the hotel is eco-friendly. The rooftop garden was a nice touch.

'Excellent location; very reasonably priced'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 31, 2012 NEW
1
person found this review helpful

My wife and I stayed here for one night last week and would absolutely stay here again. The hotel is located right outside Chinatown and right near several Cable Car lines. The front desk staff was very friendly and the room was very clean, updated, and had all the amenities one might need. To top it off, the price was less than what I would have expected for a hotel of this quality and location. There is Valet Parking available, but there is also a large parking garage one block away if you prefer to park yourself (the cost is roughly the same for each parking option). If you don't have a car, it is very easy to get a taxi right outside the hotel.

Amy S
New York City, New York
Senior Contributor
22 reviews 22 reviews
Reviews in 7 cities Reviews in 7 cities
6 helpful votes 6 helpful votes
'Excellent for a hotel in this price range.'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 23, 2012

This is not a hotel I'd ever heard of before so I was a little concerned as to what I would find. I'm happy to say that what I found was a very clean, well-appointed, friendly, conveniently-located hotel. The location is extremely convenient to public transportation, stores, restaurants. While Union Square is a very appealing area, on previous business trips I've really struggled to get a taxi to the office in the morning. Happily, the doorman out front was extremely helpful on this front (better than other doormen I've relied upon) and when he couldn't get me a taxi right away, he had a car and driver at hand who could get me to work at the same price as a cab. It really made a difference for me. The hotel staff were very pro-active, professional, helpful and polite. My room was extremely clean and "fresh" and it was nice to find the bathroom had a make-up mirror. My only disappointment was that room service wasn't available the Monday night I arrived (the restaurant was closed, too) but I think that was an unusual circumstance (but worth confirming if you plan to arrive on a Monday). Finally, as I'm a very light sleeper, I was thrilled to find that my room was EXTREMELY quiet. Overall, an excellent stay and I will definitely stay there in the future.
Less

Problem with this review?
Hawk0476
Luton
Contributor
13 reviews 13 reviews
Reviews in 16 cities Reviews in 16 cities
94 helpful votes 94 helpful votes
'Excellent base for city break'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 20, 2012

The Orchard Garden hotel is excellently located, approximately 5 minute walk from Union Square and right next to Chinatown Gate. There are plenty of options for dining within easy reach. The cable car stop on Powell Street is only a very short walk from the hotel.

The hotel rooms are modern and spacious with the biggest bathroom I have ever experienced in a city centre hotel. The bed was super comfy and very large! Check in was very straightforward and I found the staff to be helpful and friendly. We booked the Orchard Garden on a pre-paid rate and received a significant discount. Our room was on the 9th floor, at the back of the hotel so experienced no street noise from busy San Francisco.

Orchard Garden hotel is 30-40 minutes walk from Fishermans Wharf or a 10 minute cable car ride.

Two tips for anyone visiting San Francisco. Book your trip to Alcatraz in advance online and take the first boat of the day thus avoiding the crowds. Book tickets to see the San Francisco Giants play (can also do this in advance online) and thus experience real America!
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes

Msk6261
Top Contributor
149 reviews 149 reviews
Reviews in 101 cities Reviews in 101 cities
579 helpful votes 579 helpful votes
'Officially my favorite chain of boutique hotels'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 4, 2012 NEW

We live right across the bay and know the Hotel Vitale to have a good reputation and an excellent location. We decided to treat ourselves to a Giants game and a night in the city for my birthday.We got a great last minute rate so we just head across the bridge!

I have stayed at other JDV hotels and so far, they are my favorite. They just get it right. Friendly staff, trendy and an attention to detail without being stuffy.

Our city facing room was quiet and spacious. The bedroom and bathroom was immaculate and nicely appointed. Top quality linens and towels and the bed was comfy.Having read reviews about the noise, we thought we hit it on an empty Sat. night. But...... were surprised to see that the hotel was actually full. We did not hear a sound from inside our room.

It was great to be just walking distance from AT&T stadium and the game was great (Go Giants!). Boulevard, one of the better restaurants in the city is just across the street. We then strolled through the ferry terminal in the morning. The breakfast in the restaurant was also well done.

I would love for the parking to be less than $48/night but the bell staff was helpful in suggesting other options. They knew all the regulations for parking in the area. This is one of the downsides of city hotels.

If only we can make this our routine every time we want to see a ball game!?!
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes

See 2 more reviews by christianneanastasia for San Francisco
christianneanastasia
Bethlehem PA
Senior Contributor
27 reviews 27 reviews
Reviews in 20 cities Reviews in 20 cities
104 helpful votes 104 helpful votes
'Good, but not great.'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed May 31, 2012 NEW
1
person found this review helpful

My partner and I debated long and hard before booking the hotel for our San Francisco vacation. Would the Hotel Vitale worth its premium price over similar hotels located nearby? We decided to go for it, based on our positive experiences with the Joie de Vivre brand. In the grand tradition of damning with faint praise, I have to say the Vitale was good. It was not, however, great, and as a result I am left to wonder if it was really worth the cost.
When we checked in, we specifically requested as quiet a room as possible. The woman at the desk said this was no problem, and said that we'd been upgraded to a higher room class. We discovered that our room, which was on the hotel's 3rd floor, faced Mission Street and was directly above the hotel's driveway. More problematically, there were quite a few patrons of the bar/restaurant who were congregated outside this area, and their conversation was all-too-clearly audible from our room. I called down and was able to get another room, although it was a "downgrade" (and did not appreciate the front desk person arguing with me about where the noise was coming from--does it really matter whether it's noise from the restaurant or the valet area? All that I cared about was that it was impossible to sleep!). This new room faced the interior courtyard and was definitely smaller than the first, but it was quiet. Bath amenities were nice (Lather brand), and the room was nicely appointed.
I had some trouble getting my "Joy of Life Club" perks--I had emailed someone from the hotel well in advance of our stay to let them know we were members, but there was no record of this on our reservation when I arrived. I mentioned it again at check-in, but no amenity was issued. Nothing showed up the following day (during room cleaning or check-in) and finally, on the last full day of our stay, I called down to the front desk to inquire. The person I spoke to had my amenity sent up, but I feel that there should have been more follow-through on my initial inquiry, rather than my having to constantly inquire about this.
The gym was very small (the size of a guestroom, no windows) but it was clean and had nice equipment. The bar/restaurant's hours seemed oddly limited (I expected that this would be open all day during the weekends, at least, but this was not the case) and the noise that emanated from it (when we arrived at 10:30 P.M. on a Thursday) was alarming--I can't imagine that it's not audible from the second floor of guest rooms, and any rooms that overlook its patio area would probably hear this as well.
The hotel's location across from the Ferry Building was a huge plus in our book, but might be inconvenient for those not interested in this area of the city. Additionally, the financial district (which the hotel abuts) is a ghost town on the weekends, so if you're looking for nightlife, this might not be the place to stay.
Overall, I expected more.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
See 2 more reviews by christianneanastasia for San Francisco
Ask christianneanastasia about Hotel Vitale, a Joie de Vivre hotel
This review is the subjective opinion of a TripAdvisor member and not of TripAdvisor LLC.

Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
EliseDawnP
1 review
1 helpful vote 1 helpful vote
'A Disappointing Experience'
3 of 5 stars Reviewed May 27, 2012 via mobile
1
person found this review helpful

When in San Francisco, I typically stay at The Kimpton Palomar, but decided to give Hotel Vitale a try due to a last-minute special on Hotel Tonight.

After I booked the room I called the hotel to see if they have rooftop hot tubs or just soaking tubs. The woman I spoke with told me not only did they didn't have a rooftop hot tub, but did have a pool and sauna--I was ecstatic! I called a few friends up who live in the city and told them we will be having drinks poolside at the hotel soon!

Upon arrival to the hotel, no one greeted us or said they would be with us soon until I finally asked one of the bell boys if I was in the right place to check in. While this would be expected at a cheap roadside hotel, I was a little surprised to be left hanging at a hotel of this caliber.

After getting our room keys, I excitedly headed to the rooftop to check out the pool. It was non-existent. I wandered around the property in search of the pool and sauna without any luck. We finally headed down to the front desk. The woman working told us there that the property did not have these amenities, but we could use a complimentary guest pass at the YMCA to use their hot tub and sauna. Looks like rooftop pool drinks were off. I was a little bummed, but didn't want to let it ruin our vacation, so we headed to our room to get settled.

Our room was beautiful, that is, until I noticed the loud screeching noise coming from the "kitchen vent" outside our window. I called the management to see if there was any way to switch rooms, but the manager I spoke to said the hotel was fully booked and we could switch rooms the following day.

I feel truly sorry for anyone who paid full price for this room, as I awoke early in the morning to a screeching humming noise when the kitchen opened and only got about 5 hours of sleep. I called the front desk again and they said they could switch us at noon to a room on a higher floor or could charge us to move to a less noisy oceanview room.

I'm anxiously awaiting the room change to get away from the noise. Whatever you do, DO NOT stay in an interior-facing 3rd story room unless you are very heard of hearing or deaf.

I hate leaving a review this negative for a Joie De Vivre hotel, as I've had so many great experiences at their hotels in other cities, but they really could use some improvement here. Unless you are staying in one of their large oceanview suites, I would say you're much better off at the Palomar.

    *

Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?

Travellover
Orlando, FL
Senior Contributor
21 reviews 21 reviews
Reviews in 13 cities Reviews in 13 cities
15 helpful votes 15 helpful votes
'My Favorite Hotel in San Francisco'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 26, 2012

I adore Hotel Vitale! I received an upgrade to an Urban View Room during my most recent stay which includes a huge soaking tub. I was in room 730 which was right across from one of the suites where they have meetings and events. There was an event one evening in the room that went until 8pm and was a little noisy so request a room away from these meeting rooms if you need quiet. Be sure to join the Joie de Vivre loyalty program so you can enjoy your welcome gift when staying at this or other Joie properties. Everyone on staff during my stay was super friendly and make me feel very welcome. My only concern about his hotel is the limited equipment in the fitness center and lack of windows in the fitness center. You can get a free pass to the YMCA which is very close to the hotel or a pass for $10/day to the Bay Club Athletic Center which is a little less then a mile from the hotel. Hotel Vitale has a calming effect on me each time I visit.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
Ask Travellover about Hotel Vitale, a Joie de Vivre hotel
This review is the subjective opinion of a TripAdvisor member and not of TripAdvisor LLC.
Melony Williams, General Manager at Hotel Vitale, a Joie de Vivre hotel, responded to this review
May 31, 2012
Dear Travellover

We are so fortunate to have you as a Joy of Life member, and are humbled by your kind feedback. I'm sorry to hear that you were disturbed during your stay by an event adjacent to your room and apologize for this inconvenience  we never want to compromise our guests' comfort. As we are a boutique hotel, our fitness center does provide a more intimate atmosphere, and if you are looking for something larger, than the free YMCA passes and $10 day passes are a great alternative. We look forward to having you back and to providing you with a continued sense of calm upon your return.

Warm Regards,

Melony Williams
General Manager

Pros
-- Nice decor
-- Nice amenities
-- Great location for public transportation access (not a fun location though)
-- Overall clean and well kept


Cons
-- So loud. It's 3 a.m, and I am writing this review from my hotel room. I've been here 6 nights, and I haven't gotten a decent night's sleep for six nights. I would like to leave. Now. Please. I have a "city view" room, which is a view of buses on a dirty street. Between the buses decompressing and idling outside my window, the drunks on the street, the people in the building that I can hear peeing and drunkenly screaming, and the random noises from the patio above, I really have not gotten any peace or quiet.

One of the issues is that there is a rooftop garden that is open at all hours. So if you are in one of the many rooms under the rooftop garden, you get to hear everything that happens on the garden. This includes people walking up and down a metal stair case, the random drilling and machine noises, crap falling off the building (what IS that?), etc. If you get a room under the rooftop gardens, you know you're in a cheap room. You got screwed.

The walls are very thin. I can hear everyone above and next to me when they use the restroom.

And, since I'm up, I thought, why not watch some TV? Let's see. I can watch reruns of Seinfeld or a cable news channel.... Or Seinfeld. Or a news channel. They maybe have 10 channels, and MSNBC doesn't even come in well. Fox News comes in real well. Splurge a little, Hotel Vitale, and get some real channels so that people have something to do while your hotel keeps them up all night.

The hotel staff never responded to any of my questions about noise. They'd listen politely and then do nothing - not even call back. So don't bother with them; just get a different hotel.

The Hyatt Embarcadero is just around the corner. I am going to try there next time I'm here.

The other reviewers are correct about the hotel restaurant. It's always packed. It's very loud and obnoxious.

Overall, this is just not the right hotel for a business traveler.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?

Please contact me at your earliest convenience to resolve these problems.

SpikeyMikey
Lancashire
Contributor
18 reviews 18 reviews
Reviews in 15 cities Reviews in 15 cities
19 helpful votes 19 helpful votes
'A great city, shame about Vitale'
3 of 5 stars Reviewed May 23, 2012

Stayed here May 2012. In a good location at the Bay Front with views of the Bay Bridge at the foot of the financial district overlooking the Embarcadero. We had requested a Superior Room with a Water View and were pleased to have been told that we were upgraded at check-in. Thank heavens we were, the room whilst large and clean was definitely in need of refurbishment, especially the bathroom where there was no separate shower cubicle, just a shower over the bath and a shower curtain. If this was an upgrade, what are the rest like? The view on the other hand was excellent.

The hotel appears to be geared up for conferences as there were at least 3 during our 4 day stay. The hotel bar at night was uncomfortably loud and full as a result and was not somewhere you would return to relax in after a long day. Interestingly, it was quiet one afternoon and we tried to sit down and have a soft drink while catching up with the English papers only to be told that they were shut and wouldn't serve us and we were asked to order through room service. Speaking of which, room service whilst efficient failed to fill the fridge every day we were there which was annoying given that I had to call down for drinks as we were avoiding the hotel bar!

Note also that concierge is not 24 hours so if you you want to book a meal or excursion or general advice make sure you do so during office hours!

This hotel is not cheap, nearly $450 a night to stay plus taxes. It is definitely overpriced for what you get. A small Holiday Inn springs to mind which if you are happy with a Holiday Inn fine, it is not what I thought I had booked and not what I wanted. I would not return.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes

Ask SpikeyMikey about Hotel Vitale, a Joie de Vivre hotel

I am sorry to hear about the several problems you experienced during your last stay, and am disheartened to learn you were bothered by other guests. Our Hotel is a hub for several meetings and social gatherings, however we do not intend to compromise the serene experience our other guests, like yourself, have anticipated. I also would like to apologize that your fridge was not restocked, and will be bringing this to the attention of our Housekeeping Supervisor. It is through your candid feedback that we can better assist our guests, and appreciate your honesty.

I do hope you will consider staying with us again, and if you need any assistance with future reservations, please do not hesitate to contact me.

All the best,

Melony Williams
General Manager

'Great place to stay in San Francisco.'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 20, 2012

Comfortable, great location. Many excellent restaurants within walking distance. Love having the Embarcadero at your doorstep and the Ferry Building blocks away. Quieter than the area around Union Square and easy access to other neighborhoods if you're exploring. A few minor irritations, no paper a few days although I'd requested one, no water one evening after several days receiving it, otherwise staff and service were excellent. Loved being able to open the window for fresh air and city sounds. "Fresh" products were a treat. The cocktail area seems to have a good crowd for happy hour, only had an after dinner drink there one evening and it was fine.
Less

'Nice hotel, needs to brushing up on the details'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed May 16, 2012
1
person found this review helpful

I've stayed at this property several times and I have enjoyed my stay. The location is perfect, close to BART and the Embarcadero and if you choose a room with a view, it's quite nice.
The room could not have been nicer, view of the Embarcadero and the Bay Bridge. Amazing bathroom, great amenities.
Points to consider: when I checked in they asked if I would like a newspaper? I asked for the NYTimes. I never received the newspaper. I was going to mention it to the Front Desk, but decided not to -- after all, why should I?
The second day, I need to have laundry done and there was no bag? I called downstairs and it was promptly delivered.
Similar occurrence, ordered breakfast and asked for bottled water -- no water?
Sounds petty, but to me these are things that make hotels GREAT.
