Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
See 5 more reviews by Vansportsfan for San Francisco
Vansportsfan
Vancouver, Canada
Senior Contributor
44 reviews 44 reviews
Reviews in 15 cities Reviews in 15 cities
22 helpful votes 22 helpful votes
'Top of its class'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed May 15, 2012
5
people found this review helpful

This is at the top end of a 3 star rated hotel - it could easily be a higher rating if the old boys club (the Elks) that take up the lower floors shared their toys (spa, handball court etc.)

As a solo woman traveler, the location couldn't be better. A stone throw from Union Square and 4 short blocks to the Powell Station (BART & Muni.) I felt safe on all the main streets in the area & knew not to venture to some of the less safe areas.

The room itself was comfortably cozy, very clean, had a large closet to store my luggage, hang my clothes etc. The bathroom was a reasonable size, and had a huge mirror that covered most of the wall. A glass shelf was large enough to hold all my toiletries. The shower had great water pressure. The bed was very comfy. Free wi-fi in the rooms and access to the business office on the 5th floor to print boarding pass or use computer to check e-mail etc.

I requested and received a quiet room, though it faced the side of the building next door, so had no view, it was indeed very quiet and also stayed cool - a compromise well worth it to me.

The staff are all exceptionally friendly and helpful, which certainly adds to the pleasant experience. Vincent and his co-workers always seemed happy to answer my many questions & show me where things were on the map.

Taking the BART from the airport was fairly simple $8.10 each way - I loaded $16.20 on a card when I arrived so that I wouldn't have to worry about it when I departed. Take the train to the Powell Station about a 1/2 hr ride. When you exit take the escalator up, you will need to insert your BART card to open the turnstile then go to your right to the Halidie Plaza, take a sharp right and go up the escalator to Market Street, then walk straight up Powell 4 blocks to Post Street and turn left. It is a bit of an up hill hike.

The Muni (subway & trains) cost $2 per trip except the cable cars which are $6 per trip. There is a terrific cafe 2 doors down from the KP called La Taza, is open by 7am & closes at 8pm. The chocolate scone is sinfully delicious. Had the vegetarian quesadella one lunch and it was the best I have ever tasted. Prices are very good & they do have a menu on their web site.

The highlights of my 3 days were the Alcatraz Audio Tour, Dinner & Walking Tour of Chinatown and going to a Giants game at AT & T Park.

This Hotel definitely has the charm & personality that I much prefer over the cookie cutter brand name hotels. The hospitality is warm & genuine, not forced and pretentious.

    *
    *

Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
See 5 more reviews by Vansportsfan for San Francisco

'Average but worth the price!'
3 of 5 stars Reviewed May 11, 2012
1
person found this review helpful

I stayed there over the Easter weekend with my daugther and we had only good experiences. Close to a lot of SF attractions, e.g. Chinatown, Market Street etc.
Service is professional, not overly engaged or friendly, but we had no issues with anyone. The flair of the hotel is quite continental, a bit strange in decoration, but for a hotel of this age approriate and one can find it charming, too.
Only two things to be aware of - hotel windows are single pane, thus a bit noisy in the morning (at least for rooms towards the front with the street) and of course parking a car in the center of SF, well costs a fortune (minimum $25 a night), as parking spots at the curbside are extremely rare to find....

'Wonderful Hotel Experience'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 7, 2012

Stayed for the weekend for a wedding. Great location...right next to Union Square.
Very kind and attentive staff. Gloria at the front desk was especially nice, allowing me to check-in early before my friend with the actual reservation had arrived. The consiglieres were also very helpful with local eateries and hotspots and provided easy shuttle setups to and from the airport. Hotel rooms were of good size, and had a homely yet modern feel. I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the San Fransisco area.

gary_denver_orig
denver, colorado
Senior Contributor
23 reviews 23 reviews
Reviews in 11 cities Reviews in 11 cities
17 helpful votes 17 helpful votes
'Great Hotel'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed May 4, 2012
2
people found this review helpful

We have been staying at the Kensington Park hotel for several years. It is always welcoming, squeaky clean and you can't beat the location. I have read many reviews here about the hotel and there are 2 common complaints- the rooms are small and no A/C. Well, the rooms are not huge, but they are comfortable and if you are there on vacation, why spend a lot of time in your room? There is so much to do in S.F.! The A/C issue has never bothered us as we open the window- there is always a breeze and it cools off in the evening. It has never affected my sleep.

One terrific aspect of this hotel is Mr. Robert Finney, the concierge. He has always been there, knows San Francisco very well and is a really interesting man if you take some time to talk with him.
Less

6 helpful votes 6 helpful votes
'Family Holiday'
3 of 5 stars Reviewed April 25, 2012

We stayed at the Kensington Park Hotel for three nights. Whilst the room was clean and the room service good, the rooms were very small and the bathroom was dated. This is primarily an Elks Hotel and certain amenities are only available to Elks.

The staff were very polite and the concierge helped us a great deal with his knowlege of the city and the best way to get around.

Overall, this hotel is o.k. for a few nights stay but very pricey for what amenities you get!

On the plus side, if you get one of the "hop on, hop off" tour buses, the stop is just outside the hotel and the trolley car stop is just around the corner on Powell Street.
Less

Problem with this review?
Raging_Hamster
Amsterdam
Senior Contributor
31 reviews 31 reviews
Reviews in 28 cities Reviews in 28 cities
13 helpful votes 13 helpful votes
'Nice, quiet hotel on Lombard Street'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed June 4, 2012 NEW

I recently spent two nights at the Travelodge Presidio and found it to be an efficient, quiet and adequate hotel. Check in procedure was speedy and the front desk supplied us with useful information about the surroundings and about public transport in the area. The room was not large but not cramped either and it was supplied with airco, satellite tv, coffee maker, a desk and chair. The beds were very comfortable. The bathroom was small , but well organized and water pressure in the shower was very good. The ventilation was instead a bit slow, so often the air would be a bit stuffy.
Both room and bathroom were very clean.
The breakfast was included in the room rate and served in a room adjacent to the hotel office. It included tea and coffee, juice, muffins, milk and cereal. It wasn't the best ever but it was ok. My only complaint is that coffee was really not that good.
The Travelodge is positioned a bit outside the main tourist area, but still close enough for us to walk to fisherman's wharf (about 20-25 min walk) and other touristy spots. The area is also served by a few buses which pass frequently enough.
I did enjoy my visit at the Travelodge and I would not hesitate to recommend it to others.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?

heyybugg
1 review
'Awesome experience!!'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 4, 2012 NEW via mobile

My mom and I planned a trip to SF and after looking through MANY hotels we decided to take a chance on this one through others reviews. Let me tell you, this hotel is fantastic. Very quiet, the staff is absolutely awesome, great price, awesome updated rooms, FREE PARKING. We had to park around back and they had survallence all over. It was great to feel so secure. The staff was so friendly and very knowledgable. They told us how to get to certain bus stops, best places to eat, best places to visit, and even printed out a list of tours for us!. The only problem for me personally was that it wasn't as close to the Wharf and Pier as I had hoped, which isn't that big of a deal. I will DEFINITELY stay here again. It's like staying in a 3 or 4 star hotel for a lot cheaper. Thank you guys for making our vacation so great!!

David N
Saint Louis, Missouri
Reviewer
3 reviews 3 reviews
'Raymond, the concierge, was amazing!'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed June 1, 2012 NEW

We traveled to SF with another couple and were looking for a place near all of the attractions, yet affordable. My wife found both in the Travelodge on Lombard. The room was better than expected (for the price) and the location was great. The most surprising part of our trip was Raymond Archer, the concierge. One of the most friendly and outgoing people I've met who was honest about what attractions were worth our time and which ones were not. Raymond took the time to map out 2-3 bus routes as well as the trolley route, highlighting great restaurants/stops along each route.After asking us about what types of foods we liked or wanted to try, he suggested a multitude of restaurants, guaranteeing we wouldn't be disappointed; the food was incredible! Raymond overflowed with excitement about "his" city and all it had to offer. His services and knowledge were better than any concierge I've encountered in the states or abroad. Travelodge has a huge resource and "plus" in Raymond Archer. Thank you Raymond for making our trip so much more efficient and affordable with your advice! 5 STAR SERVICE!!!!!
Less

Problem with this review?
travelnhike
MS
1 review
'Quiet, hidden gem in the city by the bay'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 21, 2012

We just returned from a 5 night stay at the Travelodge. I booked this trip after reading previous reviews here on Tripadvisor, and I have to say, I was very pleased with the selection.

Located in a very quiet section of San Francisco, just steps away from the entrance to the Presidio, this hidden gem is the deal of the city. Raymond, Niki, and Bruce are wonderful hosts, and truly work hard to make you feel at home. There was no question too bothersome (believe me, I asked my fair share). Everyone was quick to help with directions, restaurant recommendations, and ideas for fun places to spend the day.

We returned to the hotel in the early evening each day, and made use of the offering of coffee, tea and cookies. These were greatly enjoyed and appreciated after a full day of touring. The breakfast is not extensive, but is just perfect to start the day. There are so many wonderful restaurants to try in SF, that all we needed was a croissant, cereal, muffin or coffee to get us going. We caught a local bus just a block or so down the street to all locations for touring. This worked out perfectly for us.

We found this hotel to be a great value. It was less than half the price of other hotels we looked at in Union Square. I have to say we treasured returning to a quiet location at the end of the day. Book this hotel. You won't be sorry.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes

jfried447
Knoxville, Tennessee
Senior Reviewer
7 reviews 7 reviews
Reviews in 4 cities Reviews in 4 cities
'Great location and wonderful staff'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 17, 2012

We stayed three days and were very pleased with this Travelodge; the location(across the street from the Presidio), free parking and the best hotel staff. We came straight from the airport and were too early for check in but were allowed to park our car and begin touring SF. Bruce was on duty when we arrived. He gave us great neighborhood restaurant recommendations (all good) and drew Muni bus lines on our map. Niki and Raymond were also wonderful; made us feel welcome and answered our many questions. The room is small but comfortable and clean. We've stayed at other Travelodges but this is the first one with such a wonderful staff. Would definitely stay again and recommend it to anyone travelling to SF. We never drove our car until we checked out; walked to neighborhood restaurants and reasonable walk to bus stops. Can't say enough about the helpfulness of the staff.

Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
MM-TorontoTraveler
Toronto
Contributor
19 reviews 19 reviews
Reviews in 11 cities Reviews in 11 cities
4 helpful votes 4 helpful votes
'High Class Boutique Hotel'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 4, 2012 NEW

XV Beacon Hotel (Fifteen Beacon) is a luxurious boutique hotel on the top of Beacon Hill in Boston. Walking distance to shops, parks and restaurants (everything is walking distance in Boston), this hotel is situated 15 minutes from Boston Logan BOS Airport (approx. $22 taxi fare).
The hotel is a 1903 landmark building with the charm of historic Boston but with the comfort of chic, classic and modern facilities. With only 63 rooms in the entire hotel, XV Beacon hotel feels like a home away from home, with friendly and helpful staff at the front desk and concierge. Each room has a cozy feeling including your own gas fireplace. We have stayed at this hotel twice in the last five years and even during our recent visit the service and quality remains superior.
During our May visit we stayed in room 404 (which happened to be the largest suite on that floor) - each floor only has seven guest rooms. Opt for one of the Beacon Hill Studio's you won't regret it - including either a Queen or King Bed, gas fireplace, large flat screen TV, large sitting area, and fabulous bathroom.
One other great feature at XV Beacon is their complimentary in-town Lexus car service. The hotel has one Sedan and one SUV that can accommodate either 2 or 4 passengers. Service is available on a first come-first serve basis; however if you know you are headed somewhere specific during your stay you can pencil in your time and location with the concierge. This is a fantastic service since taxi's are not that easy to find in Boston, and not as affordable as they are in NYC. Be sure to take advantage of this service during your stay.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
Ask MM-TorontoTraveler about XV Beacon
This review is the subjective opinion of a TripAdvisor member and not of TripAdvisor LLC.

Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
JoyfulWriter
Chesapeake, Virginia
Senior Contributor
25 reviews 25 reviews
Reviews in 18 cities Reviews in 18 cities
26 helpful votes 26 helpful votes
'Kindness from a Doorman'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 29, 2012
2
people found this review helpful

This will be an unusual review since I've never actually stayed in this hotel. However, I believe I have something to say that will recommend this hotel as a great place to stay. First of all, it is beautiful, elegant and has a terrific location. But, that's not my story. My story has to do with an employee that went above and beyond the call of duty to a person who was not even a guest at the hotel. Here it is:

My husband and I were on a cruise ship stopping in Boston for a partial day port stop. It poured rain during our entire visit to Boston. We stopped on the sidewalk under the overhanging roof of the XV Hotel. We needed a moment's respite from the rain and also, I wanted to take a picture without getting my camera drenched. We spoke to the two uniformed doormen about this need and they were very friendly and said, yes, by all means, stand under the porch. With a laugh, I remarked that this was our one day in Boston and this (the rain) was our unfortunate introduction to the remarkable city. One of the doorman (whom I will call Mr. M in this account) very kindly said, 'Wait just a moment,' and went inside the hotel. He quickly came out with an umbrella which he presented to me (I'd not brought mine, hoping the rain would stop  it never did!).

I was overwhelmed with his kindness and immediately thought, this must be the best hotel in the city and what a friendly town  and certainly, this was the most generous and kind doorman I'd ever met. The umbrella, by the way, was a tremendous help to me as the rain started pouring more and more. I will never forget this kindness and I will always have good feelings for the town, the hotel and that thoughtful doorman. Thank you, Mr. M -- you know who you are.

The website for XV Beacon Hill tells how the attractive building is a 1903 landmark Beaux Arts hotel, located on the crest of Beacon Hill. I can attest to the fact that the location is excellent for sightseeing. It is a luxury boutique hotel and, I'm afraid, on the pricey side (at least for my pocketbook). While I would love to stay there, I don't foresee that happening. Regardless, I would recommend this hotel to those of you who can afford a wonderful, luxury hotel with kind doormen and a very short walk to the State Capitol and the lovely green Boston Common park.

Kudos to XV Beacon Hill Hotel and the very kind Mr. M!

    *

Less

'Sophisticated and cozy'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 20, 2012
3
people found this review helpful

Simply put, this is a sophisticated hotel in a great location with a wonderful staff. We stayed in a Beacon Hill Studio on the ninth floor, and it was fabulous. I admit to being a sheet snob, and very rarely do hotel sheets measure up for me, but theirs did. The fireplace and surround sound stereo added to the cozy and romantic atmosphere of the room. (There are controls for both next to the bed.) The marble bathroom with rain shower head was also very nice.

We were very pleased with our stay at XV Beacon and highly recommend it.
Less

RSL_03

9 reviews 9 reviews
6 helpful votes 6 helpful votes
'WOW'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 17, 2012
5
people found this review helpful

From arrival to departure, this was a WOW experience and we have been all around the world and have experienced it all.
Our stay last month at XV Beacon was absolutely wonderful from start to finish. (The cab driver at the airport said: Good choice of hotels!) We have recommended this boutique hotel to several couples who live in the area and visited us. They agreed that XV Beacon is the perfect place for their other friends, too.

Location: 10++ (20 of 10) - walking distance to everything and everyplace; rooftop patio is fantastic; nice exercise/spa area; close to many excellent restaurants, including Moo, where we dined for dinner and brunch, and met friends for cocktails several times  all were impressed
Staff: 10++ (20 of 10)  friendly, professional ,excited to be at XV Beacon; helpful
Concierges: 10++ (20 of 10)  friendly, professional, knowledgeable, interested in finding the perfect places for us and things to do and everyone was SO NICE and made us so comfortable
Decoration; artwork, furniture, fireplace, etc.: 10++ - The rain shower head is relazing and incredible, and the water pressure is so nice. The bed helped us slept like babies each night; the fireplace was comforting and warm; the entire room and hotel was decorated to perfection. In-house Lexus and driver: 10++ (20 of 10)  impressive; excellent and caring drivers; comfortable cars. Very nice perk for guests.
Housekeeping: 10++ (20 of 10)  SPOTLESS; considerate; professional; friendly, etc. LOVE the ability for us to indicate whether we needed or wanted housekeeping service. Very considerate feature that we appreciated.
Room comfort: 10++ Ultra QUIET ROOM on the back corner. The shower head is PERFECT.
Water pressure is AMAZING. Nice bathrobes, towels and linens. Also liked the vases in the rooms - which we filled with tulips from the local market.
We definitely will return.
MAJOR COMPLIMENTS: we arrived at about 6 am and were immediately welcomed cheerfully and then checked in and given a most-excellent room. That is amazing (most hotels sigh and tell their guests that check in is 3 pm). The staff is THE BEST, in a beautiful location and facility, and they all are so happy to be there.
Many thanks for making our vacation incredibly wonderful.
Less

'"This hotel holds the key to our hearts"'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 16, 2012
2
people found this review helpful

We have been privileged to stay in wonderful hotels all around the world for both business and pleasure but nowhere has enchanted us to the extent of XV Beacon. We went to New York last month and couldn't resist a train ride to Boston for Easter and a return visit. We had our favourite corner room, ate in the restaurants - Teatro and Sorrelina - owned by the same people who own the hotel and where we always return, and met up again with the wonderful Michael, Head Concierge and all his colleagues. This is a hotel where the staff really do care. They even tracked down a Newcastle football match that wasn't on the television back in England - how's that for attention to detail?! We "love them to bits". You will too.
Less

16 reviews 16 reviews
Reviews in 6 cities Reviews in 6 cities
7 helpful votes 7 helpful votes
'Great Place To Stay in Boston'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 7, 2012
1
person found this review helpful

My wife and I have stayed twice at this beautiful boutique hotel perched right at the top of Beacon Hill. The staff is very warm, friendly, and helpful  from the doormen who greet you upon arrival all the way through the concierge and front desk. The ever present availability of a free chauffeur driven car service is the icing on the cake. The rooms are very well appointed and the bedding in particular is great. If there is a downside to the hotel it is that few, if any, of the rooms have views of the nearby Boston Commons and Public Gardens, but that's pretty much par for the course in this area of town. If you want the views you'll have to stay at the Four Seasons which literally fronts the Commons and the Gardens.
Less

vanessakate
New York City, New York
Contributor
13 reviews 13 reviews
Reviews in 5 cities Reviews in 5 cities
5 helpful votes 5 helpful votes
'You have to pay for wifi'
3 of 5 stars Reviewed June 4, 2012 NEW

Le Meridien on Battery Street in San Francisco, CA is a very nice hotel. Nice hotel lounge and bar. Great customer service. The room was lovely. Well-decorated and spacious. But the room had not been thoroughly cleaned. There was a decent layer of dust by the fridge, mini bar, and bureau. If it hadn't been for proximity for a special event I would not have chosen Le Meridien on Battery. The one plus to the location is being steps away from the pier and farmer's market. On Sunday's many things were closed and you had to plan ahead before you came in for the night if wanted something else besides room service and the mini bar. The bone I have to pick with Le Meridien is that you have to pay for WiFi service. They charge nearly $13 a day. In a city known for it's tech sector I think it is absolutely outrageous that we would have to pay for WiFi. All of these things put together, I don't strongly recommend Le Meridien.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?

pinchivida
San Diego, California
Senior Reviewer
9 reviews 9 reviews
Reviews in 3 cities Reviews in 3 cities
'A Hotel for Everyone...'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed May 31, 2012 NEW

I recently stayed over Memorial weekend with my girlfriend for a romantic getaway and Le Meridien had everything we needed for our trip. The moment we drove our car into the Valet section we were greeted and helped with a smile. We arrived early to the hotel, around 11:30am and at first the receptionist told me there were no rooms available yet, but as my girlfriend went to the restroom the receptionist checked again and they had a room ready for me, which I thought was accomodating since the policy is not to check in until 3pm. The rooms were perfect size and although we were in a lower floor, never had noise disturbance. The rooms have everything a 4 star hotel has and the bed were so comfortable that we decided to stay the first night in around 7pm after sightseeing for a little bit and slept in until the next day. Did not get to eat at the hotel, since there are so many amazing options in San Francisco. Union Square is only a 15 minute walk or a $7 taxi ride and I truly recommend to walk up to Embarcadero and have breakfast or lunch there. If you get to stay at Le Meridien on a Saturday morning please do not miss The Farmers Market at Embarcadero and have the hand dripp Blue Bottle Coffee and a Prochetta Sandwhich from Roti Rori and start your day from there, you will not regret it. Also Chinatown is about 3 blocks away and Fishermans Wharf is only a trolley away from Embarcadero. And please if you have any questions or suggestions do not hesitate to ask the concierge, she was amazing!!!
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes

kristy805
Arlington, Virginia
Contributor
14 reviews 14 reviews
Reviews in 11 cities Reviews in 11 cities
12 helpful votes 12 helpful votes
'Great location'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 29, 2012
1
person found this review helpful

Le Meridien was a great hotel. The rooms were clean and spacious. The bed was comfortable and the room (rm. 1607) was quiet.

The staff was friendly. We were given free wi-fi during our stay, which is usually $12.95/day. We were upgraded to a bay/city view room. The concierge had great recommendations for dinner.

The valet was quick. Our car was always ready and waiting for us within 5-10 mins. of calling down for it.

We did not eat at or sit in the bar area but it always seemed like it was busy and fun.

This hotel is in the financial area. It seems like a lot of the businesses close early in this area, but it is close to other areas that do have businesses that stay open later. If you are considering this hotel, I wouldn't let that change your decision. This hotel really is in a good location.

Overall, I have nothing bad to say about this hotel. It exceded our needs and we would definitely recommend Le Meridien to family and friends.

    *
    *
    *
    *
    *
    *
    *
    *

Less

Summer701

12 reviews 12 reviews
Reviews in 6 cities Reviews in 6 cities
2 helpful votes 2 helpful votes
'Modern elegance'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed May 29, 2012

Great modern decor with an amazingly comfortable bed! Towels were terrible, which was my only complaint with the room. We ordered room service for dessert (chocolate chip cheesecake) which came up as regular cheesecake, which did not appeal to us. As they were apparently out of the requested item, the hotel was happy to replace it with something else or remove the charge, which I thought was good customer service. Hotel parking fee was $60+, so we changed our car rental to avoid paying that fee. Laura, at the concierge desk, was very helpful in recommending restaurants and mapping out transportation options to make it to our rental car facility in South San Francisco. We were happy with our stay there.
Less

Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
AnaCasanaSeattle
Reviewer
3 reviews 3 reviews
Reviews in 2 cities Reviews in 2 cities
'Bustling Lobby, Comfortable Room'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed May 28, 2012

We recently had a nice stay at Le Meridien, checking in on a busy Friday afternoon. It's a surprisingly small lobby for such a sky scraper of a hotel, but the reception was friendly and efficient. As some other reviewers have stated, being located in the Financial District makes for a fairly quiet neighborhood feeling in the evening and on the weekend. Nevertheless, I think for folks who enjoy walking, it's an ideal spot to hoof it over to the Embarcadero (the Ferry Building & Fisherman's Wharf), or wander up Market Street to Powell Street and Union Square. As I am a light sleeper, we requested a room in the upper floors, and we were very pleased, indeed, with our room which faced north (with views to the west and east as well). We could see the "Pyramid" building, spirals of churches in North Beach, Marin, and part of the Bay Bridge. The room itself was nicely furnished and the bed was very comfortable. The only critique we have is that no coffee maker was available in the room. Fortunately, there is a complimentary coffee and tea service (self-serve) in the lobby.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
Ask AnaCasanaSeattle about Le Meridien San Francisco
This review is the subjective opinion of a TripAdvisor member and not of TripAdvisor LLC.

NkNik75
Cali
Senior Reviewer
6 reviews 6 reviews
Reviews in 3 cities Reviews in 3 cities
5 helpful votes 5 helpful votes
'City was booked but luckily got a room!'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed May 24, 2012

We made late reservations to attend a Giants game on Bay to Breakers weekend and although this room was overpriced it was a nice hotel. I am an SPG member so I commonly stay at Westin's or W's but since they were both booked we thought we would try Le Meridian. Although I prefer Union Square this location was not bad. Our room was $400 a night which was overpriced but understandable because of the weekend. Staff was friendly and the downstairs bar enjoyable for a few cocktails. Upon check-in they asked if we would like a corner balcony which is a hard find in San Fransisco, and we gladly took it. Bathroom was huge and room a decent size. Decor nice and everything was clean and in good shape. We walked to AT&T park along Embarcadero which wasn't far. The price was high but I often see the room rates for this hotel and sometimes you can get a decent deal when everywhere else is pricey.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
Ask NkNik75 about Le Meridien San Francisco
This review is the subjective opinion of a TripAdvisor member and not of TripAdvisor LLC.

'Lovely Hotel, with a few things to keep in mind'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed June 6, 2012 NEW

I will start by saying this hotel is lovely. Its in a wonderful location, very nice decor and the staff is fabulous. Stayed 3 nights, check in took a little while (but we did get there early). Had a parkview room on the 10th floor, which was well appointed. As others have mentioned, Top of the Mark is PRICEY!! But the views are awesome, so its worth just taking a peek. An amazing surprise was the wine and card left in our room for our 10 year anniversary. That was unexpected and much appreciated. Connie at the front desk was wonderful. We found it really annoying that it costs $16 for 24 hours of WIFI. That should be included ... very nickle and dimed with that. They are also somewhat cheap with the coffee/creamer and sugar. We had to call twice in three days b/c they only gave one packet each time we asked. (each little pack contains a couple of creamers, 2 sugars and 2 sweet n lows). Also, I have to stress, the hills are BRUTAL!!! The location is super convenient, and walking downhill is fine, but uphill ... holy moley! Unbelievable torture is the only way to describe it. We were ill prepared for the strain on our calf muscles. So definitely do research and figure out your transportation, because its really tough walking up and down the hills. But aside from that, Nob Hill is a great area, and the architecture is amazing. Overall, the Intercontinental was a great hotel, with great staff and a few irritations that we easily overlooked. We would stay here again for sure!
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
See 4 more reviews by nickylove for San Francisco
Ask nickylove about InterContinental Mark Hopkins San Francisco

MangoChetney
Santa Rosa, CA
Senior Contributor
37 reviews 37 reviews
Reviews in 16 cities Reviews in 16 cities
25 helpful votes 25 helpful votes
'Top of the Mark is Like Frosting on the Cake!!'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 4, 2012 NEW

Had a two day business trip at the Mark Hopkins. Had not stayed here in many years. Check-in was very smooth and room 628 was fantastic. Nice size, quiet, and appointments -- superb bathroom with wonderful marble designs. Had lunch at the Top of the Mark. The Cobb salad and the view were one-of -a-kind on a clear day. No crowds at all. We held meetings on the Mezzanine level, along a with a meal or two - the service was very attentive. Location is great -- you can visit the Fairmont lobby for afternoon piano music and visit the Tonga Room for dinner, as we did as a group. Internet service worked easily (fee).All in all, they held their own with any of the other big hotels in town. I was very pleased overall. Beware the valet parking fee...standard at these hotels.
Less

'Poor management'
1 of 5 stars Reviewed June 2, 2012 NEW
2
people found this review helpful

I called them to book a room for the Golden gate 75th anniversary, and made my condition to have a room that has a view of golden gate bridge so I can stay in my room and watch the fireworks. Lady on the phone assured that I will get such room. When I checked in, I asked at the front desk to make sure I am getting the right room and again they assured me. When I entered my room, Golden Gate was not even in my range. It was totally on the other side. No one took the responsibility for ruining my day. I traveled all the way to enjoy the fireworks that happens every 25 years but it got messed up. I will never recommend anyone to go in there. If they cannot even keep their promises then what is the reason for selecting such a brand name hotel. It sucks.

Smithy87
Surrey
Senior Contributor
41 reviews 41 reviews
Reviews in 31 cities Reviews in 31 cities
62 helpful votes 62 helpful votes
'Overnight stay'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed May 24, 2012

We only stayed here for one night pre-cruise and this is an opinion based on the few hours we were in the hotel. It is certainly an imposing building in a wonderful location. We were cruising with Regent Seven Seas and their staff were at the hotel to look after us (figuratively speaking). The reception staff were very helpful on check-in and later in providing a map and advice about getting to Union Square. The room was of medium size without any decent views from the window. Our view consisted of rooftops and backs of other buildings! The beds were super comfortable and the bathroom very well appointed. The room itself was the usual bland international hotel style that we have experienced all over the world. However we were jet lagged and only there for one night and the room provided all we needed for our short stay.

The Top of the Mark dining room/bar has fantastic views over San Francisco. The food was good, so was the service. Less good was the 'gatekeeper'. Other reviewers have noted the long wait for a table. Our request for a table for two was met with a 'we don't have any, you will have to wait'. How long? 'Probably 20 minutes, maybe half an hour'. Two other people offered to share a table and suddenly the ice melted. Quite a crowd built up in the lobby while we were having our meal.

Breakfast was in the Top of the Mark. Usual buffet selection - no egg station but the food was good and well presented.

Although our stay at Mark Hopkins was very short we did enjoy the experience.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
Ask Smithy87 about InterContinental Mark Hopkins San Francisco
This review is the subjective opinion of a TripAdvisor member and not of TripAdvisor LLC.

CAFOtt
Ottawa, Canada
Contributor
17 reviews 17 reviews
Reviews in 7 cities Reviews in 7 cities
3 helpful votes 3 helpful votes
'Hotel with a view'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed May 16, 2012
1
person found this review helpful

We booked the Mark Hopkins hotel for the San Francisco portion of our honeymoon. The location is prefect on Nob Hill, close to Union Square shopping, China Town, great restaurants and amazing views. The view from out hotel was worth the price, and room was well appointed. Service was good at the hotel, the staff were helpful and knowledgeable about the city. The cleaning staff were great, I saw first hand that they bring each room clean glasses and coffee mugs, they don't just wash them in the sink like most hotels. Our cleaning staff always refilled our coffee station. What was disappointing about the hotel was the lack of free Wi-Fi. I can't remember the last time I stayed at a hotel that did not have free Wi-Fi. Also, booking over their website did not work and I ended up having to call the 1-800 number to make my reservation. Overall, the price is worth it if you are looking for a hotel with a great view in a prime location.
Less

VirginiaTraveler014 has 1 more review of Columbus Motor Inn

    *
      'Clean, cheap, convenient!'
      4 of 5 stars Reviewed August 19, 2010

VirginiaTraveler014
Lynchburg, Virginia
Top Contributor
62 reviews 62 reviews
Reviews in 30 cities Reviews in 30 cities
28 helpful votes 28 helpful votes
'Great, clean, convenient place to stay with FREE parking'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 5, 2012 NEW

This was our second stay (last time was August, 2010) and it hasn't changed. Our room was clean, had a safe, and the bathroom was spotlessly clean and had a great shower with lots of hot water and a sink outside of the bathroom to ease our morning preparations. The flat screen TV was nice but we only watched it for the weather as we were out and about in our very short stay in SF (off to Northern California). The hotel is very close to North Beach, Chinatown, and Fisherman's Wharf. While this would not be considered a luxury hotel by anyone's standards it fits my 5 star requirements (and I have stayed in many so-called luxury hotels that didn't meet my standards): clean with furnishings in good shape, all of the amenities, quiet room with a comfortable bed, near excellent places to eat, a friendly and helpful front desk staff, and free parking (almost unheard of in San Francisco where you can pay up to $40 a night for the "privilege'). There is no fancy lobby but I think in all of our travels (and we tend to do a major trip for pleasure at least 4 times a year) I have sat in the lobby 3 times. I believe the key to getting a quiet room here is to reserve well in advance and state your preferences. I asked for a room on the same side as "Bimbo's" as we were there during an evening when a performance was occurring and there was really no disturbance whatsoever (my husband is a very light sleeper and he slept like a log) (there is a cute view of the apartment building next door and the "pocket garden" which is very tranquil). The view from the room was incredible--Coit Tower, San Francisco skyline (including TransAmerica building) and there was NO street noise. I could be wrong, but our room was either 305 or 307. For breakfast you can walk up Columbus to La Boulange or one of the authentic Italian cafes (we go to La Boulange because my husband LOVES their granola with yogurt). We ate lunch (on our way in from SFO) at the Beach Chalet which is at the entrance to Golden Gate Park and across from the beach (down the street from the Cliff House) and had a wonderful meal theremy husband a salad with Ahi Tuna and myself a Crab Louis salad with the sweetest Dungeness crab meat and a super champagne or chardonnay vinaigrette dressing. This time around we ate dinner at Sotto Mare on Green Street just up the street from the hotel and highly recommend it if you love good seafood in an unpretentious atmosphere with fairly reasonable prices. My husband had sand dabs (a sweeter flounder) and I had prawns--yum, yum.

In conclusion I would DEFINITELY stay here again and I highly recommend it to anyone looking for the things that make a great stay for me. We really enjoyed our stay and hope you will too!

    *
    *
    *
    *
    *
    *

Less
Was this review helpful? Yes

Little Italy was a few blocks up.
Gladly recommend this motel to anyone!

4 of 5 stars Reviewed June 2, 2012 NEW

Lovely clean accommodation in a great location. We had a room on Columbus and yes there was noise but only when I was awake. It didn't disturb anyone's sleep. Walking distance with a 4 and 5 year old to Fishermans Wharf, Alcatraz Ferries, Pier 39 and the Cable cars. We were in room 315 and had views of Coit Tower and Alcatraz. Kenato

50 reviews 50 reviews
Reviews in 33 cities Reviews in 33 cities
58 helpful votes 58 helpful votes
'Good Hotel, Convenient Location and FREE Parking.'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed May 25, 2012
4
people found this review helpful

We stayed for three nights around mid-May 2012. We had specified in our reservation that we wanted a quiet room not on Columbus and despite a late in the day arrival, that was just what we got. Concern about the night vlub next door quickly evaporated the first night when all was quiet. Rooms are large and have the normal fittings expected in hotel. TV must have been about 40" Real perk was the free parking which we needed until we returned our rental, this has to save at least $40 per night from what I could see from other holets. Three or four block easy walk to Fisherman's wharf one way and a similar distance up Columbus to find some great Italian restaurants.
Would certainly recommend.

Problem with this review?
cryjack
Houston, Texas
Reviewer
3 reviews 3 reviews
Reviews in 3 cities Reviews in 3 cities
3 helpful votes 3 helpful votes
'the price is right'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed May 20, 2012
2
people found this review helpful

On our most recent trip to SF, we wanted to stay in North Beach like we always do. But we didn't want to spend a lot of money. And, because this was the start of a road trip, we had to contend with having a rental car. Enter the Columbus Motor Inn.

Their parking lots (I think there were two) are located under the inn. It's a tight fit, but what a great deal to have free parking in the city. If the lot off Columbus is full, take your first right along the side of the inn - there's another small lot down that alley.

The rooms aren't anything special. We didn't have the balcony that so many other reviews mention - if I were to stay at the inn again, I'd probably try to figure out how to get one of those rooms (we stayed in a King, so maybe that's the difference). Didn't have an issue with noise at night, even though we were right on Columbus. All the wine at dinner might have helped.

Great location, easy parking, cheap cheap cheap.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
Ask cryjack about Columbus Motor Inn
This review is the subjective opinion of a TripAdvisor member and not of TripAdvisor LLC.

JL706
Rising Fawn, Georgia
Reviewer
4 reviews 4 reviews
Reviews in 3 cities Reviews in 3 cities
7 helpful votes 7 helpful votes
'Great place to stay'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed May 19, 2012
6
people found this review helpful

We stayed here for 4 nights in May 2012. The hotel is in a great location within walking distance to many attractions in San Francisco. My wife and I like to walk so for us China town and the wharf were within easy walking distance. Our room was on the second floor with a balcony that overlooked Columbus Street. We did notice some street noise but it was not loud enough to prevent a good night's sleep. The rooms are clean and the staff is very helpful with directions and recommendations. We had a rental car so the free parking was great. Some of our more enjoyable activities while in San Francisco are listed below.

1. Muir Woods
2. Golden Gate Park
3. Crossing the Golden Gate Bridge on bikes. You can take a ferry back to the Warf. Check for discount coupons for rentals.
4. The Cable Car Museum.
5. Walking and riding the Warf area.
6. Breakfast at the Hollywood Caf near the wharf.
7. Dinner at the Fog Harbor Fish House at pier 39 on the wharf.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
Ask JL706 about Columbus Motor Inn
This review is the subjective opinion of a TripAdvisor member and not of TripAdvisor LLC.

jaggerbomb
Calgary, Canada
Contributor
11 reviews 11 reviews
Reviews in 7 cities Reviews in 7 cities
22 helpful votes 22 helpful votes
'Thank you Hilton!'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed June 6, 2012 NEW

It was my 24th birthday and I had to decline a trip to SFO due to unaffordable costs for a hotel during fleet week. It seemed as though every room in SFO was selling for double the regular price.

My gfs surprised me by paying for the room at the Hilton - which shows that you can get an affordable room right by Union Square!

The hotel serves it's purpose, it's a comfortable room with views of the city. Location is amazing! just a block away from Union Square!

Service by the hotel staff is also terrific.

Another plus? Starbucks in the building! I'd definitely stay here again.
Less

ChiTraveler59
Chicago, Illinois
Senior Contributor
22 reviews 22 reviews
Reviews in 14 cities Reviews in 14 cities
5 helpful votes 5 helpful votes
'Excellent Hilton by Union Square....'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 4, 2012 NEW

Had a very nice stay at this Hilton the other week - very clean, updated rooms that while slightly on the small size (but not bad for San Francisco) seemed as they were renovated just 24 hours ago and are very very nice - The only negative I have is that the wifi was down for a few hours that evening but it was quickly restored....I'd definitely stay here again if in the area...

Note though that this is a BIG hotel and if you are looking for something more on the boutique scale this isn't it - Also this is more in the Tenderloin district than Union Square but no big deal and easily walk-able to just about any place you want

Also - ate at Jaspers just across the street at O'Farrel and Taylor and it's a good alternative to the in-house gastropub with decent pricing and a good selection of food and beers!
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes

DLPG
Northville, Michigan
Reviewer
5 reviews 5 reviews
Reviews in 3 cities Reviews in 3 cities
2 helpful votes 2 helpful votes
'Good Choice'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed May 31, 2012 NEW
1
person found this review helpful

Booked this hotel via Priceline and got what I thought was a fair price. Kind of concerned about it after reading some of the reviews but we ended up with a nicely refurbished room in Tower 3. Not very big but adequate. Staff were (contrary to the reviews) very nice and always helpful. Location was great - close to BART, cable cars, trolleys, bus lines and reasonable (for SF) restaurants. Health club was much better than the average hotel. Didn't eat there (Hotel food is usually bland and expensive). Only complaint was the occasional noise from the hall - walls seemed to be thinner than normal. I'd definitely stay there again.
Less

Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
MJH038
Chapel Hill, NC, USA
Reviewer
3 reviews 3 reviews
Reviews in 3 cities Reviews in 3 cities
'Four stars with some tarnish'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed May 31, 2012

Recently, I spent 4 nights at this hotel. It is a 4 stars hotel, conveniently located in downtown San Francisco. Generally, I was satisfied. However, there are certain things that can be improved. The hotel advertises free wireless high-speed internet which is deceptive, since they do not tell you that it is free only in the lobby. In the room they charge $12.90 per day, which I consider quite steep. Other hotels in the vicinity offer free room internet. I would have not booked this hotel had I known that room internet service is for pay. It was even more irritating, since two weeks before coming I inquired in an e-mail to the hotel about the cost of internet. To this day the hotel did not bother to respond. Internet in the lobby was working fine though the environment was quite noisy. The problem was to find a clean table. Starbucks coffee shop had a couple of tables for their customers, however, people were leaving empty cups, napkins and trash across the lobby. Particularly in the morning hotel needs to clean the tables of trash., coffee stains and crumbs more frequently. Yet one more comment. Every morning the guests find in front of the door USA Today newspaper which is nice until you read the Welcome folder given to you with you room key which on page 3 states that you are charged $0.75 for this service. The room rates are not cheap. Do they really have to charge for internet and newspapers?
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
Ask MJH038 about Hilton San Francisco Union Square
This review is the subjective opinion of a TripAdvisor member and not of TripAdvisor LLC.

Problem with this review?
Ashley S
1 review
'Good overall- would recommend'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed May 31, 2012 via mobile

We ended up in this hotel after a name your price Priceline deal. Very happy upon arrival. Beautiful lobby and friendly staff. Were given an upgraded room since it was our first anniversary. Wish we would have known about the newly remodeled rooms because the decor and furniture was not up to par when I think of Hilton. Recommend parking in one of the multiple public garages nearby to save $30+ a day in hotel parking fees, however; you are downtown and will have to deal with bums harassing you for money.

Overall pleasant stay. They should consider offering free wifi in rooms and not just the lobby. Would stay here again.
Less

NYTravelerOlney

17 reviews 17 reviews
Reviews in 8 cities Reviews in 8 cities
2 helpful votes 2 helpful votes
'Solid Hilton experience'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 30, 2012

Our first visit back in a year. Front desk welcome was great and departure was the same. Not sure if Starbuck's was in the lobby last year but it was a plus for the morning. Hotel is going thru a renovation but you would not know it as they have isolated the section under renovation. The hotel has an activities desk and we bought tickets for a Double Decker bus tour , the closest pickup was nearby at Union Square and we had a great tour. Lot's of deli/convenient stores in walking distance and tons of places to dine. A good hotel to base yourself from ( they also have rental car agencies across the street )..
Less

shari610
Princeton, New Jersey
Top Contributor
54 reviews 54 reviews
Reviews in 28 cities Reviews in 28 cities
76 helpful votes 76 helpful votes
'Felt the hospitality like I was back in time...'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 6, 2012 NEW
2
people found this review helpful

Sharing reviews is what I do, some people don't like them as I speak the truth, especially as I speak from the heart. It has taken me a few days to get the exact wording for this review. I wanted to be able to capture all of the products I used , remember all the people involving my trip and the whole overall experience. I can't go into full detail why things were extra special, but I can say, they just were over the top. Starting with Monika, who was just married( and I pray has a long and blessed life), to wonderful. Ray, who took over care of my family and made my stay the most memorable one for me and my niece who will never forget this hotel or visit to NYC . That was my goal. This hotel is located literally steps away from Times Square, the NYPD, and all of the delights of NYC. We did a full circle that lead us back to our hotel. The suite was amazing. The bathroom big enough to move. Being handicapped they placed special bars for me in the bath to make it easier to get up and out, ( who does that). There were plenty of towels, shampoos and robes, never had to call and ask for anything. The beds were so comfortable I actually slept through the night, something I haven't done in years. They also had special pillow types. From the doorman Steven , to Jeff. And all the other staff, but especially RAY... I recommend this hotel with a 10 star rating and wouldn't think of staying anywhere else in NYC.
Less

Problem with this review?
AandD2012
London, United Kingdom
1 review
'Wonderful Hotel'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 6, 2012 NEW

This was our first stay in New York and we chose the Casablanca because of a personal recommendation. We are so glad we did! The location, just off Times Square was perfect.
The room was a good size, nicely decorated and very clean. (It's not a high rise hotel so there is no view from the window to speak of, however).
The staff are exceptional - always smiling and eager to please. The lounge is an absolute haven of peace from the noise of Manhatten. The breakfasts, evening cheese and wine, and the all-day snacks and drinks are excellent. Obviously, you have paid for all of this in the price of the room, but worth every penny. We would have no hesitation in staying here again if we ever come to NYC.
Less

'Perfect!'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 5, 2012 NEW
1
person found this review helpful

The Casablanca totally deserves it's No.1 position on Trip. I booked direct and from my first enquiry through to check out the staff at The Casablanca were professional, helpful and cheerful, nothing was too much trouble and they took pleasure in making our stay a pleasurable one.The hotel was spotlessly clean, Rick's Cafe provided a fresh and plentiful breakfast with a good choice of breads, pastries, cereals and fruits, the 24/7 refreshments were great and the cheese and wine reception was a lovely touch. Rooms were tastefully decorated, the bed was comfy, housekeeping was excellent, bathroom was classy and the shower was big with a powerful and hot water supply. Reception staff were fantastic and they along with all staff should be congratulated on representing the hotel so well. Well Done guys!

'Our Normal New York Hotel'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed June 4, 2012 NEW
1
person found this review helpful

My wife and I have stayed here three times and just love it. We done the large high rise hotels and the tiny boutique hotels and this is right in the middle. The location is excellent, the staff fantastic, and the second floor lobby and day-long snacks and treats wonderful. You meet a lot of nice people hanging out in the lobby, and it is a much more personal experience. Several good hotels are within walking distance, and the Times Square is next door. Highly recommend this. The rooms are modest, but comfortable.

'Exceeded Our Expectations!'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 4, 2012 NEW
1
person found this review helpful

We chose to stay at the Casablanca because it was ranked #1 on TripAdvisor, so the bar was set quite high. The hotel was flawless! The location was great...50 steps from Times Square. The room was a good size for a New York hotel, nicely decorated and very clean. Rick's Cafe provided a peaceful retreat from the madness of Times Square. This was all very good, but the staff was exceptional! They did everything they could to ensure our stay was pleasant - the welcome when we arrived, providing assistance with directions, the best way to travel to our destination, obtaining tickets. We never saw the housekeeping staff, yet our room was always clean. It was like they watched to see when we went out, then came in to clean. To sum it up in a single word, this hotel is EXCEPTIONAL!

Vespiti
Alken, Belgium
Senior Reviewer
6 reviews 6 reviews
Reviews in 2 cities Reviews in 2 cities
2 helpful votes 2 helpful votes
'Coming home in New York'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed June 3, 2012 NEW

Hotel Casablanca is top to stay if you are looking for a hide away in the middle of all the vibrant action in New York. The staff is most friendly and helpful, breakfast tastes really good and the happy hours in Rick's Caf are a real treat after an exploration in New York.
We stayed in a standard room which is small but with a spacious bathroom. Rooms are clean but a bit 'dark'. The beds are small both in width as in length.
The ambiance is relaxed and you can reload your batteries here before jumping into the streetlife again. Big thank you again to the staff !
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes

Euroedmus
Prague, Czech Republic
Contributor
20 reviews 20 reviews
Reviews in 16 cities Reviews in 16 cities
36 helpful votes 36 helpful votes
'I highly recommend the Setai, but still a few negative moments to mention'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed May 29, 2012
1
person found this review helpful

I will start with a statement: this could be far the best hotel in NYC. I can not compare it to many others, I had a chance to stay at Trump Int only, but I was impressed with the extremely warm and efficient attention from the entire team at Setai.

We had a long trip from Europe with a 5 y.o. kid and although I had to wait in line to do check-in (one person was trying to help some guest while another one was typing something on his computer...not a great welcome sign to your guests) and nobody greeted me on arrival except bellboys (huge credits to everyone!) I can not fault our overall experience.

The suit I booked through LHW was huge (but no kitchen as mentioned in some other reviews...). It overlooked Fifth Ave and was very clean, large and well appointed. This is so different compare to Trump Int.! But I was not very happy with a fact that there was no bedding prepared for our son (it was clearly stated in my reservation that we are 2 adults and 1 kid) so he slept with us in one bed (we were too tied to spend time solving it on arrival). No special attention to LHW members, no upgrade (but I do not complain as we are not fancy about such things).

What I liked the most was the honesty and clearness in what is offered: in-room refreshments and internet are free and it is made clear to you when you make reservation and it makes you feel like a real guest. I appreciate the honesty of including such details in the price of the room instead of charging you extra for water or anything else (so annoying sometimes). There is no alcohol in the minibar though...I guess you need to order it? There were no instructions on it anywhere...

Hotel's location is somewhat in the middle of nowhere, but you can easily walk to all major sights. It could be a problem for those coming from small towns or those being in NYC for the first time, but we did not find it difficult to walk anywhere.

Food: Breakfast was absolutely fantastic. In room dining too. I loved the food. BUT, I would expect a bigger choice for vegetarians and those who prefer organic food. They failed to offer us any of the juices I asked for (even water melon...) and I found it strange for a hotel trying to market itself as a 5 star hotel. Could be because hotel does not have its own restaurant but the one being attached to it is servings hotel guests (that is how I understood the concept...). There seem to be some confusion in orders and we had something missing every time we placed an order for in-room dining (we rarely went down to the restaurant for breakfast, etc.). I think restaurant and housekeeping should have some better system on how to cooperate and communicate properly.

No issues with housekeeping.

Overall, this is a very nice property. Great staff. I highly recommend the Setai.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
Ask Euroedmus about The Setai Fifth Avenue, a Capella managed Hotel
This review is the subjective opinion of a TripAdvisor member and not of TripAdvisor LLC.

See 8 more reviews by ryanj31 for New York City
ryanj31
Orlando, FL
Senior Contributor
24 reviews 24 reviews
Reviews in 13 cities Reviews in 13 cities
26 helpful votes 26 helpful votes
'Skip the Setai'
2 of 5 stars Reviewed May 29, 2012
4
people found this review helpful

We visit NYC regularly and usually stay at one of the other luxury hotels in the area. After reading some reviews which placed the Setai atop the hotel world in New York, we decided to give it a try.

I'm not sure what the guests who commented so favorably experienced, but it was nothing like our experience. Also, I'm going to review this room as compared to other five-star hotels in NYC. And also given that the rack rate for a Studio Suite is $745 a night... (although AMEX got us a much better deal).

The lobby is very small and unimpressive. Check-in was delayed because the room wasn't ready (at 5:45 p.m.). The front desk personnel graciously offered us free drinks in the lobby bar while we waited. However, we needed to move fast because we had a 7:30 reservation at Daniel.

The room still wasn't ready at 6:40, so my GF had to change in the spa... Certainly not ideal.

When we did get back to the room to check-in, we noticed what looked to be drips of blood going from the carpet near the bed out to the mini-bar. Gross! We called the front desk and, rather than move us to a different room, they sent someone up to disinfect and clean the spots (they referred to them as 'coffee', yea right. I've never seen bright red coffee before).

There was a large tear and hole in the bedsheet. The bed was billed as a 'king' but was not. A queen at best. They initially offered only two pillows, but we had more brought to the room.

The room itself is large, but with a bunch of wasted, empty space. Minimalist doesn't begin to describe it. Emptiness is perhaps a better descriptor?? Bathroom was great. Expansive and lots of marble.

The 'personal assistants' offered by the hotel (branded name for 'concierge') were very nice, but useless. I've read other reviews where they forgot to give a wake-up call or didn't make a dinner reservation, and I couldn't believe it at a hotel of this supposed stature. But sure enough, that's exactly what they did to us, on more than one occasion.

Also, you can rarely get them on the phone. Many times the phone would just ring, with no answer. What is the point of selling a '24-hour personal assistant' when you can't get them on the phone for 23.5 of those hours??

The Bar on Fifth was nice. Great place to relax and have a drink. Fitness center was decent too.

However, all-in-all, we both agreed that we would never stay at the Setai again. It's off the beaten path, nice people but terrible service, especially in concierge and it's just not worth the money given the number of high-quality hotels in much better locations in the city.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?

Traveldennis
Fountain Valley CA
Contributor
13 reviews 13 reviews
Reviews in 11 cities Reviews in 11 cities
29 helpful votes 29 helpful votes
'A good choice but not quite great'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed May 27, 2012
3
people found this review helpful

Stayed here for one night before a cruise and strictly on the merits of TripAdvisor reviews. Beautiful hotel with large comfortable rooms for NYC. Loved the bar area with great bar food and drinks (although at $16 for cocktails, it is no bargain). The only issue we had was with the Dux bed would you believe. I have never slept on one and was excited that this was a feature of the hotel. It is basically a box spring with a thick mattress pad. Not exactly the cloud 9 experience we were expecting. But other than that, the room was very modern with a wonderful bathroom and high tech features. Another real bonus was the free mini bar amenities including a wonderful coffee machine and free bottled water. The price point here is definitely on the high end but the staff makes you feel welcomed and comfortable.
Less

declosetgeek
Singapore
1 review
1 helpful vote 1 helpful vote
'Not the cleanest hotel I have been to...'
2 of 5 stars Reviewed May 24, 2012
1
person found this review helpful

My husband & I stopped over in NYC for 3 nights and we got a suite studio in Setai. We were very disappointed in the following areas:
- I am allergic to dustmite and I am positive that my rooms have dustmites. I provided feedbacks and hope that the management made an effort to clean up the room. Considering the amount that we paid for the room and this is supposed to be a top hotel, I don't think dustmites are acceptable.
- The bed is too low and uncomfortable to sleep in. There are no spare pillows to make the sleep more comfortable. Accompanied with the dustmites, I did not manage to sleep much in my 3 nights.
- The furnishings looks good but the quality of the fixtures are not as expected. The toilet bowl is choked on our second day that we are there, the water pressure in the shower is too little which make showering difficult and the water pressure in the washing basin is too strong which cause the water to be splashed all over.

While I can understand that the occasional hipcups on the water pressure and toilet do happens, the cleanliness of the hotel affected the quality of my stay adversely. While I admit that I am "wow" initially by the huge room and the minimalistic design, the cleanliness really bothered me a lot. I hope they will put in more attention in the house-keeping area.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
Ask declosetgeek about The Setai Fifth Avenue, a Capella managed Hotel
This review is the subjective opinion of a TripAdvisor member and not of TripAdvisor LLC.
AnneMauriceDOS, Director of Sales at The Setai Fifth Avenue, a Capella managed Hotel, responded to this review
May 27, 2012
Dear Guest,

Thank you for your feedback regarding your recent stay with us. Once we received your comments, we surveyed the accommodations in which you stayed in. We can confirm that dustmites were not located.
We regret that you did not find our Duxiana beds comfortable. They are reknown to provide the ultimate sleep experience and adapt to any required lumbar support.
Our Italian wood found throughout the hotel, Calacatta marble and Grohe bathroom fixtures are among the finest furnishings and accessories.
We have noted your comment regarded the water pressure which was caused by work being done by the City of New York.

We truly value your opinion and hope to welcome you back in the future. I remain at your disposal if I can ever be of any assistance.

Sincerely,

Anne-J. Maurice
Director of Sales & Marketing

    *
      'Good experience and pleasant surprises'
      4 of 5 stars Reviewed December 22, 2010

scoredonu
Sacramento, California
Senior Contributor
29 reviews 29 reviews
Reviews in 16 cities Reviews in 16 cities
20 helpful votes 20 helpful votes
'2nd visit lived up to the 1st'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 6, 2012 NEW

There are two types of companies. Those who rely on their previous success and gradually let their performance faultier and those that continue to improve despite past success. The Distrikt clearly is in the latter category.

The one bad mark against them has always been the neighborhood which far from bad isn't free of its problems. Examples some bums, a porn shop, the parole board. However, since my last visit two years ago the neighborhood is changing. A new bar Beer Authority has taken over the corner of 8th and 40th offering a nice watering hole for guests of the Distrikt.

In summary, this once bad mark is slowly getting better.

The Distrikt staff remains its biggest strength. Friendly and welcoming every time my family entered or left the hotel. The room was always clean and comfortable. The hotel is centrally located for those who will spend much of their nights going to the theater.

Amy's Bread a great bakery is close by as well which is always a plus.

Overall great hotel.
Less

It is very good to have the newspaper and the weather every day.
Our room was on the 32nd floor with view on the Empire State Building, and what a pleasure to see it every night before going to sleep.
I really like the iced tea after warm days of walk.
Don't hesitate to go there, the advises are true and you won't regret it.
Again thank you to the staff who made everything easy and perfect during our stay, we will come back here for sure.

KyleGuernsey
Guernsey, Channel Islands
Reviewer
5 reviews 5 reviews
Reviews in 3 cities Reviews in 3 cities
17 helpful votes 17 helpful votes
'One year on and still excellent'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 5, 2012 NEW

I wrote a review of this hotel having stayed here last year and having now just returned from my second stay here I thought I would provide an updated review.

Having enjoyed my stay here last year, when booking this years trip, I dealt with the hotel directly to make the booking. The 7 nights stay was booked very quickly and I was given the choice to pay at the time of booking or at check in, this gave me the opportunity to keep an eye on the exchange rates secure the best rate I could when paying.

We arrived at the hotel and through the front door, it was good to be back. We were immediately welcomed to the hotel. There were a few guests in front of us, so we had a little wait, but nothing too long. Our suitcases were taken to the side for us whilst we waited. Whilst waiting, it was evident that the professionalism and level of service had not changed as the guests before us were being dealt with quickly by the very helpful front desk staff.

I am happy to report that the hotel is still as excellent as it was a year ago. When our turn to check in arrived, we were welcomed back, this being our second stay at the hotel. The staff member checking us in was very polite and processed us quickly asking if we needed anything, like a map of the city etc and was quite surprised when I said I still had a map from a trip some 3 years ago.

With door key in had we were ready to head to the room. Heading to the lift, we were asked if we needed assistance with our luggage, but having only small cases, we were happy to take these ourselves. Into the lift and heading to our room.

This year we were staying on 24th floor, in a City View room, the room was the same size as our room last year, which was on the 16th floor, this time we had a view of the Hudson from our window. I really like the rooms at this hotel, they are a decent size and very comfortable, with excellent amenities. The addition of the coffee/tea machines in the room is a plus, though I still prefer the fresh coffee in the lobby each morning.

The staff here are still very professional and always seem happy and nothing is too much trouble, whether that be asking for directions or making a reservation at a restaurant. The staff always have a smile and a welcome back / enjoy your day as you pass through reception.

The staff seem to be very proud to be a part of what makes the Distrikt Hotel such a special place and welcome comments about what is good / bad about a guests experience. This can be seen when a guest last year commented about not having coffee / tea facilities in the rooms and within a day or two every room had a machine.

Overall, I have had yet another excellent stay at the Distrikt and cannot recommend this hotel enough. I do not usually make return visits to hotels, but having had two excellent stays here, this is a hotel that I will not hesitate to return to, so much so that I am already planning next years trip.

If you're looking for a decent hotel in Manhattan, that offers a bespoke service, has excellent rooms, excellent staff and a great location, then this is it.

The hotel is still highly ranked here on trip advisor and that has to say something about the quality of this hotel.

This is a great hotel, which gives a level of service and experience that in my opinion you just don't find in a lot of hotels especially ones part of big chains.

If your thinking about staying here, do it, in my opinion, you won't be disappointed.
Less

We're glad you enjoyed our Keurig coffee/tea machine, a relatively new addition to the room amenities. We do believe the details make a difference so we're very happy to know that your stay was enhanced due to them. Thank you again and we look forward to speaking with you again for your third stay! Take care until then. Best wishes from the entire Distrikt Team.

Really enjoyed this trip and I would defo recommend this hotel to anyone looks for a great place to stay in NYC.

Wendy C
Cape Town Central, South Africa
Contributor
11 reviews 11 reviews
Reviews in 3 cities Reviews in 3 cities
'The best of everything....'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 6, 2012 NEW

I had spent some time reading hotel reviews on Trip Advisor before deciding to stay at the Elysee. We couldn't have asked for more. The service was efficient and friendly without being intrusive; our room was elegant, comfortable and super clean. It really did seem that a lot of thought had gone into the interior decor of the hotel generally and there were nice touches like the library where one could sit quietly and read. There was an atmosphere of friendly calm everywhere - an absolute delight. Just a tad noisy at night because of the air-con 'machinery' outside at the back of the hotel. We remedied this by sleeping with windows shut with the air-con on (it was quite humid). On reflection it might've been quieter taking a room at the front of the hotel, which we will do next time. In any event, it didn't spoil our stay which was wonderful.
Less

Problem with this review?
MCH93
Piedmont, California
Senior Reviewer
6 reviews 6 reviews
Reviews in 6 cities Reviews in 6 cities
4 helpful votes 4 helpful votes
'Best hotel in NYC!'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 6, 2012 NEW

I saw Hotel Elysee listed in a guide book as the most romantic hotel in NYC, so I decided to give it a try. My husband and I planned booked one of the most basic rooms that they offer, since the fancier rooms were beyond our budget. Several days before we were due to arrive, I received both a phone call and an e-mail from the hotel asking if there was anything that they could do to make our visit more enjoyable, such as arrange for tickets to a show or attraction, etc. How perfect that they reached out, because in fact there were two things that I was hoping for but had not yet made the effort to contact them about. How much I appreciated that they were proactive! One of my requests was to have a bottle of champagne on ice for us when we arrived, and the other was that I had been unsuccessful in obtaining tickets to the WTC Memorial and was wondering if they were able to assist. They took care of both of my requests immediately - they gave me a tip on the WTC tickets (which worked out, so we were able to go), and they had the champagne on ice waiting for us when we walked into the room. They also upgraded us to a beautiful suite that was larger than a lot of apartments in NYC! Amazing service and very welcoming.

The hotel is charming and lovely - traditional decor, beautiful bathrooms, and beautiful stenciled artwork on the walls in the hallways and stairwells. They offer complimentary breakfast and complimentary wine/cheese/snacks in the evenings. It is a great location, right in the heart of midtown and close to the subway. It was a good value for the money, particularly when you factor in the breakfast and the wine hour.

We didn't care for the Monkey Bar that is part of the hotel - we found it to be outrageously overpriced and nothing special. We also wouldn't bring our children to this hotel - it is more sophisticated. It was luxury without snobbery. The staff was very service-oriented and professional. We were sorry to leave, and we will definitely be staying at the Hotel Elysee again!
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes

Problem with this review?
Retired068
Cotswolds
2 reviews
'In line with expectation ?'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 5, 2012 NEW

My wife & I have just returned from a 5 night stay at the Hotel Elysee which was chosen on the basis of the consistently favourable ratings awarded on this website. We were not disappointed - the quality of both accommodation & service exceeded our high expectations. The front facing room on the 14th Floor was excellent with the added, but unexpected, bonus of a balcony. Traffic noise was not an issue - we live in a quiet lane in the English countryside ! Staff in all departments were friendly, courteous & helpful. The quality of the continental breakfast was high & the 'club' style lounge an ideal environment in which to enjoy not only this meal but the complimentary beverages & cookies that are available throughout the day, together with the early evening wine & 'nibbles'. The hotel location is ideal - accessible to, but away from, the frenzy of the 'tourist centre' of the city, close to the subway & handy for Central Park. We will stay at the Elysee again when we revisit New York
Less

'PERFECT LOCATION, PERFECT HOTEL'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 27, 2012
2
people found this review helpful

We just returned from our third stay at our our favorite little New York hotel. The moment we arrived and were welcomed by the staff, we were so pleased that we had chosen this property again. We arrived very early and were invited to have coffee in the beautiful room on the second floor where complimentary breakfast, tea, and cocktails are served throughout the day. This little gem has the feel of a small intimate European hotel.

Our room was very comfortable and well appointed. We slept very well in our ninth floor room and we were not bothered by any noise.

The property is located on E. 54 street; between Park and Madison; perfectly situated for business, cultural events, shopping and dining.

We spent three nights in the hotel and can't wait to book our next trip.

'First Class!'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 25, 2012
1
person found this review helpful

We have just returned from a 5 night stay at the Elysee. I wanted a small, gracious hotel with a good location, and that is exactly what we got! The breakfast was lovely, excellent fruit, breads and service, in a very relaxed setting that allowed you to linger if you so chose. The wine, cheeses and snacks in the afternoon were also a welcome diversion after walking the day away.
The service was competent, friendly and quiet. We will return when next in the city.
Less

1 helpful vote 1 helpful vote
'Great hotel; great service'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 21, 2012
1
person found this review helpful

My husband and I stayed at this hotel for two nights, in part to celebrate our anniversary. We were given an upgrade when we mentioned our anniversary to the staff, and our room was beyond lovely. It was quiet, spacious and elegant. We enjoyed our time in in the hotel very much. In addition that, the staff were so kind. I called the front desk in total frustration at 1:00am, as we had spent over half and hour trying to hail a taxi, and were seemingly stuck downtown. Instead of hanging up on me or laughing at me, the gentleman at the desk gave me great advice on how to best find a cab, as well as a pep talk. When we finally made it back to the hotel, he then offered me some candy. Now that is service! We are really looking forward to staying at the Hotel Elysee again.
Less

'A great place in the Village'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed June 2, 2012 NEW

Spent a few nights here on vacation in NYC visiting friends. The room is pretty basic but had most all the basic amenities you would want AND included breakfast downstairs. Very friendly owner and employees who made us feel at home. And of course the little kitty Charlie who followed us around and slept on our bed for a couple of hours. Made us homesick for our 2 kitties. Will certainly return. Walking distance to the Village, High Line walkway, stores, shops & subway stop right down the corner.
