CalBear76
Oakland, California
1 review
'Love at first Sight'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 2, 2012 NEW

What can I say that hasn't been said already. CPI is as charming, warm and welcoming as the staff. Birthday weekend for my beau, from Frisco Bay. After countless searches for the perfect hotel that was budget friendly with a NY flare, and hospitality being extremely important to me, I found CPI.

It was sold out at the time of inquiry; thanks to popularity, May graduations & summer travel. Something told me to keep checking daily because when your heart desires something, you go for it. And sure enough, one day, the dates opened... thank you sweet karma.

Thank you Al, the first to greet us, so accommodating with our check-in/payment arrangements. A special shout out to Jubel, who greeted us coming & going with a genuine smile, great conversations and really made us feel so welcomed as if we were old friends.

And there's Charlie. The special kitty that came into our room at 5am when my boyfriend & I had a spat that evening. He came onto the bed, slept between us and stayed until we realized how silly we behaved. And as if his job was done, left regally out of the room.

Thank you CPI. You made our trip special.
Less

Keith B
Boston, Massachusetts
1 review
'Friendly and Fun'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 2, 2012 NEW

My partner and I could not have been happier with Chelsea Pines Inn. The stay started with the helpful and friendly staff, one person taking our bags up the flights of stairs to our room while another took the time to go thorough the area's restaurants and attractions. Our room on the back of the building was amazingly quiet, with a comfortable bed and surprisingly spacious bathroom. The room was typically small for a New York Inn, but really had enough space overall. I would not hesitate to recommend them.

Problem with this review?
hornsfan01
San Antonio, Texas
1 review
'What a hidden gem'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 1, 2012 NEW

Chelsea Pines Inn is a great quirky little hotel in the middle of a Chelsea street. The inside lobby is clean and modern. The rooms are an adequate size (I might have had to squeeze to get around the foot of the bed but it was never really any problem) but the beds are big and comfortable. The best part are the people running the place: Jay and Al were immensely helpful and pleasant and really made us feel at home. Everyone else from those running the front desk to those keeping the break area stocked (and it was always stocked with fresh items and little snacks) was absolutely courteous, professional, and happy to just chat about how things were going. Although the rooms are up some flights of stairs, the people working there moved our luggage for us. The noise from the street was never a problem, and I never heard anyone in any of the other rooms through the walls. The location was perfect for seeing local sights, and I have to agree with others here who say that the High Line is a must-see.

I would feel comfortable recommending this to anyone I knew, and I know they would come back raving about what a great place this was.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes

AmpneyCrucis
Mission Viejo, CA
Reviewer
3 reviews 3 reviews
'A hotel that's like coming home -- only better!'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 31, 2012 NEW

My week-long stay at the Chelsea Pines in May 2012 marked my second visit to this charming boutique hotel near the Meatpacking District, High Line Park, and Chelsea Market. This is a very personal establishment; every member of the staff team relates to each guest not just as a patron customer but as a friend. This personal touch really pays dividends when you come inside the door, morning noon or night, and you are greeted warmly with welcoming conversation (and the staff has the sense to leave you alone if you appear to be hungover or otherwise under the weather). The festive atmosphere is contagious such that all the guests feel like included family, and the breakfast room and deck leading outside give travelers a place to come together and share their experiences. The all-day breakfast room, by the way, is a real highlight with the thoughtful inclusions of the complete gamut of what a Continental breakfast can be: Nespresso machine, a smorgasbord of teas and other beverages, luscious fresh fruits, high-end yogurts, sumptuous breads and pastries, imaginative cereals, even peanut butter (a personal favorite). I also like the fact that one can use the hotel's refrigerator to stash a bottle of wine or nosh. The establishment's silver screen theme is amusing and entertaining (i.e., in which movie star's room are you staying? Sophia Loren's or Rita Hayworth's or Albert Finney's or ??) All in all, this place is unique, distinctive and memorable, and I look forward to coming back again and again.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
See 2 more reviews by AmpneyCrucis for New York City
Ask AmpneyCrucis about Chelsea Pines Inn
This review is the subjective opinion of a TripAdvisor member and not of TripAdvisor LLC.

Problem with this review?
dulang723
Santa Rosa, California
1 review
'Home away from home'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 31, 2012 NEW

I have stayed at Chelsea Pines Inn 4 times. Each time, I feel more welcomed and at home. The folks who run CPI couldn't be kinder, more helpful, and better conversationalists. Having said that, if you want privacy, you've got it.

And who can resist sitting on the back patio in good weather having a 'many-options' breakfast, reading the paper, and hearing the birds sing (yes, this is NYC!). The Inn is very clean and well run. And for those of us who miss our pets when we travel, Charlie Chaplin, the resident cat, helps fill that need.

Finally, the location is fabulous. At the end of the block is the subway. The Highline (a 1.5 mile walk) is a couple of blocks away, as is the Hudson River. Small neighborhoods like Soho, Greenwich Village, and Chelsea, to name a few, offer unique shopping opportunities and are a short walk away.

You get a very different picture of what NYC can be like staying at the Chelsea Pines Inn: friendly and slower paced yet all the things you want to do are easily accessible.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
Ask dulang723 about Chelsea Pines Inn

CarolineArizona_11

Reviewer
3 reviews 3 reviews
Reviews in 3 cities Reviews in 3 cities
2 helpful votes 2 helpful votes
'Location, Service, Quality'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 31, 2012

I've visited New York a lot, but this was my first time to stay in the Chelsea/West Village neighborhood, and I LOVED it. Our room was small but immaculate, great bed, bath with toilet cubicle separated from the shower area. The highlight was the service, including encouragement to walk the High Line (a highlight of our visit) and help in getting reservations for the 9/11 memorial. Breakfast was VERY upscale continental, similar to what you get in a 3-star Italian hotel. Each person who helped us, from the owner, Jay, to the people who cleaned and maintained, had only one intention: warm hospitality. We were there as part of a Big Birthday celebration, and hotel staff helped family members surprise us with wine and chocolate-covered fruit. It's totally convenient to the subway, bus, and walkable to West Village and Chelsea, and even beyond. It was expensive, but fair market value for New York in that season.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes

Buben
Washington, DC
Top Contributor
58 reviews 58 reviews
Reviews in 37 cities Reviews in 37 cities
157 helpful votes 157 helpful votes
'Nice hotel, but too shabby chic for me . . .'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed June 1, 2012 NEW

I travel frequently to NYC for work, and have stayed at this hotel a few times in the past few years. My work colleague who travels even more frequently loves this place, and will not stay anywhere else. He finds it incredibly homey. I am not as much a fan. The style is cluttered -- overstuffed sofas that look "lived in" in the lobby, "distressed" wooden floors, chintz coverings. Sort of what you might find in a well-cared for English country house on PBS. I like minimalist design, and this is the opposite of that. In addition, there are times when the prices are upwards of $700 per night, which seems too crazy, even if it's on the company's dime. A few perks -- all snacks in the well-stocked mini-bar are free (which leads one to binge on tasty free chocolates), and there are full size shampoos, conditioners, moisturizer from trendy Red Flower in the bath. The Tribeca neighborhood is great -- lots of nice restaurants nearby.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
See 15 more reviews by Buben for New York City

Mark H
London, United Kingdom
Senior Reviewer
6 reviews 6 reviews
Reviews in 6 cities Reviews in 6 cities
3 helpful votes 3 helpful votes
'catering issues'
3 of 5 stars Reviewed May 28, 2012

I love this area of Tribeca as i used to live nearby in the 1990's. This quirky hotel has a suitably downtown vibe; all the rooms are different with the decor carefully designed to appear to have been thrown together with inherited furniture etc and the employees all seem to be 20 something chaps , all effortlessly neat,stylish and meaning well ( but not all that experienced in the tricky business of running a great hotel.) There is a great , dimly lit pool with a japanese feel in the spa. My main problem with this slightly expensive wondrousness is that it uses the next door restuarant , locanda verde for its catering and it doesnt open till 8 am which is useless for business travellers. The staff offer to get coffee/ food before then but they either forget whos responsibility it was to get it from the restaurant or the restaurant forgets etc. also, the lounge tables arent suitable for eating drippy poached eggs from ( they are knee height) and it all seems a bit of a bother for the staff. Overall then, a fine place to explore downtown from as long as you are not an early riser and as long as you realize that there is no catering that is owned by the hotel onsite.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?

'One of the best hotels in NYC and truly amazing restaurant'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 17, 2012

I cannot fault this property. The hotel is an exquisite luxury boutique and my personal preferred style- elegant but a mix of rustic European with stunning hardwood floors/beamed ceilings, colorful furnishings. Tribeca is also one of the best areas of NYC- cobblestone streets, great restaurants and shopping downtown. Laconda Verde is also one of my favorite restaurants in the city. If you can afford to stay here, do it! You will have a wonderful time.

mrsmaxernst
Chicago, Il
Senior Reviewer
7 reviews 7 reviews
Reviews in 8 cities Reviews in 8 cities
7 helpful votes 7 helpful votes
'I could live in that room'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 7, 2012
2
people found this review helpful

And eat all my meals at Locanda Verde. Staff is extremely helpful (boxed up and sent a package for me) and warm. The room was beautiful, with lots of books and light and an excellent bed/sheets and pillows. The room is better than it looks on the website. Good bathroom and toiletries. And lots of candy on all surfaces. Not sure about that one. Good location not far from shopping or wandering around in Tribeca, Soho, Greenwich Village. Subway stop not far. The spa is beautiful. In addition to my favorite restaurant there are good cocktails, and there is a private "drawing room" and patio in which to relax or order your meals from Locanda Verde. Very quiet. No hallway noise, and even if there was, there is a second door to shut off the hallway. The windows shut out all street noise. This is my new hotel standard.
Less

La Coron W
Melbourne, Australia

3 reviews 3 reviews
Reviews in 2 cities Reviews in 2 cities
3 helpful votes 3 helpful votes
'Outstanding'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 5, 2012
2
people found this review helpful

I cannot 'rave' about this hotel enough! The moment you walk through the door you feel comfortable. The staff are extremely professional and are happy to help with anything. We ended up extending our stay and even though the hotel was booked out initially they did their best to find us a room. The hotel describes itself as feeling more like someone's 'home' and that is exactly how it feels! There is such a warmth about it. The courtyard is nothing short of utterly beautiful. The drawing room is completely relaxing- especially with the log fire. They have used the space in the rooms well - I initially thought the rooms would be small but they are surprisingly large! The restaurant Locanda Verde is very good and has a great buzz. I will be returning to NY and this is the place I will go to.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes

Problem with this review?
Poulain2012
Sydney, Australia
2 reviews
5 helpful votes 5 helpful votes
'Utterly fantastic!'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 4, 2012
2
people found this review helpful

This hotel is utterly outstanding. I've spent a lot of time in hotels in NYC and The Greenwich Hotel is now, without a doubt in my mind, the best. I'm pretty picky when it comes to hotels, but this one was almost flawless to me. It oozes charm, warmth, cleanliness, individuality, credibility and style, and most importantly provides in abundance; a sense of genuine care and respect for it's guests. It's not the cheapest hotel esp. if you want a slightly larger room, but you cannot help but feel you are paying for superb, maintained quality and complete attention to detail.

From the moment I walked in and was greeted by the fantastic reception staff, then met the attentive and friendly bartenders to whom I chatted with during lunch at the bar in Locande Verde, I immediately knew I had made the right choice to book a room and looked forward to two great nights of comfort and relaxation at this truly beautiful hotel. The doormen in particular are so charming and friendly, in a down-to-earth manner and they do their job to perfection.

The eye for detail at The Greenwich is wonderful. In the rooms the extensive free mini- bar (minus alcohol) and gratis large basket of candy and snacks are a great and welcome change to the norm; the bathrooms were luxurious, spotless and the quality and size of the excellent toiletries again were very welcomed and enjoyed. (Note: they even have a plastic zip lock bag for travellers to use for liquids in airports  the attention to detail here is really quite admirable). The beds were great and linen superb quality. My only gripe was the queen bed seemed pretty small and pillows a little on the thin side. But next time I will just book a king room and just request an extra pillow or two.

The private residents bar is another welcome feature and overall I would highly recommend this hotel. I look forward to returning to stay again.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
Ask Poulain2012 about Greenwich Hotel
This review is the subjective opinion of a TripAdvisor member and not of TripAdvisor LLC.

max_umami
San Francisco, California
Senior Reviewer
9 reviews 9 reviews
Reviews in 7 cities Reviews in 7 cities
5 helpful votes 5 helpful votes
'Not a luxury comb-over'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed June 6, 2012 NEW via mobile

I was conflicted - the only Trump-branded places I've stayed at before were styled by what seemed like a grandmother on acid. Gold/gaudy. I was tired of staying mid town for work so took a chance and, based on Trip Advisor reviews, booked the Trump SoHo. It was great - contemporary, compact rooms. Great lovation in SoHo. Good service. I didn't eat there but hotel restaurant menu seemed decent. The one annoyance was elevator service. More than once, there was long line to use elevators. It's possible there were events going on upstairs, though no one in my car stopped at those floors. It seemed like they just under spec'd number or elevator speed.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes

'Great NYC hotel, but downtown location'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed June 4, 2012 NEW

Enjoyed the hotel. Service was great and attentive. From checkin to follow ups, to pool service. The service was always very graceful. Pool area was small (its NYC after all) but nicely done. I thought the pool was nicer compared to what I imagined. Rooms were nice. The chocolates and cards offering wisdom were a nice touch. Would stay again. Will check out International Hotel and Tower at Central Park next time because I do think the location is not optimal for most tourists.

Problem with this review?
Mario0355
Miami, Florida
1 review
'Nice Place to Be in NYC...'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 4, 2012 NEW

Trump SoHo is the best hotel I have stayed at in NYC. The location is great, away from the big tourist areas and walking distance from SoHo,the West Village and Tribeca. A very world class property with contemporary decor.. I travel a lot through JFK and the Trump Soho is only a short 35-40 miniute ride using the Airtrain & E train subway. The subway station is a half block away and is faster than a car from JFK especialy during rush hour. Try it once and you will be hooked. Don't forget to pack a swim suit the pool deck on the 7th floor is realy nice place to relax if you get tired of the city.

    *
    *
    *
    *
    *

Less

person found this review helpful

I've stayed at the Trump SoHo on 5 occasions now and this was my first trip in with my kid. The hotel had a special "Family" promotion with lower rates and a rollaway bed and breakfast which made it perfect for a weekend trip to the city.
One of the best hotels in New York City and THE most comfortable bed in a hotel room you will probably find.
Service was spot on as usual and front desk is probably best in NYC as well.
Highly recommended.

'Worst Ever!'
1 of 5 stars Reviewed June 2, 2012 NEW
6
people found this review helpful

After 3 hours delay and 8 hours flight from Spain i arrive with my family and a 9 month baby to the Soho Trumph Hotel at 11pm. We had late arrival so we should have the rooms and everything was paid, what was our surprise when we arrived to the reception desk and they sold our rooms... AMAZING! nothing to say, nothing to do, just shut up and move to other Hotel at 1am.

We had travelled around the world in every kind of hotels from 6stars to hostels and this first time ever happens, and in a place called Trump SoHo NY even worst.

If you plan to visit NY and you had book in this Hotel, make sure they have your rooms and they dont sell it to other client... Good luck and take care.


Juan Segui

Been in Trumph Soho Hotel 18th, 19th and 20th of May 2012
After the inconvenience we move to the Palace until the 27th and we had a great time in NYC

Buben
Washington, DC
Top Contributor
58 reviews 58 reviews
Reviews in 37 cities Reviews in 37 cities
157 helpful votes 157 helpful votes
'My favorite downtown NYC hotel'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 1, 2012 NEW
2
people found this review helpful

I have stayed in NYC multiple times in the last few years for work, and I have stayed at the Trump Soho at least 10 times. My most recent stay was in May 2012. This is an excellent hotel. One tip: if you book through the website, you can select an option to receive an upgrade to a suite based on availability for an additional payment per night (which turns out to be far less than the cost of booking the suite). I have gotten upgraded every time I requested it through the website. The suites are a real treat -- particularly the bathroom -- where the tub looks out a window. I have always had excellent service from the front desk and the staff. The only slight downside is that it has a slightly "corporate" or "generic" in terms of design. While everything is very luxe, it's not cutting edge design.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes

CocoaBean
Hershey, PA
Senior Reviewer
9 reviews 9 reviews
Reviews in 8 cities Reviews in 8 cities
10 helpful votes 10 helpful votes
'Wowie Wow Wow!!!'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 31, 2012 NEW
2
people found this review helpful

I've stayed at many Manhattan hotels and have generally been overwhelmed by the price and underwhelmed by the lodging. I expected the same from the Trump SoHo. However, from the minute my taxi pulled up to the hotel to the time I left, I was pleasantly surprised over and over. The doormen who greeted us were smiling, friendly and acted as though they truly enjoyed their job. Check-in was quick, with the attendant asking me if I'd like a complimentary bottle of water (yes, of course!).

The room was spectacular! Even though I was only on the 11th floor, I still had a fine view. Bathrooms, bed mattress, linens, towels...everything was spotlessly clean and top notch. Bathroom amenities included shampoo, conditioner, body wash, body lotion, shower cap, sewing kit, qtips and mouthwash. My favorite thing of all was the hair dryer. It was a Barbar dryer (never heard of it before). My hair never looked better. I'm buying one of those hair dryers pronto!

Turndown service was automatic and put the final touch on an excellent experience. When I returned to my room in the evening, there was soft music playing. The drapes had been drawn and a fresh pair of slippers placed at the edge of the bed. A square of dark chocolate and a fresh bottle of water was left on the nightstand. ANOTHER bottle of water and a filled ice bucket were left on the wet bar.

The level of service at this hotel was just so refreshing. And, greatly appreciated after a day of meetings and travel. I'll be calling this my little SoHo oasis from now on.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?

valzerrin
1 review
'Great Service & Great Hotel'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 30, 2012

I really only write reviews when we fall in love with a hotel.
The number one thing to write about is the service. The concierge was very helpful and accommodating. I know this is the service you are paying for, but they went above and beyond. We were very happy with our stay and felt like we coming home each night. The hotel itself is very beautiful. We were on the 14th floor - suite with an amazing view. Breakfast each morning was very healthy and amazing!!! Pool area is nice with an outside dining area as well.

Bar at night was fun for pre-drinks and celebrity watching :)
The hotel car drivers were very nice and accommodating as well.

We happened to go to the Wilshire and Santa Barbara as well to dine. Four Season Beverly Hills was def. our favorite out of the 3. It's very quaint.

For Dinner we went to:
Cut - It was delicious of course and we got to meet Wolfgang Puck. I didn't see fish on the menu but was available if you asked for it. Make sure to have reservations

Madeo - Food was delicious here as well. Have a drink at the bar first and make sure to have reservations.

Red O - We love Mexican food so this was a great pic. They have tons of Margarita choices. Tamales and pork sope were good appetizers. The crab and shrimp enchiladas were amazing. My husband had chicken and beef tacos I believe. They were like Fajitas

The Ivy - This was actually our favorite food out of all them. We asked for a reservation of course. Make sure to get the homemade tortillas with guacamole. The fried chicken was good. I had the grilled salad with scallops that was amazing. The fried chicken was better :)

The house car will drive and pick you up at all these locations :)
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
Ask valzerrin about Four Seasons Hotel Los Angeles at Beverly Hills
This review is the subjective opinion of a TripAdvisor member and not of TripAdvisor LLC.

If you have seen any of my prior emails you'll note we share all reviews with our employees and I know they are going to love it!

If your travels plans bring you back to Los Angeles, do not hesitate to contact me directly.

Warm regards,

Austin Watkins
Director of Sales & Marketing

Tones_Camille
Sydney, Australia
Senior Reviewer
10 reviews 10 reviews
Reviews in 6 cities Reviews in 6 cities
5 helpful votes 5 helpful votes
'location and rooms good, service absolutely outstanding. Wonderful, welcoming staff for whom nothing was too hard.'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 25, 2012
1
person found this review helpful

On the basics the Four seasons is fine: the rooms are clean, well maintained and comfortable. Reasonable size, but not massive. Expensive, but not crazily so. Bar is fine. Restaurant ditto. So all good, but not fabulous.

What's fabulous is the service. The staff really, genuinely do far, far more than they need to to make your stay special. They spent hours organising and re-organising flights for us, and helping us dissect all the various restaurant options in the area (and their recommendations were great). Organising a taxi to collect us from a long walk ten miles away, on the dot of 9.30 in the morning, without really being asked was sensational.

It's worth every cent. We'll stay there next time we're in LA, no doubt at all.
Less

Senior Contributor

Reviews in 14 cities Reviews in 14 cities
12 helpful votes 12 helpful votes
'Great Hotel with Great Service'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 22, 2012
2
people found this review helpful

My sister-in-laws and I were her for a weekend getaway. It was as good as it gets. The hotel is beautiful and clean. The staff is wonderful in all ways. It was like not having to do anything for yourself. You mention it and they will take care of it. We used the driving services and they were prompt and fabulous. We had spa services which were excellent. The spa facilities are relaxing and very accommodating. Everything was just good, the exercise room had some of the best equipment. The pool and jacuzzi were beautiful with flowers all around. I just can't say enough about how pleasant it was to stay here. If you get a chance to visit this area I would recommend giving this hotel a try. We did not have any problems, but I know that If you are not happy with something just tell them and if they can make it right they will. If you like a good, luxurious, clean hotel with wonderful service then this is the spot for you.
Less

Bullzfan
Port Richey, Florida
Senior Contributor
41 reviews 41 reviews
Reviews in 14 cities Reviews in 14 cities
14 helpful votes 14 helpful votes
'Service is essence of this luxury refuge'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 9, 2012
5
people found this review helpful

On our recent stay in LA we picked the Four Seasons in part because of its location in a peaceful residential area within walking distance of Rodeo Drive and surroundings and within a short drive to so many of our planned coastal visits. We also picked it because of the value of this hotel relative to other top-tier LA hotels. All that proved true when we arrived, however, we found that the thing that separated this hotel from the pack was the personable service that was attentive to every need and want wthout being fawning While I've stayed at finer facilities, I have never been treated better. The staff remembered our name and made us comfortable at every turn. A particularly nice feature is the house car limousine service which provides a comfortable magic carpet to local shopping, restaurants and sights. We also enjoyed tremendous treatment at the spa. The only negative we experienced were interminably slow elevators. A small price to pay for a truly elegant, enjoyable and restful experience.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes

nicci_ritchie
Coalville, United Kingdom
1 review
'A pleasent hotel in NYC'
3 of 5 stars Reviewed June 1, 2012 NEW

We booked this hotel based on a recommendation. The staff were friendly, the hotel was quite & clean. The continental breakfast was excellent and the wine and chees during the week was much appreciated. Short walk to subway & midtown attractions.

We had to upgraded the room as soon as we arrived as the allocated room on the 5th floor was small, dark & only had one double bed for 2 female tourists. When we have been to USA previosly the Queens are 6ft wide & Kings are 5ft wide. In UK, Queens are bigger, in US Kings are bigger hence why all the confusion here. We moved to a room with 2 king-size beds & balcony on the 11th floor. It was WOW! but we did have to pay the extra fees as there was no jesture of goodwill from the management for the confusion.
We found the frosted glass panel on the bathroom door a slight shock at first, but it did not cause a problem. Would be quite happy to stay there again but would look at other hotels in this price range for a top floor room.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
Ask nicci_ritchie about Hotel Giraffe
This review is the subjective opinion of a TripAdvisor member and not of TripAdvisor LLC.
HotelGiraffe, General Manager at Hotel Giraffe, responded to this review
June 4, 2012
Dear nicci-ritchie,

Thank you so much for choosing the Hotel Giraffe. We are delighted that you enjoyed your stay. We also thank you for your feedback and for giving us this opportunity to share some information with the TA community. For international travelers, you might wish to be aware of American mattress sizes: A Full or Double Bed is--54 x 75 inches (137 x 190 cm), a Queen Bed is 60 x 80 inches (or 153 x 203 cm) and A King Bed is 76 x 80 inches (or 198 x 203 cm). The room you booked had one Queen bed (our most affordable room) and the room you ended up with, which we were lucky to have available is a deluxe room with 2 Full size beds (our most spacious and highest priced non-suite room).

On our website and our booking engine, we offer this bed size information on the description of each available room type. We also include the bed size in the name of the room. We also offer photos and floor plans so that travelers can feel confident that they know exactly what they are booking. While we do not charge extra for double occupancy, we do charge extra if travelers prefer and select a larger room or a suite.

Regarding the bathroom door, the hotel was designed by a wonderful and innovative architect and interior design team, Stephen B. Jacobs and Andi Pepper, who won awards for the softly contemporary Hotel Giraffe design, however we can certainly appreciate that on occasion, some guests are not absolutely comfortable with the translucent door. We are always more than happy to paper the door for a guest on request to make them feel more at ease. I am sorry if you were uncomfortable even for a moment and I only wish we had known so that we might have resolved that for you while you were still in house. Perhaps, because you mentioned the issue here, we will have the opportunity to extend that service for one of our future TripAdvisor guests.

Please do let me know personally the next time you are coming to NYC as I would love to help you select the ideal room and high floor to suit your needs. We hope to have the pleasure of welcoming you back soon. I can be reached directly at peter@hotelgiraffe.com.

Sincerely,
Peter Velk, General Manager
Report response as inappropriate
This response is the subjective opinion of the management representative and not of TripAdvisor LLC.

Problem with this review?
Pumpkintraveler
Houston, Texas
1 review
'Very Enjoyable Stay'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed May 31, 2012 NEW

We booked a suite and enjoyed the cleanliness of the rooms, the amenities and the friendly service. The location and the breakfast were excellent. Our only disappointment was the diminished privacy, in that the living area of the suite faced an air shaft and looked directly and closely into some office buildings. There were only shades and it was very dark with them down. It would have been nice if there were some sheer drapes to mitigate the fish bowl feeling. Same with the bedroom. There were only shades and you could see into the office buildings across the street. Sheers would have been helpful so that we didn't feel so self-conscious, yet had natural light in the room.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes

Problem with this review?
tripperUK27
Stratford-upon-Avon, United Kingdom
Reviewer
3 reviews 3 reviews
Reviews in 3 cities Reviews in 3 cities
'Great Place to Stay in NYC'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 30, 2012

Just returned from a week in New York, staying at the Hotel Giraffe.
It is an excellent small hotel in the heart of the city. Very central for visiting all the main sites, and easy walking distance to many of them. Whilst it is situated on busy Park Avenue, it is a very calm and quiet place to relax inside the hotel. A simple but nice breakfast is served in the lobby....(as is a free cheese and wine event each day from 6:00pm to 8:00pm...a very nice touch). A fairly small but pleasant roof garden is open for evening drinks.
I would definitely recommend this hotel.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?

amp94596
walnut creek, ca
Senior Contributor
42 reviews 42 reviews
Reviews in 21 cities Reviews in 21 cities
114 helpful votes 114 helpful votes
'A Great Value, Staff and Comfortable'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 27, 2012

I have traveled regularly to NYC for several decades at all budgets. It is frustrating to try to find a place that is quiet, comfortable, spotless, with a great staff, updated and efficient for less than the cost of my monthly house payment. I think the Giraffe delivers on all of these. Too many well known hotels are simply noisy, a little frayed around the edges, have just OK staff. I can endure any of those things, but what is really bugging me these days is how hotels offer an attractive basic rate but then get you with service fees for everything. At the Giraffe all the basics are included. For example you will read numerous posts about the nice breakfast in the morning, the wine and cheese at night and then later cookies. I appreciate the free papers (NYT, WSJ) and free WiFi as well as little things like two free bottles of water in the room. (By comparison, I was just at the W in San Francisco and they charge you $4 a bottle in the room!). The beds and linens are extremely comfortable. Bedside is an iPhone docking station. The closet actually had enough space for my wife and I to hang everything for 4 days. We had 2 chairs for sitting in the room and plenty of space to move around (it was a King)
The staff was always pleasant and friendly. They all seem to really enjoy their jobs and working at the Giraffe. I will certainly return.

This is a comfortable hotel. It isn't a hip, boutique experience. There were many people from Europe, all ages and families.

The hotel can book a car service to JFK for $77 including fare, tax, tip. A cab can easily run you $55 and wont be as comfortable or ready for you.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
See 6 more reviews by amp94596 for New York City
Ask amp94596 about Hotel Giraffe
This review is the subjective opinion of a TripAdvisor member and not of TripAdvisor LLC.

Meridith M
San Diego, California
Reviewer
5 reviews 5 reviews
Reviews in 4 cities Reviews in 4 cities
'Decent in an average way'
3 of 5 stars Reviewed June 5, 2012 NEW

The hotel was perfectly fine. No real complaints, except that parking is $24/night. I was only there for one night so it wasn't an issue, but this will add up awfully quickly for a family trying to stay here on vacation. There was nothing wrong with the hotel, but I give it an average rating because I generally expect a Westin to be a little higher end in room finishes and ammenities. The hotel felt like a perfectly decent business-class hotel, but nothing more special than that. That said, we drove to LA for the day and just needed a decent place to stay for the night, and this worked well for that and we were able to get a good rate ($100) for an LA hotel.
Less

'Good Room for a Quick Stay'
3 of 5 stars Reviewed June 2, 2012 NEW

We stayed at the West Los Angeles Airport for less than six hours on our way to Kauai in April. We arrived at the hotel approximately 1:30 in the morning and we found the person at the front desk very friendly. The bed was very comfortable. We had to be back at the airport at 7 a.m. We used the free shuttle to and from the airport and we found the drivers to be very nice and helpful. The hotel is only a few blocks from the airport, so it is a great place to stay if you have a layover in LA.

'Not what I excepted from a Westin'

'High $$$ low Class'
2 of 5 stars Reviewed May 29, 2012

Overpriced hotel for what you get. Bed was nice and clean, sheets and mattress were comfortable. Everything else in the room cost you money. Bottle of water was $$$. Wireless was $12.99. Feeling of the room was cheap with skimpy # of towels, no robe, and plastic water glasses.

Service was poorly staffed. Only two people at the check-in desk at peak check-in time which meant a long wait. No one to help you with your bags.

Overall quality: not what one would expect from the Westin line of hotels.

My advice go to a "lower end brand" of hotel also on Century Blvd. where you can get the same level of service, free wifi and a free breakfast for fewer $$$.
Less

See 4 more reviews by JennShio for Los Angeles
JennShio
California
Senior Contributor
39 reviews 39 reviews
Reviews in 17 cities Reviews in 17 cities
119 helpful votes 119 helpful votes
'Great Stay at the Westin LAX!'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed May 29, 2012
1
person found this review helpful

I, along with my husband and 10 year old daughter stayed at the Westin LAX for a seminar 5/24 - 5/27/12. We stayed in Room 1021 on the 10th floor.

We parked at the front of the hotel and left the key with the valet while we checked in. Self-parking is $24.75 per day, Valet parking is $33 per day. There's also a parking tax of $1.00 per day.

The spacious room had a king size bed, two night stands with lamps on each. The bed had great pillows and blankets. Theres a sofa that can be converted into a sofa bed, an ottoman, and another side table and a floor lamp. Along the left side of the room was a long table section, starting with the coffee station with Starbucks coffee, a table lamp, desk area, telephone, and a flat screen TV, 3 drawers, a mini bar refrigerator, and more shelving. There's a tray of snacks that will be charged to the room if you eat any of the snack items. You do get one complimentary bottled water.

The mini bar refrigerator is called refreshment center, and there's a big sign that states 'Please make your selection carefully; any item removed from the refreshment center will be automatically billed to your room. Removing items from the refreshment center to store personal belongings will incur a $25.00 cleaning and re-stocking fee.' I had requested a mini refrigerator and unfortunately, none were available. So Isabel, who checked me in, gave me permission to empty out the refreshment center, so I can use it free of charge. Be careful because there are sensors and if you move anything, your bill will be automatically charged. So these charges showed up on my statement, and I had to go to the front desk to get them removed.

There's a large mirrored closet with an iron, ironing board, electronic safe, and two luggage valets.

The bathroom has a lot of counter space with one sink. There's a vanity mirror, hair dryer, tissue, and plastic cups. Toiletries include white tea aloe shampoo & conditioner, body wash, body lotion, two white tea aloe soaps in the shape of a leaf, and mouthwash. The shower had good water pressure,

Hanging on a hanger in the bathroom is a super soft white Westin robe to use during your stay. I requested two more, so we each had a robe.

In the rooms, high speed internet access costs $12.95 per day for 1.5 MB (email, web browsing), and $15.95 for 5 MB (streaming video, downloading.) You were given a roaming code so you can get wi-fi anywhere in the hotel. Unfortunately, every time I tried to enter my code, it didn't work. There's free wifi in the lobby for 45 minutes.

They have an outdoor pool and whirlpool on the 3rd floor. Hours are 6am - 10pm. It's a rectangular pool with depth ranging from 3 feet to 4 feet.

There's also a fitness room on the 3rd floor open 24 hours. It includes treadmills, cross trainer, stationary bikes, free weights, and weight stations.

If you don't want to eat at the Daily Grill restaurant, local places within walking distance are Taco Bell across the street and Carl's Jr. to name a few.

Before my stay, I contacted Heather Repinski in the Sales department at the Westin LAX. And she was able to offer me free wifi in my room, as well as a discounted self-parking rate of $10. This was fantastic, so I really appreciate Heather offering this!

As a Gold Preferred Guest, you get extra perks; you get to choose either bonus starpoints, free in-room internet access, or a complimentary beverage. Other Gold benefits are you get are 3 Starpoints per US dollar spent, which is a 50% bous over Preferred, upgrades to enhances rooms at check0in, and 4pm late checkout if available. The room was spacious, and with the Gold perks, I would stay at the Westin LAX again.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
See 4 more reviews by JennShio for Los Angeles
Ask JennShio about The Westin Los Angeles Airport
This review is the subjective opinion of a TripAdvisor member and not of TripAdvisor LLC.

cajudy47
Senior Reviewer
10 reviews 10 reviews
Reviews in 9 cities Reviews in 9 cities
1 helpful vote 1 helpful vote
'Such friendly staff - perfect central location'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 29, 2012

We had planned to stay at another Starwood resort but due to the fact that the other location had insane pet policy, we returned to the Westin LAX. This facility is staffed with friendly, efficient people who want you to enjoy your experience. Our room on the preferred guest level was quite large (no view, but it was only one night) with a sleeper loveseat that could have accommodated a child had we traveled with one. The room was clean, the bed was the "heavenly" bed we expect and appreciate. Room service was too us within 30 minutes and was excellent. Our small dog was made over by the staff who offered a special bed (she has her own) as well as other guests. It was like returning to the home of long-time friend.
Less

We stay in the Opera Suite on the first floor, complete with Grand Piano, a lovely balcony overlooking a sweet garden with a trickling fountain that lulls us to sleep, in this beautifully furnished flat. What quiet and privacy we enjoy in the evenings there after a busy day of business. If you want the feeling of "living" in a Brownstone, in what we consider the best neighborhood, you will adore this beautiful Bed and Breakfast.

brittles82
Lehi, Utah, United States
1 review
1 helpful vote 1 helpful vote
'Icing on the cake'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 14, 2012
1
person found this review helpful

My husband and I took a trip to new York to celebrate my birthday and up coming 10th anniversary. I had no idea where we were staying, he wanted to keep it a surprise. After we arrived at The Inn New York, I was beyond pleased with this surprise. We arrived a little after 6am and were greeting warmly and taken to our suite. I was instantly in awe of the charm and history of this quaint Inn.

We stayed 2 nights in the Library Suite and 3 nights in the Spa suite, and we fell more in love every day. From the delicious snacks, treats, and breakfast items left and replenished daily, the antique decor and helpful staff, we never lacked anything during our stay. It was great to be out in the city all day and then have a nice, quiet peaceful place to return to. I could honestly go on forever and talk about each detail of this beautiful Inn.

If you are looking to stay in the hustle and bustle of the city, staying in a large and busy hotel, then this place is not for you. If you are looking for somewhere quiet, comfortable (the beds are amazing!), clean, and unique to stay than this is the place for you. You are literally steps away from the subway station, and just a few blocks from central park.

When we return to New York someday, I know exactly where we will be staying, and I am looking forward to trying out the other suites!

    *
    *
    *
    *
    *

Patrick F
East Granby, CT
1 review
3 helpful votes 3 helpful votes
'Best on the Upper West Side'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed April 23, 2012
3
people found this review helpful

My husband and I recently stayed for 3 nights in the Vermont Suite at the Inn NYC. I almost hesitate to write this review because it's one of the best kept secrets on the Upper West Side. However, we had such a fantastic stay and it's too easy to rave about the Inn. We are former residents of the UWS and were looking for something that reminded us of living there. We normally stay at the Beacon Hotel in the neighborhood, but we were unable to get a reservation. After some further searching, we found the Inn and it sounded exactly like what we were looking for. Our suite was luxurious, beautifully decorated, comfortable with lots of personal touches. The hospitality and host Elyn made us instantly feel at home. We had our own separate entrance to the Vermont Suite and the array of snacks, fresh cheeses, quiche and bottle of wine upon our arrival allowed us to settle in and unwind after our travel to the city. The location is on a beautiful street and within walking distance of both Central Park and Riverside Park, numerous cafes, wine bars, shops and other local area attractions (Lincoln Center, Museum of Natural History). Its also ideally located to the subway for easy access to Times Square, Theater District, etc. The bedroom is on the lower level and was so comfy and quiet and just what we needed after busy days of walking around. We felt like we lived there and didn't want to leave. We also had an opportunity to see several of the other suites at the Inn and they were equally as beautiful. I travel frequently for both work and pleasure and while this may be more expensive, it's worth it to have your 'own' place in the city rather than a tiny impersonal hotel room. It rates at the top of my list and you could not be more spoiled. We will definitely be returning to our other 'home' in the city soon.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes

'15th Anniversary Trip'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed December 12, 2011
3
people found this review helpful

My husband surprised me with a trip to New York for our anniversary. Upon arriving at the Inn, we were greated by the friendliest warmest hostest and introduced to the housekeeper. We entered an old world styled suite that was absolutely homey and lovely. Since it was our anniversary, the Inn had put a chocolate cake with the words "Best Wishes" written in it. The kitchenette was fully stocked with wine, soda, cheese, crackers, coffee, tea, hot cocoa, muffins, bagels and more. The large airy bathroom had a jacuzzi tub, sauna, and a shower with plenty of room for two.
The Inn is located on the West Side, away from the hustle and bustle of the city, but still close enough to everything to make it easy to get where we wanted to go. I would absolutely recommend this wonderful home away from home for anyone who wants a quiet get away with all the perks of the big city!
Less

REV028
New Jersey, U.S.A.
Reviewer
5 reviews 5 reviews
Reviews in 4 cities Reviews in 4 cities
4 helpful votes 4 helpful votes
'A Rare NYC Hotel'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 29, 2012
1
person found this review helpful

If you're looking for the convenience of midtown Manhattan, but are trying to avoid the concrete and glass monolithic hotels typical of a metropolis then The French Quarter Guest Apartments is the place you want. In fact, even if you do enjoy the large hotel experience, The French Quarter is an ideal place to stay. A block and a half from the theatre district in Times Square, this charming hotel offers a memorable experience you wouldn't expect to find in Midtown. Clean, a tastefully decorated room, and all the amenities you expect in any hotel. Contrast the modern conveniences with this property's unique location  a look out the window on 46th Street and your view is framed with trees  the morning's are punctuated with the clip-clop of the horse drawn hansom cabs making their way to Central Park from their west side stables. Colin, the proprieter, is extraordinarily helpful and friendly, and assisted us in arranging transportation to an event. We stayed in Room 207, a beautiful room one flight up with a bay window sitting area overlooking 46th Street. A great room but it is a one flight walk-up, however, the hotel features elevator service to most of their rooms. If you stay be sure to visit Amy's Bread on Ninth Avenue between 46th and 47th for peerless baked goods and sandwiches.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes

Our only regret was that we didn't book with them from the start! I'd definitely return to The French Quarters.

K E
Basking Ridge, New Jersey
1 review
5 helpful votes 5 helpful votes
'Fantastic Gem in NYC'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 9, 2012
5
people found this review helpful

The French Quarters Guest Apartments is a uniquely charming hotel near Times Square. The rooms are impeccable, the beds and bedding are incredibly comfortable, the decor is warm and inviting and the location is convenient to shopping, theatres, and great restaurants. Located on restaurant row making it a perfect location to experience some great restaurants and be walking distance to the theatres. Colin McCormick and his staff (Torrey, John and Stefany) are incredibly helpful and professional. They assisted us with show recommendations, restaurant reservations, and transportation. We felt like we were at home! We stayed in the two bedroom apartment and it was incredible. Great outdoor patio area, two separate bedrooms and pullout couch in living room, spotless bathrooms with L'Occitaine bath products in each bathroom, flat screen tv's in each room, tons of room for a NYC hotel, kitchenette with microwave, refrigerator, sink, keurig coffee maker. Daily continental breakfast is excellent; fruit, coffee, bagels, cereal, oatmeal, toast, etc. Highly recommend this hotel whether you are one person, a family, or larger group. They have rooms of all shapes, sizes, and prices...you won't find better! We will stay in the French Quarters every time we visit the city!
Less

Problem with this review?
See 4 more reviews by retroject for New York City
retroject
Michigan
Contributor
12 reviews 12 reviews
Reviews in 7 cities Reviews in 7 cities
7 helpful votes 7 helpful votes
'Fantastic boutique hotel in Midtown'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 8, 2012
1
person found this review helpful

The French Quarters Guest Apartments is a fantastic little hotel in midtown Manhattan -- a few blocks from Times Square. If you're visiting NY to see the traditional tourist sights, this is a great spot to stay. It is just a few blocks from Times Square, most Broadway (and off-Broadway) shows, Rockefeller Center, 5th Ave, etc. Central Park is also close - maybe a 10-15 minute walk.

The hotel is on a great street, surrounded by restaurants. On the weekends, it can be a little noisy (NYC never really sleeps) but, as we had the 2-bedroom apartment on the 4th floor, it wasn't a problem.

The apartment itself was excellent. The room was clean and in great condition. There was a master bedroom with a king(!) bed and a private bathroom. The other bedroom had a queen bed and a shared bathroom off the central living room area. Both the bathrooms are nicely appointed -- shower only, but that was hardly an issue for us. There were flat screen televisions in both bedrooms, as well as plenty of layers of bedding; perfect for all temps. The living room also has a flatscreen TV (with built-in DVD player) and plenty of seating for 4. The kitchenette had a microwave, refrigerator, Keurig coffee maker, and sink -- great for snacks (I'm not sure why you'd want to eat in the room with all the fantastic restaurants in NYC). The balcony is also great, providing a wonderful view of the street and surrounding midtown buildings (as well as the lights of Times Square).

The included breakfast is functional - not amazing but still a great way to start the day (and it's included). All the basics are covered: cereal, bagels/croissants, fruit, hard-boiled eggs, and yogurt (including organic Greek, which was excellent).

The staff is nice and helpful. The only negative thing, for some, would be the elevator. It is, quite possibly, the slowest elevator in NYC. It's easier to take the stairs (except if you have your luggage). If stairs are a problem, and you are impatient, keep that in mind. Otherwise, it's really no problem.

As we'll be back in NYC soon, we most definitely will look at the staying here again. Highly recommended.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
See 4 more reviews by retroject for New York City
Ask retroject about The French Quarters Guest Apartments
This review is the subjective opinion of a TripAdvisor member and not of TripAdvisor LLC.

'Hidden Gem'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 2, 2012
1
person found this review helpful

The French Quarters is a hidden Manhattan gem and I would recommend a stay here without reservation. I was greeted by Colin McCormack when I arrived and have never met a more personable hotel manager. The front desk staff escorted me to my room, explained where everything was, and was great throughout the stay. I stayed in room 402; the entire suite was spotless and there is a large balcony to enjoy (definitely check out the city all lit up at night from there). The beds were comfortable, there were tons of pillows, and the televisions all have dvd players if you'd like to stay in and watch a movie. The location is perfect if you'd like to see a show or have a nice meal. Give the French Quarters a try and you'll be pleased with your decision.

SoCalSunshine951
San Diego, California
2 reviews
2 helpful votes 2 helpful votes
'Great location and hotel'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed April 30, 2012
1
person found this review helpful

We picked this hotel for it's price and location near Times Square, and it delivered even more. The hotel itself has an old-fashioned charm; our room had one complete wall of bricks, a fireplace, and picture window. The hotel staff even sent up a handwritten note welcoming us to the hotel. The room and bathroom were clean and well maintained. The only cons of the room were the size (slightly small) and a bit of noise (poor sound insulation from the hallway); however given the price paid those were not significant setbacks. The best part of the hotel was its location. Although it is a couple blocks from Times Square, it's on a strip of restaurants and bars that are very active on the weekends. Also, the staff is excellent, as they were more than willing to help us arrange to hold our bags after we had checked out.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes

GRIFFONEAGLE
Washington DC, District of Columbia
Top Contributor
58 reviews 58 reviews
Reviews in 8 cities Reviews in 8 cities
18 helpful votes 18 helpful votes
'Great Location, very nice hotel.'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed June 2, 2012 NEW
1
person found this review helpful

Overall, a lovely hotel right in the heart of New York. First off, the location cannot be beat! Right across from "Book of Mormon" (Eugene O'Neil Theatre), next door to "Chicago" (Ambassador Theatre), and right around the block from Times Square! Also next to great food options, including E&E Grill (where you get 10% off when you stay at the Pearl!).
The room was spectacular! No view, but the interior was spacious, clean, and very comfortable. The beds were very nice (although our full-beds might have been a little small), and I loved the showers (waterfall shower heads - directly above you)!
In terms of service, I was a bit disappointed. Check-in was nice, although I would have appreciated a smile from the Front Desk staff and help with our luggage. Doorman was friendly, but he was there at intermittent periods. Very disappointed with the breakfast. Nothing but some fruit, coffee, tea, and oatmeal still in the packet. All of this with plastic silverware and cups did not give me a good impression. However, the concierge was nice enough to recommend a nice place right around the corner (Pigalle), so I do give them credit. The housekeeping was excellent, and I have no complaints in that area. The service was not bad, it just needs some improvement.
Like I said before, this is a great hotel and for the prices in New York, it's a great value. I would highly recommend it. I would stay at this hotel again when I return to New York.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
See 17 more reviews by GRIFFONEAGLE for New York City

RSO1962
Manila, Philippines
1 review
'Excellent choice'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 1, 2012 NEW

Took a chance but saw the reviews on Trip Advisor. A little more expensive than the Sheraton where our conference was supposed to be but it was close enough that it didn't matter. The hotel is in a great location. Across the street is the Book of Mormon musical while on the left was the Chicago musical. On the right was the Actor's chapel so if you are Catholic, you can hear an anticipated mass at 11 pm on Saturday night, just after a Broadway play, so you can wake up late on Sunday morning. The breakfast buffet was simple but decent. Staff was very accommodating and friendly while the room was perfect. The EE restaurant served a very good steak and they made sure our dinner was done so we could catch our play on time. There is a discount in the restaurant when you are checked in. Times Square was nearby and we felt safe in our room. I would stay here again.
Less

The location of The Pearl Hotel is great, rooms were very clean, comfortable and modern. Breakfast inclusion was ok but agree with previous comments, considering room rate, plastic plates were not appealing, also the seating for breakfast was insufficient. Overall, well located, modern, clean and comfortable, only negative Reception staff.

'Great Choice'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 29, 2012
1
person found this review helpful

My family and I stayed at The Pearl May 24-28 and were well pleased. The rooms are spacious, well maintained and quiet. You couldn't ask for a better location....just steps from Times Square, train station, theatres and other attractions. A grocery store just a couple of doors down the block was convenient for drinks and snacks to stock the refrigerator. All of the staff was friendly, helpful and didn't seem to mind answering lots of questions. All rooms do not have a tub so if you want/need one you should probably request it. We will stay here again and recommend it to others.

9 reviews 9 reviews
Reviews in 5 cities Reviews in 5 cities
28 helpful votes 28 helpful votes
'Perfect hotel for first trip to NYC'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed May 29, 2012
1
person found this review helpful

we just returned from a 5 night stay at The Pearl and had a great time. For first time visitors the location was great, just half a block from the hustle and bustle of Times Square yet removed enough that it was a quiet oasis at the end of the day. My husband, sister and her husband stayed in a 2 bed room with a patio. The patio was all walled in but it was nice to have the extra space to hang out on while others were getting ready. I had emailed requesting the two beds be queens and we were happy with the size of the room for the four of us. We we on the second floor right by the location where the breakfast and afternoon wine and cheese were held but never heard the guests in the early mornings and it was super handy to run over to grab a quick coffee and breakfast every morning. We also took advantage of the wine a couple of the afternoons and that was a nice touch to unwind from our hectic days before heading in to get ready for the evening. All the staff were friendly and helpful and we are very glad with the choice we made to stay at The Pearl.
Less

'Excellent hotel near Times Square'

person found this review helpful

We had a very pleasant stay here. Rooms are nice sized and well appointed. Staff is friendly. It is modern in style but the atmosphere is low key and comfortable. Given the cost of NYC hotels, we felt we made a good choice for the rate. Nice to have a continental breakfast included as well. The only minor item is that when the AC cycles on at night, I could really feel the draft - but that would not deter me from staying here again. This is an excellent choice for the Times Square area.

'Hip Hotel in Soho'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 1, 2012 NEW

As a treat, a friend and I stayed for 2 nights at the Crosby Street Hotel. The location was perfect for shopping and sightseeing in the area. The hotel is gorgeous and has a laid back contemporary feel. Everywhere you turned there was a fabulous artwork or installation to enjoy. The interiors and furnishings are works of art on their own - so beautiful. We had a meal one evening sitting up at the bar. Food and cocktails were divine. The staff were friendly, helpful and engaging. We used the gym both mornings and although small, it had all the equipment we needed. I look forward to another visit.

'Fantastic bolthole in Soho'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 29, 2012
1
person found this review helpful

The Crosby Street is an absolute gem. I can't say one negative thing about the stay (unusual for me), so instead I'm going to mention the things that made it extra special:

1. The design and decor is interesting, with a sense of humour and at the same time homely and perfectly calming.
2. Room was a haven from the city. Very spacious, light airy, bed super comfy, bathroom perfect.
3. Staff couldn't have been more professional or friendly if they tried.
4. Extra special elements - the comfy 24 courtesy bar drawing room.
5. Allocating us a room in the evening, hours after we checked out to shower and change after being caught in the rain.
6. Concierge - advising excellent restaurants and making flawless bookings.

- Will definitely stay there again and highly recommend it.

See 2 more reviews by JujubeeNewYork for New York City
JujubeeNewYork
New York
Senior Reviewer
6 reviews 6 reviews
Reviews in 2 cities Reviews in 2 cities
2 helpful votes 2 helpful votes
'A little piece of London in New York'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 19, 2012
1
person found this review helpful

Although we live in NYC, my family and I spent Christmas at the Crosby St. Hotel. We checked in very early on Christmas Eve since I had to go to work, and were pleasantly surprised to find that the rooms were ready, which started our weekend off on the right note. i was able to unpack and have breakfast in the bar before heading off to my job.
On the return, we had a lovely afternoon tea in the sitting room - with Ruinart Champagne, don't miss it - and our server was extremely gracious and knowledgable. Meals in the bar on both Christmas Eve and Christmas Day (as well as breakfast on Boxing Day) were thoroughly enjoyable.
The design aesthetic of the rooms is in keeping with Firmdale, although I will say that the rooms are showing some wear. We booked two luxury doubles. A nice touch was the full sized candle given to each of us on Christmas Day.
The only let down was with check out. I was paying for both of the rooms, and although I had settled my account, one room was never transferred to the other and approximtely $1500 was held on my debit card. I'm not sure what it is with Firmdale, but they never process my bill correctly.
Overall however, this was a very enjoyable Christmas made all the more pleasant by spending it in a service oriented, boutique hotel that manages to capture the spirit of London in New York City.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
See 2 more reviews by JujubeeNewYork for New York City

SE-Explorer
Augusta,GA
Top Contributor
106 reviews 106 reviews
Reviews in 39 cities Reviews in 39 cities
185 helpful votes 185 helpful votes
'Beautiful,Quiet,Comfy,Exquisite Service'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 13, 2012
3
people found this review helpful

Cannot say enough wonderful things about this hotel. When the price is close to $600/night (& that was a special including breakfast, for the 2nd to the cheapest room), expectations are very high. We arrived very early so waited in the Drawing Room. Rooms are quiet, beautiful, NON-shabby chic, great environmental controls (excellent A/C), extremely comfortable beds, flat screen TVs with video inputs (for the techie geeks) with large windows and great bathrooms with (only) shower with powerful water flow! The staff were friendly, helpful and accommodating. The breakfast was your choice of anything: the steak & eggs were phenomenal-huge portion set us up for a whole day of walking the city! The buffet of yogurts, berries, fruit, muesli, cereals, bagels, toast, plus one may order tea service or coffees of any variety. We will definitely return, if the budget allows!

    *
    *
    *
    *
    *

Less

What's great: Rooms are beautiful & spacious, Floor to ceiling windows, hot shower & lovely amenities.
What's bad: The Staff, smelly bed & pillows, price.
I booked the CSH based on photos & location, which more than met my expectations. However, the staff was horrible. Polite, but not helpful at all. Housekeeping broke the shade while we were out to dinner despite having a "do not disturb" tag on the door. When I called to have it fixed and ask why housekeeping came into my room even tho I left the DND sign, the concierge blamed me for the shade & never alerted maintenance, so after 3 calls, the maintenance man finally arrived. The housekeeping question was ignored even though i asked 3 times. We requested a wake up call which never happened & when we expressed our frustration to the front desk, they desk clerk said flippantly "sorry".
The bed & pillows STUNK, like dirty hair-I'm guessing housekeeping never heard of Febreze, but they did come in uninvited to break the shade & fold the toilet paper into an arrow....

For $700 a night, I expect a better experience. The staff is unnecessarily snooty & apathetic, and in my opinion, incompetent. They smile & say hello, but no one went above those mild pleasantries. The stink was also upsetting, as I had Client appointments in the room & ever client remarked on the odd smell.

The restaurant is not much better. overpriced & painfully slow. The Caesar Salad is good, tho. Go to Balthazaar for an amazing meal or head down to Lomardis if you want affordable pizza. The Crosby Bar is disappointing for the price.

For $700 a night, I would expect a doorman or someone to help carry bags inside. I also expect a room not to stink, and for the hotel staff to do their jobs. It's a shame, it's such a beautiful hotel & a great location, the staff ruined my experience.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
Ask KristenNichols about Crosby Street Hotel
This review is the subjective opinion of a TripAdvisor member and not of TripAdvisor LLC.

6 reviews 6 reviews
Reviews in 5 cities Reviews in 5 cities
13 helpful votes 13 helpful votes
'Modern Hotel with Great Service in Central Location -- Perfection!'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 5, 2012 NEW

We just returned from a long-weekend visit to NYC. The Andaz was the perfect hotel for us. Located in mid-town, a short walk from Grand Central and Washington Square (Eataly!), and plenty of shopping, and an inexpensive cab ride to points North and South (Harlem, Battery Park, etc.). The staff at the hotel went above and beyond the service you get at most high end hotels -- they were very friendly and accommodating! Arriving to a friendly host and a glass of wine was a nice way to start off the weekend on Friday night. We had a splash suite which was spacious and lovely -- and had a magnificent view of the Public Library. Will definitely stay here again on our next trip to NYC.
Less

4 of 5 stars Reviewed June 5, 2012 NEW

I think all that needs 'tweeking' is the staff who greet you and then it would be perfect
Room service staff were GREAT!

We went in April and stayed in this hotel initially because it was well located, reasonably priced and got great reviews and we were not dissapointed. It is a very different hotel experience, not at all the usual formal and often stuffy reception you get, since it is very chilled out and the staff are more like good friends who can't do enough to help. This was a special occaison since I was proposing, so I had been emailing the hotel for a few weeks before we arrived for suggestions on making this extra special. Amanda coletta could not have been more helpful and I cannot praise her enough on what she did to help us. I would like to mention Joe also who was also a great laugh, not just because he kept filling my wine glass during the 'free' happy hour each evening in the reception.

'Former NY'ers Loved It!'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 31, 2012 NEW

We stayed in the Andaz in March and loved it. As former New Yorkers and frequent travelers, we really enjoyed our stay at the hotel. The staff was accommodating, the room was quiet with great views of the New York Public Library and we really appreciated the small touches (the free minibar, happy hour, the friendly staff, great bath products). We also got a free upgrade and a bottle of wine after the fire alarm on our floor went off early one morning. The gym is sizable with good weight machines and cardio.

3 helpful votes 3 helpful votes
'Exceeded my expectations and then some.'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 30, 2012
1
person found this review helpful

This was my first time staying at the Andaz on 5th Avenue, and I have to say that my wife and I had a wonderful time there. The room and decor was relaxing and modern. The service was warm and accommodating. Kelly at the front desk always addressed us by our names and always inquired if we needed anything, and greeted us with her great smile. Joe was also very helpful. New York is a fast and busy city, but every time I stepped into the Andaz, We felt at ease. Their gym is accessible 24 hours a day, which is great for guests traveling from a different time zone.

Coffee is ready in the lobby every morning, and wine is offered every evening. It was raining during our trip, so umbrellas were offered at the door for guests. Staff members flagged down cabs when it was pouring outside. I'm very appreciative of all the hard work the staff puts in. Kudos to them. We thank you for your service.
Less

'Perfect NYC getaway'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 6, 2012 NEW

The rooms are wonderfully appointed and the size is completely reasonable. Folks complaining about the size are clearly unfamiliar with NY proportions--yes, it is small, but it is still comfortable, with plenty of room to move around and a very nice size bathroom. The staff was very helpful (we appreciated the free loaner umbrella on a rainy day) and you get a lot for your money here with the 1) COMPLETELY IDEAL LOCATION, 2) free breakfast, 3) free wifi, etc. The location really couldn't be better--it is in the very cutest part of SoHo and just a quick walk from the east village, lower east side, washington square park, etc. We loved it.

mainetraveler555
Portland, Maine
Reviewer
4 reviews 4 reviews
Reviews in 4 cities Reviews in 4 cities
1 helpful vote 1 helpful vote
'Has Potential but not there yet - dissapointed - DON'T TAKE THE PAID UPGRADE'
2 of 5 stars Reviewed June 4, 2012 NEW

We were excited to stay at the Nolitan because of all the great reviews. When we arrived we were dissapointed to find that the rooftop and restaurant are essentially non-existent..on top of that when we got to our city view balcony room it was TINY. I understand NYC hotels are small, especially in the boutique group, but this was really small. For the price tag the hotel just did not deliver. Even the rooms looked sort of tired for a newer hotel.

The biggest warning and turn off was that they tried to get us to pay for an upgrade at check in. I actually almost took them up on the offer as it was only $35/night and we could get a king room. On second thought however I decided to stick with our original booking. I am glad I did - when I looked online to see what the difference in the upgrade offer room was and our booked room it was actually CHEAPER!!! They tried to get us to pay for a downgrade! I feel so uncomfortable about this. I also heard them trying to upgrade the people who came in after us.

On checkout I asked the gentelman who checked us in about his offer and asked him why he was trying to get us to pay more for a downgraded room - he said he was offering a better room on a higher floor but we were already staying in a city view. When i told him that he said he was offering a corner room - it would have made sense but I specifically asked when trying to decide if we should take the offer if it was a corner room he was offering - he said No - just a king room and the only difference would be the size of the bed.

Maybe it was a mis-understanding but it just isn't settling well with me. BEWARE of this tactic - it's a trick.


I will say the people were friendly and service was good too - unfortunately not enough to make up for the other short comings.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
Ask mainetraveler555 about The Nolitan Hotel
This review is the subjective opinion of a TripAdvisor member and not of TripAdvisor LLC.
Jennifer Villanueva, General Manager at The Nolitan Hotel, responded to this review
June 6, 2012
I truly apologize for your recent experience and can understand why the matter, of the upgrade, is unsettling. After speaking with the Guest Service Agent, that checked you in, I assure you that this was a genuine mistake. He mistakenly read the room type booked as a Neighborhood Balcony room, which offers a $35 upgrade to a Cityscape King, rather than a Cityscape Balcony. As a result of this incident, we are implementing an additional feature in our reservation system to safeguard these types of mishaps.
With regards to the restaurant and rooftop, we strive to make mention of the restaurant renovation and rooftop use at every opportunity including both on the website and email confirmation as well as the pre-arrival message. However, thank you for the opportunity to review our current status for all. At the moment, we are developing a new restaurant concept that we hope to launch by mid-summer. In the meantime, we are offering a complimentary continental breakfast in our restaurant daily and seamless in-room dining by collaborating with our neighborhood restaurants for delivery service. As for the rooftop, it is open to guests to take in the breathtaking views or for private events.
With respect to the quality of the rooms, I was saddened to hear that they were perceived as tired. The entire team takes great pride in servicing the hotel and while we have received excellent feedback about the condition of our rooms, your feedback is extremely valuable and our team will take extra measures to ensure that guestrooms are in pristine condition.
If you would like to discuss the matter further, I would be delighted to hear from you. Please feel free to contact me directly at 212.925.2555 or Jennifer@nolitanhotel.com.
Report response as inappropriate
This response is the subjective opinion of the management representative and not of TripAdvisor LLC.

'Contemporary design and great staff!!'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 1, 2012 NEW
1
person found this review helpful

This really does live up to all the reviews, especially concerning the staff. They are among the friendliest, most helpful of any hotel staff I have encountered in my travels. Instantly, you feel like you are family. Kudos to Felix, and all the others! The hotel has a very nice contemporary design. Sure, the rooms are small, but that's typical for NYC rooms. It's just a few blocks from Little Italy, Soho and a subway stop. All the things you need for a stay in lower Manhattan. The continental breakfast is standard danish, yogurt, bagel variety, so nothing special there. The chocolate turn down treats are delicious. The staff alone rates up along side my experiences at Four Seasons or Ritz Carlton.

m k
New York City, New York
1 review
1 helpful vote 1 helpful vote
'fine... but not that great'
3 of 5 stars Reviewed May 30, 2012
1
person found this review helpful

my husband and i are NYC residents but stayed in the hotel for our anniversary. it was fine... but not worth the expense. last year we stayed at the nearby Mondrian, which was amazing, gorgeous and fun (and even less expensive than the Nolitan). The rooms here were very small and the balcony overlooks ugly, busy Kenmare street. The Nolitan didn't do anything wrong necessarily, but they didn't do anything right either. Stay at the Mondrian, the Bowery or the Standard EV instead. Same price, MUCH better experience. This place is ok if you really just want a small, boxy, clean room in a good neighborhood. If you want to step into another world, go elsewhere.

'Great Experience'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 29, 2012

Very good. Not the cheapest, but clean, comfortable and great location. Good design and ambiance, it felt 'cool'.

There was a tapping noise on our first night, not only did they move us without fuss, but when we returned from dinner, they had left a complimentary bottle of wine on the side.

The bar was not open when we were there, although we were told it would be open soon. This is not really an issue in NoLiTa, so many good bars and restaurants about.

Very impressive, would definitely return.

Allana F
San Antonio, Texas
2 reviews
'Excellent hotel, great location'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 6, 2012 NEW

We chose the Bryant Park Hotel because of the central location. Our stay was 4 nights/5 days - May 17-21st. Upon arrival, we were greeted by Kevin, who assisted with our luggage. At the front desk, Robert checked us in and provided excellent customer service and general information. It was a welcomed respite after a horrible travel experience. We reserved the Junior Park Suite. It was WONDERFUL!!! The room was beyond expectation. Staff is extremely friendly and helpful. Sarah, in Conceirge was the BEST. She was able to assist with a couple of much needed reservations. Darren, the manager, is great and accommadating. I would definitely return, as well as recommend this hotel to anyone.
By the way, the hotel is very close to Times Square and 5th avenue. Bryant Park was across the street. Plus Bryant Park Grill provided good, easy access food and drinks. Additionally, the Koi restaurant on-site is definitely worth a try; Fantastic!
