Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
TarakayAustralia
Australia
Senior Contributor
33 reviews 33 reviews
Reviews in 5 cities Reviews in 5 cities
22 helpful votes 22 helpful votes
'Noisy Construction opposite Hotel'
3 of 5 stars Reviewed June 3, 2012 NEW
2
people found this review helpful

We stayed in the club tower room at the New York Palace. The hotel has advantages and disadvantages. The positives are that the hotel is in a nice location, the rooms are spotless, the beds are very comfortable, the towels really good quality and the bathrooms cleaned really well. The club floor is very nice and provides outstanding meals. Concierge in the Tower section are extremely helpful and really nice people, they provide sound good advice.
The disadvantages with this hotel are: 1. The hot water goes cold often and remains cold for around 5 minutes. This means you have to get out of the shower. A problem when you have shampoo on your hair. This happened to us on 4 separate occasions. One time there wasn't any water at all. 2. The club floor staff do not clear the tables as efficiently as required and of concern they quite often do not wipe the tables, so you can have a clear table to sit at but it is dirty. 3. The club floor has ONE toaster for the entire club floor guests. The toaster is also extremely slow and when the toast finally pops up it isn't cooked anyway. The ONE toaster only does 2 slices at a time. The club floor staff have no attention to detail, and this is a real shame because the club floor produces great food and is set up on the 39th floor. 4. The door to the club floor kitchen makes the biggest squeeky noise that can be heard all over the club floor. Again, club floor staff have no attention to detail and could either a. put some oil on the hinge or b. keep it open. 5. The club floor can get quite busy, and they don't have enough tables and chairs to cater for a busy attendance. Add to this, they don't clear the tables as efficiently as they should, just compounds the problem. 6. Some staff at Reception at the Towers are in denial about the construction taking place and pretend that they don't know it goes on all night, 7 days a week. The construction even closed the road right outside the Hotel and really does impact on the entrance and the rooms on that side. We asked to be moved and we could even hear the noise in the night and we were not above it. 7. The hotel also does not have a good restaurant that provides decent genuine food. Instead they have the Guilt restaurant that only offers a set menu and the food is fiddly, poorly made and easily the worst restaurant we have ever been to, anywhere in the world. This is a real shame that the hotel allows this restaurant to be privately operated within the hotel. 8. The hotel has no pool. 9. The hotel has no jacuzzi or no spa

Overall, the problems could be resolved at the hotel and the fact that these problems go unresolved suggests that management aren't aware of what is going on. In about a years time, the construction will have been completed and that will resolve the noise problem. In the meantime, recommend that you only book if you have written confirmation that you can be guaranteed to have a room not on the side of the construction. In any case, we couldl still hear it, as we were just around the corner from the front of the hotel and heard the beeping and trucks all night. They even sounded a siren when the crane was operating during the night. There is a mature lady on the towers reception, who we recommend you avoid. She can be quite flippant with her remarks and not understanding that people are on a holiday that they have saved up for all year and been looking forward to. She also has no idea what time the club floor shuts either and send us up the first night and when we got there, we were told it was closed. It would be preferable for the hotel to be honest about the construction noise and the water problems they are having. No one likes to be misled.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
Ask TarakayAustralia about The New York Palace Hotel
This review is the subjective opinion of a TripAdvisor member and not of TripAdvisor LLC.

3 helpful votes 3 helpful votes
'Intimate and welcoming'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed June 6, 2012 NEW

Our 4 night stay was very enjoyable. Room was great size for Manhattan and nicely furnished. Due to a plumbing problem after the 2nd night, were were graciously upgraded to another (bigger) room. Staff were extremely friendly and accommodating. I am a clean freak and tend to obsess over things BUT....even someone less germ-phobic than I would tell the management that the carpets in the two rooms we had were VERY soiled and unappealing. Fine hotels such as the Michelangelo would be wise to lose the carpeting and go to wood floors and area rugs. Initial cost of flooring may increase but payback would come quickly with easier and better daily maintenance.


Humahuaca25
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?

FarmGirl1103
Senoia, GA
Contributor
11 reviews 11 reviews
Reviews in 4 cities Reviews in 4 cities
4 helpful votes 4 helpful votes
'Not as Good as it Once was'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed June 2, 2012 NEW via mobile

While I am happy to see that others are upgraded and treated like royalty, I do not share the same type of service, maybe I should just reserve thru Expedia and hope that the staff thinks it is my first time at the hotel. This was my sixth or seventh stay and I was disappointed. The room was small and when i talked to June she said it was the same room type as in the last stay. Not sure how that could be when it had a couch and two chairs. Her explanation was that the rates go up every year and she could move me to another room with a charge of course. There was no turn down service on the second evening of my stay and I was told that they were understaffed. The quality of the toiletry items has declined from the last time. The complimentary coffee and Danish has been moved to the basement of the hotel in a very tiny windowless room. They need to just do away with this if they can't keep it in the elegant lobby bar. Where we're the doormen all weekend, oh wait that must have been them two doors down talking to their buddies at the adjoining building. Very disappointed with this stay, too many other boutique hotels to try.
Less

jcpPA
pennsylvania
Senior Reviewer
9 reviews 9 reviews
Reviews in 4 cities Reviews in 4 cities
9 helpful votes 9 helpful votes
'The best of the best'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 2, 2012 NEW
1
person found this review helpful

We stayed at the Michelangelo over Memorial day weekend and couldn't have been happier with our choice. From our checkin with June to our check out with Walter, we were treated wonderfully. Even the bellman were friendly and helpful. We were located only 2 blocks from Times Square and yet it was so quiet and relaxing. I have read so many times that New York hotels are shoebox small, but the Michelangelo room was very spacious, clean and very elegant. I can't imagine staying anywhere else.
Practically next door is the Cafe Duke, open 24 hours, for anything you would need at regular, rather than New York prices.
The free coffee, tea and pastries in the morning was just one more thing that put this hotel head and shoulders above the rest.
The best way to discernible the Michelangelo is that it really is an oasis in the middle of a bustling city.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes

'My favorite hotel in New York!'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 1, 2012 NEW

Great boutique hotel in NY Midtown, with an European charm. The staff hospitality is outstanding. I got a room upgrade with no extra charge. Rooms are incredibly spacious, have large marble bathrooms, luxurious furniture and linens. The concierge is very helpful and all staff is attentive to details which make us feel special, such as a delicious tiny Belgian chocolate candy left on the guests pillow every night. In the mornings, there is complimentary coffee, croissants and scones. Can't wait to go back. Definitely, my favorite hotel in NY.

LLHH
Vancouver
Reviewer
3 reviews 3 reviews
1 helpful vote 1 helpful vote
'Magnificent Hotel and Central Location'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 27, 2012

Booked this hotel through Expedia with no issues. From the time you enter the hotel lobby you feel welcome. The hotel and rooms are wonderfully decorated and staff make you feel right at home. The rooms are huge and super clean. Very comfortable beds. We had a very comfortable King suite with walk in closet and safe. We asked for a high floor quiet room and were accomodated. The room looked into an adjacent building wall but was so quiet as a result. You'd never know you were in the centre of Manhatten. Great location just a few blocks to the subway, time square, rockerfeller centre and broadway. You can walk everywhere or just get on the subway. Very safe area to walk around. The hotel includes a quick cofee/tea and pastry to start your morning with. This is enough to get you going. Very helpfull staff and doorman. Wouldn't hesitate to stay here.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes

BakerNomi
Pittsburgh, PA
Contributor
12 reviews 12 reviews
Reviews in 4 cities Reviews in 4 cities
5 helpful votes 5 helpful votes
'Nice hotel, great location, eat somewhere else'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed May 27, 2012

Members of our family have stayed at this hotel twice in the last month. We've been quite happy with the accommodations; the first time we stayed, we were upgraded from a room to a suite. Since there were three of us and we had a roll-away bed, this was great; the extra bed went into the sitting room (thereby rendering it useless for sitting, but that was okay), and we had a powder room as well as a full bath, which helped a lot. The concierge arranged car services and restaurant meals for us, and the doormen got us taxis as needed. We were just a couple of short blocks from Times Square and the theater district, and there were plenty of restaurants nearby. That turned out to be a good thing; the breakfast we had at the hotel was over-priced and mediocre. That was our only complaint, however.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes

beachlover135
California City, California
Reviewer
4 reviews 4 reviews
Reviews in 4 cities Reviews in 4 cities
3 helpful votes 3 helpful votes
'Excellent Location!'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 26, 2012
1
person found this review helpful

This was our first trip to NYC, and we were very impressed by the Michelangelo Hotel from the moment we walked into the lobby! Very elegantly decorated, even had chandeliers in the elevators! Staff was friendly and welcoming, and very helpful. Our room was comfortable (lots of pillows!) and had very large bathrooms! The real attraction for us was that we were able to walk to Central Park, Times Square, the Theater District, Rockefeller Center, shopping, etc. The hotel was very close to several eateries, including the famous Carnegie Deli! Subway stations are within easy walking distance as well. We felt that the hotel was reasonably priced, comfortable, and an excellent centralized location for getting to/from the attractions of NYC. We will definitely stay here again.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes

Stokee7
Stoke-on-Trent England
Reviewer
4 reviews 4 reviews
Reviews in 3 cities Reviews in 3 cities
8 helpful votes 8 helpful votes
'A Pleasant Stay in the Big Apple'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 6, 2012 NEW

Stayed at the Staybridge for 8 nights in May and June. We were with a couple of friends and their room was on the 21st floor and ours on the 2nd. We asked if we could could be moved to be nearer them, the staff at the Staybridge were more than helpful and the next day were had our room up on the 21st. Our cases were moved to our new room while we were out without any fuss at all. The rooms are lovely and very clean, and the kitchen is a bonus, it includes a fridge/freezer, dishwasher and microwave. The lifts can be busy at breakfast but we really did not have to wait very long. Our room was situated right next to the lift and we were worried it would be noisy, but we had no problems.

The breakfast is good and includes cereal, eggs bacon etc and rolls and jam.

The staff are wonderful and very friendly and nothing is too much trouble. I will certainly recommend this hotel and hope to stay there again later in the year.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes

brngckn
Cypress, Texas
Top Contributor
87 reviews 87 reviews
Reviews in 60 cities Reviews in 60 cities
50 helpful votes 50 helpful votes
'Short Stay but Will be Back'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed June 6, 2012 NEW

This is a good deal for New York City. It's well located, being near to Penn Station, bus terminal, Times Square, etc. The room is a tight fit with a king bed, but you don't spend your time in the hotel when in New York. I only stayed one night but see the appeal of the little kitchen. Bathroom was well-stocked, bed comfy, room clean, wifi free and fast, staff very nice.

They were doing some work on the floor of the lobby while I was there that interrupted the elevator service to some degree, but I'm sure that's done now. My only complaint was the breakfast. Everyone in the hotel must have been eating at the same time - it was crowded, you had to go downstairs to sit and some of the food wasn't being restocked fast enough.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes

Hillygirl2
Wokingham
Senior Contributor
27 reviews 27 reviews
Reviews in 22 cities Reviews in 22 cities
13 helpful votes 13 helpful votes
'Great Value for New York and very comfortable'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 6, 2012 NEW

Realy the staff make this hotel. Comfortable rooms with full kitchenette, good breakfast but the staff are so helpful and friendly it makes the difference. The position is very central right by the Port Authority subway on 8th Avenue and close to Times Square. Well within walking distance of Hells kitchen as well. There is no room service if that is want you want, but you can have take out either in the lounge area or in your room if you want. The rooms might be thought of as a little drab, but with an excellent flat screen TV, microwave, dishwasher etc I don't think you should complain. Yes we were on the 27th floor and the lift could be a little slow at times, but not enough to complain about.
Less

June 6, 2012

Hell's kitchen is situated around the corner of 9th avenue offering different types of cuisines, and plenty of very good restaurants that can be booked through our concierge.
Thank you again and we look forward to welcoming you for your next trip to the Big Apple.

As a group of girls travelling together & staying at your hotel we were quite pleased to see how clean, comfortable & convenient the rooms were especially to have everything supplied. Nice to have access to the amenities within your hotel free of charge.
Breakfast being offered and presented very nicely with a varity of food,well stocked at all times.
Cocktail being offered during the week says alot for the staff & management goes a long ways. Gives Guest time to get to know & speak to them one on one especially the Manger who went above & beyond(can,t remember his name starts with Ki sorry)who offered places to eat, see, do etc. When he learned of one of the girls celebrating her 60th. birthday he made sure her day was special by surprising her with a bottle of champagne on ice in her room when she arrived back to hotel.
Very considerate.
Staff were very friendly & enjoyed how they would mingle with the guest as they were coming & going from the hotel.
Most impressed to see good communication from Mangement, Staff & Guest. Congratulations.
Your ratings should be at least 4-41/2 Star

vianca2009
Atlanta, Georgia
Contributor
13 reviews 13 reviews
Reviews in 2 cities Reviews in 2 cities
4 helpful votes 4 helpful votes
'Excellent Stay'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 30, 2012
1
person found this review helpful

We stayed at this hotel from May 22-25. It was three of us. My wife, six year old son, and myself. We chose this hotel because it was so close to everything and because of the reviews.....we were not disappointed in the least. The hotel was beautiful and the rooms were spacious and clean. The full size fridge was a plus. We didnt use the stove though. Times Square is literally right around the corner. We walked just about everywhere and we never felt unsafe. We did learn something that is not mentioned in any of the reviews however. We flew into Laguardia and all yellow cabs charge a flat rate of $45 to take you to Manhattan but we found a car service that took us to and from the airport for much cheaper. There is a car service called carmel and they were great and very quick. their number is so easy to remember i will never forget it...212+666+6666. if you have a smart phone you can download an app called cab 4 me and it is really great, but i digress
whenever we needed fresh towels, they were brought right up. it was very quiet and we were only a few feet away from the elevators. we never had a problem with the elevators, the longest we waited was maybe 60 seconds. breakfast was different everyday. If you get up early there arent alot of people there but around 7 oclock it fills up pretty quickly. the free happy hour they have from 5-7 was quite nice, the only real down side to this hotel is the fact that they dont have a tub. After walking all over new york it would be nice to soak in a hot bubble bath to relax your feet but the shower is nice.
when we return to new york this is the hotel of our choice. the view from our room was simply amazing. it was a view of times square.
Less

I would also like to thank you for all the tips given, especially to get breakfast as early as it starts to avoid all the morning crowds and long wait for elevators.
The Staybridge Suites offers different type of rooms types including rooms with bathtubs as we offer exceptional guest amenities, including complimentary daily breakfast buffet; complimentary guest laundry and fitness center; a complimentary 24-hour business center.
We look forward to welcoming at the Staybridge suites for your next trip to New York.

Carla R
San Francisco, California, United States
1 review
'Awesome'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 6, 2012 NEW

This was my first time staying at Eventi and I would definitely go back and recommend it to anyone. We had a Deluxe King room with an incredible view. There was plenty of space and the bathroom was huge. I have heard horror stories about NYC hotels being so tiny you can barely open the door. Not so at Eventi, spacious, clean and nicely decorated. And not only was the room fantastic, but the staff were so helpful. I came in on a red eye and had an event at 2pm that day. I called the front desk twice to see if a room was available yet, explaining I had to get ready for my event. The second time I called, they remembered me and because I was a rewards member and they knew I had an event they upgraded me to a room that was available now. Much appreciated. They also had a happy hour from 5-6 with wine and sangria, plus the water always had really refreshing iced tea or infused water. Whatever it was, it was really good.
Less

'Perfect Getaway in New York'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed June 5, 2012 NEW

This understated mid town gem is all you could ask for in a New York hotel. Perfectly helpful staff are kind and courteous upon arrival and continue the charm throughout my stay. Rooms are updated and surprisingly large (even when sharing), the bathroom is a magnificent is size. The beds are wonderful... Really comfortable and nicely dressed. Slept like a baby. Big windows give lots of light and great rooftop views. Location is key at the Eventi, perfectly placed between the upper crust of Central Park and a leisurely walk to the trendy haunts in Soho and beyond. Definitely would stay again.

hknudsen_24
Lexington, Kentucky
2 reviews
'Outstanding stay'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 1, 2012 NEW

We had stayed at Eventi last year, so when we decided to visit NYC on our honeymoon, we immediately chose Eventi. It was the perfect choice. They upgraded us to a suite on the 23rd floor, which was ready when we arrived at 11am. Then when we got back from sightseeing, there was a bottle of champagne and box of truffles with a note from Marco, the concierge. The staff is top notch--always friendly and helpful. Both times we've stayed here, the rooms have been quiet with comfy beds, which helps you to recover from the hustle and bustle of the city. We love the location--just one subway stop from Times Square, and plenty of subway lines to choose from. Eventi is definitely our first choice for future trips.

CAScott
Washington DC, District of Columbia
Reviewer
4 reviews 4 reviews
Reviews in 2 cities Reviews in 2 cities
2 helpful votes 2 helpful votes
'Eventi is aging well'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 31, 2012 NEW

We visit a couple times a year and for the last year or so, have stayed exclusively at this hotel, changing from several years worth of stays at their sister hotel, 70 Park. I believe this is our 5th visit to the hotel. We were very grateful to be checked-in a bit early so we could make our standing lunch reservations downtown - that was a huge bonus since we usually have our puppy in tow and we are always fretting abuot what time we will actually be able to get into the room. This time, we upgraded to a suite - and the room did not disappoint. It was spacious (especially by NYC standards), with hard woods, a separate sitting room, and marble tiled bathroom. The only downside, we learned after checking in, is that all suites face west (not the most appetizing view) instead of a city view. So, you'll have to pick your poison - space or view. But, having stayed on the other side, the rooms there are also rather large, so either way you are safe. We love the lobby staff, from the doormen who always remember us (probably because we have a very cute, by active, pomeranian in tow), the manager, Gabriella, helped us through a few bumps that were specific to our pooch, and the bellman staff who were always accommodating. There was a large wedding taking up the outside 5th floor balcony on one of our nights there, so wine was served in the lobby, which was fine since it was a bazillion degrees outside. And, I enjoyed the fashion show as the gorgeously outfitted guests began arriving. We had a good talk with the 2nd floor restaurant staff who acclimated us to the new set-up there. They have lovely outdoor seating which will be nice in cooler weather. A bit disappointed that we couldn't bring Simba out on the balcony on the bar side - we had high hopes for a cocktail out there on one of our days, but we understood their policy. Everyone is accommodating and helpful and warm. You will love the location - traffic faces uptown on a one way street, which makes taking buses from downtown a breeze. A walk crosstown takes just 10 minutes. The area itself is rather sparse, but you can walk up to shopping areas north of the hotel, if that's your thing. We pretty much stay put downtown for some of our favorite restaurants, so we tend to walk over to 5th Ave and take a downtown bus straight down (easy-peasy.) We also usually arrive by train at Penn, after parking our car at Secaucus Junction where parking is much cheaper. It is just one short stop from Secaucus to Penn Station and a simple block walk over to the hotel. We figure what we save in parking and in cab fares, we can spend elsewhere (like upgrading to a suite!) We will return in September for yet another visit, if not sooner. We look forward to (hopefully) cooler weather and a terrific stay.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
See 2 more reviews by CAScott for New York City

See 3 more reviews by CaliforniaIngridG for New York City
CaliforniaIngridG
Orange County, CA
Reviewer
4 reviews 4 reviews
1 helpful vote 1 helpful vote
'Great location, amazing beds, and fabulous staff!'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 31, 2012

Cannot say enough good things about the Eventi in NYC. Close to the iconic Flat Iron building, and walking distance to the famed Macy's and Times Square. Wonderful mid-town location.

The property itself is deceptive from the outside. The outside appears to be your standard NYC hotel. However, once you step inside you know this is a unique property. The lobby has comfortable chairs and sofas, and when we arrived there was a fire going in the fireplace. The lobby offers gourmet tea and coffee each morning, and water with fresh fruit is present in the afternoon and evenings. The hotel hosts a guest wine reception night on the roof top (which moves to the lobby in the event it rains).

The rooms are beautiful, extremely clean, and the beds are amazing and so comfortable! Loved that the beds were queen size, and not doubles or the dreaded NYC twin. My friend loved the pillows so much that she ordered one online when we returned home! The best thing to note about this hotel is that it is quiet!! We were the first room directly off the elevator and never once heard elevator traffic or guest noise. We also never heard street noise. The only one thing I would change would be to add a bath tub, but that would be it.

The best part of this property for us was the front desk staff, especially the night staff. Everyone was genuinely kind and extremely friendly. It was nice to be welcomed late each evening by the night crew.

Hands down, this is a great property and I'll be back!
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes

'Great Exterior, Average Interior'
3 of 5 stars Reviewed May 31, 2012

The hotel and rooms are well designed The only problem with the room was that I did find that the aircon system was very noisey whilst on.

The actual service from the staff seems much to be desired. I only spent a night there and was worried about catching a flight very early the next morning. I approached the front desk and ask the man there to organise a taxi for me at 4am - he laughed and said that there are always taxis outside so I don't need to worry. Being a foreigner and worried about missing my international flight I expressed concern and he said he would make sure that one was there for me then so I didn't need to worry - I was quiet skeptical that he would actually do this because of his tone and he seemed pretty tired of me bugging him about this taxi issue.

The following morning at 3:50 I was told that there was no sign or note left by the guy at the front desk to organise a taxi for me and I was fetched at 4:15.

Experience at this hotel was average compared to the 3 boutique hotels i stayed in before this. Not worth the money for such an average experience.

jammy1985
London, United Kingdom
1 review
'Amazing hotel - shame about the some of the staff!'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed May 30, 2012 via mobile

Just come back from an amazing stay in NYC at the Eventi. I really wanted to give this hotel a 5 star review as up until the final day they had done no wrong. However when we went to check out, we had been charged for items from the mini bar and room service which we hadn't ordered or take. When we told the member of staff this, he said that he would have to 'investigate' and if we could wait. We sat for over 20 mins before he came over and said that although they had the charges on their system they didn't have a receipt for the room service. At this point I questioned that perhaps the room service had accidentally been charged to the wrong number. This was met with a frosty reply that it was on the system. Essentially implying that we were lying about it. I said that what was concerning me was that someone was using our name, or if not ordering to our room without us being there. The member of staff just said 'well like I said there's no receipt so we'll just take it off'. Now if I had ordered it, I wasn't going to pretend I hadn't and try and get out of paying. I just incensed me that we were made to feel accused and treated like we were trying to get away with something that was at the end of the day the hotels error. Shame as everything up to that point had been great.
Less

Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
Dave07
Amsterdam, The Netherlands
Senior Contributor
21 reviews 21 reviews
Reviews in 13 cities Reviews in 13 cities
54 helpful votes 54 helpful votes
'Best location to visit NY'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 5, 2012 NEW

The hotel is located within 10min walking from Penn Station, Empire, Broadway theaters, Times Square. Literally, you have all NY at your feet, as it has also a subway station right next to the hotel entrance....
My wife and I stayed 4 nights mid-May and it was great. We arrived by train from Penn and found easily our way to the hotel within 15min.
We did not take the breakfast, as there was plenty of choice outside the hotel.
Nice steak restaurant (Brendan's), Subway, 2 Irish pubs and 2 Korean restaurants are on the same street with the hotel (2 min walk max.).
Also, Starbucks just across the hotel, past the subway station. And supermarket and souvenirs, etc. Everything is very close if you stay at this hotel.
The service at the reception and concierge is thoughtful and pleasant, cleaning was impeccable.
Room could be a little bigger (we had standard city view room on 30th floor, facing the Empire State Building), but this is NY... LAN/Wifi Internet in room. Safe also. Although right across 2 elevators, we could not hear anything in the room - very nice surprise.
Cannot say much about the rest, as we stayed most of the time out of the hotel.
Took the subway to Brooklyn, then walked the Brooklyn Bridge back and entered the Financial District, going further to Battery Park to take the ferry for the Statue. This was roughly a 5 hour tour, since we skipped Ellis Island.
Walking from the hotel in the evening is very easy to get to most theaters with Broadway shows, Times Square and up to the lower edge of Central Park - less than 1h easy walk to the park.
One can book from the hotel cruises around the city, on boat or bus, but we did not, as we preferred to walk every street.
Beware, if it rains or it is foggy, you will not be able to see the city panorama if you climb the Rockefeller or the Empire. Looking out from the hotel window gives you already a good sense of how clear the sky actually is....
We had a great time and would recommend this hotel for any NY visit, as its location is perfect.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
Ask Dave07 about Hilton Garden Inn New York West 35th
This review is the subjective opinion of a TripAdvisor member and not of TripAdvisor LLC.

'This will be our NYC hotel of choice from now on!'

'This will be our NYC hotel of choice from now on!'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 2, 2012 NEW

What can I say that hasn't been said by all the positive reviewers here.
Before we even arrived, Beanca emailed me to make sure things are ok and that she'd have something special for my wife for her birthday later in the week. Sure enough we had a high floor room with a great view of the Empire State Building. For her birthday Beanca sent up a birthday cake. I thought the great room was good enough but Beanca sent my wife a birthday cake as well. What a great gesture! I can't remember the name of the girl who checked us in. She talked to my little girl when we checked in. During our stay whenever she saw us she'd wave at my little one which made her feel very special. Thank you so much for that.

The room was great. I've been in smaller rooms in NYC so i can't complain about the size of the room because I thought it was fairly large. The fridge was great as we could buy milk from the pharmacy a few steps away from the hotel and the little one would have something to drink before going to sleep. The shower. It was great! I love it that it actually has a good flow of water pressure. After a long day of walking through the hot and humid weather, coming back for a relaxing shower was very soothing.

Otherwise. Great hotel. Clean. Friendly staff. There was some noise from the street but the room was generally quiet. This will be our hotel of choice when we visit NYC from now on.

Problem with this review?
TCU61
Greensboro, North Carolina
Reviewer
5 reviews 5 reviews
Reviews in 4 cities Reviews in 4 cities
4 helpful votes 4 helpful votes
'Central Location a Plus...'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed May 31, 2012
2
people found this review helpful

The Hilton Garden Inn on West 35th Street is a clean, well-staffed, and centrally located hotel. Less than a block from Macy's, a block from the Empire State Building, a few minutes to Times Square, and convenient to the subway system. One can easily walk to either Penn Station or Grand Central in about 10 minutes. If you drive, they have an arrangement with a parking garage on 26th street for discounted pricing. (Of course in NYC, "discounted parking" is relative...).

We had two rooms during the stay for four guests. Our rooms faced 35th Street and were on the 12th floor. Street noise was not an issue. The rooms were clean and comfortable, although not as large as one might find at Hilton Garden Inns in other locations. Space is a commodity in the City and visitors will likely spend little time in the rooms outside of sleep, shower, and sorting out plans for the day/night. The A/C worked well and kept the rooms comfortable (allowing to keep the windows closed, thus reducing any street noises issues).

The hotel is serviced by three elevators. During our two night stay, it seemed as if one elevator was out of service at some point or another. This slowed getting to and from rooms a bit, but was not overly intrusive. Peak times in the morning were a bit slowed by only two elevators, but nothing to stress over.

The lobby has a small bar/lounge area to get a drink. A nice spot to relax and decide "what next". There is a hotel restaurant, but we did not take advantage of it. With so many food options in the city, I find it difficult to "eat in" when so much awaits outside.

Pricing is very competitive for NYC. It was Memorial Day weekend, so in an off-peak weekend, prices could be better.

If returning to NYC for a stay, we would very much consider this location again.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
Ask TCU61 about Hilton Garden Inn New York West 35th
This review is the subjective opinion of a TripAdvisor member and not of TripAdvisor LLC.

'Great hotel in Manhattan'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 31, 2012

We were lucky to choose this really good hotel. The hotel is in excellent central location and just near a subway station to get anywhere you want. A lot of shops and drugstores nearby. Fridge and microwave oven in the room that can be really convenient. In the morning you can have coffee, tea or hot chocolate downstairs for free, in the evening there is lemonade. Breakfast for only $10 in the hotel is very good. Wi-Fi Internet for free in the rooms. In the Business Center you can print your papers for free.

'Good Staff'
3 of 5 stars Reviewed May 29, 2012 via mobile

I brought my daughter to NYC to see Wicked and we stayed one night using HHonors points. The room was small but adequate and the staff was very good. We shared a king bed because there were no rooms avaliable with two beds. One side of the adjustable air bed deflated in a matter of minutes and would not hold air. I was told this is extremely rare, but I have been told that before at other HGI's (I'm an HHonors gold member). Maybe I'm just unlucky, but this has happened to me on at least two other occasions (deflating bed). When these beds work properly, they are excellent, but when they don't work, they are horrible. I have back issues and like these beds when they work, but when they don't, it's very bad news if you have back issues.

1blokeCA
Los Angeles, California
Reviewer
5 reviews 5 reviews
Reviews in 3 cities Reviews in 3 cities
8 helpful votes 8 helpful votes
'Still a beautiful airport hotel after 16 years!'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 5, 2012 NEW

Without a doubt, this is one of the top 2 airport hotels at LAX. I stayed here maybe around 20 times back in the 1990s (it was still fairly new then) and this was my first visit in over a decade (April 2012). After reading some of the horrible reviews online, I decided to take a chance since the Hilton and Westin at LAX have held up really well over the years.

Check In was amazingly friendly. The Black Lady at the front desk (I didnt get her name) was so wonderful and really went out of her way to place me in a wonderful room on the 9th floor. We had a lovely chat about the hotel back in the 90s, and I was able to share a few stories. She really made the difference in kick starting a lovely stay.

I CANNOT SAY THIS ENOUGH....First impressions at Check In set the stage for the stay. Period!

The room was very modern with beautiful furnishings throughout. Modern fittings in the bathroom, large flat screen in the room, very comfy chairs and a super comfy, albeit firm-ish bed. Housekeeping staff were super polite! The room felt and looked super clean if you know what I mean!

There is a nice gym on the 2nd floor, pool and.....sauna (rare in airport hotels).

The hotel lived up to my expectations as in the older days, and I HIGHLY recommend everyone to pick this hotel. I only stayed here for one night this time, but the hotel would work for anyone who needs a few nights. Its a very classy hotel up there with the LAX Hilton, better than the Westin LAX. Anyone looking for an airport first class plus hotel would not be disappointed by either of the three.

The Renaissance is the only 4 star hotel at LAX (for you priceline/hotwire bidders ;)

Burger King is across the road (if thats your thing) otherwise In & Out is a quick 3 min drive with other food places and a Ralphs supermarket and Trader Joes market (TJ is the place that foreigners will love) near by. The airport is less than 5 mins on their bus (which I did not use this time)

If you like to watch airplanes land...the final approach to the runway is within excellent viewing range (hotel has triple framed windows, so noise is hardly an issue).

All the car rental places are across the street or nearby, with Avis and Budget within a 2-5 min walk.

Not one issue with this hotel!
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
Ask 1blokeCA about Renaissance Los Angeles Airport Hotel
This review is the subjective opinion of a TripAdvisor member and not of TripAdvisor LLC.

dantex
Olney, Texas
Contributor
13 reviews 13 reviews
Reviews in 5 cities Reviews in 5 cities
2 helpful votes 2 helpful votes
'LAX Renaissance'
3 of 5 stars Reviewed June 3, 2012 NEW

I bid for 4 star LAX on Priceline and got this hotel for $70. The lobby was nice
and cool design and the front desk staff were very friendly. I think my room was a lock-off room from a suite. It was small with a strange configuration. The furnishings looked dated and the upholstered chair had a big stain on the seat cushion. The TV sat on a dresser at an angle from the bed, not directly in front.
The room had a small desk and a refrigerator but no mini bar the window was small
with a view of a parking lot. The bed was nice and comfy. There is valet and self parking. Self park is easy and the garage is adjacent to the hotel by elevator. I don't remember the self park fee but I think it was $25.
The hotel is immediately outside LAX and really close to rental car returns.
I didn't try the hotel restaurant nor did I use room service. There are several
fast food places within a few blocks McDonald's, Carl Jr's.
It's a very convenient place to stay if you have an early flight.
Less

yanna
green valley, az
Contributor
11 reviews 11 reviews
Reviews in 10 cities Reviews in 10 cities
34 helpful votes 34 helpful votes
'upgraded room made stay worthwhile'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed June 2, 2012 NEW

My daughter and I stayed at this hotel on two Sundays, one week apart. The first visit was in an ordinary double bed room on the 8th floor. It was small, and had some stains on the carpet. The second visit we asked to upgrade to a suite. We paid a small price and also received access to the lounge on the club floor with free breakfast. This room was well appointed and although we only had a king bed and a sofa bed, it was worth the price. There was an appropriate level of staffing on the second visit, so that when someone arrived to check in another receptionist appeared at the front desk. The week before there was a line for check-in. The bar and lounge area also had pleny of help, compared to the previous week. Now I would stay at this hotel again, knowing what I know about the different room accomodations.
Less

Problem with this review?
Jim L
Lexington Park, Maryland
1 review
1 helpful vote 1 helpful vote
'Spent a lot of nights here'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 2, 2012 NEW
1
person found this review helpful

I have been very happy with my stays here of the last couple of years. I travel to LA often for business and the Renaissance has become my top choice. I Have to say the new management gets the 5. If I graded last year it would have been a 4. What impressed me most was that the staff recognized me at my second visit and greeted me like an old friend, unlike where I had been staying previously for almost two years of business trips. I have always found the staff willing to assist, whether it was a room issue or recommending a local restraurant. The restraurant in the hotel has good food, but the menu is not to my taste. The Fitness room seems to always be clean, functional and with enough equipment to not be crowded. With two years of experience here, I have had some issues with rooms, that have been handled very promptly and only once have I ever had to make a second call on the issue. All rooms have a mini-fridge which is now a necessity to me as a travelling diabetic. Internet service was not very stable at times last year, but that seems have been worked out. Airport transport has been much better since they changed the routing, usually taking less than 20 minutes from getting to the lobby to airline dropoff. Sometimes the busses get out of sync and it will take 30 minutes from lobby to dropoff. There is a monitor showing the bus locations just across from the valet parking stand. If in a hurry it has only been $10-12 (including tip) to take a cab.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes

'Great Airport Hotel - can't go wrong'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed May 30, 2012 NEW via mobile
1
person found this review helpful

Great hotel, although we didn't actually spend a lot of time here as we got in late and left pretty early. The room and the hotel itself were nice, clean and relatively modern.

I would say, save yourself the overnight parking charge as you can leave the car in one of the side streets next to the hotel (not even 50 meters away from the main entrance).

We had a room on the 5th floor facing the airport. You can't really hear anything so noise is not an issue.

All in all, good place to stay.

Problem with this review?
BBadvisor
Silicon Valley
Senior Reviewer
7 reviews 7 reviews
Reviews in 7 cities Reviews in 7 cities
17 helpful votes 17 helpful votes
'Not a bad airport hotel'
3 of 5 stars Reviewed May 29, 2012

Make sure to confirm your room preference and bed type with the hotel ahead of time or pick another property to stay. I had a bit of drama trying to get a room with two beds and manager had to intervene to solve my problem. Apparently reservations are only a 'request' and don't really constitute a "reservation". This shows poor hotel management and puts unnecessary stress on guests during check-in process. If I book a room with two beds, I expect to get a room with two beds! Period!

The rooms are clean with refreshed carpet, furniture and flat panel TV with plenty of towels and amenities. My only issue was with the bed. It seems like an old mattress (a little wobbly) with not much support and padding. It's a shame. If you change the mattress with a good quality support, it would be a very comfortable hotel.

Both valet parking and self-parking are outrageously expensive. If the room is ~$100 per night, does it make sense to charge 30% of the daily room rate for valet parking and 15% for Internet access?
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?

Problem with this review?
luv2globetrot
Nashua, New Hampshire
Top Contributor
56 reviews 56 reviews
Reviews in 53 cities Reviews in 53 cities
191 helpful votes 191 helpful votes
'Disappointing and blah'
3 of 5 stars Reviewed May 29, 2012

This Marriott was a bit of a let down from other Renaissance properties we've stayed in.
Kind of hard to pinpoint why...just kind of blah, nothing special about the rooms.
They almost seemed more Holiday-Inn-ish (which doesn't neccesarily mean bad, just not what you'd expect from Marriott).
The decor was a mish-mash of furniture and everything seemed like it was poor quality furniture, lamps, art on the walls, etc.
The bathroom also wasn't up to par...very basic bathtub/shower, but clean.
Hard to tell this from the photos and again, it wasn't horrible, just disappointing and not what we've seen at other locations.
This may be good for an airport stopover, but we intended it as a base to spend 4 nights in L.A. to sightsee because we got a good AAA rate of $94/nt.
Not a good location for this...guess we should've known better. Too far from all the tourist stuff (Hollywood, Beverly Hills, etc) and of course traffic is horrible (duh!)
We reserved all 4 nights and left after 1 after getting a good deal on Hotwire in West Hollywood at the Hotel Palomar (LOVED that place...I've also posted a review for that one).
I'm assuming it's convenient from LAX (we did NOT fly into or out of here so can't comment on that), but if all you want is close to the airport, clean and you get a good deal, go for it.
But if you are expecting a 4 star room you may be let down as we were.

    *
    *
    *
    *
    *

Less

CharlesKickham
London
Senior Contributor
30 reviews 30 reviews
Reviews in 20 cities Reviews in 20 cities
13 helpful votes 13 helpful votes
'Ideal place to stay in LA'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed June 5, 2012 NEW

This started life as a motel in 1947 and is just fantastic. Don't let motel put you off. Every single room has its own doorway from the main courtyard and has been continuously upgraded. The rooms are immaculate and really comfortable but all very private, with no busy foyer to have to negotiate. The en-suites are a good size, the rooms are welcoming and very comfortable.It's small scale and it's very personal. The location is great for Santa Monica, Brentwood, Sunset, Hollywood and the freeways. The staff were just wonderful and the whole place is very relaxing and immaculate. Each member of staff - it has only one or two on at a time - was wonderful and it has a lovely cosy, welcoming feel. Brentwood village is a ten minute walk and has wonderful restaurants and a great village feel - make sure to visit Brentwood village mart on Barrington. Any issues? Only one. We stayed in room 460 which has a wonderful private patio area and is larger than the other rooms, but the hotels boiler is located right behind the back wall and you can hear it operating at night. It's quite loud but it's not such a big deal after a night or two. I'm sure the folks at the front desk have offered the explanation many times before. I'd certainly go back and to the same room. A great stay.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
See 2 more reviews by CharlesKickham for Los Angeles

urbanspelunker
Washington DC, District of Columbia
Senior Reviewer
8 reviews 8 reviews
Reviews in 8 cities Reviews in 8 cities
16 helpful votes 16 helpful votes
'Excellent base to see LA'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 5, 2012 NEW

Stayed at the Brentwood for four nights while visiting friends and sightseeing in LA. For the price, it is hard to imagine a better choice in LA. The room and bathroom were small but clean, the bed, linens, TV, and toiletries were top quality, and the continental breakfast, fresh fruit and tea available all day, and cookies and milk in the evenings were an appreciated touch, especially if you've had to sit in LA traffic! Evan at the reception was a pleasure throughout our stay. The shopping areas of Brentwood are close enough to walk, though we drove since we had a car.

The hotel's location is particularly good if you're interested in spending time in Malibu, Santa Monica, or Venice, or visiting the Getty. The trip to Hollywood or Los Veliz is quite a bit longer, but that's because LA is a big city. There was a lot of traffic on Sunset outside the hotel, but I am not sure there's anything to be done about that; it's LA after all and considerably cheaper than a more secluded place like the Beverly Hills Hotel, a little further east on Sunset!

We booked a queen room, but if we did it again we'd probably book a king room for a couple. Queen seemed perfect for one person, but it was a little tight for two, as we both had big bags (we were in the middle of a two-week trip).
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes

'Great place for exploring LA'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed June 4, 2012 NEW

Spent a couple of nights here and had a very comfortable stay. I can't say much about the surrounding amenities (in terms of walking distance at least), but did find it a great base to see most things in LA by car. The rooms (which are spotlessly clean) feel like self contained little cottages, much more homely than a standard motel. Ample parking is provided. Seems like a nice neighbourhood too. Very friendly staff. My only gripe would be that its right next to an intersection and the traffic was quite heavy and a bit noisy, as a result I found myself waking earlier that anticipated each morning. Still, I'd very happily stay here again.
Less

Reviews in 14 cities Reviews in 14 cities

'Quality Motel in LA close to almost everything'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 3, 2012 NEW

Stayed here two nights and was very well pleased with our stay there. It is a former motel that has been upgraded. It is located in a good neighborhood and we felt very safe there. In close proximity you will find Hollywood, Beverly Hills, Santa Monica beach/Venice Beach and so forth.
Had to do some paperwork in conjunction with work and the reception staff was very helpful in regards to printing and scanning the documents.
Room was clean and comfy! Complementary wireless internet is also available which was nice.
There is a continental breakfast, but we did not try this. The cookies in the evening was a nice touch!
Recomended!
If traveling by car be aware of traffic in LA. It is congested almost all day long.
Less

'Wonderful "hidden" gem!'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed May 28, 2012
1
person found this review helpful

My son lives in Brentwood and suggested that I stay here because of the close proximity to his home and he heard it was "nice." Well, my son is a smart boy! The Brentwood Inn was charming and the service was amazing! Staff and management were so friendly and happy...it appeared that they actually like working there! The grounds are small (one of the reasons I choose it) and the rooms are a little small too, but the cleanliness and service made up for that. Having been in the hotel business, I know what good service is...that personal touch is what brings customers back time and time again. Special kudos to Britain who was so cheerful and helpful, even at 10:00 at night. He is certainly an asset! If you are tired of the typical overpriced, large, impersonal hotels in the L.A. area, The Brentwood Inn is the place for you!

JaneK66
Surrey
Senior Reviewer
6 reviews 6 reviews
Reviews in 5 cities Reviews in 5 cities
4 helpful votes 4 helpful votes
'Great place to stay in LA'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed April 23, 2012
1
person found this review helpful

After spending ages searching for somewhere to stay in LA (with parking), I finally came across the Brentwood Inn and chose it because of the good reviews it had. I wasn't disappointed. We received such a warm welcome when we arrived and all the reception staff were very friendly and helpful and told us places to visit etc. They have different types of teas and cookies in the reception that you can help yourself to in the afternoon and evening, and the breakfast (included in the price) was very nice - fruit, cereals, yoghurt and pastries etc, and you can sit in the little courtyard and eat it.

One of the big benefits was the free parking and you can park right outside your room. The rooms have been very nicely renovated and are very comfortable and spotlessly clean.

It's located in Brentwood which is a nice suburb. You really need a car if you're staying here. It's well located for driving out to the coast, eg Malibu, Santa Monica, Venice Beach etc, and also for driving into Hollywood, Beverly Hills and downtown.

We really loved this hotel and would stay there again if we go back to LA.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes

JCLatrigg
Liverpool, United Kingdom
2 reviews
'Excellent customer service'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 6, 2012 NEW

The staff here certainly know how to look after their guests. Every member of staff made our visit for our wedding anniversary extra special. We were upgraded on arrival and were given a complimentary bottle of prosecco which we enjoyed on the splendid rooftop bar.Our room was a decent size for New York with a wonderfully comfortable bed and a very trendy shower .The location on West 47th Street literally just off Times Square was excellent. It was hard to believe the tranquillity of the hotel in comparison to the hustle and bustle of Times Square.A simple breakfast was included in the rate which more than filled you up for the day ahead. Information and advice was given readily and staff always took the trouble to ask you about your day- we particularly enjoyed the attention we got from many of the staff after we attended the Mets game where Johan Santana achieved cult status by achieving a 'no -hitter' in the game against St Louis Cardinals. As a brit who didn't know a great deal about baseball before I quickly realised the historical significance of the event as it was plastered over news bulletins in papers and on TV. I could write so much more about the Sanctuary Hotel and would recommend it to anyone. Special thanks to Julio for his advice, wit and general hospitality.A wonderful hotel- keep up the excellent work!!!
Less

See 2 more reviews by jquillm for New York City
jquillm
Louisville, Kentucky
Senior Reviewer
7 reviews 7 reviews
Reviews in 5 cities Reviews in 5 cities
21 helpful votes 21 helpful votes
'This is not a hotel for everyone'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 5, 2012 NEW

Before selecting Sanctuary, read the reviews here. It is not a $95/night Hampton Inn along the interstate with large rooms and a big free breakfast. It is in the heart of New York City where space is at a premium and most hotel rooms are small and expensive...just like Sanctuary. Other hotels charge outrageous fees for internet access and the most basic continental breakfast. Sanctuary has free Internet and a perfectly good light continental breakfast included in the cost of the room. If you want a full breakfast, you can leave the hotel and pay for ham, eggs and hash browns within a block. And if you need surgical level lighting to find your way down the hall, look elsewhere. Sanctuary is all about a great, quiet location a block from Times Square and a staff that is fully committed to a level of service that is hard to find anywhere. We were part of two couples who just spent four nights there in King Deluxe rooms which provided all the room we needed. We couldn't believe the level of attention we received from the staff. They spent all the time we needed to give us information about getting around, making recommendations and booking reservations for us. We were always greeted warmly coming and going. But if you like to be left alone and ignored, Sanctuary is also not for you. For us it was perfect.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes

ceciChile
chile
Contributor
16 reviews 16 reviews
Reviews in 10 cities Reviews in 10 cities
18 helpful votes 18 helpful votes
'Too dark for my taste'
3 of 5 stars Reviewed June 4, 2012 NEW

I read many reviews before my trip to NYC and I picked the Casablanca for our first 4 nights, then we had to go to Washington DC for a few days and I chose the Sanctuary for our last 2 nights in NYC.
I picked it because it was close to TS, breakfast was included and the reviews were great.
The staff are really nice and attentive but I think we just were not lucky. We got there and were greeted very nicely and shown to our room in no time. The room was tiny, only space for one night table and the shower was right next to the bed, so very disappointing!!! We waited for our luggage for a while and decided to go for a walk because it never got to our room, on our way out, my sister noticed one of her bags was by the front desk, strange!!! so we asked about our bags. There had been a sort of misunderstanding and they had stored them. No problem , they sent them to our room right after. Now our room was cramped!!! tiny and with 4 big bags plus 2 pieces of hand luggage. !!!!
The bed was nice and soft and the place was quiet.
We decided to look at the bright side. We were in NY and we had only 2 days left so we tried to make the most of them.
The hotel was really dark, it looked like a night club to me, the sanctuary part was OK I mean the front desk and the aisle on the way to the elevator, but the decor at the bar and coffee place wasn't really related to anything like a sanctuary.
Breakfast was OK, orange juice, coffee and bagels, some other pastries, we usually have a light breakfast so it was Ok for us.
The people at the front desk were very attentive, they printed our check in vouchers and were always willing to offer help with directions etc.
When we booked the room we were offered a bottle of prosecco and we asked for it on our last evening. I had to ask for it 3 different times and mention their STAR policy to finally get it. We had it at the lounge which was nice, because our room was so little.
I really hate to say this because the staff are so very nice and I understand the good reviews, but if I had known the size of the rooms and the night club look I wouldn't have booked it.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
See 3 more reviews by ceciChile for New York City
Ask ceciChile about Sanctuary Hotel New York
This review is the subjective opinion of a TripAdvisor member and not of TripAdvisor LLC.
Jeremy Poon, General Manager at Sanctuary Hotel New York, responded to this review
June 5, 2012
Thank you for taking the time to post a review about your visit to the Sanctuary Hotel

I'd like to apologize that your experience at our unique hotel was not what you expected.. We have a very distinctive contemporary style . As you see from most of our reviews, our guests appreciate a cozy, warm, and inviting atmosphere that we strive to create. We make every effort to present our guests with a discrete retreat away from the hustle and bustle of the city, creating a "home away from home" feel, with a touch of glamour. The goal with the design is to create a serene and tranquil environment that would be representative of the Sanctuary Hotel name (not to mention the genuine and attentive services that our staff provides).

Although some of our rooms are not considered large, many would agree that it is common to New York standards. I would like to suggest you try our deluxe rooms, which have additional space for added comfort and upgraded amenities. I believe that it would definitely be a better fit for your needs. Additionally, we always ensure that we are competitively priced and offer additional value that most hotels charge for. We offer complimentary wifi, breakfast and gym passes to "Equinox". Along with our well known service, we believe that we offer a great value.

My only wish is that you would have informed us about your unhappiness with the room size, and given us an opportunity to provide you with additional room options. Here are the Sanctuary, our team is always here to ensure guest satisfaction.

I would love for you to give us another opportunity in the near future, so that I may personally ensure that you have a comfortable and enjoyable visit.

Best Regards,

Jeremy Poon
General Manager
Report response as inappropriate
This response is the subjective opinion of the management representative and not of TripAdvisor LLC.

1
person found this review helpful

Otherwise it would be fully booked and we couldn't stay here again.

What can you say, from the moment you arrive, until you have to leave, you are greeted by staff who are only too willing to help. The service is superb and the staff are what makes the Sanctuary Hotel special. You are made to feel welcome your entire stay unlike the bigger hotels.

Nothing is too much trouble, they are friendly, courteous and professional. After a long day of sight seeing, shopping, entertaining or dining, a nice touch is the welcome you get each time you come back, no matter the time.

The rooms are beautifully decorated, the bed is super comfy and the shower wonderful with its big shower head. No problems with the size of the room. Not sure how much more room the others need when that say they are too small (stayed in smaller when I was in Hong Kong).

The decor of the hotel is luxurious and complements the theme the hotel has. Some may say it's a bit dark but it makes the atmosphere very relaxing and welcoming unlike some of the big name hotels which seem clinical and lack warmth. It's more like coming back home than a hotel.

And as they say, location, location. Any closer to Times Square and it would be their front door. It is less than a minutes walk away. Plenty of other sights are a short walkaway and those that are not you walk past the a subway station when walking to Times Square.

If your not sure, as the Sanctuary is not one of those name brand hotels, don't worry you will enjoy your stay here, I did.
Less

'Amazing stay!'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 1, 2012 NEW via mobile

My memorial day weekend stay at this hotel was flawless.
I was there to celebrate my 21st birthday and 10 minutes after my check-in I was greeted with dessert and a card signed by the staff with very kind and personalized messages.
The bed was heaven! I cannot stress that enough. I was worried the room and bathroom were going to be too small but they were perfect! It was 3 of us staying in the double double and we all were extremely comfortable.
The staff is friendly and helpful, they made our hotel stay a breeze.
Breakfast was good, I wish they had more cereal options, but the coffee made up for it.
Also, the location is a plus, it's literally a block away from Times Square.
I will definitely be staying here next time I visit NYC!

'Perfect way to spend 1 night in NYC'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 31, 2012 via mobile

I had booked this hotel very last minute and stayed here on my first night in NYC.

The service was superb, from the staff who helped me with my luggage to the very friendly barmen.

On arrival I was asked if I knew how to get taxis, how much to tip and general getting around the city which really helped since it was my first time to NYC.

The rooms were well decorated, bed very comfortable and the shower was divine (especially after travelling for 20hrs!)

In the evening, one of the 'experience managers' called Jacob Schwartz totally took care of my first night out and it was truly memorable. From the exquisite vehgetarian restaurant to a New York hot spot, my first night in this vibrant city was incredible! A great thanks to him for making my stay with you guys unexpected but exceptional.

I look forward to coming back to stay with you guys. Keep up the excellent service and unique oferrings.

See you on my next trip!

CathRun
San Diego, California
Contributor
15 reviews 15 reviews
Reviews in 10 cities Reviews in 10 cities
9 helpful votes 9 helpful votes
'A luxurious, welcoming retreat in the heart of Midtown Manhattan.'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 30, 2012
1
person found this review helpful

My teen and I stayed at Sanctuary Hotel for a week long trip this past month. I was being an indulgent mother as she chose the hotel based on the photos of the decor she saw online. I am a bit particular about where I stay and was leaning towards a big name hotel vs. a boutique hotel. Wow. What can I say? Sanctuary Hotel provided a first rate stay. And the primary reason I feel this way is because of the staff. A phenomenal bunch of young men and women who really go out of their way to take care of you. But overall, it is really a fabulous place in Midtown Manhattan.

Decor~ Check out the photos online. It is really a beautifully decorated place. I liked the darker decor, I thought it was peaceful but very, very hip. I have to admit that I was a bit cautious initially, thinking that it was going to be some sort of cool urban place with an attitude to match, but I couldn't have been more wrong. It is chic and it is very, very welcoming.

Location~ Times Square is truly steps away and around the corner from Sanctuary. Broadway is just a few steps further and Top of the Rock is about the same distance in the other direction. The subway (which we became quite proficient at) is on the corner. There is a small shop across the street for sodas or snacks and tons of restaurants, shops, etc. within walking distance. NYC is a very walkable city, so once you have the basics sorted out, it is very easy to get to Central Park and several other locations from Sanctuary. Also Grey Line bus tours is barely a block away. And the staff is always on hand to help with directions, maps...and encouragement!

Room~ The queen room was fine for two. We had plenty of room to move about, the "closet" was sufficiently large enough to hold our things for a week, the bathroom is gorgeous....overall it is a well planned out space for a city hotel. We were offered a choice of the 9th or 2nd floor upon check in and were told that we would have more natural light on the 9th floor. We were also advised that Haven, the rooftop bar, was just above us and that we "probably wouldn't be disturbed" by the noise. Hmmm. It did get loud in room 907. They woke us up two nights in a row dragging furniture across the floor at nearly 2 am. I finally, grumpily, stomped upstairs to complain. They were mortified and apologized profusely (I probably scared the hell out of them). They were very sweet and one of the guys even had me point out where our room was so they would be quieter! After this we were able to sleep fairly soundly in the room after about 11pm. I think it just is what it is. They have a fabulous rooftop bar. If you think the noise will be too much, ask for a lower floor. I don't think there's much they can do about it.

Cleanliness~ Absolutely pristine. I will say the only staff we had issues with was housekeeping (one of the maids snapped at my daughter when we asked for clean towels...she was very fortunate I didn't get her name or else I would have been downstairs at the front desk in an instant) but they still do an excellent job.

Haven Bar~ Fun. Beautiful. Friendly. Make sure you make a trip up to the rooftop to enjoy the music, the view, and a drink. Absolutely worth it. A wonderful place to slip up to after dinner in the city. I liked the bar inside the hotel as well. There they would show old, romantic movies like "An Affair to Remember" on a huge screen. And Dean Martin and Frank Sinatra are mixed in with more contemporary easy jazz singers all day long....Sigh. Such wonderful touches.


Breakfast~ The girls who serve at breakfast are amazing! They never falter at bringing you what you need or request with a smile. They dash around in these cute little black dresses as unobtrusively as possible. Never was a coffee urn empty or the pastry tray not filled...fabulous. They have bagels, bread, hard boiled eggs, pastries, a little cereal...and apples, oranges, bananas....I would suggest that maybe some Greek yogurt and granola or other kinds of fruit would be a nice change sometimes. But then again we were there for a full week. At any rate the breakfast was always plentiful and the coffee was always fresh and strong...great way to start the day.

Service~ I saved the best for last. Where to start? Let's see. There is, of course, Jacob the concierge, who would toil and hustle to get Broadway tickets or restaurant reservations or bus passes....I swear, the man is a walking encyclopedia of New York City. He has contacts all over the place and is so easy to talk to about different options for entertainment (and an occassional burst of a Gershwin tune). Also Jimmy, his sidekick at the front desk, whose droll English humor (wicked man) always made me laugh. I loved interacting with the staff....And there's Julio and the other doormen who made the place feel as safe as Fort Knox....Freddie, Brandon, Lauren....everyone was so sweet and helpful. Marta gave me written directions for the subway to Greenpoint, a Polish neighborhood in Brooklyn and we found it with no troubles. They really made our stay special.

When we were on the plane home I mentioned to my daughter that we might want to stay closer to Greenwich Village on our next stay in NYC but she firmly said "No". It's the Sanctuary Hotel or nowhere for her. This coming from a teen that I thought was happy just having her daily glass of milk and cinnamon roll for breakfast and free wi-fi. But then just yesterday she said wistfully, "Do you remember Jacob at the hotel? Wasn't he nice? Wasn't everyone nice? It was so pretty. Don't you miss it there?" Yeah. I really do.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes

Jeremy Poon, General Manager at Sanctuary Hotel New York, responded to this review
June 5, 2012
Thank you for writing such a wonderful and thoughtful review about your stay at the Sanctuary Hotel.

We are pleased to know that the experience for you and your daughter was so memorable. While we strive to exceed the expectations of all our guests, we understand that there is always room for improvement.

In regards to the housekeeping interaction with your daughter, rest assured that this is something that will be addressed accordingly. I'm also glad that our rooftop staff was able to respond to your needs accordingly.

We hope that your next travels to NYC will bring you back to the Sanctuary Hotel. We would love to continue the endearing experience that you and your daughter were able to appreciate.

Should you need assistance with future reservations, please do not hesitate to contact me directly. I would be more than happy to assist you and Jacob would love to do something special.

Warm Regards,

Jeremy Poon
General Manager

kittyjoy
Bangkok, Thailand
Contributor
12 reviews 12 reviews
Reviews in 12 cities Reviews in 12 cities
39 helpful votes 39 helpful votes
'Excellent hotel, food and service'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 6, 2012 NEW

Stayed here 6 nights from May 28 to Jun 3, 2012 and found the hotel superb!
Location: Great location. Just two straight blocks from Times Square but it's far enough to avoid the busy and unpleasant atmosphere. Three main subways around - Grand Central, 42th street Port Authority and Bryant Park. All withing walking distance. Many nice and reasonable-priced restaurants nearby.
Service: All staffs(the front desks, the cashiers, the concierges, the maids, the bell men, the bartenders, the waiters etc) are well-trained and have both good attitude and service-mind. They were all proper and very efficient.
Dining: Had breakfast 2 days at Gaby and also ordered room service. Foods were of high-quality and standard and above all these very delicious (do not taste like hotel foods but more like good restaurants)!
I paid about $345+++ to $475+++ a night (not the same rate everyday) and that worth every dollar!

    *
    *
    *
    *
    *
    *
    *

'Excellent location'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed June 6, 2012 NEW

We stayed at the Sofitel for our first trip to NY and really enjoyed the central location. The daily bottles of water in the room were a nice touch. We only used the hotel as a base as we were out & about all day but the room was comfortable and we enjoyed the powerful shower. A tip to smokers: it's one of the only NY hotels that allows smoking in rooms but only at floors 28-30 (superior rooms). As the weather wasn't very nice, it was nice to be able to smoke indoors & sitting after having walked miles.

Shiningstar12
Reviewer
3 reviews 3 reviews
Reviews in 2 cities Reviews in 2 cities
'You pay for the location if anything. Service is poor'
2 of 5 stars Reviewed June 5, 2012 NEW

Positive: A nice touch was the fruitplate for our honeymoon in our room and that we got a room on the 29th floor so we had a good view. Concierge Service was nice.

Negative: We were staying at Sofitel in Munich and Berlin, Germany before, i have to say its a total difference, the rooms at Sofitel NY are not as close luxurious as the ones in Germany and the staff is not very warm and welcoming (for instance when i arrived in my wedding dress on ,no one was there to open the door). All you pay for is the view, definately not the room. Beeing that we live in NY and have the view all the time i wish we wouldve picked another hotel! Saturday we were out of the room until 4 or 5 pm and when we came back the room was not cleaned (we didnt leave the Do not disturb sign on!). I work for hotels and this is not acceptable for the price we paid (about $420 a night)! Later an attendant came we told her to fix the room at 8 pm, but then we went out at 6pm and i told the Front desk clerk to clean the room right now instead of 8pm. Well, when we came back nothing happened. I had to call front desk again and then finally the maid came up. This shouldnt happen and i dont think Sofitel NY can meet the Standards of Sofitel Europe. Another thing is that we tried to call the front desk and housekepping and could never get a hold of anyone, the only one we got on the phone was the concierge. Its very upsetting for us because it was our wedding weekend and we expected to have a good experience since we trusted the Sofitel Brand... Definately will not recommend this hotel.
Less

beers4u
Aptos, CA
Reviewer
3 reviews 3 reviews
Reviews in 2 cities Reviews in 2 cities
'Great room, great location, great staff'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 3, 2012 NEW

We couldn't have been happier with the Sofitel. We had a Jr. Suite and a superior queen for our girls. They were attached with a private hallway. I believe the price we paid for our rooms was the best value we had during our trip to New York City. The hotel is half a block from 5th Avenue shopping and 2 blocks from Times Square. Everyone from the doormen to the front desk staff were friendly and helpful. We never had to wait more than a minute or two for a cab out front and the desk made sure our free breakfasts were erased from the bill (family package) upon check out. We will definitely stay here again and we will enthusiastically recommend this hotel to our friends that visit NYC.

bfgleason
Hattiesburg, Mississippi
Contributor
18 reviews 18 reviews
Reviews in 6 cities Reviews in 6 cities
7 helpful votes 7 helpful votes
'Love this place!'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 6, 2012 NEW

This was my second stay at this hotel, and it was great!! My sister and I took my two nieces to NYC for my oldest nieces birthday, and I flew in from Pittsburgh earlier than they flew in from
Louisiana. I got to the hotel at about 11:15 and checked in and was told I could leave my bags, but since my sister was not there yet I told the lady at the desk that I would just sit in the lobby and maybe 30 minutes later someone brought me keys to my room!! Nearly 4 hours before check-in!! the best was the day we left though! Our flights both left late so we checked out and left our bags then went sight seeing. When we got back Alonzo let us in the guest bathroom in the lobby that is accessible by your room card but we had already checked. He then let us in the fitness room for some cold water before we left!! I will stay here again and again!!
Less
