sandyman57
London, United Kingdom
Senior Reviewer
6 reviews 6 reviews
Reviews in 5 cities Reviews in 5 cities
11 helpful votes 11 helpful votes
'Location, Location, Location!'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed June 2, 2012 NEW
4
people found this review helpful

As the title suggests, we feel that this Hotel is very nicely placed for attractions, theatres and restaurants. One avenue from Times Square (and Broadway), you just simply cross the road, walk 250 yards and Times Square is looking at you!
The Hotel staff are very friendly and attentive, the rooms are absolutely fine - clean, tidy, decent size for a City Hotel and everything works well. Good continental breakfast is part of the deal and there is a good selection from fresh fruit salad, yoghurt, cereals, toast and sticky buns, waffles, scrambled egg and sausages plus decent coffee! A great base to stay at.
Plenty to do in NY? Second time we have been, but still left not seeing it all!
If you want a nice and easy way of starting off your visit and want to tour around some, then there is a Gray line shop just 3 streets down from the Hotel. Here you can buy 1-3 day 'hop on hop off' bus passes and they either run uptown or downtown. To start the uptown loop it is a few yards away from the shop, the other loop is from Times Square so it couldn't be easier. So a nice way to get taken around with very good commentary from a guy or girl on the bus delivered often with some good humour mixed in! So you can simply plan your visits around the relevant stops made by the buses.
We also used the underground/Metro which is perfectly easy to get you about - ticket machines are straight forward enough, but if in doubt there are plenty of people around to ask.
Then of course there are the cabs, got to be done! Just fling yourself out in the road a bit and you will get a cab OK and they were not as expensive as we thought they might be.
I am sure readers most probably know where they want to go already, but a few thoughts:
9/11 Memorial Gardens - very poignant and you cannot but help to be affected by it. We were in NY 4 years ago and at that stage ground zero building was going on, but still below ground. Now the new tower is looming over the skyline and whilst not finished, it is now taller than the Empire State building.
Once you have left the Memorial - Brooklyn bridge is across the road and is certainly worth walking across and good photo opportunities. Or get back on the bus and next stop is Wall Street and just below this is Battery Park. Here you can buy tickets to go on the ferry to Liberty Island and Ellis Island (it stops at both in the same trip). Of course the Statue of Liberty is iconic and a 'must do', but Ellis Island is also well worth a visit and the museum there is very interesting around the history of immigration into the United States.
You can also take the Staten Island ferry from Battery Park and this is absolutely free - so if you want to take pictures of the New York skyline or photograph the Statue of Liberty, then this is a good way of doing so.
Empire State building - you know you need to do it! I would personally buy a fastpass on the website as if you are limited in time this is a good way to sneak past big queues.
Rockefeller Center - well worth a whizz up to the top and there are some great views from there.
Central Park is lovely and you can't go to this City without a walk in the park! Zoo at the South East end, boating lake south west end.
There's loads more to do, but finally one other thing you should do is go to the theatre. This time we went to see Ghost (theatre just down the road) and it really was an excellent show. Very funny at times, sad at others but the special effects are stunning and you leave feeling you have been thoroughly entertained!
So, if you are going to New York - you will have a great time.
If you are thinking about it - for goodness sake just get it booked!
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
Ask sandyman57 about The Hampton Inn Times Square North
This review is the subjective opinion of a TripAdvisor member and not of TripAdvisor LLC.

'Perfect for our Family'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 30, 2012
1
person found this review helpful

This hotel was picked for several reasons that were important for our family. Location (close to Gershwin theatre with Wicked) and subway stations, free Breakfast (hot with plenty of choices), free 24 hr coffee/tea/hot chocolate and apples for snacking, Queen beds instead of double beds. Our family has 2 teens so breakfast saved us a bundle each day. Coming back to the hotel after our busy sightseeing days, the free hot drinks and apples were a welcoming touch. We also appreciated the queen beds instead of doubles which with teens sharing a bed is a must for keeping the peace. Next door to the hotel are plenty of food choices and a drug store for things forgotten. Laundry mat down the street was helpful when drenched with tennis shoes at Statue of Liberty (45 minutes later and 6 quarters problem was solved). Hotel was even able to accomodate a late check out after they checked their schedule when we asked them. We were able to leave directly from hotel to airport which was a nice way to end our stay since we were exhausted. No complaints.

kaylars
Las Vegas, Nevada
Senior Contributor
22 reviews 22 reviews
Reviews in 5 cities Reviews in 5 cities
'Great location, great stay'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed May 29, 2012
1
person found this review helpful

Location was great, 8 min walk to time square and surrounded by subways. The front desk, breakfast staff and bellmen were friendly and inviting. The 2 dbl room worked perfect for 4 people and didn't seemed cramped. The a/c however seemed to lag which would have upset me in the summer but it was comfy for the days we were there. I do wish there was a fridge however I don't expect there to be one. I loved out view facing 8th st, just waking up and looking out the window to see all those taxis driving by added to my "you're in NY moment". The walls seem to be thin but we didn't have any complaints. The free breakfast was amazing and was just the perfect way to start the day. I read reviews that is was really busy and to go early but didn't run into this problem. The only thing I had to wait maybe for a minute was the waffle maker since there is only two but it was nothing. Had to use the business corner a couple of time and fax some documents which was a breeze. We were in town during Fleet Week and didn't feel like it was ever to crowded until the last day we left which started off Memorial Day weekend

Reviews in 2 cities Reviews in 2 cities
9 helpful votes 9 helpful votes
'Fantastic Location, Lovely room'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed June 3, 2012 NEW

We stayed at The Jewel for 4 nights, and found it to be very good. First of all location was excellent, literally facing the Rockefeller Centre, 10 minute walk to Times Square and 5th Avenue shops, and 20 mins to Central park. Easy access to subway also so ideal for sight seeing. The rooms were very comfortable, not a bad size for NYC standards, bed was comfortable and bathroom was good. Air con and wi-fi in the room and tea and coffee making facilities. Hotel staff were always pleasant and happy to help, nice lounge area with access to computers for printing tickets etc. We had a lovely stay and I would definitely recommend this hotel to other tourists visiting New York and wanting to be in a good location. On a NYC note definitely buy the New York passes if you are planning on doing all the sights we saved about 100 as a result of having these passes. Also for a superb meal if you want an extra special evening go to Ruth Chris' Steakhouse on the same street as the hotel down towards times square, best food in New York and excellent service.
Less

Problem with this review?
mat210589
Manchester, United Kingdom
Reviewer
3 reviews 3 reviews
Reviews in 3 cities Reviews in 3 cities
3 helpful votes 3 helpful votes
'Innovative and accommodating Jewel'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 3, 2012 NEW
1
person found this review helpful

We visited New York over Memorial weekend. From the moment we arrived at the Jewel the staff were extremely cheery and helpful and check in was very smooth. Being a fairly new hotel in Manhattan it has a contemporary feel that other hotels lack. The reception is small but has a nice seating area if you are awaiting for a transfer at the end of your holiday. Alternatively, there is a lounge on the second floor with complimentary drinking facilities, free access to computers and a lovely seating area. The added bonus here is you can check in for your return flight (If applicable) with complete ease at your own leisure.

The room we stayed in was the smallest double room; although certainly not too small. Some people may complain about the size, but it is rare to find a large room in any hotel in Manhattan unless your paying the big bucks for a penthouse. Why would you need any bigger? Cleanliness of the room was fantastic, and the little touches such as the i-pod docking station, coffee machine, fridge and microwave just added that extra luxury. Considering we were staying in Midtown, sleep was completely uninterrupted and I wasn't woken once by any noise.

On each floor there is water machine with complimentary water bottles for guests. What a great idea; something I have not seen before and we took complete advantage of. I did not use the gym on the fifth floor, but along with the vending machine, ice machine and free use of the washing machine these were further innovative ideas to accommodate guests' needs.

We did not visit the Terrace club situated nearby but there was a gift of a complimentary drink and discounted food courtesy of the Jewel.

Overall, our stay was completely perfect at the Jewel. Situated in Midtown, whether it is your first time in Manhattan or you are returning I would 100% recommend The Jewel as a trustworthy hotel that has a lot to offer.
Less

'Passed the test'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed June 2, 2012 NEW

See 3 more reviews by arch49 for New York City
arch49
TN
Senior Reviewer
7 reviews 7 reviews
Reviews in 3 cities Reviews in 3 cities
2 helpful votes 2 helpful votes
'Passed the test'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed June 2, 2012 NEW

We typically stay in 4-star hotels but decided to try this one because of the price, design, location and good previous reviews.
I suppose the test of any hotel is how they handle it when things go wrong. So I'll share both the good and the bad. Check in: We arrived at 2:00 and were told we had to wait until 3:00 to check in so they held our luggage in the hotel storage. This was a little stressful since we had to be across town for business, but based on older reviews about lost reservations, we decided to wait nearby for an hour by walking around Rockefeller Center, which is just across the street (great location).
We came back at 3:00 to check in and were promptly given a room on the 15th floor where I thoroughly checked the bed since I had heard that all New York hotels might have bedbugs, even the nice ones. For the first time in my travels over 20 years, I actually found a bug between the mattress and box spring, alive and crawling. I am not a bug expert and it became evident the hotel staffperson would not acknowledge it was a bedbug without their own independent investigation. Not being aware that the burden of proof is on the guest, I failed to take a photo or trap it and later they said they did not find it. However, they assured us they take these kinds of things seriously and did the right thing and accommodated our request to be moved to a different room several floors away, which was bug-free for the rest of our 5 night stay. We were so glad to have a new bug-free room we decided not to mention that we had booked a room with a view and stayed in our new room facing an alley, which was very quiet.
The room decor was basic but nice and the standard room was sufficiently spacious. The bed was a little too close to the window AC unit which made it uncomfortable at night with blowing cold air directly on the person closest to the window. It was nice to have an operable window in the room, but it was a little too warm during our stay to use it. Sliding doors on bathrooms look nice but provide no acoustical privacy. The shower curtain was a strangely lower-grade design choice in a bathroom with mostly upscale finishes and I wish they had replaced it between guests or at least every few days (didn't look like it). The tile grout, fixtures, and surfaces were clean and shiny.
The filtered water (with bottles) available in the hall was a very nice amenity which we used every day. If you're looking for the ironing board, you have to get it from a common hall closet but we had no trouble once they told us where to find it.
Checkout is at noon but our plane would not depart until 8pm so the hotel was nice enough to store our luggage and allow us to use the second floor lounge to freshen up when we returned at 5:00 to pick up our luggage and head to LaGuardia. They called a car service but no one was available so we walked down to St. Patrick's Cathedral to hail a cab and got lucky on the 3rd try (first two said they would not go to the airport)- we were his last fare before shift change and he was heading home near the airport. I would recommend to anyone to arrange for car service a day ahead at least, especially if you're trying to hail a cab to the airport at rush hour.
Overall this is a nice looking hotel with basic services and that is what you pay for. It was a decent value in a great location and for New York, I think they passed the test.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
See 3 more reviews by arch49 for New York City

This review is the subjective opinion of a TripAdvisor member and not of TripAdvisor LLC.

'Little jewel'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 30, 2012 via mobile

Excellent hotel with a great location. Strolling distance to many of the top attractions including times square, broadway, 5th ave, central park, top of the rock to name a few. You won't find a better hotel for the price in that location.

Rickers86
Darlington, United Kingdom
Reviewer
3 reviews 3 reviews
Reviews in 3 cities Reviews in 3 cities
6 helpful votes 6 helpful votes
'Loved it!'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 29, 2012

I stayed here with my mum and sister to celebrate my sister's 21st birthday. I loved this hotel, it is clean, tidy and in a great location.

Our room (on the 3rd floor) had views of Rockefeller Center and St Patricks Cathedral. It was a good size with a double bed and sofa bed in for the 3 of us.

Little perks of the hotel include a lounge on the second floor with use of computers, internet and printing facilities for free. There is also free wifi in all of the rooms. On each floor there is a water machine with empty water bottles for you to fill up.

Staff were nice and friendly, they assisted with any questions we had.

I loved this hotel and would recommend it to anyone, will definately be going back!

    *
    *
    *

Less

Britelines
London
Senior Reviewer
9 reviews 9 reviews
Reviews in 4 cities Reviews in 4 cities
4 helpful votes 4 helpful votes
'Best feature: LOCATION!'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 24, 2012
1
person found this review helpful

I can only echo all of the other good reviews about the Jewel!

It's best feature is it's location, literally steps from Radio City Music Hall and Rockafeller Centre! Such a perfect base for exploring the city. Some rough walking times from the hotel:

Rockafeller Centre - 2 minutes
St Patricks Cathedral - 2 minutes
Times Square - 10 minutes
Central Park - 15 minutes
Empire State Building - 20 minutes
Madison Square Gardens - 25 minutes
Museum of Natural History - 45 minutes

That's pretty much everywhere we walked, the subway is so accessable but as it was our first time in the city, wanted to take everything in!

Room was clean, modern, good shower and a comfy bed - everything you need when you're not spending too much time there! Free water bottles on every floor, the hotel doesn't have it's own restaurant but has a range of nearby restaurants that delivery - we had breakfast one morning that was delicious!

Staff in the lobby were always happy, chatty and willing to answer any questions/help with directions etc.

I definitely felt like we got good value for money too! Would 100% come back to stay!
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes

suzukigsxr1000k1
Preston, United Kingdom
Senior Contributor
37 reviews 37 reviews
Reviews in 21 cities Reviews in 21 cities
13 helpful votes 13 helpful votes
'Comfortable'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 6, 2012 NEW

Booked the London for an anniversary trip to NY, we had a great time. From our arrival we where made to feel welcome as we had booked for our anniversary we had a complimentary room upgrade, bottle of wine and a nice handwritten letter from the manager. The rooms were very spacious the suite layout was quite modern but not in a bad way. We have stayed in NYC and never had rooms as big as these for the price. On the day of our departure my parents received a bill for the stay even though it was prepaid. This was quite a shock for them and a worry.The front desk manager Tony could not have been more helpful, he took the booking voucher and resolved the problem in a matter of minutes and reassured my parents all was well. It was excellent service.
The hotel was a good base for sightseeing and there were a number of places to eat locally, everything from Deli's to top class restaurants. It was my parents first trip to NYC and they loved it.
I would like to thank all the staff for making our stay so enjoyable.
Less

'Ab Fab'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 4, 2012 NEW

I can't say enough about my experience at this hotel. I thought the price, first of all, was quite reasonable, given the location right in midtown close to Central Park and Times Square. The front checkin staff was very friendly and let us know that our room was not ready, not surprising, given that we were there at 9 a.m. However, they did check! When we did check in closer to 3, the room that we had was just incredible. So spacious with a separate sitting area, bedroom with two beds and a bathroom that was just huge - beautiful details in the tile with a deep, deep tub. Even the amenities in the bathroom - robes, slippers, etc. The beds themselves - ahhhh, just heavenly. Our room was very quiet, also.

We plan to go back same time next year and stay at the London. Why would I go anywhere ese?

Rkenn44263
Reviewer
4 reviews 4 reviews
Reviews in 3 cities Reviews in 3 cities
1 helpful vote 1 helpful vote
'A luxury experience is as much about service as it is about sheets'
1 of 5 stars Reviewed June 2, 2012 NEW

I'm disappointed to say that this property has not living up to my expectations. Although I booked two suites through AMEX Platinum FHR, the service has been, at best, shoddy and at worst downright mean.

After having my plans change such that I couldn't accompany my family to NY this weekend, I called in advance and advised the hotel of the change. They assured me that all was taken care of and asked me to fax an authorization to them, which I did in advance. To wit, when my Mother in law arrived, tired from a long international trip to NYC, she was treated coldly and asked to provide a credit card although I had already made arrangements to pre pay. Further, when my partner and sister in law arrived a bit later, they were treated even worse, notwithstanding my arrangements they were made to wait until after 1030 pm until finally they were also asked to provide another credit card and were advised coldly that none of the FHR benefits would be provided to them.

All this after multiple phone calls from me. Very disappointing. Service in the hospitality industry is ALL about finding ways to provide stress relief from long travels and to be made to feel welcome, as if in one's own home. I'd ask the staff that treated my family so poorly how they would feel if their own father or mother were treated in such a way as they have treated mine.

I am a loyal AMEX platinum card holder for many years, mainly because of the travel benefits, but never again at this property. The team at the Gramercy Park, Nomad or The Greenwich would have welcome my family with a smile, a nod and assurances that all was well as the details were worked out. London NYC, take note, this is why you will never be a player in the high end market.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
Ask Rkenn44263 about The London NYC
This review is the subjective opinion of a TripAdvisor member and not of TripAdvisor LLC.

Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
See 2 more reviews by SHW_sf for New York City
SHW_sf
San Francisco, California, United States
Reviewer
3 reviews 3 reviews
1 helpful vote 1 helpful vote
'the cool spot.'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed May 31, 2012 NEW

The location is fab and the rooms are very clean-contemporary. The decor is minimalist-Brit and actually very appealing in the layout. The service matches the style - lighthearted and to the point. The lobby is small and welcoming (to retain a personal, boutique-feel) but note that this place will not check you in before 3pm except in very rare instances - the late check out is guaranteed, so plan accordingly. The higher floor rooms facing Central Park are a must. For a special birthday we obtained the corner room on 42nd floor. Absolutely breathtaking view. The showers are a true highlight here: One rain shower option and the other a high-pressure shower head. Plentiful counter space but I do wish they had better upgraded bath toiletries like Brit Molton Brown stuff, perhaps... instead of the current no-brand they use? All in all it's a good place to crash and take in the UES vibe while in NY.

The hotel hosted the CW upfronts in May which made it crowded to get in and out of with camera wielding kids at the exterior of door at all hours day and night. Celebrities were sighted at all hours in the lobby and elevators - but it all retained a quietness on the hotel's inside. The construction causes no discomfort - you never hear it if you're there in the evening and leaving by 11am. If they did not have the construction contraptions around the front hotel facade, you'd never guess there was anything of the sort happening - unless you're unfortunate to get a room which is covered up by the crews, so keep your room preferences open and clear in advance to the hotel.

Cons: The London Bar is a pretty place but: the booths are a tad worn down, the service is lame from the youngish (on trial looking) staff and the afternoon tea sucks - we were unceremoniously informed that they prepare sandwiches the night prior so it's not a fresh offering - oh and they do expect you to 'study' their tea menu well in advance because if you have a dietary issue with their offerings, they'll simply take that item off with no alternate or replacement - because "all sandwiches have to be accounted for well ahead of your arrival". On a very warm spring day the said sandwiches must have been stored at room temperature overnight because the bread was off and dry-stale for all the tea sandwiches. Rubbish attitude.

    *

Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
See 2 more reviews by SHW_sf for New York City

This review is the subjective opinion of a TripAdvisor member and not of TripAdvisor LLC.

Getawayfromitall67
London
Reviewer
4 reviews 4 reviews
Reviews in 3 cities Reviews in 3 cities
10 helpful votes 10 helpful votes
'Fabulous decor, great location, efficient, friendly staff.'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed May 31, 2012
1
person found this review helpful

We loved this hotel. It was a special occasion so we were prepared to pay more to ensure we were not disappointed. The suite was large and beautifully decorated in pale blue and silver with carpet in bedroom and wooden floor in separate lounge which had plenty of window seating and a rocking chair. Walk through wardrobe to shower room with large double shower added to sense of space. We were on the 29th floor and it was very quiet - looking across 55th Street which is not too busy. Only disappointment was that our view of the park was a glimpse through many other buildings despite paying for a Vista suite and asking for a view for our special occasion. Did not complain as everything else was so good. Restaurant and bar in hotel were excellent and staff were all friendly and efficient. Expect to pay a lot for room service and breakfast but it is good quality.
Less

nlcwsparkle
Boynton Beach, Florida
Senior Reviewer
7 reviews 7 reviews
Reviews in 3 cities Reviews in 3 cities
'Great place to stay'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 5, 2012 NEW

Was in New York with 2 of my grown sons, for another son's graduation from Law School. Really didn't want to spend a lot on a hotel room, but that's not easily done in New York, especially if there are 3 people. We arrived at about 11am, our room was ready and they let us check in early... a full day to site see!! Price was very reasonable by New York standards. Room had a king bed and a sofa/futon type bed. Bed was heavenly and the maid sevice made up the sofa bed everyday so it was ready when we got back. Great view from our room, though I couldn't say what direction it was.
Room also had complimentary coffee maker, frig, microwave and safe; it had a hairdryer and iron/ironing board. While shopping for rooms in New York, I found that these types of ameneties are not the norm as room space is typically very small. Can't say enough about the hospitality: always pleasant, helpful and personable. No matter what time we got in(sometimes very late), there was always a pleasant person to great us. Hotel is close to EVERYTHING!!! About the only thing that could have made it any better would have been breakfast included. I will definately stay here again when in the BIg Apple.

    *

Less

5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 4, 2012 NEW

Concierge service was great, location can't get any better, very close to Broaway but not close enough to make it lose an excellent sleep night. Nice personalized bag of candies was there when we first came in. Liquor, deli, food market, almost all metro lines and Times Squared no longer than a block away.
Less

cheropita
Niagara Falls, Canada
Reviewer
3 reviews 3 reviews
Reviews in 2 cities Reviews in 2 cities
3 helpful votes 3 helpful votes
'Wonderful experience!'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 4, 2012 NEW
1
person found this review helpful

Myself and 3 friends just spent 3 nights over the week-end at The Hilton Garden Inn Times Square. This hotel was in the best location. We had Times Square 1 block away, Hells Kitchen a block the opposite way and the Theatres we're all around us. Our room was a great size and very clean. We had 2 queen size beds, complimentary WiFi, coffee maker, safe in the closet, great view looking toward the Hudson, could even see the cruise ships in Port and very comfy beds. They serve complimentary Starbucks coffee and Tazo teas in the lobby every mornng which was very handy. There are also yummy cookies available at the front desk. If needed there is a business office where you have access to computers and or printer. They also loaned us umbrellas the one evening as it was calling for rain. One of the nicest things about this hotel is the staff. From the second we checked in to to the second we left every staff member was extremely friendly and very helpful. We felt so at home. One of the staff even called our room to check in with us to make sure all was good and was there anything they could do for us. I would highly recommend this hotel if you plan on visiting New York City. You will not be disappointed.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes

Love2Travel_FL3
Orlando, Florida
Senior Reviewer
10 reviews 10 reviews
Reviews in 5 cities Reviews in 5 cities
5 helpful votes 5 helpful votes
'Convenient Location & Extremely Friendly Staff'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed June 4, 2012 NEW

I would stay at The Hilton Garden Inn ... again! The whole staff welcomed us at every occassion that we stepped through the doors and offered many suggestions to where to dine, shop, etc.. Charles, bellman, was funny and helpful with subway directions and catching us a cab. Joanna was very personable and had shopping suggestions too. Check-in and Check-out was fast and convenient. There is a little pantry in the lobby area to purchase beverages, snacks, etc.. Free coffee is available in the lobby during morning hours. The internet is complimentary which is a plus. The heart of Times Square is about 5 blocks away, and one subway station is about a block away. Central Park is about 8 blocks away. NOTE - A SUBWAY TRAIN RUNS UNDERGROUND OF THE HOTEL. We had a 2nd floor room and could hear the subway throughout the evening - it runs less during off peak hours. If you are in the lobby, you may feel the subway roar under you. The restaurant that is connected to the hotel is pretty good. The Hilton Garden Inn has a restaurant (connected/next door) with a $19.99 breakfast buffet including coffee and juice which is very average tasting but a good price. I viewed the workout room which has nice machines and is very small. The room was clean and had a nice flat screen tv.
Good value for your money!
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
Ask Love2Travel_FL3 about Hilton Garden Inn Times Square
This review is the subjective opinion of a TripAdvisor member and not of TripAdvisor LLC.

Mariette d d
Westlock, Canada
Senior Reviewer
7 reviews 7 reviews
'one super week in New York at the Hilton Garden Inn on Times Square'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 4, 2012 NEW

Upon arrival, we were welcomed 'home' (since we were staying for eight nights!) and given a room facing 8th Ave..... rather than another building. It was great fun watching the hustling and bustling from the 5th floor but once we closed the window, the noise was minimized... not at all bothersome. We had a microwave, fridge and coffee maker with coffee in our room and, upon arrival, a gift with bottles of water, goodies, etc. We truly did feel at home. The room was kept spotlessly clean and it was a large room with 2 queen beds and still lots of room for a desk, large dresser, and microwave stand. Every morning when leaving the hotel, we were greeted with smiles and questions we had about the city were answered with lots of additional information. The restaurant and lounge were inviting. We enjoyed a dinner and breakfast there, both were very good with excellent service. The small store was also stocked with anything we needed in the moment. One of the best things was the location of the hotel... right in the middle of the theatre district and the heart of Times Square.... we were able to walk everywhere ..... and the subway was right across the street as well. We highly recommend this hotel ..... the cost is comparable to other hotels in Manhattan.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes

See 3 more reviews by Sarah E for New York City
Sarah E
Artesia, New Mexico
Contributor
11 reviews 11 reviews
Reviews in 6 cities Reviews in 6 cities
3 helpful votes 3 helpful votes
'Great location'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed June 3, 2012 NEW

This hotel is in the perfect location, very close to the action without being right in the middle of it. It was clean and comfortable. The room and bathroom were very small, but I'm sure that's to be expected in NYC. Our room faced Eighth Ave., and our biggest complaint was the noise coming from the street, particularly sirens from the nearby firehouse. I slept through most of the noise, but my husband, who is a light sleeper, was awoken many times each night. We loved the little French restaurant that is connected, where we had coupons for breakfast each morning. It was a delicious full breakfast buffet unlike the run-of-the-mill breakfasts at most hotels. The food and service there were both wonderful. We would definitely stay here again but would request location facing the back of the property.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes

See 7 more reviews by docwgk for New York City
docwgk
Mobile, Alabama
Senior Contributor
28 reviews 28 reviews
Reviews in 14 cities Reviews in 14 cities
17 helpful votes 17 helpful votes
'Wonderful find'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 11, 2012
6
people found this review helpful

I recently stayed at the San Carlos Hotel for the first time. I made my selection based on desired location and Trip Advisor reviews (my usual "go-to" hotel in NYC was already booked for the weekend I wished to travel). I couldn't have been more pleased. The staff were friendly and very helpful. The room (two double beds) was large, nicely appointed and very clean. There was a roomy desk with comfortable chair and wi-fi was available free of charge. In addition to the two beds and desk, there was a comfortable upholstered chair with ottoman. A small alcove contained a refrigerator, microwave and coffeepot. The bathroom was roomy and modern. The elevators was very efficient with very little waiting time no matter the time of day. The continental breakfast was complimentary and was served just off the main lobby from 7-10 AM daily. Yogurt, sweet rolls, bagels, toast and cereal as well as coffee, tea and orange juice were available. By NYC standards, the room rates were very reasonable. I think I have found a new "go-to" hotel for my visits to NYC!
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes

mnrbeau1
southern california
Reviewer
3 reviews 3 reviews
Reviews in 2 cities Reviews in 2 cities
8 helpful votes 8 helpful votes
'This is Where we will ALWAYS Stay'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 8, 2012
5
people found this review helpful

Over the last 6 years we have stayed at the San Carlos Hotel at least 4 times. In between we tried a few different hotels which were good but ended up returning to the San Carlos because, as a whole, nothing can beat it. All personnel treat you like royalty and the rooms are beyond clean (I am a germaphobe) and updated. The continental breakfast suffices if you're not a big hot breakfast person (they have yogurts, danishes, cold cereals, apples, cottage cheese and hot drinks as well as juice).

The rooms are quite large and well laid out and you can't beat the location with an easy walk to TImes Square and Central Park.

We decided to stop trying out other hotels - this will be our destination for our yearly trip to NYC.

I accidently rated the spa and pool, both of which I don't know if they have.
Less

Senior Contributor
24 reviews 24 reviews
Reviews in 15 cities Reviews in 15 cities
16 helpful votes 16 helpful votes
'Good value, good location'
3 of 5 stars Reviewed May 8, 2012
1
person found this review helpful

Stayed two nights in a very spacious well equipped room in this small hotel right around the corner from the Waldorf Astoria. My room had a kitchen, couch, and comfortable bed. Bathroom was small but functional. Breakfast was included but I didn't try it - looked like the usual continental buffet. My only hesitation in recommending this hotel is a very limited room service menu that comes from the Indian restaurant next door. The food was pedestrian and the delivery person hit me up for a tip in cash- a rather odd exchange. No silverware came with the meal - the idea was to use the silver from the kitchen but then plates and silver stayed until the next morning. Otherwise, my stay was good and I would go back. It is away from the hustle and bustle but very well located.
Less

See 5 more reviews by ValuingTraveler for New York City
ValuingTraveler
New England
Senior Contributor
36 reviews 36 reviews
Reviews in 13 cities Reviews in 13 cities
24 helpful votes 24 helpful votes
'Decent Enough'
3 of 5 stars Reviewed April 28, 2012
1
person found this review helpful

This was an adequate stay for a reasonable price.

The hotel is well situated on E 50th; across the street are both the Benjamin and Affinia 50, so others might want to try them for comparison.

There's nothing special about the property. The reception lounge is relatively small yet efficient. The executive room I took was ok, decent space, comfortable sofa and chairs, workable kitchen facilities - but not of a quality of a place like the Alex. Bathroom was small yet functional - ok water pressure and Aveda giveaways. Bed quality was fine.

Two gripes were the towels and the continental breakfast. The towels were so worn and thin that I thought their sandpaper-like quality might exfoliate my entire body without ever really drying it. Really, it was like a bad summer camp experience. And the continental breakfast was bland, cheap in quality and tasteless. The hotel management must have someone specifically picking up months supplies of huge quantities of nourishment at BJs or Walmart.

So, if you want that location (50th and 3rd) for a decent night's sleep, grab a discounted rate and avoid the breakfast. It's a decent enough place for a night or two (p.s. go get a breakfast bagel at Ess-A-Bagel and coffee across the street and don't even try to justify the embedded continental breakfast cost).
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
See 5 more reviews by ValuingTraveler for New York City

philipmillermd
Hallandale, Florida
Reviewer
4 reviews 4 reviews
Reviews in 3 cities Reviews in 3 cities
6 helpful votes 6 helpful votes
'Another excellent stay t this wonderful hotel'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed April 25, 2012
2
people found this review helpful

I just finished my fifth stay at this best kept secret in Manhattan on April 17-20 and the best thing about this hotel is the friendliness of is staff fom the concierge to the bellman (Bobby) to the check-in staff. They are all amazingly kind and well-informed. The rooms are very spacious with modern furnishings. The beds are ver comfortable. The heat and A/C work very well. The television reception on some of the stations in my room (#1009) could have been better bu this small factor is not severe enough to lower my rating of the hotel. It is in every possible way five star. The continental breakfast provided every morning with the cost of your room is fine. Best of all the location is excellent for every type of sightseeing you could want to do in Manhattan.
Less

George_PConnecticut
Connecticut
Senior Contributor
49 reviews 49 reviews
Reviews in 40 cities Reviews in 40 cities
33 helpful votes 33 helpful votes
'Communication problems'
2 of 5 stars Reviewed June 4, 2012 NEW

I wish I didn't have a negative review for a hotel that has many positive aspects. But here goes I arrived a little after the 3 pm check-in time and wasn't surprised to hear that they weren't quite ready to hand over my room key yet. After all, it was a Saturday at a popular hotel in NYC these things happen. So I had a seat in their (beautiful) lobby. And I paid attention. During the course of nearly an hour, I observed the earnest front-desk staff attempt to get verification from housekeeping as to the readiness of the rooms (I was one of several guests awaiting check-in). Those status requests seem to evaporate into thin air, because the front-desk folks had to try again, and again and again. Now, I don't proclaim to understand the ins and outs of running a hotel, but it stands to reason that each day by 3 pm, a well-oiled system is in place to have the housekeeping check completed  or to communicate any issues to the front desk along with a very accurate estimate as to the timing of a resolution. That was not the case here that day.

I compliment the front-desk staff for their grace under pressure, and I appreciate manager on duty Kiana for recognizing the need for a bit of service recovery. At 4 pm, I was finally in my room; and she did send up a nice amenity of almonds, etc. The room was very appealing; not huge, but fresh and modern. Soon I discovered, though, that the bathroom sink stopper was fully engaged, and no amount of effort to open it was successful. That meant washing hands, brushing teeth, etc. in the shower. As I left for the evening, I noted this issue to the front desk person, who wrote it into a log. By the time I came back, after midnight, the problem remained. I would have shrugged it off had there been any indication  a note, a voice mail message  that someone had inspected it and determined that it would be best to wait until my checkout the next day, take the room out of service and fix it. That I would have understood. But instead, there was no sign that it had been investigated. I wondered once again about their issues with communication.

Now, if I were reading this review, I think I would take a chance and stay at the hotel anyway (if I got a great rate). The positive things that others have written are valid. The location is great (granted, 'Times Square South' is a stretch of a description of W. 35th St., but whatever), the dcor is pleasing, free wifi is awesome and I did get quite a deal. But next time I'm in New York, I'll look elsewhere. It's too bad, because were it not for these communication problems, this could have been my go-to place.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
See 4 more reviews by George_PConnecticut for New York City

cjlov22
Minneapolis, Minnesota
Reviewer
3 reviews 3 reviews
Reviews in 2 cities Reviews in 2 cities
3 helpful votes 3 helpful votes
'Friendly staff, nice room design, a bit of a ways to Times Square'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed May 30, 2012

Stayed here for my first time in NYC over Memorial Day weekend. Called ahead and let them know my flight was arriving in the morning and was told if my room was available I could check in early. Was able to check in around 11am which was really nice to be able to settle in and take a load off. Had a queen sized standard room. Comfy bed, nice sized flat screen and cool looking bathroom and overall furnishings. Also plenty of convenient outlets to plug in your gizmos. Even had an ihome alarm clock to dock my phone. Friendly staff and liked the vibe of the place, not at all like a cookie cutter chain hotel (even though this is part of the Wyndham franchise).

The only big drawback for me was location. Definitely felt safe (midtown police precinct is literally next door) but this place isn't nearly as close to Times Square as I thought. It is definitely "South", like 12 blocks south. Subway station is at the end of the block so anywhere you want to go it's not hard, but must admit after a couple of late nights out on the town in the Times Square area it would have been nice to have home base a little bit closer.

Couple of other minor drawbacks:
- Hotel bar closes at midnight or earlier despite room menu that says it closes at 2. Got back around 1am my first night, was planning on getting a late night snack and drink for the room but found out that they were already closed There are not a lot of options in the immediate area (avoid Tick-Tock diner) so it would be nice to have in-hotel option but at least don't advertise that it's open later.

- No bedside lighting in the room. Didn't really need it but I think it would be nice. Just had overhead lighting and lamp bracketed to the desk side of the room.

Overall a satisfying stay, staff was great but if you're planning on spending a good amount of time in the Times Square/Broadway area just be aware of where this location actually is.
Less

Eugene E
Sedona, Arizona
Senior Reviewer
8 reviews 8 reviews
Reviews in 4 cities Reviews in 4 cities
6 helpful votes 6 helpful votes
'I wish I didn't have to write this'
2 of 5 stars Reviewed May 29, 2012
2
people found this review helpful

My wife and I stayed at the TRYP Times Square South for one night May 9, 2012, on a return trip from Europe. I read the positive reviews on Trip Advisor and felt we were lucky to book this hotel. Before I start on the negative points, I do have to say that the staff we dealt with were courteous and professional at all times. So I would give the guest services staff at least a 4.
We had an excellent check in experience and very satisfied with our room. When we returned from dinner, we pulled down the covers on one of the beds. The sheets were littered with black flecks and hairs. We called the desk and the night manager was in our room immediately. She told us that the flecks were fuzz from the laundry bins but the hairs were unacceptable. She took photos and told us that she would move our room. She returned a while later and took us to another room. As we settled into the new room we noticed that both bed skirts were covered with red wine stains and foot prints. There was also a large black stain on the wall. We were too tired to complain again that night and decided to speak to the manager in the morning. While we were getting showered, my wife discovered that the hair dryer did not work. We called the day manager and she came the room to apologize for the situation. She said that the bed skirt stains were not acceptable, but the stain on the wall was just glue. We felt for a hotel of this quality, glue stains on the wall were not acceptable either.
The manager gave a breakfast comp and box of nuts and candy. When we spoke to her later she promised to call us the following week to let us know what the hotel would do to change our TRYP experience. It is now two weeks later and no phone call, despite our calling asking the manager to return our phone calls.
My wife and I are not very concerned with hotel amenities but cleanliness of beds, bedding and rooms are critical to an enjoyable stay for us.
This is first bad review I have written and I hope it is the last.
Less

I appreciate your feedback, as this helps us become the very best that we can be, and I look forward to speaking with you directly concerning your recent stay. I may be contacted at 212-600-2440, or magonzalez@wyndham.com. In the meantime, we remain fully at your service and look forward to the chance of welcoming you back at the TRYP Times Square South.

Sincerely,

Marianett Gonzalez  Guest Services Manager

'Week with Teens in LA'

Problem with this review?
PJCPA
Atlanta
Contributor
11 reviews 11 reviews
Reviews in 9 cities Reviews in 9 cities
32 helpful votes 32 helpful votes
'Week with Teens in LA'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed June 5, 2012 NEW

In reviewing several of the comments about this hotel prior to my visit, I was a little worried about what I had to look forward to, however, upon arrival all my fears were put to rest. We booked through hotwire and got a $160 per night rate and were very happy with what we received for this price. The hotel lobby is very nice, the rooms were good, however a little small, and the pool area was just right, especially having a hot tub that our teens were in every night. While this may not sound like a resounding endorsement, the thing that really stood out to me outside of the "bricks and mortar" was the customer service. From the greeting we received upon arrival back every day from the outdoor bell staff, to the friendliness of the concierge and other hotel staff, I would rate their service a 5 out of 5, and felt like they truely had my interest at heart in trying to deliver whatever service they could.

Beyond this, for us, the location was also excellent. When in LA, you hear most people say prepare to be in traffic during a portion of your trip. And while this is true to some degree, we felt we were only 20 minutes from any major tourist area such as Venice Beach, Santa Monica, Hollywood, or downtown, and having the Beverly Hills/UCLA area a mile away and a nice outdoor mall next door, you could not get much better.

Overall, if you are anything other than a couple looking for a dramatically romantic place to stay, then the Hyatt should be in your top five for places to consider.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes

businesstraveler93
Washington DC, District of Columbia
Contributor
13 reviews 13 reviews
Reviews in 11 cities Reviews in 11 cities
5 helpful votes 5 helpful votes
'Service with a smile'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed June 5, 2012 NEW

All too often when you check into a hotel you feel anonymous. Not at this Hyatt Regency--from the doorman, front desk and every other staff member i encountered i received smiles and a warm welcome.I have stayed here before, but by no means am i a "regular" At most I come to LA once a year. They had my profile stored and from then on everyone called me by name--a nice touch! When I checked into the room I noticed that one of the lamps was broken. I called housekeeping and was answered with my name--not room number! Within 5 minutes someone was at the door to fix the problem. As it could not be repaired quickly within 10 minutes a new lamp was delivered. Service does not get any better than that!

The rooms are spacious and clean and all have balconies--a nice place for your morning coffee. Amenities are what you expect from this type of hotel. Other things--like the pool area, bars and restaurants are all well run. It's so nice to be in a hotel that runs smoothly.

As this is LA everything is measured by distance--this location is very good--not too far from the Airport, Westwood, Beverly Hills and even to the Getty Museum which I wanted to visit.

It's quiet as well. No need to look further for a good hotel in LA.

Lest you think I'm a shill for the hotel--if you read my other reviews, I'm not always this complementary.

One side note for smokers--this hotel offers rooms for smokers that have air purifiers-- another nice touch so the hallways and room do not reek of smoke odors.
Less

a410traveler
Spring Hill, Fl
Senior Contributor
49 reviews 49 reviews
Reviews in 28 cities Reviews in 28 cities
45 helpful votes 45 helpful votes
'Excellent experience'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 29, 2012

This hotel opened in the 1960's as a Westin and owes its architecture to that chain. Lyndon Johnson was the first U.S. president to stay there but Ronald Reagan visited so often that it was called the "Westin White House". It became a Hyatt about 5 years ago.

The lobby, hallways, bar and restaurant are beautiful. All rooms come with a balcony and fully opening sliding glass door. Room 1023 was quite spacious and the cool fresh breeze coming in from the balcony was a great improvement over the stale air conditioned air found in all too many hotels with sealed windows.

The chair and ottoman were very comfortable and the letter desk came with 2 first rate office style chairs.

The bathroom was large and really just beautiful. The toiletries were made by Hyatt's usual brand Portico. If you haven't tried these let me say that they are better than average hotel toiletries.

On the down side the carpet in my room was just beginning to show wear.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
Ask a410traveler about Hyatt Regency Century Plaza
This review is the subjective opinion of a TripAdvisor member and not of TripAdvisor LLC.

WorldTravelRod
Clearwater, Florida

73 reviews 73 reviews
Reviews in 31 cities Reviews in 31 cities

'Great Location, Very Good Hotel'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed May 28, 2012

There are lots of hotel choices in LA and I very often end up choosing this one. I have stayed here at least a dozen times-maybe more.

On the advantages side the location for BevHills/Westside/freeways is perfect.
Rooms are nice, its a 4 star, not an opulent 5 star. Great views of the city from all rooms. Nice pool and scene when its a nice. Very convenient to walk across the street for movies, mall and quick bite. And I really appreciate that the internet just works-all the time. Some hotels the internet is clunky, you have to sign on, etc etc.Zero web access issues at this hotel.

Parking is outrageous at $36-but I will of course still be back
Less

15 reviews 15 reviews
Reviews in 14 cities Reviews in 14 cities
58 helpful votes 58 helpful votes
'Great alternative to an airport hotel'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed May 25, 2012
1
person found this review helpful

We stayed here during a one-night stopover in LA and found it to be a good choice rather than an airport hotel. It is not far from LAX and convenient to Century City shopping and restaurants, Beverly Hills, Santa Monica, and West Hollywood. The front desk check-in was quick and efficient; the room was nicely decorated, comfortable, and clean. Having an outdoor balcony and a Starbucks in the lobby was a plus. We walked one block over to RockSugar for a great dinner. Valet parking was always quick and efficient, as was checkout. Would definitely stay here again when in L.A.
Less

Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
lauren818
Portland, Oregon
Contributor
12 reviews 12 reviews
Reviews in 8 cities Reviews in 8 cities
'Great for a conference but lots of nickle and diming'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed May 22, 2012

Stayed here for a legal conference and this was one of the nicest conference facilities I've been to. The staff was top notch at all of our meals and the food was surprisingly good.

The bar/pool/restaurant area is very nice but was quite crowded and noisy.

Be prepared for being nickle and dimed on everything - parking is $36 per night if you want access to your car, in-room internet costs extra (not sure about lobby - although free wifi was provided for our conference).

Rooms are much larger than I was expecting.

Front desk staff could use improvement. Had some snafus at check-in (originally sent to a room that didn't exist, then sent to a room that was not what I had reserved, and then finally ended up in a "correct room"). At check-out, they double charged me for parking and it took a good 15 minutes to straighten out (and thank goodness I double checked the bills or I would have had a problem with my corporate credit card!).

Location was good - next to the mall is super convenient for easy dining and entertainment. It cost my coworker $50 for a taxi from the airport, which is quite a bit more than what the hotel website advises.

Pinkberry at the mall = love for me
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
Ask lauren818 about Hyatt Regency Century Plaza
This review is the subjective opinion of a TripAdvisor member and not of TripAdvisor LLC.

'OK for the Hotwire Hidden Price'

mk9600
Saint Augustine Beach, Florida
Senior Contributor
36 reviews 36 reviews
Reviews in 14 cities Reviews in 14 cities
6 helpful votes 6 helpful votes
'Excellent Service, Spoil Us Rotten'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 28, 2012
1
person found this review helpful

Staff continually recognize their guests throughout their stay. They truly wish to accomodate your desires. The staff offered assistance before we asked for it. The concierge took great pleasure in making food recommendations, immediatly provided directions from off the top of their head without having to look up anything. One night we had a show to see and wanted a reservation following the show...the concierge looked up the show length and made a reservation at a time that followed the show end time and allowed time to travel to the restaurant. All recommendations were great.

I went to run in Central Park on Friday and they offered water up my return without me asking for it. They inquired about the length of my run and two days later remembered me and asked if I was going to run again.

We called for ice and they quickly fulfilled the request with no follow up. The spa was wonderful and staff were experts in their trade. Very knowledgeable and courteous, wish I had gone to the spa sooner, went on the last day as they have a steam room within the spa. They also have a relaxation area and a music menu to select the type of music you wish to experience for your treatment. Staff were very nice and welcoming without pressuring one to purchase their La Prairie products. They sent a complementary gift up to the room following the spa service.

Look forward to my return to this hotel!
Less

'Friendly and attentive staff'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 27, 2012

First time in this NYC hotel. Excellent location. We walked to many sites, but cabs are available or subways close. Room was located on the inside corridor. No views, but also no street noise. Room was bigger than I expected. Bathrooms clean and neatly organized.

Didn't eat at the hotel. Too many places which were close.
Staff was probably the friendliest I have ever encountered. Anything we needed, they were there to help.
Would definately stay again and recommend to others.

Problem with this review?
traveltheworld4u_12
Nicosia, Cyprus
Reviewer
5 reviews 5 reviews
Reviews in 3 cities Reviews in 3 cities
4 helpful votes 4 helpful votes
'I SO wanted to fall in love with this hotel...'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed May 23, 2012
2
people found this review helpful

but the prince sadly turned into a frog. I erred on the side of generosity but 3.5 stars would have been more accurate.

This hotel has a lot going for it as far as the hardwiring is concerned- to start the location is perfection - around the corner from Fifth Avenue and right across from Central Park. You have the best of New York laid at your feet. The rooms are timelessly elegant and generous in size. The bed among the best I have ever experienced... BUT to quote Gertrude Stein "There is no there there".

The staff and service, the soul of any great hotel, are wildly disparate and range from truly excellent to borderline disgruntled. Several times there was no one at the door including when I first arrived with luggage in the middle of the afternoon and after arriving back after the theatre late at night. Check in was somewhat perfunctory and it was the first time I was not upgraded as an Amex Plat card holder which is fair enough if they have no rooms available however upon check-in the guaranteed late checkout of 4pm was confirmed by the clerk at her initiative which I did appreciate. On my final day, at a little after the regular check out time I received a call thanking me for the stay and well, in short asking me to leave! Taken aback but thinking this was a misunderstanding, I assured the clerk that the guaranteed check out at 4pm was confirmed by one of his colleagues but instead of apologizing he just asked me when I would leave and said that my keycard (which is used for both the room and elevator and was faulty the entire time of my 3 night stay) would no long work and if I intended on staying I would have to come to the front desk. I was so disgusted I packed up and left with a very bitter taste in my mouth and astonished at the rudest treatment I have ever experienced at any hotel. I am the type of person who always checks out 5 minutes before the time and If they were pressured for rooms they could have handled this a lot better. To add insult to injury the bill contained several mischarges in the favor of the hotel including all three breakfasts (which were included in my rate) charged as lunch. It was quickly remedied but still this shouldn't happen at a hotel of this caliber.

While I rather like this hotel doesn't have a large impersonal lobby it is missing a great bar like Bemelmans at the Carlyle or the King Cole Bar at the St. Regis.

Most importantly and sadly, however, I found the Ritz-Carlton Central Park lacking in any sort of graciousness or charm.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?

keb1234
Auburn, Alabama
Top Contributor
61 reviews 61 reviews
Reviews in 39 cities Reviews in 39 cities
36 helpful votes 36 helpful votes
'Fantastic hotel'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 16, 2012

My husband and I stayed here for a long weekend in April. I was a little bit wary when we first checked in because the hotel seemed a little bit pretentious for us, but my concerns were quickly alleviated. The staff at this hotel are all extremely friendly and eager to help. But the best part of the hotel is the room. I spend 150+ nights/year in hotel rooms and this one was by far my favorite. The room was bright with a great view of the park, the bed was extremely comfortable, and the bathroom and bedroom were both large enough that my husband and I never felt like we were getting in each others way. Unfortunately, my husband and I both got food poisoning on this trip (not from eating at this hotel), but if it had to happen I am glad we were at this hotel. That may be the only downside - the room is so nice you don't want to leave it.
Less

'The only place I'll stay in NY (in my dreams)'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 16, 2012

I am a loyal Marriott fan, and Marriott never lets me down.A hefty 140,000 rewards points for 2 nights stay, and worth every point.I can't wait to go back.Location is excellent for shopping.Staff and decor in rooms and public areas exceptional.Aspey bath products.Robes and slippers.Large bathroom.Central park views. I kept running over to Bergdorfs while my husband cat- napped, just to breathe in the exquisite designer offerings- you will never see so much so beautifully,serenely displayed in any other store in NY.I walk in their doors and literally float through the store..And of course Tiffany is just across the street.Good restaurants around the corner too-Rue 57 on 57th st for one. Sarabeths a few doors down from hotel has lovely omlettes,and indoor,outdoor seating. Note- Marriott East Side behind the Waldorf is actually pretty fine too. And- they are around the corner from Avra- a high end, yet casual enough busy Greek restaurant.You can pick out a whole fish from their in house fish market and have it cooked anyway you like.Delicious bread basket,everything fresh and tastey, not cheap, but worth the splurge.I always end up taliking about food!

sheryl h
Odessa, Texas
Reviewer
4 reviews 4 reviews
1 helpful vote 1 helpful vote
'Most accomodating hotel...ever!'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 9, 2012
1
person found this review helpful

My husband and I flew into Philadelphia, rented a car and drove to New York to stay at the Ritz-Carlton Battery Park where we had made reservations a couple months earlier. Our GPS took us to the Central Park location instead of Battery Park...we had unloaded our car and they had parked it before we realized the mistake. Instead of being treated like tourists who didn't have a clue (which we were) they quickly found us a room in this location. However, we wanted to stay in the Ritz where we made reservations. They graciously let us leave our car at their hotel, found us a cab and sent us on our way. When we arrived at the Battery Park location we were treated like royalty and they continued to pamper us for the remainder of our stay. The concierge was very helpful in helping us zone in on the best things the city has to offer for our short stay. The concierge ordered us a limo, after 6 hours of walking from lower Manhattan to mid town, to see the city at night and he was one of the drivers for the Apprentice contestants...he drove us all night to see the city that never sleeps...he was wonderful, informative and a great historian...We never met an unfriendly person in all of New York and the staff (and luscious rooms) made it a trip worth remembering!
Less

Davek36
Philadelphia, Pennsylvania
Senior Contributor
25 reviews 25 reviews
Reviews in 12 cities Reviews in 12 cities
15 helpful votes 15 helpful votes
'They Exceed Expectations.... in excess'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 2, 2012
2
people found this review helpful

Ender, the accomplished and passionate welcoming host who escorted my wife and I to our beautiful room, overlooking Central Park, gushed when he talked about the pride that he and the other employees of The Ritz Carlton Central park shared.
24 hours we checked out fully convinced that they had every rite to be proud. In the Ritz Carlton world, one that always demonstrates superior service, the Ritz Carlton stands tall. In the world of normal hotels.... they don't stand a chance.
Awesome in every move. Not a single slip. Room was perfect and just what we had expected. Employees I had not even met greeted us by name (I've got to figure out how they do that? Do they have pictures of guests in the employee lounge?)... everyone greeted us with that warm "welcome home".
It was a one night trip up to see a Barry Manilow concert at Radio City. We mentioned that to the staff when we checked in. After a great evening on the town and at the concert, we returned to our room to find Chocolate Covered Strawberries, the lights and bed turned down and a Barry Manilow romantic CD playing in the Bose sound system. My wife freaked... a note accompanied the CD indicating that it was a gift to help us remember our visit with them.... are you kidding me.

New York, Central Park, Ritz Carlton... your going to pay, but who cares? This hotel and this staff have no rivals if it is an exceedingly memorable visit to New York you desire. If you're just looking for a cheap bed, this is not your place.

Highlights are the Location, Central Park, Staff, The club lounge.
Like all in New York, the rooms are relatively small, but better than most. The hotel is old, but fresh.

One of the top properties in the US. Bar none.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
See 2 more reviews by Davek36 for New York City

Problem with this review?
pjp_11
Palm Springs, California
2 reviews
Reviews in 2 cities Reviews in 2 cities
1 helpful vote 1 helpful vote
'Best Place to DeStress after Husband's Heart Surgery'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 1, 2012 NEW
1
person found this review helpful

I am writing to let you know how pleasant our stay at The Elan was at a most unpleasant time in our lives. My husband and I checked into the hotel May 13 and were greeted by the desk clerk (from New Orleans). The following morning he had open heart surgery to repair an aortic aneurysm. That surgery was a huge success but he had a stroke that wasn't detected until the next day. A friend stayed with me until my mother arrived from Dallas on Wednesday morning. I can't begin to tell you how great it was for us to de-stress once we returned from Cedars-Sinai in the evenings. The side table lamps were lighted, soft music playing, and chocolates. The "Wishing You Sweet Dreams", with the weather forecast for the next day, was not only a nice touch, but very helpful~ especially because it included the temps.

There were so many big and little things that made this an exceptional boutique hotel. Any time we had a question, Michael Kim seemed to be the person we talked with on the phone. At one point I was having difficulty getting online and he suggested that I bring my laptop to the desk. I took it down there and he got me right on line. All of the staff seemed genuinely friendly~ not forced and Michael especially friendly and helpful.

At one point I was having trouble getting a signal on my cell and got the strongest next to the window. I couldn't help but notice that the sill was spotless and the rest of the room was very clean, too.

The bathroom was great with room under the sink for the bags of toiletries and the lemon grass scented toiletries you provide were
good but the soap was so unique and made such good sense!!! The little touches like the shoe cloth and Kleenex fan folded, were things that take time for the housekeepers but add to the over-all feel of the caring to detail that the hotel has done so well. The outstanding things were the robe and towels~ the weight was the best ever! They were thick enough to be very absorbent but not so weighty~ especially the robe! They were "green" also as I'm sure they don't take as long to dry.

The breakfast had a nice selection and we enjoyed the coffee~ both in the room and with breakfast. The casual seating and places to eat were comfortable. We didn't use the mini bar but the list looked like there were lots of choices if you need to use that.

You probably wonder if I stay at many hotels, but I have in the past and my mother, who constantly travels both domestically and internationally, thought your hotel was exceptional. She made out the comment folder and was disappointed there wasn't more comment space to rave about the hotel.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
Ask pjp_11 about Elan Hotel Los Angeles

'Oasis in Los Angeles'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 27, 2012
1
person found this review helpful

There's no garden or pool here, but the hotel manages to create an oasis-like feel on busy Beverly Boulevard. While you can walk to the posh Beverly Center or the high end home design stores or Rodeo drive for shopping, the hotel is a quiet oasis to return to. Every staff member is exceedingly helpful. They go out of their way to make you feel comfortable and at home. The rooms are large and comfortably furnished, and their wine and cheese hour and breakfast, included in the price, are generous.

ThatSkyCat
Portland, Oregon
Reviewer
4 reviews 4 reviews
Reviews in 3 cities Reviews in 3 cities
'@Cedars? Thank heavens u can slink back here & rest'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed May 17, 2012

Have stayed a couple of times (Jan 2012 & Apr 2012) here due to the thrill of undergoing medical procedures at Cedars. Location is perfect. If your health allows, Cedars is a quick walk, if not, a short cab. Staff gets it. You (or someone w/you) is so sick that they are in LA and visiting Cedars and not Disneyland. One is treated kindly and the evening wine is a relief. Get some breakfast in the morning (unless you are NPO and if so, sorry). It is simple and fresh and lordy, odds are you have big day ahead. Rooms are small. Bed and bathroom are decent, nice design and have all the basics. If you feel a burst, trot over to Marshall's - great buys. And there is also a CVS just down the way to get those new RXs filled - 24hrs! I like these Elan folks, they handled the rabid patient (me) and the stressed family with gentle consideration. Thank you.
Less

Problem with this review?
Cynthia A
San Francisco, California
Reviewer
3 reviews 3 reviews
Reviews in 3 cities Reviews in 3 cities
6 helpful votes 6 helpful votes
'Nice staff, actual accommodations so-so'
3 of 5 stars Reviewed May 14, 2012
5
people found this review helpful

I stayed at the Elan for 3 nights a few months ago. In town for work and the location was great for my purposes (getting to and from Gower Studios quickly). I already knew the neighborhood well, and it is a great one for seeing Hollywood, Weho, and pretty much anything you'd want in LA. The staff was nice and seemed helpful, although again I didn't really need info or anything from them so my contact was minimal. My issue with the hotel is simply that actual bed etc seemed barely over motel class. There was nothing particularly wrong with it, It just wasn't wasn't luxe by any stretch of the imagination. Bed was very hard, pillows were flat, linens were scratchy. The room was very warm, and although there was an outside "balcony" it was on street level facing a run-down apartment building and wasn't exactly enticing. At the time I stayed there was no onsite restaurant or bar so after a long day of shooting, relaxing in the evening and having a drink at the hotel was not possible. I think I paid just under $200 per night for the room, which frankly didn't seem worth it, especially compared to other hotels in LA at the same price point that had more to offer. Most likely I won't stay again.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?

Problem with this review?
DeniDes
Los Angeles, California
1 review
'Would Stay Again'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed May 13, 2012

Needed a place close to Cedars Sinai Hospital and thanks to their discount for hospital visitors, it made it affordable, especially in this area. I also really liked that they had valet parking. My other hotel choices were street parking or a parking structure, so here I felt safe arriving back late at night.

Service was great, and the staff even made sure I had a glass of wine upon my late night arrivals. I couldn't make the wine and cheese hour due to my visits at the hospital. Rooms were clean, lots of pillows and good size bath towels. Loved the water pressure in the shower. It was perfect.

My only "complaint" was that the sheets on the bed aren't pulled close enough to the top. I'm average height, but had to burrow down to feel like I was covered; then, my feet were at the edge of the bed. I sleep in super soft bed at home, and I didn't find the firmness of these beds too harsh.

Complimentary wi-fi is awesome, plus they have 3 computers with a printer downstairs in the lobby area.
Less

Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
Francesca P
Livermore, California
Reviewer
3 reviews 3 reviews
'Very nice!!'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed June 4, 2012 NEW

I recently stayed for 5 days, post surgery at a NY hospital. (I am from CA). My apartment had a full kitchen, bedroom, livingroom with a pull out bed for my niece, and access to a terrace. There was plenty of room for me to get moving with crutches, and I did not feel like I was in confinement. The staff were very kind. The apt was kept very clean. There were two drawbacks, one which would not matter for most tourist or business travelers. The first, there is some interesting thumping noises that go on during the day. there were times when I fell asleep without earplugs that it woke me, however, not a big deal. The other was the shower. The water pressure was ok, but the temp was weird. The first day it was hot or scalding. Maint. came up and got it adjusted for me, and it was fine the next day. The third day, it was back to hot and scalding. Overall very minor complaints.
Overall I would reccomend this propert, the minor quirks are far outweighed by price, cleanliness, and proximity to all kinds of things.
Less

Kevin51
Sydney, Australia
Contributor
19 reviews 19 reviews
Reviews in 15 cities Reviews in 15 cities
13 helpful votes 13 helpful votes
'THE place to stay in New York City'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 4, 2012 NEW

BWHH was recommended by a friend who has stayed there several times. We stayed for 17 days and could not have been happier with the accommodation. It is so handy to everything: subway, buses, Broadway, Rockefeller Centre/Plaza and Times Square. The apartments are huge, with separate kitchen, living room, bedroom and bathroom.

All of the staff were friendly and helpful, especially Sam the Man, and the delightful Mayran who manages the breakfast room. Yes, the breakfast room can be a little tight during busy periods, but we sometimes used the quaint outdoor patio which was secluded and tranquil. We never had the need to take a breakfast tray back to our room. The freshly-made waffles were a real treat, as were the munchkin donuts!

BWHH is one of the most comfortable, friendly and well-located places that I have ever stayed.
Less

1 review
'AMAZING CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 1, 2012 NEW

When I tell you that customer service is not dead, I mean it with this hotel. I was in town from Chicago for the weekend attending my father's graduation. At the minute, the hotel I had booked for my parents as a graduation gift fell through and the hotel I was in was fully booked. My husband and I happened upon the hotel accidentally and decided to see if it was a good place for my parents to stay. I am very picky especially when it comes to my parents. Inside the hotel, I encountered SAM (the manager). When I say amazing personality, I am not lying folks. This man went WAY out for me and my parents. Aside from the great customer service, the hotel reminded me of a beautiful New York apartment. It was gorgeous and spacious. My parents could not stop talking about how much they enjoyed their stay. When I return to the city where will I be staying??? Absolutely, positively here. Thanks Sam!!!
