8 reviews 8 reviews
Reviews in 4 cities Reviews in 4 cities
7 helpful votes 7 helpful votes
'Best kept secret in NYC. Shhh.....don't tell!'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed May 8, 2012
1
person found this review helpful

My family of 5 stayed here for 4 days while visiting a college for my daughter. I will say that the hotel exceeded my standards in most categories.

Room: PROS: We got a 1 BR suite. It had a kitchen, 1 BR and a living room with pullout couch. With a family of 5 we had more than enough room to operate and to move about. The place was very clean and updated.The bathroom was good.Kitchen was cleaned and dishes washed each day. Fridge was stocked with complimentary snacks and water. Nice Touch. CONS: The water pressure of the shower was weak. We did not have hot water in the shower for 2 of the 4days. More like luke warm. It was uncomfortably cold. They had to shut of the elevator off for one of the days. Walking up 6 flights stairs after a long day in NYC was not fun, trust me. However, consider that this is an old apartment bldg in NYC. Whaddayawant??

Location: All Pros and no cons. Five stars all around. Walking distance to Times Square and Rock Center. Any kind of food you could want right at your feet. Best Italian food I have ever had is right next door. Pizza Place too. Across the street is a European bakery to die for. On and on. Not to mention the subway is just around the corner to take you wherever you need to go. Felt extremely safe in the area around the hotel. Not a care in the world walking at night with my husband and kids. The location of the hotel is def worth the price of admission.

The hotel: No cons. Five star staff is very friendly, helpful and accomodating to the needs of their guests. The breakfast was delicious. Hot eggs, bacon, juice, best coffee ever, best bagels ever, oatmeal, danish etc. The usual fair.

One other possible con is that when I got home I found dead roach bodies amongst our clothing. We don't and have never had roaches for the past 11 years. I cannot say where they came from. Our suit cases were on the floor of the hotel the whole time but I suppose the pests could have come from anywhere. Also like to mention that I did not physically see any live roaches while in the apartment/suite. I hate to write this, but thought it was important to mention.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
Ask skeimig about BEST WESTERN PLUS Hospitality House
This review is the subjective opinion of a TripAdvisor member and not of TripAdvisor LLC.
Robert Gaeta, General Manager at BEST WESTERN PLUS Hospitality House, responded to this review
May 8, 2012
Thank you for your review and we are glad you enjoyed your stay with us! Our housekeepers will be very glad to hear you found your apartment clean. It is rare in NYC to have elbow room so we are glad you were able to take advantage of that in our large apartment suite.

We have not had water pressure/temeparature mentioned to us by our guests. I wish I knew while you were here so we could have addressed it for you. I wil have our engineer go run the shower in all the 6th floor two bedrom apartments to see. Our elevator requires some maintence and we try to do that while the guests are out sightseeing midday or if quiet, do the work during the night. It's tough with only one elevator but we try to keep any inconvenience to a minimum.

We use a very reputable nationally recognized service for our extermination and have double the amount the amonunt of service even they recommended as a preventive measure. We have not had any reports of what you mention here. I am sorry that you saw that though and I will have it investigated but as you mention we hope also suspect it came from a cab or airplane.

We hope to see you here again someday soon!! Thank you again!!

Warmest Regards,
Robert

GlobalSilverbirch
global
Contributor
14 reviews 14 reviews
Reviews in 13 cities Reviews in 13 cities
4 helpful votes 4 helpful votes
'If you want a holiday apartment in NYC stay here'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 7, 2012

We stayed here end April early May 2012, Our room, 2A faced the street so was quite noisy at night, we did however get used to the noise. The 2 bedroomed apartment was a very good size for 5 adults and we weren't crowded at all. Could have dodne with a second bathroom though for that first trip in the morning, five adults wanting to be in there at the same time made for a lot of fidgeting around.

Beds were very comfortable, kitchen was a good size and well equiped. Everywhere was very clean albeit 'shabby'. The chaps on reception were friendly, helpful, and knowledgable. The one problem we had was sorted quickly and without fuss.

Breakfast was tyical breakfast fare, ie- cereal, omlets, sausage, danish, muffins, toast, fruit, yog, waffles. But the breakfast room is very small so I'd say grab the trays from your room go and load up with your breakfast and eat it back in your apartment or if the weather permits there is an outside seating area.

Location was excellent, on E 49th it wasn't far from Times square, Central Park, Top o The Rock and Grand Central Staion. Subways were close by and plenty of places to eat.

We stayed at Radio City Apartments 2 years ago and think that this place is better. We booked it through apartments2book.co.uk so got a very good price. Beaware though that it is very easy to block the toilets, best to 'close the door before all the guests have left' flush and start again if you see what I mean..
Less

5Travelsmiths
Canberra
1 review
'Fantastic family choice'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed April 28, 2012

Our family of five, including 3 young children, stayed in one of the 2 bedroom apartments. The service provided by Sam and the rest of the team was outstanding, even housekeeping was happy to return later in the day to accommodate sleeping jet-lagged children. The facilities were first rate - full size fridge, all appliances in order except for the dishwasher which was promptly replaced while we were there - and the apartment had plenty of room, particularly given the price. One very handy thing was that each of the 2 bedrooms as well as the living area had a TV, which meant that even though one of the kids was asleep on the sofa bed in the lounge room, it didn't mean lights out and quiet time for everyone else. Only drawback to mention is that the street noise can be a bit much from time to time but all of us slept very well nonetheless and what can you expect for such a central midtown location? We have had several vacations to New York and stayed in a variety of places in Manhattan, but I think we've found the place we'll be returning to each time from now on in.
Less

See 2 more reviews by travelersSC for New York City
travelersSC
South Carolina
Senior Contributor
49 reviews 49 reviews
Reviews in 18 cities Reviews in 18 cities
17 helpful votes 17 helpful votes
'Where we stay when showing NYC to first timers'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed June 3, 2012 NEW
4
people found this review helpful

My wife and I stayed here twice when showing family members the city for the first time. When we come as a couple, we choose quieter neighborhoods, but this is a perfect location for first-timers, especially with children and teenagers.

Both times we got a suite so grandchildren could join us in our room. The first suite was larger with bathroom access from both rooms, but the more recent one was smaller with bathroom access only in the main bedroom. Even so, it worked, and there was privacy for both rooms when desired.

The street outside the hotel is as crowded and noisy as can be, but the hotel itself is very quiet. We were on the 34th floor this time; there are four elevators and they are fast and efficient. The rooms are well equipped and the service is good. We paid extra for Wi-Fi this time. A friend once told me, "You don't come to New York to save money!" Words of wisdom.

Some tips: We bought unlimited 7-day passes for the MTA ($29) and were glad we did. We ate at Ellen's Stardust Diner both times; a fun intro to NYC for children/teenagers. Also, we take them to Lombardi's for pizza and Rice to Riches for desert. Both are wonderful and unique to NYC. We love Junior's (Times Square) for after theater dining. The Staten Island Ferry is a great (free) way to see the Statue of Liberty, and there is a very moving 9-11 Memorial on Staten Island near the ferry. Second Ave Deli is wonderful for a kosher deli experience. By planning ahead with some online research, we have seen the top three Tony nominated Broadway shows (Book of Mormon last year; Death of a Salesman and Once this year). Broadway shows are amazing. Also, kids love Madam Tussauds, and so do we. Good FREE things to do (other than Staten Island) are visit Strawberry Fields in Central Park, walk the Brooklyn bridge (and Brooklyn Heights), visit Washington Square Park, walk the High Line park, see Rockefeller Center, see Grand Central Station, and walk through Chinatown. Our teenage grandson, who plays the drums, was wowed by the show we saw at the Blue Note (we love this place) and enjoyed the early jazz show we caught at Birdland.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
See 2 more reviews by travelersSC for New York City

Richard D
Rockville, Maryland
1 review
'Great stay for college graduation week!'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 2, 2012 NEW

We stayed for four nights in May on an AXON7 award (145K HHonors points) for our daughter's college graduation week - what a wonderful stay! The room was clean and roomy and every single hotel person we interacted with was terrific, from the security men at the hotel entrance to the Cowboy (really!) at the reception desk, to the staff at the restaurant, to the folks cleaning the rooms.
I knew the hotel only provided 2 free breakfasts each day from reading Tripadvisor reviews so when the Cowboy at the front desk confirmed that policy, I told him we would have 4 people in the room and asked whether we could have 4 free breakfasts on two of the days rather than 2 free breakfasts on four of the days. He said it would not be a problem and set it up for us in the computer for the last two mornings of our stay. But wait it gets better! At the first breakfast, my wife talked with Hannah, the hostess at the restaurant, about some special accomodations we would need the next morning. Not only did Hannah have everything ready and waiting at breakfast the next day, but she also addressed us by name as soon as she saw us! Hannah really went out of her way to make sure we felt special and were well taken care of - thank you Hannah!
Overall, a fantastic stay - we highly recommend this hotel for a family stay in NYC!
Less

LMODelMar
Del Mar
Contributor
12 reviews 12 reviews
Reviews in 10 cities Reviews in 10 cities
6 helpful votes 6 helpful votes
'A Great Experience with a 10 year old'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 2, 2012 NEW

For a tourist in New York the Double Tree Suites is a perfect location. We had our 10 year old granddaughter with us and she loved Times Square. With or without a child, Times Square is a great experience. The hotel is located right next to the subway entrance and close to Penn Station so transportation is easy. The hop on, hop off bus pickup is just around the corner. The M and M store, Toys R Us with the inside ferris wheel and many other stores and restaurants are within a few blocks. We saw Lion King and it was right across the street.

We were on the 38th floor and it was very quiet. I recommend requesting a high floor as Times Square, honking cars and sirens are noisy.

We had a room with 2 double beds and sofa bed in the living room area. Our granddaughter slept in the bedroom with us which was nice because we could watch TV in the living room when she went to bed and my husband was able to get up in the morning, make coffee and read the paper without disturbing us. Most hotel rooms in New York are very small but these were not. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful.



My husband is a Hilton diamond member and our breakfast buffet was free but we did have to pay for our granddaughter. If you have to pay the breakfast buffet it is over priced.

Our refrigerator wasn't working and the repairman didn't come up until several hours later. We didn't wait for him. When he did get there he apologized for taking so long and compensated us by not charging for our granddaughters breakfast the following to mornings which was very nice of him.
Less

Bhramanti-Pune
Pune
Top Contributor
70 reviews 70 reviews
Reviews in 26 cities Reviews in 26 cities
53 helpful votes 53 helpful votes
'Best value in Times Square with it's location..'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed June 1, 2012 NEW
1
person found this review helpful

Our three week US vacation started with Big Apple. While the taxi driver knew the place, I could not see it from distance. Rather when he stopped in front of hotel on 7th avenue, I started worried. A bell boy came quickly to the cab, took over the luggage working with cab driver, mentioned the pieces number and gave us a receipt. He followed us in. Granted the receiving lobby on first floor or for that reason on third floor is not fancy. The quick check-in, warm cookies, and friendly reception makes it up for that. We had a 36flr conference suite. It had a view of central park and times square. Being on 36th for meant no noise issues. Window cover took care of flashing light nicely.

As locations go, this turned out to be an excellent location around times square, with
1. Train stops just in front of the hotel for times square/42nd st stop- a multi route junction. (liberty statue- battery park, Chinatown-canal street, museum of natural history- 76th st, empire state building - 34th st all accessible through this. Just buy a 50$ metro card for a family of 4 for 3 nights stay.)
2. Broadway, off-broadway theaters are few blocks around this location and 50% discount broadway show ticket booths are literally in front, facing 47th st., and
3. Food places around are so many and nearby, including the soup nazi, Stage Deli, Ray's Pizza.
With these many choices, we had chosen not to do b'fast in hotel.

Central park, Columbus Circle, Rockfeller Center and Radio City are at walking distance.
We appreciated that doubletree provides Guest Suite - that are clean, well furnished (kitchenette, bathrooms, lots of towels and toilettories and unlimited warm cookies at front door - a very smart move as at this location that all we wanted from the hotel!
Less

'Great location and very good experience'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed May 31, 2012 NEW

Booked this on Hilton points. Six nights on Diamond reward so had a king suite on 28th floor which was a great view. Breakfast buffet was very good although exactly the same all six mornings. Had to meet my driver at 6:45 so opening at 6:30 was a challenge. Staff made sure i was fed and I appreciated that. Very busy week in NYC with the fleet and Memorial Day but well managed by the hotel. Have stayed here several times before and it was better than I remembered. Good exercise room. Convenient to everything. Nothing truly amazing but a very comfortable stay with only one disappointment experienced by my wife. The refrigerator was not working and we lost $50 of food from a steak house and a sushi bar. It took all day to get it working and she lost the only sunny day waiting in the room for the repair man. Staff tried to recover and provided several options which we accepted with satisfaction.

'Unbeatable location in Times Square'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed May 31, 2012 NEW
1
person found this review helpful

After awful weather delayed my arrival into NYC, I finally arrived at the Doubletree at about 230 in the morning. A tip for those who have never been to the hotel before, the hotel is actually on the corner of 7th Avenue at 47th St NOT Broadway/47th despite the address being listed on Broadway. However, after a phone call to the hotel and a quick loop around the block I got to the right spot and checked in. As a Hilton Honors Diamond member I got upgraded to a Pure Suite with very nice amenities and promptly collapsed on the bed and went to sleep. Bed and linens were very comfy and high quality. Room was facing Times Square, but the drapes totally blocked out all light and it did not distract my sleep at all. Wake up call at 8 am, and I was up and at 'em. Shower needed a little maintenance as the water was weak coming out of the shower head and water was gushing out of the faucet resulting in a lot of standing water in the tub while I was showering. Not a big deal. Went to Ginger's for breakfast, nice buffet, plenty of variety, service in the restaurant was non-existent. Nobody ever came after I was seated to pour coffee or offer beverages. Finished my plate, grabbed my things, and off to work. Would definitely stay there again, but a couple of tweaks could turn this place from good to great.
Less

tam6572
SW Wales. UK
Senior Contributor
21 reviews 21 reviews
Reviews in 8 cities Reviews in 8 cities
12 helpful votes 12 helpful votes
'5 Stars for location'
3 of 5 stars Reviewed May 31, 2012

Double Tree Hilton
We stayed here based on the main reason we are a family of 5 (2 adults 3 children 16,13,10) and these suites could fit us all in at a reasonable price, in an amazing location.
We arrived at 1am and my 10 year old son asked if he could wear his sunglasses as it was so bright in Times Square! The hotel lobby was secure and we were greeted by a security guard who explained that check inn was on the next floor. The staff member on duty was not particularly friendly and did not offer the children any cookies but it was 1am.
Our room as we had requested was on a high floor we were actually on the top floor (away from any traffic noise). The room was basic but clean with a handy kitchenette.
We had booked our New York Trip to celebrate my 40th Birthday and although the hotel new this there was nothing to acknowledge this special event, this was very disappointing as a message or a card on the TV would have sufficed.
The concierge were very helpful , and able to get tickets for a sold out Knicks game for us at Madison Square Garden, we were very pleased and grateful.
Overall great for the location average hotel experience.
Less

Thank you again for your feedback, and we hope you will give us another opportunity soon to make our stay the best it can be.

AtlantaTalkinghead
Atlanta
Senior Contributor
33 reviews 33 reviews
Reviews in 25 cities Reviews in 25 cities
25 helpful votes 25 helpful votes
'Excellent Property in "Times Square"...Sort Of'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed June 6, 2012 NEW

We just returned from a long weekend in New York City and stayed at this property. As hotels in NYC go, this is an excellent property. Our room was bigger than most you find in Manhattan (king room) and came equipped with a flat panel television with an excellent choice of stations, complimentary coffee, a desk, overpriced snacks and a mini bar. The bathroom was modern and spacious and the linens were of high quality. Overall, the room was very clean, no bugs, and the street noise from 44th street was minimal.

As for calling this property as a "times square" location, that's a bit of a stretch. The hotel is located at the corner of 44th Street and 8th Avenue, which is about two blocks west of the traditional Times Square location that's become a fixture in the minds of travelers and where the annual New Year's Eve celebration takes place. With that said, it's location might actually be more of an attraction for some of you since it's quieter than being in the "heart" of Times Square. Plus, it's a short five minute walk to all the action.

BEWARE: I booked the reservation through Hotwire and was able to save about $120 a night off the regular rate. However, the Hotwire rate is basically for a "run of room" reservation, meaning you get what they offer you. When I checked in, they offered us a room with two full beds. That wasn't going to work for my wife, daughter and I. They ended up offering us a king room upgrade (complimentary), which we took, but then charged us $30 a night for a rollaway bed. We still saved money in the long run. However, I would check the hotel's website and compare their rates with Hotwire. If comparable, book through the hotel so you know exactly why you're getting. If you are a solo traveler or someone traveling with your spouse, go the Hotwire/Priceline route.

Would I stay here again? Absolutely. The location was great, the staff was accommodating and our weekend was a lot of fun. But it's NYC, so be prepared to open your wallet often!
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
See 2 more reviews by AtlantaTalkinghead for New York City

Reviews in 10 cities Reviews in 10 cities
15 helpful votes 15 helpful votes
'Better than Hilton and W'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 4, 2012 NEW
1
person found this review helpful

I stayed in NYC for work and pleasure for six days at three hotels, the Intercontinental Times Square, the Hilton Times Square and the W Union Square. The intercontinental was the newest and had the best rate. It's a gorgeous hotel and near Times Square. Great service, nice staff. Hilton wasn't bad, but lobby was on a high floor, but had a large area for sitting, working and hanging out. Main entrance was under construction so one entered on 41st St. W Union Square was nice, but room not as much light as the other two and also didn't have as good views although it was in a great location. the W was normally more expensive, but I had a discount local rate through work. W's bar area is neat, but also sort of small. For the money at hotels normal rates, the Intercontinental was the best value.
Less

Problem with this review?
Dayle B
1 review
'Fantastic beds, amazing service and the best location - right in the middle of it all!'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed June 3, 2012 NEW via mobile

My girlfriend and I travelled to NYC for 10 days of shopping, eating out and site seeing and generally experiencing all the magic that New York offers. Whilst in the airport terminal I flicked an email to the conceirge to arrange a chauffered car collection from JFK at late notice as I was not going to be contactable for some 18 hours, it was there, fantastic quality and a friendly driver with no fuss! When we arrived at the hotel we received a warm welcome and asked if there were any opportunties to be on the highest floor we could - the Reservations attendent was great, understood how excited we were and bumped us up.
The room was so comfortable, everybody raves about the beds on TripAdviser and they were so right, expect to find it hard to get out of them! The rooms were serviced impeccably each day - remember to drop housekeeping a tip every couple of days and get extra special treatment!
The in-room dining was wonderful, attention to detail and no different to what you would expect if you were sitting downstairs in the restaurant which was also a fantastic intimate atmosphere, expecially at night!
The bellboys are fantastic and the doorman so helpful in getting a cab or simply taking your shopping upstairs so you can continue on your way!
Adrian and Sonia at the conceirge desk were unbelievably friendly, helpful and full of ideas. I called them up on a clear day whilst on the bus and asked if they could organise my friend and I a helicopter trip for later that afternoon - no problem! Just one example of how helpful they were - not to mention pointing us in the direction of some great bars and restaurants!

The only negative during our trip was the fact that there was no free wifi in the hotel and $15/day is pretty expensive on what are not cheap rooms... perhaps something to think about, but NYC is full of free wifi - almost every coffeshop, restaurant has it!

Thanks Intercontinental Times Square for your contribution to an amazing holiday!
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
Ask Dayle B about InterContinental New York Times Square

Maryanne S
Tampa, Florida
2 reviews
Reviews in 2 cities Reviews in 2 cities
'Best Kept Secret in NYC'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 4, 2012 NEW

I spent 3 nights at Ink48 over memorial Day weekend. It's definitely off the beaten path away from all the touristy areas, but still near everything.
The entire staff was professional, friendly and accommodating. I asked for early check-in and once my room was ready, they seeked me out in the den area. Check- in and check-out was quick and uncomplicated.
I had a corner city-view room. It was very large compared to other NYC hotels that i have stayed at. And it was impeccably clean.
The food at the Print restaurant was amazing, as was the service. The roof top lounge, The Press, offers breath taking city views in a living room type atmosphere.
I definitely plan on staying here on future trips to NYC.

Reviews in 6 cities Reviews in 6 cities
6 helpful votes 6 helpful votes
'Amazing Views!'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 4, 2012 NEW

We stayed in the Hudson River Suite that had an amazing view over the Hudson River (Funny that!)

The room was generously large and had high quality furniture and fittings throughout. We would almost call it a home away from home.

Whilst we did not dine in the hotel restaurant we regularly had drinks on the roof top bar and enjoyed the magnificent views. I would like to point out to management though that it was somewhat disappointing we could not charge back our drinks from the bar back to the room. Therefore had to head back to the room. Just a minor point but put us out a little as we had to get the lift to ground floor then to the room, then to the ground floor, then back to the bar. Yes you read it right! Apparently this is some "security" measure but just made no sense. After this we made sure we took cash to the bar!

We enjoyed the nightly drinks that the Kimpton are renowned for too!

Location wise was very good with times square only a 10-15 minute walk and Hells kitchen only about 5 minutes down the road for all the dining options you could imagine.

Overall a pleasant stay and would certainly stay again! This was our first stay at a Kimpton and we will surely try other properties in their group when we return back to the US
Less

See 2 more reviews by irishiiis for New York City
irishiiis
Chicago, Illinois
Senior Reviewer
10 reviews 10 reviews
Reviews in 6 cities Reviews in 6 cities
22 helpful votes 22 helpful votes
'Can't be beat'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 3, 2012 NEW

We spend a birthday celebration weekend with another couple at Ink 48 May 26-29. It was wonderful. The front desk is staffed with very friendly, accommodating, knowledgeable people, well-equipped to respond to all questions. They know spots around the city the average tourist wouldn't find most likely, and they are eager to help solve any problems which might arise. They get high marks, definitely. The rooms are more spacious that your average NYC hotel, possibly because the hotel is located in a rehabilitated printing factory a block off the Hudson River at 47th and 11th. Not right in the middle of things but an easy walk to almost anywhere, if you like to walk, which we do. Our city view room included a small sitting area, perfect for having a drink before going to dinner, although the hotel hosts its own complimentary happy hour from 5 to 6, where they serve wine, which included a very nice sangria while we stayed. An added treat is the coffee/tea service in the morning, and icy cold water or lemonade available in the lobby during the day. There is a wonderful bar, The Press, on the rooftop with amazing views in all directions. Try to visit during the day and at night, as it looks entirely different. Be warned that much of the seating LOOKS very cool, but is terribly uncomfortable. The restaurant off the lobby, Print, has amazing food but is not a Kimpton restaurant, as we were told several times. It didn't matter to us. The food was an inventive combination of fresh-sourced ingredients, and we rate Print a don't miss feature of staying at Ink 48. Become a Kimpton In Touch member, and not only do you earn credit for a future free night, but the wii-fi is free, and you get a mini bar coupon. It's no wonder why we loved Ink 48, and were sorry to say good-bye
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes

'Great hotel, friendly staff, just a little far away from the action'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 2, 2012 NEW

This hotel was delightful! Very clean, spacious rooms, and a nice view. Lots of amenities. Our bed was comfy. We had a large tub and a stand alone shower. The staff was extremely helpful, friendly, and accomodating. Check-in was fast, smooth, and easy. A bottle of champagne was delivered shortly after we checked in! They have a wine reception every evening which we only caught once as we were so busy, but it was a delicious summer sangria. I didn't noticed any unnecessary noise, even though there is a rooftop lounge. There are no ice machines, but whenever we needed ice, it was delivered to our room within minutes. They are pet-friendly, so if that bothers you, you may want to go elsewhere as there were several dogs there. My only slight complaint is that the hotel is a little far away from where most of the action is. So we started each day with generally a 3 avenue (avenues are long, streets are short) walk before we even got to anywhere we wanted to be. If you don't enjoy a good long walk, either take cabs or stay someplace closer to where you want to be. We kept telling ourselves we were burning off all the delicious food we enjoyed on our trip. Ha ha ha! Given a good deal, we would stay there again based on the great staff alone.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
See 7 more reviews by Lisadiva for New York City

'second time as good as the first'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 31, 2012 NEW

I just came back from a weekend stay at Ink 48 in New York. I had stayed there in January and was looking forward to a return visit although I was a little afraid I would be disappointed since I liked it so much the first time. But, to my delight, I loved it just as much the second time. Although a little out of the way (48th and 11th), the hotel is just so nice and welcoming. Everyone is really very nice and helpful. I had an amazing room with a king size bed, a couch and a huge bathroon with a bathtub and a separate shower. I left, once again, looking forward to my next visit.

Problem with this review?
bigbasin
San Jose
Contributor
13 reviews 13 reviews
Reviews in 9 cities Reviews in 9 cities
9 helpful votes 9 helpful votes
'Nice, but....'
3 of 5 stars Reviewed May 30, 2012

I would rate this hotel 3.5 stars.

Front Desk: efficient and professional staff. The Staff person rattled off a list of benefits, not sure what all they were. A Better experience would have been to provide me with a check-list of perks.

Non-Front Desk staff: outgoing and fun. I wish the Housekeeping Staff and In-room dining staff would man the Front Desk. In fact, I hope Kimpton encourages individual contributors to cross-train and move up to management.

Decor: Modern. Bed was a comfortable rating of B. The mattresses used at the Arizona Biltmore will always be the best. A shelf ledge on the left against the wall was a bit wobbly.

Internet: ok for email

Clock Radio: correct time was not set. I had to search the net to figure out how to set the time. You had to remove a back cover and press two buttons.

Neighborhood: where UPS has its Manhattan depot. I'm glad I didn't stay near Times Square. A bit of a walk to subway, especially during 80 percent humidity. Would have been nice to offer a free shuttle to the subway.

Nits: I'm getting tired of conservation when it means I can't see my face in the bathroom mirror to shave because there is not enough light. If you want to conserve, go with bright LEDs. TV was ok, no local TV guide provided. Did I see mold in the shower? Or, was it just because it was dark in the bathroom?

Other: I booked my room with Sinqueaway and probably won't do it again. Don't understand why Kimpton has associated itself with such a consumer-unfriendly organization. Didn't know I would not accrue Kimpton Rewards points until I called to confirm my reservation.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
Ask bigbasin about Ink48 - a Kimpton Hotel
This review is the subjective opinion of a TripAdvisor member and not of TripAdvisor LLC.

alijenks
Ancaster, Canada
1 review
1 helpful vote 1 helpful vote
'Good Hotel, Ball Dropped By Staff'
2 of 5 stars Reviewed June 1, 2012 NEW
1
person found this review helpful

Stayed in suite 1410 for 5 nights in May, got a great deal on Travelzoo ($215/night). One bedroom suite was huge, plenty of windows, lighting, closet space, functional bathroom, plenty of outlets, iPod dock, etc. Room could not have been better. Also, breakfast was fantastic - took advantage every morning (croissants were from Balthazar and were to die for!). Couldn't beat the Empire State views from the penthouse rooftop. Staff was friendly enough, and location was fantastic (we were able to walk everywhere).

I would have given this hotel a much better review if it were not for one very concerning problem. On the third day of our stay, we returned to the hotel after a long day (10+ hours) of being out and about to find our hotel door unlocked and ajar. This was presumably the error of careless cleaning staff, and no doubt an accident. This could have been disastrous, as we had our Macbook, iPhones, iPads, plus all of our newly purchased goods in the room. Luckily, nothing was missing from our hotel room.

What was even more concerning was the lack of response or concern from the staff. We called front desk to notify them and received no apology, no offer to send someone up to check things out, make sure no one was in our room or nothing was missing - just an offer to replace our room keys (what good would this do?). Frustrated, we let this go. However, upon checkout, we brought this up again, and this time the front desk staff did seem more concerned. They put a note on file of the incident, and apologized. This made us question why there hadn't been any note or indication made in the first place? Not good, ball had been dropped by staff more than once.

Two weeks later, I have noticed two small charges on my Visa. I have had to call the hotel to inquire what they are for, and received and email response indicating them to be the result of local phone calls placed and items missing from the mini fridge. No phone calls were made (even so, there is not any indication anywhere that there is a charge associated with making local phone calls - this seems quite ridiculous), and I know there was nothing taken from the mini fridge. However, is not worth my time to further challenge these.

Ultimately, my experience at the Morgans could have been much better if it hadn't been for this unfortunate instance and the overall poor response of the staff. We were very lucky that nothing was missing from the room - that could have wrecked our trip. Unless another fantastic deal comes up for this hotel, I probably will not be back.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
Ask alijenks about Morgans Hotel
This review is the subjective opinion of a TripAdvisor member and not of TripAdvisor LLC.
Rigas, General Manager at Morgans Hotel, responded to this review
June 4, 2012
Thank you very much for your review. I do recall this incident - in a small hotel like this, we are normally very aware of everything that goes on. First of all, I am very sorry that you experienced this.

From what I recall, the Front Desk staff told you they were going to conduct a key interrogation. This was done (the interrogation actually records doors opening and closing). The report showed that the Room Attendant actually shut the door because we saw a record of an entry and a departure that corresponded with her paperwork. What we did notice is that the door does not shut completely unless it is pulled shut. Unfortunately, the mechanism was faulty and was fixed. I am very sorry about this.

A word of caution to every guest - these things do happen on occasion in any hotel. It is important that you ensure when you leave the room that the door is completely shut. As you walk away, it may sound like it has shut completely but sometimes it does not. It is by no means your fault, it is up to the hotel to check these things but sometimes it happens during a guest stay. Always check behind you to ensure that your door locks properly. If it does not, please let Management know.

Kind regards,

DR

OuterbanksNc
NC
1 review
'Wonderful weekend in NYC'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 17, 2012

I always read reviews before making a decision on hotels so I appreciate detail and accuracy - I want this to be helpful to others! The Morgan Hotel is by far the best hotel we have stayed at in NYC. Our Loft room and bathroom was impressivly large and tastefully decorated. Beds comfortable and above all, everything was super clean. Although this is an older building, the facility has been updated. After a day out exploring the city & visiting with family, coming back to the hotel felt like coming home to one's own apartment on Madison Avenue. The breakfast was a welcome surprise as was the lovely breakfast room itself. I can't say enough about the staff - they were always helpful, friendly & treated us as welcomed guests. Valet parking was convenient & well priced. The location is also great. We have family in NYC and we will definately be back to the Morgan. Loved it!
Less

singbluesilver

'need a phd to work lights'
3 of 5 stars Reviewed May 15, 2012
1
person found this review helpful

went to stay for one night with my hubby, shower was beautiful..one of those waterfall ones. but if you're looking for a hotel name while driving up madison avenue, which is stressful enough as it is, dont bother as there is no hotel name out front..just the street number. its on purpose, so it feels more like home. as a visitor, i prefer to have the name on front so when i stumble out of a bicycle rickshaw at 3 am drunk i know where i am.

the bed was super comfy, i wanted to take it home with me. we had a 2 room suite, it was ok..lots of comfy pillows.

the free breakfast was nice as it ended at noon, not at 10 am like other hotels.....we never make it to those as who wants to get out of bed that early for a bagel?? it was the basics, creeal, fruit, pastrys...they were pretty bland though.

but seriously, when you cant figure out how to work the lights in the bathroom when youre sober, its too difficult. too confusing...just give me a switch!!


all in all it was a ok place, the staff was friendly.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
Ask singbluesilver about Morgans Hotel
This review is the subjective opinion of a TripAdvisor member and not of TripAdvisor LLC.
Rigas, General Manager at Morgans Hotel, responded to this review
May 17, 2012
Thank you for your review. I am happy that you had a good stay. You are right - we do not have a sign in front of the hotel. People do find us however!

We get our pastries from Balthazar - one of the finest places in the city so I am surprised you found them bland.

Really, you do not need a PhD to work the lights - something that I always do when arriving at a new hotel is to ask for a Bellman whether I have lots of luggage or not. I find it is so helpful to get a 'room orientation'. I often fumble with lights and thermostats myself so it is always good to get a little tour!

Hope you have a great summer!

Regards,

GalwayGirl159
Galway, Ireland
2 reviews
'Great hotel'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 15, 2012

Stayed for 5 nights in November (yes this review is long overdue!) with my sister to celebrate her 40th birthday. It is a lovely hotel with wonderfully attentive staff. Our room was lovely and spacious by NY standards and the beds so comfy it was hard to get up in the morning! The continental breakfast was a real bonus as was the lounge on the first floor which meant we could have a nice cup of tea whilst setting up and using our newly purchased iPads. My only slight criticism would be the lack of lighting in the room - we were on the 12th floor overlooking the street but the room was still a little dark. Would definitely stay here again.

See 13 more reviews by des12404 for New York City
des12404
des12404
Senior Contributor
25 reviews 25 reviews
Reviews in 11 cities Reviews in 11 cities
14 helpful votes 14 helpful votes
'Unforgettable Stay at Trump Towers'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 5, 2012 NEW

We just returned from three nights at Trump Towers to celebrate my Nephew's eleventh birthday and are still basking in the "afterglow".
Our upgraded corner room had a wonderful view of Columbus Circle where 7th Ave. and Broadway converge as well as a good view of Central Park.
The staff was as welcoming and gracious as you would expect at a hotel that is in the Trump group. Nothing was too much trouble and they always had a welcoming smile each time you returned to your "New York home away from home".
Our Nephew couldn't have been more pleased. He even slept with the shades up so that he could enjoy the ambiance of New York's neon wonderland.
When we arrived, we had a significant snafu at the airport and needed to re-print all of our documentation for the trip. The front desk took care of the problem with professional courtesy and efficiently delivered a computer to our room since the Business Center was closed at that late hour. All of our missing documents were printed and waiting for us early the next morning (including tickets to the theatre, the Empire State Building, 911 Memorial, dinner reservations, etc.).
Thank you Kristin!
I am not sure why there are negative comments regarding the size and configuration of the bathroom. We found it to be lovely and very well equipped (spa tub, lighted makeup mirror, extra huge towels, wonderful toiletries, etc.).
Perhaps the only negative (and this is really nit-picking) was that the half bath lighting was quite dim, making it difficult for make up application. There, I did find a negative as you always can if you are a pessimist!
The location, service and staff make Trump International Hotel and Tower my first choice on any future visits to New York.
Again, thank you for all of your courtesy. You gave my Nephew a lifetime memory of our time in New York that will live long after we are gone from his life.
Less

5 reviews 5 reviews
Reviews in 4 cities Reviews in 4 cities
5 helpful votes 5 helpful votes
'Well done Donald!!'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed June 1, 2012 NEW

Just finished a 7 night stay at the Trump international and wish I was still there!! We stayed in a 1 bedroom executive city view suite which was gorgeous. Ceiling to floor windows with views down Columbus circle which we loved. I know central park is beautiful, but in my opinion you can get beautiful green views in any place so not worth extra, the city view was very iconic NYC to me. After hectic days of site-seeing we couldn't wait to get back to our calm oasis of a suite to watch a film on the mammoth TV (it was HUGE and there were 2!)

The kitchen was really useful as we didn't want to eat out at restaurants for so many nights so we just popped over to Whole Foods and it even had a freezer so were able to keep a stash of take-home Pinkberry (one round the corner!)! Other good things: great subway lines next door, perfect location, easy for cabs.

Like other reviews, there really are only a couple of downsides. The bathroom is very average and with the space available, not really sure what they could do to improve. It was also not very soundproof. We went down to check out the pool and it was only OK, but I guess good for NYC standards. Don't let bad comments about the bathroom turn you off though, the rest of the room more than makes up for it and it's still nice enough. And finally, it goes without saying that a downside is the cost, but worth it if you can afford it.

A fantastic hotel, you won't regret!
Less

Euroedmus
Prague, Czech Republic
Contributor
20 reviews 20 reviews
Reviews in 16 cities Reviews in 16 cities
36 helpful votes 36 helpful votes
'Could be so much better...'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed May 29, 2012

I booked Trump just for one reason - to watch Macy's Thanksgiving Parade and to have an opportunity to watch it from your room. We moved to Trump from a different hotel so I could do an immediate comparison. Reservation was done well and special thank to a reservation manager who took care of all our needs.

The location is superb - we were overlooking Central park and the view was breathtaking. Arrival was quite clumsy, I did not feel like a welcome guest to be honest. Check-in went smoothly though (well I paid in advance anyway). Our begs arrived before us as the other hotel we were staying at took care of everything for us and transferred all our luggage to Trump. The guy who took our begs up was not very friendly and I had a feeling that he was looking at us like at some "Europeans who do not know how to tip so why to care much". Staff overall is quite friendly and helpful.

Our room was way too small for 1200 USD per day I was paying. My fault I guess not to look for something bigger. We liked a fact of having a full kitchen as our son likes when we cook something rather then eating at different places all the time. The gold plating, the marble, Trump's face on the water bottle and vodka's bottle....I am afraid this is way too much.

In-room dining was absolutely fabulous. Excellent food, great service. I can not fault it. We did not have a chance to eat at the hotel restaurant or to have breakfast, but I heard that food is excellent.

Housekeeping needs serious improvement. I expect some better one at the hotel claiming to be 5 star (I guess everyone can put it on front sign nowadays).

I would have no problems staying at Trump again, but only if there are no rooms available at 2 other hotels we visited during our stay in NYC. I would still recommend it to my friends traveling without children and for short stays only if they want to stay next to Central Park or if they go for business.
Less

windance
new jersey
Contributor
13 reviews 13 reviews
Reviews in 7 cities Reviews in 7 cities
16 helpful votes 16 helpful votes
'quirky'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed May 21, 2012
2
people found this review helpful

First, the location is superb - overlooking central park and steps from the Columbus Ave subway hub. Staff quickly recognizes the guests and is quite friendly and helpful, giving the impression that it is an intimate place. I booked a jr. suite with park view via amex platinum -- sadly, no "upgrade upon arrival" (unusual, but I guess, none was available). The room was a bit quirky with two long, slender interconnected rooms and the layout detracted from the ambiance. Still, the bed was excellent, views superb. There was a full kitchen, a second bath and enough closet space to store a moose. I did, however, get a bit tired of seeing The Donald's name and face everywhere.

I ordered a birthday cake, vintage champagne and roses (it was a celebration) less than 24 hours before check-in. All were spectacular and the champagne was iced to coincide with the timing of my arrival (nice touch - I've found it sitting in melted ice water at other hotels).

Parking is a challenge at the Trump, as it's off to the side and one needs bread crumbs and a road map to find the back door into the hotel (it shouldn't be this hard - all that's needed is a sign!). For those who religiously avoid hotel restaurants, Jean George is one of the country's top tables (and priced accordingly, but well worth the expense - especially if you're a foodie. I wouldn't recommend a quick meal - dinners here are to be savored (Book well in advance, though). While the restaurant might be a tad too extravagant for some, the adjoining lounge serves excellent food in a more relaxed, albeit very noisy, space. The lounge, however, may be a bit too "happening" for those who prefer a quieter meal. Strangely, with such a pedigree for the dining room, I found breakfasts here to be OK, but nothing special.

Overall it's very nice hotel and I'd stay again. It's a good value (especially when compared to the nearby Mandarin). It's a toss up with the Tower rooms at the NY Palace (my other go-to hotel in NYC) for the price. The Palace Towers offers a better location for theater and shopping, rooms have a bit more feng shui, and the executive lounge is convenient, albeit typically quite crowded. On the other hand, the intimacy, views and service at the Trump were terrific - so either will be a good choice.
Less

'Back to the 70s'
3 of 5 stars Reviewed May 13, 2012
3
people found this review helpful

I spent a whole week at this hotel during a business trip to NYC. Let me begin by saying that the location is superb (opposite Central Park), the service corteous, the rooms big & clean and well serviced....

However this hotel screams 70's left right and centre. The building itself seems to have been dipped in a pool of chocolate - brown everywhere. And then the gold plating, the marble, and Trump's own face on the water bottle....come on!

My room was also noisy and could hear traffic down below. Gym & Spa were being refurbushe. Room service options were limited and frankly quite bland. Room for improvement.

SixStarQueen
Hong Kong
Senior Contributor
33 reviews 33 reviews
Reviews in 15 cities Reviews in 15 cities
60 helpful votes 60 helpful votes
'Closest to an Asian 5* I have ever come across in North America'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 10, 2012
2
people found this review helpful

Before my husband and I checked in (hotel check in time was a very late 4 pm) I rang and asked if we could leave our luggage and have 2 suits, an evening gown and a tuxedo pressed before actually checking in AND have ALL items returned by 6 pm on the same night. They said it wouldn't be a problem.

After dropping everything off at 11am I went off shopping and rather than carting my purchases about with me I had them delivered to the hotel (bear in mind I had not yet checked in) . By the time I returned to the hotel at 5:30 to check-in all my deliveries had not only arrived but was already placed with all my luggage.

Within 20 minutes of arriving in our room, tea and coffee was delivered and very soon after that all our pressing was delivered and carefully hung up in the large walk-in closet.

Our room was spacious, clean and bright. The view of Columbus Circle and Central Park was perfect.

The only complaint I have is that tea was not served in a teapot but rather in a very North American way of teabag sachet in amongst the sugar packets with a large pot of hot water and cup and saucer. I like my tea to steep before pouring a cup.

During our time here the spa, gym and Jean-George was under renovation so we didn't get to experience any of the 3 however on our previous trip to NYC we did have a wonderful in Jean-George.

Brilliant, friendly service staff, everyone always had a ready smile!
Less

Good Points.

1. Staff are extremely friendly.and service is excellent
2. Restaurant is beautiful - I only had breakfast as a part of a package - but the food was excellent
3. Room was extremely well appointed - I was upgraded to a suite and it was very comfortable

Bad Points

1. Corridors are in need of a refurbishment
2. Spa was closed and therefore I did not get to experience the swimming pool

I would return sine it was very comfortable - but not my favourite

La Coron W
Melbourne, Australia
Reviewer
3 reviews 3 reviews
Reviews in 2 cities Reviews in 2 cities
3 helpful votes 3 helpful votes
'Fantastic'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 5, 2012
1
person found this review helpful

This was our first trip to NY and we couldn't have asked for a nicer place. The location is brilliant - we wanted to stay at a place where Central Park was the doorstep and it's exactly that! The staff are outstanding and the hotel itself is very comfortable. We stayed in a junior suite and whilst I can't complain, the next time I would ask for a central park view. Even though we were on a high floor, the city view is just ok. To have a fantastic 'city view' in NY you really need to be on a floor 20+ up. The hotel's 'attention to detail' is impressive, they really do put in the effort. Bathroom is a tad small but we could deal with that! The one thing this hotel lacks is a 'bar'. It would be nice to come in after a long day out in NY and relax in a bar. The restaurant was closed for renovations when we were there so perhaps they are factoring this into their new space.
Less

meagan1223
Boston, Massachusetts
Contributor
11 reviews 11 reviews
Reviews in 7 cities Reviews in 7 cities
10 helpful votes 10 helpful votes
'Excellent West side hotel.'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed April 30, 2012
1
person found this review helpful

I usually stay on the East side but was so happy that I decided to mix things up and stay on the West Side, more specifically Columbus Circle, since I was visiting friends on the upper west side. It is truly an incredible location. The hotel rooms were clean, bright, beautiful and large. It had its own kitchenette, and large windows showing the great expense of central park with the skyline of the East side in the backdrop. You could see all of the carriages lining up to take people for rides. The doorman and check in staff were always friendly and helpful. The Time Warner center, with its shops, offers everything that you may have forgotten or even things that you didn't realize you wanted. The whole foods is convenient if you are staying for awhile and want some snacks, or if you have small children and would like to have some milk for the refrigerator for when they wake up in the middle of the night or don't want to have to travel with baby food. There are several great restaurants just steps away. I would definitely recommend this hotel.
Less

storage
Boca Raton, Florida
Senior Contributor
37 reviews 37 reviews
Reviews in 28 cities Reviews in 28 cities
82 helpful votes 82 helpful votes
'Fantastic hotel in one of my favorite areas of NYC'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed April 30, 2012
2
people found this review helpful

This hotel is wonderful and our stay was great from beginning to end. The desk staff is very professional and helpful. They were always there for us, but were never intrusive. Our check-in was so easy and we were brought complimentary drinks. We had asked for a high floor and we were given the highest floor in the hotel section. The hotel suite was large and beautiful. Everything was high-tech and automated from the blinds, to the drapes to the lighting. The afternoon/evening housekeeper was fantastic and kept our suite spotlessly clean. She would also bring us extra coffee, etc. if we needed it and one day she noticed that I had a cold and she came back and brought me additional tea - she was really wonderful and made our stay even more comfortable. To add to the comfort, there was plenty of closet space to stay for a month and the room stayed dark and quiet, allowing us to sleep late. The fitness center was being renovated when we visited but the makeshift gym was fine for us as the equipment was all new and housed everything that we use. We ate at Jean Georges which is the restaurant in the hotel and it's world class. Leave at least three hours for dinner though as it's a NYC event. I used to live in this area of Manhattan so I especially enjoyed seeing how much the area has changed and improved in the past few years. The only drawback is that the water pressure was extremely weak which made showering and bathing difficult and the bathroom was small in comparison to the size of the suite. Overall we loved this hotel and will stay here again when visiting the Upper West Side.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes

We certainly look forward to welcoming you back in the near future.

Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
RyanRoberts
Sheffield, United Kingdom
1 review
1 helpful vote 1 helpful vote
'Frustratingly Sloppy'
2 of 5 stars Reviewed May 28, 2012
1
person found this review helpful

Just arrived back from our stay at the James Hotel in SoHo.

The majority of the staff at the James are terrific: courteous, friendly and knowledgable. Michael Daniels on breakfast service was particularly professional and took the time to engage with us about our trip. He clearly has a thorough knowledge of New York City and its best venues and locations. The James would possibly make better use of his skills as a concierge (this position seemed to be hot-desked and was hit-and-miss in its quality). This wasn't a major issue for us, though.

The big issue we had with the James was that when it was good it was excellent, but when it was bad, it was diabolical. I have honestly never experienced such a resentful attitude from hotel staff. There were only one or two bad staff members on the James team, but they completely nullify the best efforts of their colleagues. The rest of the James staff have every right to feel cheated and betrayed by this ruinous minority.

The cleaning and room service was shocking. Dirty cups left to pile up, consumables not replenished and the worst possible attitudes. We had to call downstairs EVERY DAY of our stay to tell them things were dirty, missing, not replenished, unfinished etc.

On one occasion, guest services brought two clean cups after we informed the hotel that we had no clean ones as the dirty ones had not been cleared.

When they arrived, we had this little conversation at the door:
Us: "Can you take these two dirty cups for us?"
James Staff (already walking away): "No. You have to call room service for that, I'm a houseman".
The tone of this member of staff's voice was unnecessarily forceful and resentful.

We made a complaint to the manager of the hotel about this, and she was very apologetic about the shortcomings and the rudeness of her staff. She promised us that all of our needs would be catered for the rest of our stay. Unfortunately, the lack of care and attention to detail continued to the point where we became bored of ringing for a breakfast order form and telling them that they hadn't cleared away our breakfast cups and replenished the tea and coffee.

This, in addition to the shower knob missing from our shower and a blocked sink when we arrived (which were quickly and efficiently rectified) only highlighted that more attention should be spent on the housekeeping.

The view from Jimmy's bar is terrific and it's worth going up there before 9pm (before the crowds arrive). But it's not enough to justify a stay at the James.

So, we can't recommend the James and we won't be going back because it's just not worth the risk. Lots of terrific staff (as I stated earlier) like Felix, Christopher, Nicole, Michael Daniels and others. I just feel bad for these people that they have colleagues that are severely jeopardising their hotel's reputation.

Finally, charging $40 for a rollaway bed for one of our five nights, that we never requested may have just been an honest mistake. Check your bill at the end of your stay, just like we checked ours, so you don't pay extra.

It's OK trying to be the coolest hotel in town, but they really need to get the basics right first.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
Ask RyanRoberts about The James New York
This review is the subjective opinion of a TripAdvisor member and not of TripAdvisor LLC.

cello377
Cape Town Central, South Africa
1 review
1 helpful vote 1 helpful vote
'Great Boutique Hotel Experience in the heart of Soho NYC'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 28, 2012
1
person found this review helpful

This was our first visit to NYC and after researching and talking to friends we decided to stay in Soho - right choice! The next question was whether to rent an apartment or stay in a hotel. Although I travel a lot I'm not a fan of corporate and chain hotels and usually prefer to look for an apartment or boutique hotel in the place that we are visiting. We settled for The James as the choice in Soho seemed to be limited. What a good decision! The hotel itself is light and bright making up for the rooms being quite small. The bedrooms are comfortable. The restaurant and rooftop bar are spectacular. The interior styling is modern, natural and chic. The staff are the friendliest I have ever experienced - anywhere! Christopher, our doorman deserves a special mention. This gentle giant of a man was a feature of our NY experience. Hands down - highly recommended.
Less

'What a great experience !'

Despite the small - really small - disappointment in the cleanliness of the room, our stay was just amazing. The staff is very very friendly and helpful. The room and the view were really wonderful. And what a great location to explore Soho and its chic boutiques and beautiful people, also walking distance from The Village and Meatpacking. The place to be if you are interested in the south of Manhattan.
Free coffee in the morning / wine & cheese in the evening in the hotel lobby are a clear plus vs. other hotels.
Had fun at Jimmy's , James' roof top bar, where cocktails are great as well as breath-taking views on Hudson, WTC, Empire...
Overall great, unforgettable experience !

'Cool Rooftop Bar'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed May 18, 2012

Some friends and I went to The Jimmy, the rooftop bar at The James Hotel, for drinks at sunset. What an amazing view! The drinks were pricey but delicious and we figured we were paying for the ambiance. Try the cucumber vodka, it is a special treat. The outside area has a small pool, and I had to wonder how many drunk people had fallen into it over the years. The place is small and it got pretty packed, but it was a nice spot for a couple of drinks. Don't expect to hang out there all night unless you want to drop a lot of dough.

kayamaya
Malibu, California
Senior Contributor
26 reviews 26 reviews
Reviews in 13 cities Reviews in 13 cities
5 helpful votes 5 helpful votes
'Wonderful Hotel and Rooftop Lounge'
4 of 5 stars Reviewed May 14, 2012
1
person found this review helpful

We loved our stay at the James for Valentine's Day Weekend. We were happy that they accept small dogs, and delighted with the dog's bed they provided and a welcome goodie bag that included gourmet truffles for the puppy. The hotel and room design is lovely - clean, simple and modern. Perfectly outfitted mini bar with some of our favorite gourmet drinks and foods. Great selection from artisan, organic to common favorites. Was surprised to find lots of dust in the food tray as I'm all about cleanliness and details, but that was the only unclean aspect of our entire trip. Bathroom amenities were great, although I would have loved a bath tub. Loved the shower gel - wish it was available for purchase. We had a wonderful view from our top floor suite. The room was comfortable and modern enough to entertain a few friends. Favorite spot was the rooftop bar. Perfect for cold weather, as you don't have to go outside to be in one of the coolest spaces in town with delicious food, drinks and 360 views of the city. Perfect place to have your friends visit with you while you're in town. My NYC friends enjoyed the space and I enjoyed not needing to get out into the freezing weather. Food in the hotel overall was pretty good. I loved the late night spaghetti, while our breakfast in bed was just good. Juices at the restaurant were delicious. I highly recommend going to the Soho Grand for brunch - delicious arugula salad and lovely space. The only bad experience with the James was our cab driver telling us how the door boy demanded a payment from him in order to tell us that he is available, if the driver didn't pay him he would have lied to us that the driver was busy - really uncool as on top of that we tipped the door boy, so he ended up with extra $30 for being shady... Other than that, I will definitely stay at the James on my next NYC trip. Perfect location, close to great restaurants, shopping, galleries, etc. Love the modern, urban feel of it.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes

Designdoll
New Delhi, Delhi, India
2 reviews
Reviews in 2 cities Reviews in 2 cities
1 helpful vote 1 helpful vote
'A Gem in Soho!'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed May 6, 2012
1
person found this review helpful

I stayed in a two sided floor to ceiling glass panelled room with a fantastic views of the river!The room and bathroom(shower only) were comfortably sized with coffee\tea facilities, classy toiletries,comfy beds and linen. I preordered room service breakfast which arrived on time , high quality food beautifully presented! The David Burke restaurant is amazing and packed for lunch and dinner in their indoor and lovely outdoor spaces! The rooftop bar and pool have terrific views and are rocking in the evenings!the lobby lounge is a great place to meet friends,browse ,sip wine and have a bite (complimentary).The staff are charming and extremely friendly! The doormen enthusiastic and will hail a taxi at any time.forget pre booking a cab for the airport,they can be found easily in the area for half the price! Newark is just 25 mins away on a good day! Fashionable shopping and restaurants within walkable distance and Subway access is close by.
The local crowd that uses the hotel is trendy but the guests themselves are very eclectic! A very non intimidating yet sophisticated and contemporary hotel with tons of light and energy!
Less

meagan1223
Boston, Massachusetts
Contributor
11 reviews 11 reviews
Reviews in 7 cities Reviews in 7 cities
10 helpful votes 10 helpful votes
'I wish Margaret from reservations ran this hotel.'
3 of 5 stars Reviewed April 29, 2012

I know my title may sound strange but I really believe if she did, it would truly be a notch above so many other hotels because of her attention to detail and customer service skills. I don't want to give this hotel a negative review, I wanted to like it as much as Margaret in reservations. It is certainly not a bad hotel, but it has the potential to be a wonderful hotel. In defense of the hotel, since I only stayed for one night, maybe I caught it on an "off" day. I was coming to town for a Dr's appt and because I was so sick I needed my mother and her husband to drive me. I had changed my reservation 3 times because my migraine was so bad and Margaret was very accommodating. The day of my arrival I called to add a room to my reservation. The rooms were around $750 and I was eligible for an upgrade because I am an Andrew Harper member. Margaret made the smart suggestion that I upgrade my room for a couple hundred of dollars and then use the upgrade, and add on my parents room making it a two bedroom suite. I thanked her for even thinking that up and was so excited about my stay. The Andrew Harper rewards also entitled us to a bottle of wine, vip fruit basket, free afternoon tea and a continental breakfast. When we arrived, around 3:30, they said the room wasn't ready and I thought, oh perfect we can go for tea, but we were told to wait in the waiting area, which we did. After about 45 minutes we were taken to our room. The living room was great, it was comfortable, newly re-finished, it had a terrace with a really interesting city view, if you hung over the balcony enough, you could even see central park. I took the nicer bedroom, it had the same city view, a gorgeous bathroom with great amenities. The carpet however was wet from being cleaned and had that weird chemical smell, if I didn't have a migraine, it would have been more livable for me. The other bedroom was also nice, city view, but not as good as mine and it had a much smaller bathroom. But again, we were only there for one night. We had room service for dinner and we were told that it would take approximately 45 minutes, it ended up closer to an hr and 45 minutes. I hate confrontation, so does my mother, but my stepfather yelled at room service which embarrassed me greatly, they took care of the bill which I thought was more than generous (maybe it was part, I really stayed out of the whole thing, I hid in my bedroom). The food was amazing, we had this awesome tomato soup, although it would have been better if it came with the gorgonzola crustini it was advertised with. I had the fresh pea ravioli which was delicious. The VIP fruit basket was 3 apples. No tea. There was no breakfast the following morning. We were also charged a price higher than quoted. Oh, and the lady who did the turn down was lovely I guess to some up.
Pros:
Margaret, Margaret, Margaret....
CIty view suite with terrace
room service

Cons:
Things are just not delivered as promised (I believe this is a customer service issue)
We were charged a price higher than we were quoted

Honestly, I wouldn't stay here again because I don't know what it would be like, this is my only experience with this hotel. It was overall just more disappointing than anything, it would have been better to expect nothing and be surprised along the way.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
See 2 more reviews by meagan1223 for New York City
Ask meagan1223 about Lowell Hotel
This review is the subjective opinion of a TripAdvisor member and not of TripAdvisor LLC.
Miriam Wisbert, Front Office Manager at Lowell Hotel, responded to this review
May 7, 2012
Thank you for your review and for the kind words about our reservation manager Margaret and for the housekeeping attendant who performed turndown service in your room.
We understand your frustration having to wait 45 minutes for the room to get ready while you were not feeling well. After your arrival, we did rush the room and gave you access to the room at 2:45pm. We strive to accommodate requests for early check-in whenever possible, however our regular check-in time is at 3pm. We apologize that you were not able to go to the Pembroke Room while you were waiting, as well as for the delay for your room service order.
The slightly higher rate we charged for your suite was an error from our part and the difference was adjusted accordingly. We sincerely apologize for this inconvenience this caused.
Please rest assured that we are taking the necessary steps of evaluating all points of your feedback and ensure them from never recurring.

As a member of Andrew Harper you are entitled to complimentary continental breakfast daily as well as complimentary afternoon tea for two once during your stay. In order to receive receive this, you would need to order tea and breakfast either to your room through room service or in our Pembroke Room on the second floor. We apologize for not making these benefits clear to you upon your arrival.

We genuinely value your feedback and your time to share your experience. We are continuously working on improving our service and standards. Based on our telephone conversation, we appreciate that you agreed to return to our hotel and we are excited to welcome you back to the Lowell in the near future.
Report response as inappropriate
This response is the subjective opinion of the management representative and not of TripAdvisor LLC.

people found this review helpful

When you walk down the steps from 63rd Street to the Lowell's small lobby you feel as if you're coming home from the storm of the city. The desk people are welcoming, the concierge is knowledgeable and "wired," the doorman and porters greet you pleasantly. When you get to your suite, assuming you have treated yourself to one, you wonder if you'd just as soon stay for a loong while. We've been coming to the Lowell for a few decades, and the place has maintained a delightfully high level of service all that time. The rooms have been refurbished more than once during that period. The latest do-over was A+ with respect to the bathroom in our last suite -- a very worldly friend commented, on seeing the bathroom, "I want a bathroom just like this!" Our bed had about 10 pillows on it, making choosing just the right one a snap. Usually higher rooms are hotter (hot air rises, after all) but to our delight our suite on the 14th floor was not unpleasantly warm. The hotel only has two tiny elevators, one of which is not infrequently out of service, which is inconvenient, but the only fly I can identify in this particular ointment -- or, rather, balm.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
Ask WashingtonTraveler21 about Lowell Hotel

MLP50
Birmingham, Michigan
Senior Contributor
21 reviews 21 reviews
Reviews in 7 cities Reviews in 7 cities
13 helpful votes 13 helpful votes
'The Lowell is understated, elegant, and becomes your personal pied a terre in a lovely and convenient east side neighborhood.'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed November 9, 2011 via mobile
1
person found this review helpful

I believe we've been staying at the Lowell for approximately 15 years, usually visiting in the spring and fall. My wife and I have a favorite one-bedroom suite that we request, which is particularly nice in cool fall weather with its wood-burning fireplace. The suite has been totally renovated with a beautiful and spacious white marble bathroom and granite topped kitchenette. We use the Lowell as our base on these 5 night trips for forays to the theater, museums, restaurants and socializing with friends who are lucky enough to call NYC home. The Lowell is a welcome and ultra-comfortable respite from busy days and nights. We have also used it to host small cocktail gatherings in our suite, or order pizza up and watch a movie with friends. As I said, it feels like home and it's a tranquil and inviting respite to busy days and nights in the city. But above all, the real gems of the Lowell are its staff.
These people are there to serve in a friendly and professional manner. They're down to earth, but exacting in executing your wishes and making you feel welcome and very special. From desk managers, to doormen, to bell men, to waiters and housekeeping, we see very little turnover from year to year. I assume the Lowell personnel are treated well, enjoy their jobs, and therefore reciprocate to their guests. The concierges, John Mark and Philip, are outstanding resources, well connected, and eager to advise and facilitate. The Lowell is a small hotel with approximately 4 rooms or suites per floor on 17 floors. It is an old building, but gracious and elegant. If you enjoy your hotels large, sleek, and bustling, this isn't what you're looking for. If you want highly personal attention, elegantly timeless ambience, and a stellar east side location between Park and Madison, this is your place. However, like most things dear and unique, it comes at a price, and it will get your attention depending on what type of accommodation you
choose. But, that is a matter of choice, personal prioritiy and most likely frame of mind. The Lowell offers my wife and I everything we're looking for in NYC and we always look forward to coming back.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes

I recently stayed here for the weekend with some girlfriends. We stayed in a one bedroom suite. Everything from the lobby to the room was absolutely amazing. This hotel is absolutely beautiful....the rooms were like an apartment and were quite cozy and contemporary. It is a great location on the upper east side and easily accessible to all the shopping on Madison Ave. Despite being in the middle of Manhattan, it was unbelievably quiet! I will definitely be back and most definitely recommend to anyone I can!

The price was low and resonable.
Would recommend this motel to others.

Michigandress
mid-Michigan
Top Contributor
55 reviews 55 reviews
Reviews in 33 cities Reviews in 33 cities
42 helpful votes 42 helpful votes
'We Felt Like Family!'
5 of 5 stars Reviewed July 21, 2011

When we were planning a weeklong trip to Los Angeles to visit family, our son was put in charge of finding us a place to stay. "You'll love this place," he told us. "I walk past it almost every day. It's a cool little Brazilian boutique motel with a cafe' attached, and it's really inexpensive."

A trip to the motel's website added to our intrigue. Actually -- it seemed a little too good to be true.

But we were not disappointed. Driving into the motel plaza (Note: The driveway is very narrow and is hard to spot from the street.), it felt as if we were being transported to South America -- we found ourselves surrounded by bright colors and flowering plants and quirky SA garden art and festive music.

Our room, while small and basic, also reflected this bright, lively Latin flavor.

Although we didn't spend a great deal of time at the motel, we enjoyed the time we were there -- especially just sitting outside our room at the patio table, enjoying the out-of-doors (not always a given in LA). We also enjoyed time in the adjoining cafe', which features a variety of Brazilian food, LOTS of Brazilian soccer on TV and, interestingly, some very good sake' cocktails (love the sugar-cane stirrers).

Long story short -- we had a great time here, and appreciated the friendliness and graciousness of our hosts. We really felt taken care of in a city that can sometimes feel anonymous and not particularly visitor-friendly. We were told that this little motel is popular lodging for visiting families during holidaytimes, and we can see why.
Less
Was this review helpful? Yes
Problem with this review?
Ask Michigandress about Villa Brasil Motel
This review is the subjective opinion of a TripAdvisor member and not of TripAdvisor LLC.
